original: dga' ba dang 'dod chags ni med do //
analyzed: dga' ba dang 'dod chags ni med do //

original: de ltar nan tan du sgrub pa de ni tshe 'di nyid la yongs su mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur ba'i skal ba can yin te /
analyzed: de ltar nan tan du sgrub pa de ni tshe 'di nyid la yongs su mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur ba'i skal ba can yin te /

original: de la yang myu gu 'byung ba med do //

original: gzhan yang kha cig ni slob pa phyir mi 'ong ba yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang kha cig ni slob pa phyir mi 'ong ba yin te /

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi lhag ma srid pa'i rtse mo bsgrubs nas gnas te /
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi lhag ma srid pa'i rtse mo bsgrubs nas gnas te /
translated: Having attained the peak of existence, which is beyond the base of neither perception nor nonperception, they abide there.

original: de'i sa bon ni rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du med par gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i sa bon ni rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du med par gyur ba ma yin te /

original: des ni rnam par shes pa'i gnas de yongs su shes shing khong du chud do //
analyzed: des ni rnam par shes pa'i gnas de yongs su shes shing khong du chud do //
translated: They fully understand and comprehend that base of consciousness.

original: brjed ngas pa'i dbang las byung ba'i gong ma'i srid pa shas tsam ni yod de /
analyzed: brjed ngas pa'i dbang las byung ba'i gong ma'i srid pa shas tsam ni yod de /

original: de ltar na phyir mi 'ong ba de'i phyi ma la 'og ma'i myu gu 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na phyir mi 'ong ba de'i phyi ma la 'og ma'i myu gu 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //

original: de las bzlog pa thams cad la ni yang srid par skye ba'i myu gu yod par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa thams cad la ni yang srid par skye ba'i myu gu yod par rig par bya'o //

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa ni gnyis te /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa ni gnyis te /

analyzed: lta ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / de ma yin pa'i nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //

analyzed: de la lta ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ni 'du byed rnams la bdag dang bdag gi rnam par log par bzung bas 'jug pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba ste /

original: des na 'du byed rnams la bdag gam bdag gir khas len pa dang / rtsa ba de las byung ba de de ma yin pa'i phyi rol pa'i lta bar gyur ba rnams khas len pa'o //
analyzed: des na 'du byed rnams la bdag gam bdag gir khas len pa dang / rtsa ba de las byung ba de de ma yin pa'i phyi rol pa'i lta bar gyur ba rnams khas len pa'o //
translated: Thus, it is the acceptance of the aggregates as a self and as ‚Äúmine,‚Äù and the acceptance of the other heretical views that arise from that root.

original: de ma yin pa'i nyon mongs par 'dod chags la sogs pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa gnyis yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ma yin pa'i nyon mongs par 'dod chags la sogs pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa gnyis yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Affliction by the other defilements should be understood as the two afflictions of desire and so on.

original: de la lta ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa las rnam par grol ba'i tshe ni de ma yin pa rnams la gtan du rnam par grol bar 'gyur ba'i skal ba can du 'gyur gyi /

original: de ma yin pa rnams las rnam par grol ba'i tshe ni lta ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa las rnam par grol bar 'gyur ba'i skal ba can du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ma yin pa rnams las rnam par grol ba'i tshe ni lta ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa las rnam par grol bar 'gyur ba'i skal ba can du mi 'gyur ro //

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩ'di ltar 'dir skyes pa @177a * //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / 'di ltar 'dir skyes pa @177a * //
translated: Why is this?üîΩBecause one who is free from attachment to the base of nothingness and below

original: ci yang med pa'i skye mched man chad kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba ni sa 'og ma pa'i de ma yin pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams las 'jig rten pa'i lam gyi sems rnam par grol bar 'gyur gyi 'jig tshogs la lta ba las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ci yang med pa'i skye mched man chad kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba ni sa 'og ma pa'i de ma yin pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams las 'jig rten pa'i lam gyi sems rnam par grol bar 'gyur gyi 'jig tshogs la lta ba las ni ma yin no //

original: de yang des na sa 'og ma pa dang / sa gong ma pa'i 'du byed 'dres pa'i lus la bye brag med par bdag gam bdag gir khas len te /
analyzed: de yang des na sa 'og ma pa dang / sa gong ma pa'i 'du byed 'dres pa'i lus la bye brag med par bdag gam bdag gir khas len te /

original: des na srid pa'i rtse mor song du zin kyang phyir ldog par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: des na srid pa'i rtse mor song du zin kyang phyir ldog par 'gyur gyi /

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyi lus thams cad la sdug bsngal bar yongs su shes pas 'jig tshogs la lta ba spong ba sngon du 'gro ba'i nyon mongs pa spong bas phyir ldog par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyi lus thams cad la sdug bsngal bar yongs su shes pas 'jig tshogs la lta ba spong ba sngon du 'gro ba'i nyon mongs pa spong bas phyir ldog par mi 'gyur te /
translated: But one does not turn back from the path that transcends the world, because one abandons the defilements by first abandoning the view of individuality, having fully understood suffering in all its aspects.

original: de bas na 'dir ni lta ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa 'ba' zhig kun nas nyon mongs pa chen po yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'dir ni lta ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa 'ba' zhig kun nas nyon mongs pa chen po yin par rig par bya'o //

original: lam gyi bgrod pa gcig pa ni rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: lam gyi bgrod pa gcig pa ni rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste /
translated: The single course of the path should be understood as threefold:üîΩthe stage of the common man, the stage of him who has entered into the stream, and the stage of the adept.

original: so so'i skye bo'i sa la 'du byed brtag pa rnam pa lnga yod do //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i sa la 'du byed brtag pa rnam pa lnga yod do //

original: gnas lnga brtag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnas lnga brtag pa gang zhe na /

original: 'du byed rnams kyi rang bzhin brtag pa dang / rgyu brtag pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu brtag pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i rgyu brtag pa dang / rnam par byang ba brtag pa'o //

original: sngon so so'i skye bo'i gnas skabs rnams su gnas lnga la mkhas par gyur nas slob pas gnas po de dag nyid la de ma yin pa rnam pa lngas rtog pa nas mngon par shes pa myur bar 'gyur te /

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /

original: 'du byed rnams kyi 'du byed kyi rgyu dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu dang / rnam par byang ba'i rgyu 'gog pa la zhi ba dang / rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba'i lam la nges par 'byin pa dang / 'du byed thams cad la yang sna tshogs mang ba'i bdag nyid can dang /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams kyi 'du byed kyi rgyu dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu dang / rnam par byang ba'i rgyu 'gog pa la zhi ba dang / rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba'i lam la nges par 'byin pa dang / 'du byed thams cad la yang sna tshogs mang ba'i bdag nyid can dang /

original: rang gi sa bon las skye ba dang / de ma yin pa'i rkyen las skye ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi sa bon las skye ba dang / de ma yin pa'i rkyen las skye ba'o //

original: gnas gnyis la sgrib par byed pa'i yongs su yi 'chad pa rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gnas gnyis la sgrib par byed pa'i yongs su yi 'chad pa rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste /

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /

analyzed: gang gi gnas skabs su skye ba dang / gang la brten te skye ba dang / ji ltar skye ba dang / rnam pa ji lta bu @177b skye ba'o //

original: de la 'phags pa ma yin pa bden pa rnams la mi mkhas pa nyi tshe'i skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la 'phags pa ma yin pa bden pa rnams la mi mkhas pa nyi tshe'i skye bar 'gyur te /

original: 'phags pa ma yin pa de'i yang gnas lnga la mi mkhas pa la skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa ma yin pa de'i yang gnas lnga la mi mkhas pa la skye bar 'gyur ro //

original: de la 'du byed rnams las bdag dang bdag gir khas len pa'i rnam pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba las ni brten te skye ba'o //
analyzed: de la 'du byed rnams las bdag dang bdag gir khas len pa'i rnam pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba las ni brten te skye ba'o //
translated: In this regard, the view of the transitory collection, which is the mode of accepting a self and what belongs to a self in relation to the formative forces, is that on which one is born.

original: de la 'du byed yongs su 'gyur ba rnam pa gnyis kyis ni skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la 'du byed yongs su 'gyur ba rnam pa gnyis kyis ni skye bar 'gyur te /

analyzed: rkyen gzhan la yongs su 'gyur ba dang / rang gi sems kyi log par rtog pa yongs su 'gyur ba'o //

original: de la sdug bsngal las yongs su 'gyur ba ma 'ongs pa'i dogs pas skrag pa'i rnam pa dang / gyur zin pa'i 'og tu phongs pa'i rnam pa dang / gyur zin nas kyang sdug pa de yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba la lta ba'i rnam pa dang /

translated: Therein, the transformation of suffering is the form of fear due to anxiety about the future, the form of distress due to the loss of what has already occurred, and the form of anxiety due to the view that what has already occurred will again come into being.üîΩThe transformation of nirvana is the form of despair due to the imagination that the body will be transformed in nirvana.

original: mya ngan las 'das na lus yongs su 'gyur ba la rtog pas yongs su yi 'chad pa'i rnam pa ste de de ltar zhugs pas bstan pa la mngon par dga' ba la yang sgrib par byed la mya ngan las 'das pa la mngon par dga' ba la yangüîΩsgrib par byed do //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das na lus yongs su 'gyur ba la rtog pas yongs su yi 'chad pa'i rnam pa ste de de ltar zhugs pas bstan pa la mngon par dga' ba la yang sgrib par byed la mya ngan las 'das pa la mngon par dga' ba la yang sgrib par byed do //
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva who has entered this path is obstructed from delighting in the teaching and is obstructed from delighting in nirvana.

original: dmigs pa dang rang gi spyod yul la ni sgo gnyis nas bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa 'jug ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa dang rang gi spyod yul la ni sgo gnyis nas bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa 'jug ste /
translated: The grasping of ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine‚Äù occurs through two doors in regard to the objective realm and one‚Äôs own experiential range.

original: 'di lta ste /

translated: It is as follows.

original: rtog pa dang myong ba'i sgo nas 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang tshor ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: rtog pa dang myong ba'i sgo nas 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang tshor ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: The view of the perishable collection and feeling are associated with the perishable collection through the aspects of conceptualization and experience, respectively.

original: legs par gsungs pa dang nyes par bshad pa'i chos can gnyis ni sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i gzhi mtshungs mod kyi /
analyzed: legs par gsungs pa dang nyes par bshad pa'i chos can gnyis ni sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i gzhi mtshungs mod kyi /

original: 'di na nyes par bshad pa'i chos can ni sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa na /
analyzed: 'di na nyes par bshad pa'i chos can ni sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa na /
translated: In this world, those who possess the Dharma that is badly-spoken, when recollecting their former abodes,

original: 'du byed rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi shes te /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi shes te /

analyzed: mi rtag pa'am /

original: rgyu med par rtog go //
analyzed: rgyu med par rtog go //

analyzed: legs par gsungs pa'i chos can gyis ni shes pas na rtog par mi byed de //

original: 'di ni khyad par dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni khyad par dang po'o //

original: gzhan yang nyes par bshad pa'i chos can ni snyoms par 'jug pa gang la brten te dran pa de la sdug bsngal bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi shes pas ro myong bar byed de ro @178a * //

original: myang bas 'das pa'i 'du byed rnams la ni lta'o //
analyzed: myang bas 'das pa'i 'du byed rnams la ni lta'o //

original: ma 'ongs pa rnams la ni mngon par dga'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa rnams la ni mngon par dga'o //
translated: He is attracted to future formative forces.

original: da ltar byung ba rnams la ni skyo bar bya ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral bar bya ba dang / 'gog pa'i phyir mi 'jug go //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba rnams la ni skyo bar bya ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral bar bya ba dang / 'gog pa'i phyir mi 'jug go //

original: 'di ni khyad par gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni khyad par gnyis pa'o //

original: gzhan yang nyes par bshad pa'i chos can ni de ltar log par zhugs pas kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa bzhis kun nas nyon mongs shing yang srid par skye ba mngon par 'grub par byed de /
analyzed: gzhan yang nyes par bshad pa'i chos can ni de ltar log par zhugs pas kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa bzhis kun nas nyon mongs shing yang srid par skye ba mngon par 'grub par byed de /

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

analyzed: de ni las gsang yang byed cing sogs la las rnying rnams la yang reg cing 'dor bar mi byed de /
translated: One who is engaged in the secret of karma and so on, who touches the old karma and does not discard it,

original: 'di ni las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: this is the affliction of karma.

original: 'du byed rnams la 'jig tshogs la lta zhing sems can gzhan dge sbyong dang bram ze rnams la yongs su 'jal bar byed cing brtags nas bdag ni che'o snyam pa'am /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams la 'jig tshogs la lta zhing sems can gzhan dge sbyong dang bram ze rnams la yongs su 'jal bar byed cing brtags nas bdag ni che'o snyam pa'am /
translated: One who views the sa·πÉskƒÅras as a self, who compares oneself to other ≈õrama·πáas and brahmins, and after investigation thinks ‚ÄúI am great‚Äù or ‚ÄúI am equal‚Äù or ‚ÄúI am small,‚Äù

original: bdag ni mnyam mo snyam pa'am bdag ni chung ngo snyam du 'dzin pa 'di ni lta ba dang nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal gyis kun nas dkris pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //

analyzed: sred pa'i kun nas dkris pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ni nang ngam phyi rol la brten nas sred pa spyod pa rnams las rig par bya'o //

original: de rnams kyi bag la nyal gyi kun nas nyon mongs pa ni de rnams kyi rgyu dang 'brel ba'i lta ba dang nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang sred pa'i phyogs kyi gnas ngan len yin no //

analyzed: 'di gnyis ni 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma @179b byas pa ste /

translated: the unsurpassed knowledge, the unsurpassed path, and the unsurpassed liberation.

original: de la shes pa bla na med pa ni zad pa shes pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa dang / mi slob pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba'o //
analyzed: de la shes pa bla na med pa ni zad pa shes pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa dang / mi slob pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba'o //
translated: Among them, the unsurpassed knowledge is the knowledge of destruction, the knowledge of non-arising, and the right view of one beyond training.

original: mngon par shes pa myur la sla ba'i lam ni lam bla na med pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa myur la sla ba'i lam ni lam bla na med pa'o //
translated: The path of quick and easy supernormal knowledge is the unsurpassed path.

original: sems rnam par grol ba nyams pa med pa ni rnam par grol ba bla na med pa ste /
analyzed: sems rnam par grol ba nyams pa med pa ni rnam par grol ba bla na med pa ste /
translated: The unshakable liberation of mind is the unsurpassed liberation.

original: de rnams bsdus pa ni shes pa dang / spong ba dang / tshe 'di la bde bar gnas pa zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams bsdus pa ni shes pa dang / spong ba dang / tshe 'di la bde bar gnas pa zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
translated: These are to be known as the knowledge, the abandonment, and the happy abiding in this life.

original: slob pa'i shes pa gang yin pa dang / lam gang yin pa dang / rnam par grol ba gang yin pa de dag ni bla na med pa ma yin te /üîΩbla @182a * //
analyzed: slob pa'i shes pa gang yin pa dang / lam gang yin pa dang / rnam par grol ba gang yin pa de dag ni bla na med pa ma yin te / bla @182a * //
translated: The knowledge, the path, and the liberation of the trainee are not supreme,

original: na yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: na yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are surpassed.

original: dgra bcom pa'i lam thams cad ni mngon par shes pa sla ba dang / myur bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i lam thams cad ni mngon par shes pa sla ba dang / myur bar rig par bya ste /
translated: The path of the arhat should be known as the easy and quick direct intuition,

original: gnas ngan len thams cad bcom pa dang bya ba byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas ngan len thams cad bcom pa dang bya ba byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because all the negative reflex actions are destroyed and the task is accomplished.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa la brten pa 'du byed rnams rab tu rnam par 'byed pa na dus gnyis su rnam pa bzhis 'jig tshogs la lta ba yongs su shes na dus gnyis kyi rjes thogs su zag pa zad pa thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa la brten pa 'du byed rnams rab tu rnam par 'byed pa na dus gnyis su rnam pa bzhis 'jig tshogs la lta ba yongs su shes na dus gnyis kyi rjes thogs su zag pa zad pa thob par 'gyur te /
translated: When one who is based on the factors of enlightenment discriminates the formative forces, he fully understands the personality view in two times and in four aspects. He obtains the destruction of the contaminants immediately after the two times.

original: dus gnyis po gang zhe na /
analyzed: dus gnyis po gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two times?

original: so so'i skye bo'i sa dang / mthong ba'i sa'o //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i sa dang / mthong ba'i sa'o //
translated: the stage of the common man and the stage of insight.

original: rnam pa bzhi po gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi po gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four aspects?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: rang bzhin dang ; gnas dang / kun nas slong ba dang / 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin dang ; gnas dang / kun nas slong ba dang / 'bras bu'o //
translated: nature, basis, instigation, and result.

original: de la 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rang bzhin ni 'du byed do //
analyzed: de la 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rang bzhin ni 'du byed do //
translated: The nature of the false view of individuality is the formative forces.

original: 'du byed rnam pa lnga ni de'i bdag gam bdag gir dmigs pa'i gnas yin no //
analyzed: 'du byed rnam pa lnga ni de'i bdag gam bdag gir dmigs pa'i gnas yin no //
translated: The five aspects of the formative forces are the basis for the observation of a self or of things pertaining to a self.

original: lta ba'i nye bar len pas bsdus pa de'i kun nas slong ba ni ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i rkyen gyis byung ba'i sred pa'o //
analyzed: lta ba'i nye bar len pas bsdus pa de'i kun nas slong ba ni ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i rkyen gyis byung ba'i sred pa'o //
translated: The instigation of that is craving which arises from the condition of contact that is accompanied by ignorance and is included in the grasping of false views.

original: de yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rim pa rnam pa lngas 'byung ste 'di lta ste /üîΩkhams sna tshogs kyi rkyen gyis ni reg pa sna tshogs 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rim pa rnam pa lngas 'byung ste 'di lta ste / khams sna tshogs kyi rkyen gyis ni reg pa sna tshogs 'byung ngo //
translated: Moreover, that arises through the fivefold process of dependent origination.üîΩFrom the condition of the diversity of the elements there arises the diversity of contact.

original: reg pa sna tshogs kyi rkyen gyis ni tshor ba sna tshogs 'byung ngo //
analyzed: reg pa sna tshogs kyi rkyen gyis ni tshor ba sna tshogs 'byung ngo //
translated: From the condition of the diversity of contact there arises the diversity of sensation.

original: tshor ba sna tshogs kyi rkyen gyis ni sred pa sna tshogs 'byung ngo //
analyzed: tshor ba sna tshogs kyi rkyen gyis ni sred pa sna tshogs 'byung ngo //
translated: Various kinds of craving arise conditioned by various kinds of feeling.

original: sred pa sna tshogs kyi rkyen gyis ni len pa sna tshogs 'byung ste /
analyzed: sred pa sna tshogs kyi rkyen gyis ni len pa sna tshogs 'byung ste /
translated: Various kinds of clinging arise conditioned by various kinds of craving.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba gang yin pa de ni mi rtag pa'o //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba gang yin pa de ni mi rtag pa'o //
translated: That which is dependently arisen is impermanent.

original: de la 'bras bu ni dus skabs gsum du 'jog tshogs la lta bas sgrib par byed pa ste /
analyzed: de la 'bras bu ni dus skabs gsum du 'jog tshogs la lta bas sgrib par byed pa ste /
translated: The result is obscured by the view of the transitory collections in three times.

original: 'di lta ste ;
analyzed: 'di lta ste ;
translated: It is as follows:

original: bdag med pa las brtsams nas chos la rtog pa'i bzod pa'i dus dang / mngon par rtogs pa'i dus dang / dgra bcom pa nyid 'thob pa'i dus kyi tshe'o //
analyzed: bdag med pa las brtsams nas chos la rtog pa'i bzod pa'i dus dang / mngon par rtogs pa'i dus dang / dgra bcom pa nyid 'thob pa'i dus kyi tshe'o //
translated: When one begins with selflessness, the time of the acceptance of the investigation of phenomena, the time of clear realization, and the time of attaining arhatship.

original: de la dus gcig tu ni bag la nyal gyi 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i sgo nas som nyi za ba dang / the tshom can du 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: de la dus gcig tu ni bag la nyal gyi 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i sgo nas som nyi za ba dang / the tshom can du 'gyur ro ;
translated: At one time, one is doubtful and uncertain through the latent tendency of the view of the transitory collections.

original: / chos la rtog pa lan mang du byas pa'i rgyus som nyi bsal du zin kyang mngon par rtogs pa'i dus na bsam pa thag pa nas mya ngan las 'das pa la gtong ba'i tshe bag la nyal gyi 'jig tshogs la lta ba de nyid kyi sgo nas
analyzed: / chos la rtog pa lan mang du byas pa'i rgyus som nyi bsal du zin kyang mngon par rtogs pa'i dus na bsam pa thag pa nas mya ngan las 'das pa la gtong ba'i tshe bag la nyal gyi 'jig tshogs la lta ba de nyid kyi sgo nas
translated: The reason is that, although he has already eliminated doubts by repeatedly contemplating the Dharma, when he is about to give up samsara from the depth of his heart at the time of realization, he examines the formative forces of the view of the transitory collection that is dormant in him and thinks:

original: log pa'i 'du byed la yongs su brtags nas bdag ni @182b chad par 'gyur /
analyzed: log pa'i 'du byed la yongs su brtags nas bdag ni @182b chad par 'gyur /
translated: ‚ÄúI will be annihilated,

original: zhig par 'gyur /
analyzed: zhig par 'gyur /
translated: I will be destroyed,üîΩI will cease to exist.‚Äù

original: med par 'gyur ro zhes mya ngan las 'das pa la chad par lta zhing med par lta bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: med par 'gyur ro zhes mya ngan las 'das pa la chad par lta zhing med par lta bar 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, he views nirvana as annihilation and as non-existence.

original: des na de'i yid mya ngan las 'das pa las phyir ldog ste 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na de'i yid mya ngan las 'das pa las phyir ldog ste 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, his mind turns away from nirvana and does not enter it.

original: de phyis nyes pa de las sems rnam par sbyangs nas bden pa rnams mngon par rtogs te /
analyzed: de phyis nyes pa de las sems rnam par sbyangs nas bden pa rnams mngon par rtogs te /
translated: Later, he purifies his mind of that fault and realizes the truths.

original: mngon par rtogs pa dang ldan du zin kyang de bag la nyal gyi sgo nas nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal gang yin pa de dang bral bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa dang ldan du zin kyang de bag la nyal gyi sgo nas nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal gang yin pa de dang bral bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Even though he has realized the truths, he is not free from the pride that thinks ‚ÄúI am‚Äù because of his dormant tendencies.

original: brgya la lan 'ga' brjed ngas par 'gyur bas nga rgyal gyi kun nas dkris pa'i sgo nas bdag gi bdag ni 'di'o snyam du yang dag par mthong ste /
analyzed: brgya la lan 'ga' brjed ngas par 'gyur bas nga rgyal gyi kun nas dkris pa'i sgo nas bdag gi bdag ni 'di'o snyam du yang dag par mthong ste /
translated: But when it is sometimes forgotten, then through the influence of the pride-entanglement, he sees himself as a self, thinking, ‚ÄúThis is my self.‚Äù

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: Thus he thinks:

original: bdag ni che'o //
analyzed: bdag ni che'o //
translated: ‚ÄúI am great,‚Äù

original: bdag ni mnyam mo //
analyzed: bdag ni mnyam mo //
translated: ‚ÄúI am equal,‚Äù

original: bdag ni chung ngo snyam mo //
analyzed: bdag ni chung ngo snyam mo //
translated: ‚ÄúI am small.‚Äù

original: de la gnas skabs gnyis su ni bag la nyal gyi stobs kyis sgrib par byed do //
analyzed: de la gnas skabs gnyis su ni bag la nyal gyi stobs kyis sgrib par byed do //
translated: In the first two states, he is obscured by the power of the latent impressions.

original: gsum pa'i skabs su ni bag chags kyi stobs kyis sgrib par byed do //
analyzed: gsum pa'i skabs su ni bag chags kyi stobs kyis sgrib par byed do //
translated: In the third state, he is obscured by the power of the residual impressions.

original: 'du byed rnams ni rgyu rnam pa gsum gyis 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams ni rgyu rnam pa gsum gyis 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Conditionings arise through three kinds of causes:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: namely,

original: sngon gyi las dang nyon mongs pa'i stobs dang / smon lam gyi stobs dang / da ltar byung ba'i rgyu dang rkyen gyi stobs so //
analyzed: sngon gyi las dang nyon mongs pa'i stobs dang / smon lam gyi stobs dang / da ltar byung ba'i rgyu dang rkyen gyi stobs so //
translated: the power of past karma and afflictions, the power of vows, and the power of present causes and conditions.

original: de la so so'i skye bo'i sa la ni yongs su shes nas mthong ba'i sa'i rjes thogs su mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i zag pa rnams zad pa 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la so so'i skye bo'i sa la ni yongs su shes nas mthong ba'i sa'i rjes thogs su mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i zag pa rnams zad pa 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the stage of the common man, after the stage of complete knowledge and seeing, one obtains the destruction of the defilements to be destroyed by seeing.

original: mthong ba'i sa la ni yongs su shes shing spang ba byas nas dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu thob pa'i rjes thogs su zag pa rnams zad pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mthong ba'i sa la ni yongs su shes shing spang ba byas nas dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu thob pa'i rjes thogs su zag pa rnams zad pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the stage of seeing, after complete knowledge and destruction, one obtains the fruit of arhatship, and after that, one obtains the destruction of the defilements.

original: 'du byed rnams la ni rnam pa lngas tshul bzhin du 'dri zhing lan 'debs te /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams la ni rnam pa lngas tshul bzhin du 'dri zhing lan 'debs te /
translated: One should ask and answer correctly about the formations in five ways.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: rang bzhin dang / ldog pa dang 'jug pa'i rtsa ba dang / ldog pa dang 'jug pa dang / ldog pa dang / 'jug pa'i thabs so //
analyzed: rang bzhin dang / ldog pa dang 'jug pa'i rtsa ba dang / ldog pa dang 'jug pa dang / ldog pa dang / 'jug pa'i thabs so //
translated: The root of reversal and engagement, reversal and engagement, and the means of reversal and engagement.

original: de la rang bzhin ni rnam pa lnga ste gzugs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la rang bzhin ni rnam pa lnga ste gzugs la sogs pa'o //
translated: Therein, the nature is fivefold: form, etc.

original: de la ldog pa dang 'jug pa'i rtsa ba ni 'dun pa ste /
analyzed: de la ldog pa dang 'jug pa'i rtsa ba ni 'dun pa ste /
translated: Therein, the root of reversal and engagement is aspiration.

original: dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa yan chad zag pa zad pa thob pa'i bar gang yin pa ste /üîΩ'di ni ldog pa'i rtsa ba'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa yan chad zag pa zad pa thob pa'i bar gang yin pa ste / 'di ni ldog pa'i rtsa ba'o //
translated: The root of turning away is that which is from aspiration for virtuous qualities up to the attainment of the destruction of the contaminants.üîΩThe root of engagement is that which is from aspiration for the realms of beings of lesser and medium capacity up to the attainment of the destruction of the contaminants.

original: 'dun pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: 'dun pa nas bzung ste /
translated: The root of turning away is that which is from aspiration for the realms of beings of lesser and medium capacity up to the attainment of the destruction of the contaminants.üîΩThe root of engagement is that which is from aspiration for the realms of beings of lesser and medium capacity up to the attainment of the destruction of the contaminants.

original: kye ma bdag ni skal ba ngan pa rnams nas tshangs ris pa rnams kyi bar du skal ba mnyam par skye bar gyur cig snyam ste /üîΩder sems kyang kun du bsten cing bsgom la mang du byed de de nas der skye bar 'gyur @183a * //üîΩba gang yin pa'i 'di ni 'jug pa'i rtsa ba'o //
analyzed: kye ma bdag ni skal ba ngan pa rnams nas tshangs ris pa rnams kyi bar du skal ba mnyam par skye bar gyur cig snyam ste / der sems kyang kun du bsten cing bsgom la mang du byed de de nas der skye bar 'gyur @183a * // ba gang yin pa'i 'di ni 'jug pa'i rtsa ba'o //
translated: The root of turning away is that which is from aspiration for the realms of beings of lesser and medium capacity up to the attainment of the destruction of the contaminants.üîΩThe root of engagement is that which is from aspiration for the realms of beings of lesser and medium capacity up to the attainment of the destruction of the contaminants.üîΩThe root of turning away is that which is from aspiration for the realms of beings of lesser and medium capacity up to the attainment of the destruction of the contaminants.

original: de la ldog pa ni 'du byed rnams la 'dun pa dang 'dod chags kyi nye bar len pa tsam spangs pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgal te 'du byed rnams nye bar len pa yin du zin na ni ldog pa med par yang mi 'gyur te /üîΩdgra bcom pa la yang 'du byed pa yod pa'i phyir ro //

translated: The root of engagement is that which is from aspiration for the realms of beings of lesser and medium capacity up to the attainment of the destruction of the contaminants.üîΩThe root of turning away is that which is from aspiration for the realms of beings of lesser and medium capacity up to the attainment of the destruction of the contaminants.üîΩThe root of engagement is that which is from aspiration for the realms of beings of lesser and medium capacity up to the attainment of the destruction of the contaminants.üîΩThe root of turning away is that which is from aspiration for the realms of beings of lesser and medium capacity up to the attainment of the destruction of the contaminants.üîΩThe root of engagement is that which is from aspiration for the realms of beings of lesser and medium capacity up to the attainment of the destruction of the contaminants.üîΩThe root of turning away is that which is from aspiration for the realms of beings of lesser and medium capacity up to the attainment of the destruction of the contaminants.üîΩThe root of engagement is that which is from aspiration for the realms of beings of lesser and medium capacity up to the attainment of the destruction of the contaminants.üîΩThe root of turning away is that which is from aspiration for the realms of beings of lesser and medium capacity up to the attainment of the destruction of the contaminants.

original: gal te 'du byed rnams la nye bar len pa tha dad pa zhig yin na ni des 'dus ma byas su 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te 'du byed rnams la nye bar len pa tha dad pa zhig yin na ni des 'dus ma byas su 'gyur te /
translated: If appropriation were a separate entity from the formations, it would be unconditioned.

original: 'dus ma byas yin pas rtag par yang 'gyur la de lta na ni ldog par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas yin pas rtag par yang 'gyur la de lta na ni ldog par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And if it were unconditioned, it would be permanent and thus not subject to cessation.

original: de bas na nye bar len pa ni 'du byed rnams kyi phyogs gcig bzung ba yin te /
analyzed: de bas na nye bar len pa ni 'du byed rnams kyi phyogs gcig bzung ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, appropriation is a part of the formations.

original: de'i phyogs gcig kun du spyod pa gtan spangs pas ldog tu btub po //
analyzed: de'i phyogs gcig kun du spyod pa gtan spangs pas ldog tu btub po //
translated: Since a part of it is completely abandoned through practice, it is possible to stop it.

original: de la 'jug pa ni yang srid par skye ba'i rgyu dang / rnam pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: de la 'jug pa ni yang srid par skye ba'i rgyu dang / rnam pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i rgyu'o //
translated: Entry into existence is the cause of birth in a new existence, its aspect, and its present cause.

original: de la yang srid par skye ba'i rgyu ni ji ltar 'di na kha cig phyi ma la smon nas las byed par 'gyur te //
analyzed: de la yang srid par skye ba'i rgyu ni ji ltar 'di na kha cig phyi ma la smon nas las byed par 'gyur te //
translated: The cause of birth in a new existence is like the following example: Here someone performs an action with a desire for a future existence.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus su bdag 'du byed 'di lta bu zhig dang ldan par gyur cig snyam ste /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus su bdag 'du byed 'di lta bu zhig dang ldan par gyur cig snyam ste /
translated: He thinks, ‚ÄúIn the future, may I be endowed with such and such formations.‚Äù

original: des yang srid par skye ba'i 'du byed rnams kyi rgyu yang phangs par 'gyur la da ltar byung ba rnams kyang ma spangs te /
analyzed: des yang srid par skye ba'i 'du byed rnams kyi rgyu yang phangs par 'gyur la da ltar byung ba rnams kyang ma spangs te /
translated: The cause of the formative forces that lead to rebirth is also destroyed, but those that have already occurred are not abandoned.

original: de ltar na 'du byed rnams kyi bye brag yod do //
analyzed: de ltar na 'du byed rnams kyi bye brag yod do //
translated: Thus, there is a distinction between the formative forces.

original: de la rnam pa ni 'du byed du gtogs pa rnam pa bcu gcig po rnams yin te snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la rnam pa ni 'du byed du gtogs pa rnam pa bcu gcig po rnams yin te snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The aspects are the eleven aspects that pertain to the formative forces and these should be understood as above.

original: 'di la da ltar byung ba'i rgyu ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di la da ltar byung ba'i rgyu ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The cause of the present is as follows:
