original: de la 'jug pa'i thabs ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba la brten nas 'du byed rnams la nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / ro myong bar byed pa gang yin pa dang / bdag gang bdag gir lta ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'jug pa'i thabs ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba la brten nas 'du byed rnams la nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / ro myong bar byed pa gang yin pa dang / bdag gang bdag gir lta ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: The means of engaging in it are the pride that thinks ‚ÄúI am‚Äù in regard to the formative forces, which is based on the view of the perishing aggregates, the experience of the formative forces, and the view of ‚Äúmine‚Äù in regard to the self.

original: de la ldog pa'i thabs ni 'du byed rnams la nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal med pa dang / nyes dmigs dang / nges par 'byung ba dang / bdag dang bdag gir mi lta ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la ldog pa'i thabs ni 'du byed rnams la nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal med pa dang / nyes dmigs dang / nges par 'byung ba dang / bdag dang bdag gir mi lta ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: The means of turning away from it are the absence of pride that thinks ‚ÄúI am‚Äù in regard to the formative forces, the recognition of the faults, the means of deliverance, and the absence of the view of ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine.‚Äù

original: de la 'jug pa'i thabs ni mthun mthun du ma rig pa dang sred pa'i phyogs su gtogs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la 'jug pa'i thabs ni mthun mthun du ma rig pa dang sred pa'i phyogs su gtogs par rig par bya'o //
translated: The means of engaging in it should be known as the side of ignorance and craving, respectively.

original: de'i gnyen @183b po las ni ldog pa'i thabs so //
analyzed: de'i gnyen @183b po las ni ldog pa'i thabs so //
translated: The means of turning away from it is the antidote to that.

original: nyan thos mi mkhas pa ni rgyu gnyis kyis ston pa'i bstan pa las 'das nas sdig pa'i lta bar ltung ba'am /
analyzed: nyan thos mi mkhas pa ni rgyu gnyis kyis ston pa'i bstan pa las 'das nas sdig pa'i lta bar ltung ba'am /
translated: The disciple who is not skilled in means, by two causes, transgresses the teaching of the Master and falls into a sinful view.

original: tshig tu smra ba dang / kun rdzob kyi bden pa la rnam par rmongs pa dang / don dam pa'i bden pa la rnam par rmongs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshig tu smra ba dang / kun rdzob kyi bden pa la rnam par rmongs pa dang / don dam pa'i bden pa la rnam par rmongs par 'gyur ro //
translated: He is confused about the conventional truth and confused about the ultimate truth.

original: de de ltar rnam par rmongs pas kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i tshul las gcig tu nges par 'das pa dang / don dam pa'i bden pa'i tshul las gcig tu nges par 'das nas 'du byed rnams kyi 'jug pa la tshul bzhin ma yin par rtog par byed do //
analyzed: de de ltar rnam par rmongs pas kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i tshul las gcig tu nges par 'das pa dang / don dam pa'i bden pa'i tshul las gcig tu nges par 'das nas 'du byed rnams kyi 'jug pa la tshul bzhin ma yin par rtog par byed do //
translated: Thus, confused, he goes beyond the one-sidedness of the conventional truth and goes beyond the one-sidedness of the ultimate truth, and he wrongly imagines the engagement of the compounded.

original: 'phags pa 'ba' zhig bzhed na ston par mdzad pa ni gnas gsum yod do //
analyzed: 'phags pa 'ba' zhig bzhed na ston par mdzad pa ni gnas gsum yod do //
translated: If he is only interested in the noble, he is taught by the teacher in three ways.

original: byis pa so so'i skye bo ni de lta ma yin te gzhan las thos pa nyi tshe'o //
analyzed: byis pa so so'i skye bo ni de lta ma yin te gzhan las thos pa nyi tshe'o //
translated: The foolish ordinary person is not like that, but only hears from others.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this.

original: 'du byed rnams la bdag dang bdag gir med par mthong bar bdag nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du ston pa dang / gang la brten pas nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal 'jug pa de spangs na yang de thams cad kyi thams cad du ma spangs pa yang ston pa dang /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams la bdag dang bdag gir med par mthong bar bdag nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du ston pa dang / gang la brten pas nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal 'jug pa de spangs na yang de thams cad kyi thams cad du ma spangs pa yang ston pa dang /
translated: He shows that the self is just as it is seen, that is, as devoid of self and ‚Äúmine‚Äù with regard to the aggregates. He shows that even though one abandons that self, which is the basis of the conceit ‚ÄúI am,‚Äù one does not thereby abandon all of the aggregates.

original: 'jug pa'i rten med du zin kyang nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal ma spangs pas ji ltar kun du spyod pa ji lta bu yin pa ston to //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rten med du zin kyang nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal ma spangs pas ji ltar kun du spyod pa ji lta bu yin pa ston to //
translated: He shows that even though the basis of the conceit ‚ÄúI am‚Äù is no longer present, one still acts as though the conceit ‚ÄúI am‚Äù were present.

original: de la 'du byed rnams la nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la 'du byed rnams la nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The conceit ‚ÄúI am‚Äù with regard to the aggregates is of two kinds:

original: mngon par zhen pas kun du spyod pa dang / brjed ngas pas kun du spyod pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par zhen pas kun du spyod pa dang / brjed ngas pas kun du spyod pa'o //
translated: that which is active through manifest clinging and that which is active through forgetfulness.

original: de la mngon par zhen pas kun du spyod pa ni 'phags pas spangs te kun du mi spyod do //
analyzed: de la mngon par zhen pas kun du spyod pa ni 'phags pas spangs te kun du mi spyod do //
translated: The first is abandoned by the ƒÅryas and does not operate.

original: gnyis pa ni bag la nyal gyi sgo nas spyod de /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni bag la nyal gyi sgo nas spyod de /
translated: The second operates through the latent propensities.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba spangs su zin kyang 'phags pa'i lam legs par ma bsgoms pa'i phyir kun du spyod do //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba spangs su zin kyang 'phags pa'i lam legs par ma bsgoms pa'i phyir kun du spyod do //
translated: Even though the view of the transitory collection has been abandoned, the pride thinking ‚ÄúI am‚Äù still occurs because the noble path has not been well cultivated.

original: de ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i bag chags tsam dang 'brel pa'i tshul gyis brjed ngas pas kun du spyod pa'i nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal gyis rten gyi bya ba byed do //
analyzed: de ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i bag chags tsam dang 'brel pa'i tshul gyis brjed ngas pas kun du spyod pa'i nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal gyis rten gyi bya ba byed do //
translated: It occurs through the mere connection with the latent potentialities of the view of the transitory collection, and it functions as the support for forgetfulness.

original: de bas na spangs kyang kun du spyod pa yod do //üîΩde la 'phags pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyi sgo nas 'du byed rnams yid la byed pa na yang nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal kun du spyod par mi 'gyur na spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi sgo nas lta ci smos /üîΩgdags pa'i sgo nas yid la byed pa na yang dran pa nye bar gnas na ni nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal kun du mi spyod do //
analyzed: de bas na spangs kyang kun du spyod pa yod do // de la 'phags pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyi sgo nas 'du byed rnams yid la byed pa na yang nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal kun du spyod par mi 'gyur na spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi sgo nas lta ci smos / gdags pa'i sgo nas yid la byed pa na yang dran pa nye bar gnas na ni nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal kun du mi spyod do //
translated: Therefore, even though it has been abandoned, it still occurs.üîΩWhen ƒÅryas bring to mind formations in terms of their intrinsic characteristics, the pride thinking ‚ÄúI am‚Äù does not occur, let alone when they bring them to mind in terms of their general characteristics.üîΩWhen they bring to mind the aggregates as mere designations, if mindfulness is present, the pride thinking ‚ÄúI am‚Äù does not occur.

original: gdags pa nyid yid la byed pa @184a * //
analyzed: gdags pa nyid yid la byed pa @184a * //
translated: When they bring to mind the aggregates as mere designations, if mindfulness is present, the pride thinking ‚ÄúI am‚Äù does not occur.

original: na dran pa nye bar gnas pa med na ni nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal kun du spyod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: na dran pa nye bar gnas pa med na ni nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal kun du spyod par 'gyur ro //
translated: If mindfulness is not present, the pride that thinks ‚ÄúI am‚Äù becomes active.

original: so so'i skye bo ni spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi sgo nas 'du byed rnams yid la byed pa na yang sems kyi rgyud nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal gyis rnam par 'dres na gnas skabs gzhan dag la lta ci smos /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo ni spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi sgo nas 'du byed rnams yid la byed pa na yang sems kyi rgyud nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal gyis rnam par 'dres na gnas skabs gzhan dag la lta ci smos /
translated: Even when ordinary people attend to the formations in terms of their general characteristics, the stream of their thought is mixed with the pride that thinks ‚ÄúI am.‚Äù What need is there to speak of other situations?

original: de la 'phags pa'i rgyud la ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba bag la nyal dang kun nas dkris pa'i sgo nas spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: de la 'phags pa'i rgyud la ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba bag la nyal dang kun nas dkris pa'i sgo nas spangs pa yin no //
translated: In the stream of consciousness of an ƒÅrya, the view of the transitory collection has been abandoned by means of both latent and manifest forms.

original: bag chags dang 'brel pa'i sgo nas ni slob pas ma spangs so //
analyzed: bag chags dang 'brel pa'i sgo nas ni slob pas ma spangs so //
translated: However, it has not been abandoned by a learner through the force of the latent propensities.

original: nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal ni bag la nyal dang kun nas dkris pa'i sgo nas kyang ma spangs so //
analyzed: nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal ni bag la nyal dang kun nas dkris pa'i sgo nas kyang ma spangs so //
translated: The pride that thinks ‚ÄúI am‚Äù has not been abandoned by means of either latent or manifest forms.

original: de la nga'o snyam du 'dun pa gang yin pa de ni nga rgyal gyis kun nas dkris pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la nga'o snyam du 'dun pa gang yin pa de ni nga rgyal gyis kun nas dkris pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The desire to think ‚ÄúI am‚Äù should be understood as the fetter of pride.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar rjed ngas shing 'dod pa dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i ro myang bas 'phrog pa de ni 'dun pa'i sgo nas nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal gyis kun nas dkris pa kun tu spyod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar rjed ngas shing 'dod pa dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i ro myang bas 'phrog pa de ni 'dun pa'i sgo nas nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal gyis kun nas dkris pa kun tu spyod do //
translated: Thus, he is carried away by his forgetfulness and by his enjoyment of the taste of his desires and of his meditative concentration.

original: de yang des bag la nyal gyi sgo nas ma spangs la kun nas dkris pa'i sgo nas yongs su ma shes te 'di ltar de de'i tshe brjed ngas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang des bag la nyal gyi sgo nas ma spangs la kun nas dkris pa'i sgo nas yongs su ma shes te 'di ltar de de'i tshe brjed ngas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, he has not abandoned the latent dispositions of this pride, which is a form of conceit that thinks ‚ÄúI am,‚Äù and he has not completely understood the envelopment of this pride. Thus, he is forgetful at that time.

original: 'gog par ma gyur pa ni kun nas dkris pa dang bral du zin kyang yang kun tu spyod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gog par ma gyur pa ni kun nas dkris pa dang bral du zin kyang yang kun tu spyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He has not stopped it because, even though he has become free from the envelopment, he still engages in it.

original: zad par ma byas pa ni de'i bag la nyal yang dag par ma bcom pa'i phyir ro //üîΩtshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams kyi tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams la kun tu dga' bar bya ba'i dri ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: zad par ma byas pa ni de'i bag la nyal yang dag par ma bcom pa'i phyir ro // tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams kyi tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams la kun tu dga' bar bya ba'i dri ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: He has not destroyed it because he has not completely destroyed the latent dispositions for it.üîΩThere are two kinds of questions that a bodhisattva should ask his spiritual masters:

original: nad pa dri ba dang / bde ba dri ba'o //
analyzed: nad pa dri ba dang / bde ba dri ba'o //
translated: questions about the sicknesses of the bodhisattvas and questions about their happiness.

original: de la nad pa dri ba ni ci khyod tshor ba dub pas bzod par gyur tam zhes bya ba dang / srog dang mthun pa'i phyir sdod pa dang / ci sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba shas che bar ma gyur tam /
analyzed: de la nad pa dri ba ni ci khyod tshor ba dub pas bzod par gyur tam zhes bya ba dang / srog dang mthun pa'i phyir sdod pa dang / ci sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba shas che bar ma gyur tam /
translated: Are you not troubled by the contact of unpleasant things?

original: rgyun chags par ma gyur tam /
analyzed: rgyun chags par ma gyur tam /
translated: Have you not lost what you have gained?üîΩThe questions about happiness are: Are you not troubled by illness?üîΩAre you not troubled by the great pain?

original: mi sdug pa'i 'dus te reg pa dang / yid dang mi mthun pa rnams lus su zhugs par ma gyur tam /
analyzed: mi sdug pa'i 'dus te reg pa dang / yid dang mi mthun pa rnams lus su zhugs par ma gyur tam /
translated: Are you not troubled by the contact of unpleasant things?

original: zhugs pa las kyang med par song ngam zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhugs pa las kyang med par song ngam zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Have you not lost what you have gained?üîΩThe questions about happiness are: Are you not troubled by illness?

original: de la bde ba dri ba ni 'di ltar 'di na kha cig kha cig la nad kyis nyon mongs par ma gur pa'i phyir gnod pa chung ngam zhes dri ba'o //
analyzed: de la bde ba dri ba ni 'di ltar 'di na kha cig kha cig la nad kyis nyon mongs par ma gur pa'i phyir gnod pa chung ngam zhes dri ba'o //
translated: Are you not troubled by the great pain?üîΩAre you not troubled by the contact of unpleasant things?

original: phyi rol gyi gnod pa med pa dang yang yams kyi nad las gyur pa med pa'i phyir nyam nga ba nyung ba'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi gnod pa med pa dang yang yams kyi nad las gyur pa med pa'i phyir nyam nga ba nyung ba'o //
translated: Have you not lost what you have gained?

original: mtshan mo bde bar gnyid kyis log pa dang / khas zas bde bar zhu bar gyur pa'i phyir @184b bskyod pa yang ba'o //
analyzed: mtshan mo bde bar gnyid kyis log pa dang / khas zas bde bar zhu bar gyur pa'i phyir @184b bskyod pa yang ba'o //
translated: and sleep at night is easy and comfortable, and food is easily digested.üîΩThe classification of the synonyms for the life of ease is as follows:

original: 'tsho ba dang / stobs dang / bde ba dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / bde ba reg par gnas par gnas pa'i rnam grangs rnams kyi dbye ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'tsho ba dang / stobs dang / bde ba dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / bde ba reg par gnas par gnas pa'i rnam grangs rnams kyi dbye ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: life, strength, happiness, freedom from distress, and living in a state of ease.

original: nyan thos kyi sa las zas kyi tshod rig par bya ba las brtsams pa bzhin no //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi sa las zas kyi tshod rig par bya ba las brtsams pa bzhin no //
translated: This is like the explanation in the Sravaka Levels about knowing the proper amount of food.

original: dri ba de yang gnas skabs rnam pa bzhir gtogs par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: dri ba de yang gnas skabs rnam pa bzhir gtogs par rig par bya ste /
translated: That question is to be understood as belonging to four situations:

original: nang gi gnod par gtogs pa dang / phyi rol gyi gnod par gtogs pa dang / mtshan mo gnas par gtogs pa dang / nyin mo gnas par gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: nang gi gnod par gtogs pa dang / phyi rol gyi gnod par gtogs pa dang / mtshan mo gnas par gtogs pa dang / nyin mo gnas par gtogs pa'o //
translated: belonging to the situation of internal harm, belonging to the situation of external harm, belonging to the situation of staying at night, and belonging to the situation of staying during the day.

original: dgra bcom pa tshe 'di nyid la kha zas dang tha snyad dang / phung po dang / khams dang skye mched rnams la nye bar mi 'gro ba dang bral ba ma yin pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu ma shes nas dgra bcom pa ni nye bar mi 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa tshe 'di nyid la kha zas dang tha snyad dang / phung po dang / khams dang skye mched rnams la nye bar mi 'gro ba dang bral ba ma yin pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu ma shes nas dgra bcom pa ni nye bar mi 'gro ba'o //
translated: The arhat is not one who does not approach food, language, the aggregates, elements, and sense bases in this very life.

original: dgra bcom pa ni nye bar mi 'gro ba'o zhes bya ba tshul bzhin ma yin par rtog par byed de /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa ni nye bar mi 'gro ba'o zhes bya ba tshul bzhin ma yin par rtog par byed de /
translated: He does not understand them as they are in reality. He thinks, ‚ÄúThe arhat does not approach.

original: dgra bcom pa ni tshe 'di la nye bar mi 'gro ba ma yin te 'di lta ste de ni kha zas dang / tha snyad dang / phung po dang / khams dang skye mched rnams la yang dag par snang bas na /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa ni tshe 'di la nye bar mi 'gro ba ma yin te 'di lta ste de ni kha zas dang / tha snyad dang / phung po dang / khams dang skye mched rnams la yang dag par snang bas na /
translated: The arhat does not approach in this life. He sees food, language, the aggregates, elements, and sense bases as they are.

original: de'i phyir dgra bcom pa ni shi ba'i 'og tu gdod nye bar mi 'gro ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir dgra bcom pa ni shi ba'i 'og tu gdod nye bar mi 'gro ste /
translated: Therefore, the arhat does not approach after death.

original: dgra bcom pa ni 'du byed rnams khas mi len zhing nye bar mi 'gro'o zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis dgongs te gsungs pa gor ma chags go snyam ste /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa ni 'du byed rnams khas mi len zhing nye bar mi 'gro'o zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis dgongs te gsungs pa gor ma chags go snyam ste /
translated: The arhat does not accept or approach formations.

original: de ni dam pa'i chos ltar bcos pa dang lta bar gyur par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni dam pa'i chos ltar bcos pa dang lta bar gyur par rig par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood as the counterfeit of the true Dharma and as a view.

original: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa'am nyan thos chen po ni dam pa'i chos ltar 'chos pa de ltar bur gyur pa spangs pa'i phyir don gyi dbang rnam pa gnyis la brten nas shin tu 'bad par byed de /
analyzed: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa'am nyan thos chen po ni dam pa'i chos ltar 'chos pa de ltar bur gyur pa spangs pa'i phyir don gyi dbang rnam pa gnyis la brten nas shin tu 'bad par byed de /
translated: The pure conduct of the great disciples is based on two kinds of power: in order to avoid the counterfeit of the true Dharma, they exert themselves with great effort.

original: gang zad de dag nyid kyis 'dod pa'am gzhan dag la yang ston par byed pa'i rgyu 'dis 'gro ba ngan par skye bar gyur na mi rung ngo snyam pa dang / bstan pa la dga' ba'i sgo nas dam pa'i chos ltar bcos pa la brten pas bstan pa nub par 'gyur na mi rung ngo snyam pa'o //
analyzed: gang zad de dag nyid kyis 'dod pa'am gzhan dag la yang ston par byed pa'i rgyu 'dis 'gro ba ngan par skye bar gyur na mi rung ngo snyam pa dang / bstan pa la dga' ba'i sgo nas dam pa'i chos ltar bcos pa la brten pas bstan pa nub par 'gyur na mi rung ngo snyam pa'o //
translated: They think, ‚ÄúIt would not be right for me to be reborn in a bad destiny because of this cause, which is either my own desire or my teaching to others,‚Äù and ‚ÄúIt would not be right for the teaching to disappear because of my reliance on the counterfeit of the true Dharma out of my fondness for the teaching.‚Äù

original: dam pa'i chos ltar bcos pa de skye ba la ni rgyu gnyis yod de /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos ltar bcos pa de skye ba la ni rgyu gnyis yod de /
translated: There are two causes for the arising of a counterfeit of the true Dharma.

original: nang gi 'jig tshogs la lta ba ma spangs pa dang / de la brten pas 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i skyes bur rtog pa'o //üîΩrgyu rnam pa de gnyis spang pa la ni gnyen po dam pa'i chos bstan pa rnam @185a * //
analyzed: nang gi 'jig tshogs la lta ba ma spangs pa dang / de la brten pas 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i skyes bur rtog pa'o // rgyu rnam pa de gnyis spang pa la ni gnyen po dam pa'i chos bstan pa rnam @185a * //
translated: The first is the non-abandonment of the inner view of the transitory aggregates, and the second is the conception of a person who engages in and disengages from actions on the basis of that view.

original: pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: pa gnyis yod de /
translated: The remedy for the abandonment of these two causes is the teaching of the true Dharma, which has two aspects.üîΩThe first is the teaching of selflessness by way of the order of the impermanence of compounded phenomena.

original: 'du byed rnams la mi rtag pa nyid kyi go rims kyis bdag med par bstan pa dang / bsgyur ba bzhis 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i skyes bu mi dmigs pa ste /üîΩ'di lta ste /üîΩ'dus byas sam 'dus ma byas kyi sgo nas nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang / sangs rgyas kyi bdag ni de bzhin 'ongs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams la mi rtag pa nyid kyi go rims kyis bdag med par bstan pa dang / bsgyur ba bzhis 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i skyes bu mi dmigs pa ste / 'di lta ste / 'dus byas sam 'dus ma byas kyi sgo nas nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang / sangs rgyas kyi bdag ni de bzhin 'ongs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The second is the non-apprehension of a person who engages in and disengages from actions by way of the four modes of transformation.üîΩThe self of the sravakas, pratyekabuddhas, and buddhas is designated in two ways: as compounded or uncompounded.

original: de yang rnam pa gnyis su 'dogs te phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa la ni 'dus byas su 'dogs so //
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gnyis su 'dogs te phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa la ni 'dus byas su 'dogs so //
translated: The self of the sravakas and pratyekabuddhas is designated as compounded because it is associated with the remainder of the aggregates.

original: phung po'i lhag ma med pa la ni 'dus ma byas su 'dogs so //
analyzed: phung po'i lhag ma med pa la ni 'dus ma byas su 'dogs so //
translated: The remainderless is designated as unconditioned.

original: don dam par ni 'dus byas la yang 'dus byas kyis gdags su med do //
analyzed: don dam par ni 'dus byas la yang 'dus byas kyis gdags su med do //
translated: In the ultimate sense, the conditioned cannot be designated by the conditioned,

original: 'dus ma byas la yang 'dus ma byas kyis gdags su med do //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas la yang 'dus ma byas kyis gdags su med do //
translated: and the unconditioned cannot be designated by the unconditioned.

original: dam pa'i chos bstan pa des khong du chud pa rnam pa drug bskyed na dam pa'i chos ltar bcos pa spangs par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos bstan pa des khong du chud pa rnam pa drug bskyed na dam pa'i chos ltar bcos pa spangs par rig par bya ste /
translated: When the teaching of the true Dharma produces the six kinds of understanding, it should be known as the true Dharma, in contrast to that which is false.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: What are the six kinds of understanding?

original: dgra bcom pa de'i phung por bsdus pa'i 'du byed du gtogs pa 'jig pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir mi rtag par khong du chud pa dang / tshe 'di la na ba dang / rga ba dang sdug bsngal ba'i gnas su gyur pa'i phyir sdug bsngal ba nyid khong du chud pa dang /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa de'i phung por bsdus pa'i 'du byed du gtogs pa 'jig pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir mi rtag par khong du chud pa dang / tshe 'di la na ba dang / rga ba dang sdug bsngal ba'i gnas su gyur pa'i phyir sdug bsngal ba nyid khong du chud pa dang /
translated: They are the understanding of impermanence, because the aggregates of the arhat are included in the conditioned and are subject to destruction; the understanding of suffering, because this life is the basis of sickness, old age, and pain;

original: rang gi ngang gis 'gag pa dang / spong pa'i khams dang ; 'dod chags dang bral ba'i khams dang / 'gog pa'i khas la 'gog pa dang / rnam par zhi ba dang / bsil ba dang / nus par khong du chud pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi ngang gis 'gag pa dang / spong pa'i khams dang ; 'dod chags dang bral ba'i khams dang / 'gog pa'i khas la 'gog pa dang / rnam par zhi ba dang / bsil ba dang / nus par khong du chud pa'o //
translated: the element of cessation, the element of peace, the element of original nature, the element of complete nirvana, the element of cessation, the element of tranquility, the element of coolness, and the element of ability.

original: de ltar khong du chud pa de la ni log pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang ldan pa'i dgra bcom pa'i 'du shes gang yin pa de yang mi 'byung na shi ba'i 'og tu de nye bar 'gro ba dang / nye bar mi 'gro bar lta spros par ga la byed /
analyzed: de ltar khong du chud pa de la ni log pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang ldan pa'i dgra bcom pa'i 'du shes gang yin pa de yang mi 'byung na shi ba'i 'og tu de nye bar 'gro ba dang / nye bar mi 'gro bar lta spros par ga la byed /
translated: One who has such understanding does not even have the idea of being an arhat who has attained the false pride of superimposition, much less the elaboration of whether or not he will go to the next life after death.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba ma spangs pa la ni nyes dmigs gnyis yod par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba ma spangs pa la ni nyes dmigs gnyis yod par rig par bya ste /
translated: It should be understood that there are two disadvantages for one who has not abandoned the view of the transitory collection.

original: gsod pa po bzhin du sdug bsngal bar byed pa'i 'du byed rnams la bdag gam bdag gir khas len pa ni de dag gis de 'khor ba na sdug bsngal bar byed par 'gyur ba dang / tshe 'di la yang 'phags pa'i shes rab bla na med pa'i srog gi dbang po 'gag par byed de /
analyzed: gsod pa po bzhin du sdug bsngal bar byed pa'i 'du byed rnams la bdag gam bdag gir khas len pa ni de dag gis de 'khor ba na sdug bsngal bar byed par 'gyur ba dang / tshe 'di la yang 'phags pa'i shes rab bla na med pa'i srog gi dbang po 'gag par byed de /
translated: They accept that compounded phenomena that cause suffering like a murderer are the self or that of the self, because they cause them to suffer in samsara and they block the life force of the unsurpassed wisdom of the aryas in this life.

original: dper na mi la la zhig la 'khon yod pa'i mi zhig yod pas mthus bsad mi nus par rang gis shes nas bsad pa'i phyir @185b yid rton du gzhug pa sngon du btang bas yid du 'ong ba kun tu spyod de /
analyzed: dper na mi la la zhig la 'khon yod pa'i mi zhig yod pas mthus bsad mi nus par rang gis shes nas bsad pa'i phyir @185b yid rton du gzhug pa sngon du btang bas yid du 'ong ba kun tu spyod de /
translated: For example, a man who has a grudge against someone else is unable to kill him through force, but knowing this, he gains his trust in order to kill him and acts in a pleasant way.üîΩKnowing that he has gained his trust, he deprives him of his life.

original: de yid rton par gyur par shes nas srog dang bral bar byed pa de bzhin du byis pa so so'i skye bo yang 'khor pa'i mi lta bu'i 'jig tshogs la lta bas phyi ma la sdug bsngal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de yid rton par gyur par shes nas srog dang bral bar byed pa de bzhin du byis pa so so'i skye bo yang 'khor pa'i mi lta bu'i 'jig tshogs la lta bas phyi ma la sdug bsngal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In the same way, childish ordinary beings are like a man in samsara, because the afflicted view of the self causes them to suffer in the future.

original: yid du 'ong ba'i 'du byed la chags pa dang ldan par kun du spyod la so so'i skye bo rmongs pa de yang gsod par byed pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba la phan yon du lta ba'i nyes par lta bar mi byed de de la /
analyzed: yid du 'ong ba'i 'du byed la chags pa dang ldan par kun du spyod la so so'i skye bo rmongs pa de yang gsod par byed pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba la phan yon du lta ba'i nyes par lta bar mi byed de de la /
translated: The foolish ordinary person who engages in attachment to attractive compositional factors does not see the fault of viewing the perishable composite that is the cause of killing as beneficial.

original: de ltar yid brtan par gyur pas 'phags pa'i shes rab kyi srog gi dbang po de las ma thob pa yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba'i sgo nas rab tu nyams par byed do //
analyzed: de ltar yid brtan par gyur pas 'phags pa'i shes rab kyi srog gi dbang po de las ma thob pa yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba'i sgo nas rab tu nyams par byed do //
translated: In this way, due to that trust, they completely destroy the life force of the ƒÅryas‚Äô wisdom by losing what has not been obtained.

original: 'di gnyis ni 'di las phyi rol pa rnams chos 'dul ba la the tshom za ba dang rmongs par 'gyur ba'i gnas yin te /
analyzed: 'di gnyis ni 'di las phyi rol pa rnams chos 'dul ba la the tshom za ba dang rmongs par 'gyur ba'i gnas yin te /
translated: These two are the bases for doubt and confusion regarding the Dharma and Vinaya of those outside this teaching.

original: gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni yod pa dang med par lta ba yang spong la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni yod pa dang med par lta ba yang spong la /
translated: The TathƒÅgata abandons the views of existence and nonexistence.

original: nyan thos kyang shi ba'i 'og tu kha cig ni mngon par 'grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: nyan thos kyang shi ba'i 'og tu kha cig ni mngon par 'grub par 'gyur /
translated: Some ≈õrƒÅvakas after death are established in the formless realm.

original: kha cig ni mngon par 'grub par mi 'gyur bar lung ston pa gang yin pa dang / don dam par tshe 'di dang tshe phyi ma la bdag rtag par mi dmigs pa dang / ston pa gsum ste /
analyzed: kha cig ni mngon par 'grub par mi 'gyur bar lung ston pa gang yin pa dang / don dam par tshe 'di dang tshe phyi ma la bdag rtag par mi dmigs pa dang / ston pa gsum ste /
translated: The three teachers are

original: rtag par smra ba dang / chad par smra ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa yod par thugs su chud pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rtag par smra ba dang / chad par smra ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa yod par thugs su chud pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: those who propound permanence, those who propound annihilation, and those who understand the existence of the Tathagata.

original: som nyi za ba dang / rmongs pa de'i rgyu ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: som nyi za ba dang / rmongs pa de'i rgyu ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The cause of doubt and confusion is twofold:

original: dam pa'i chos ltar bcos pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos ltar bcos pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: it should be understood as similar to the counterfeit of the true Dharma.

original: de spang bar bya ba yang de bzhin te bstan pa rnam pa gnyis yin no //
analyzed: de spang bar bya ba yang de bzhin te bstan pa rnam pa gnyis yin no //
translated: Its abandonment is also similar, as there are two teachings.

original: bdag med pa'i chos 'di ni rgyu gnyis kyis 'di las phyi rol pas 'jug par dka' ba dang / rtogs par dga' ba yin te /
analyzed: bdag med pa'i chos 'di ni rgyu gnyis kyis 'di las phyi rol pas 'jug par dka' ba dang / rtogs par dga' ba yin te /
translated: This Dharma of selflessness is difficult to enter for those outside because of two causes, and it is not pleasing to understand.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: What are the two?

original: de ni rang bzhin gyis kyang rtogs par dka' ba dang / de ji lta ba'i tshul gyis rtogs par sla ba ltar de dag de dang mi 'dra'o //
analyzed: de ni rang bzhin gyis kyang rtogs par dka' ba dang / de ji lta ba'i tshul gyis rtogs par sla ba ltar de dag de dang mi 'dra'o //
translated: It is difficult to understand by nature, and it is easy to understand in the manner of suchness. Those other vehicles are not like that.

original: de la mi slu ba'i don dang / rtogs pa'i don dang thun mong ma yin pa'i don gyis na rang bzhin gyis 'jug par dka'o //
analyzed: de la mi slu ba'i don dang / rtogs pa'i don dang thun mong ma yin pa'i don gyis na rang bzhin gyis 'jug par dka'o //
translated: It is difficult to understand by nature because of the meaning of non-deception, the meaning of realization, and the meaning of non-commonality.

original: zab pa yin la zab pa nyid du snang ba'i phyir 'di ni mi slu ba'i don to //
analyzed: zab pa yin la zab pa nyid du snang ba'i phyir 'di ni mi slu ba'i don to //
translated: It has the meaning of non-deception because it is profound and appears as profound.

original: bdag nyid kyis mthong bar dka' la gzhan gyi sgra las ni bka' 'khor du khong du chud pa'i phyir 'di ni rtogs pa'i don to //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis mthong bar dka' la gzhan gyi sgra las ni bka' 'khor du khong du chud pa'i phyir 'di ni rtogs pa'i don to //
translated: It has the meaning of realization because it is difficult to see for oneself, but can be understood from the words of others.

original: rtog ge'i spyod yul ma yin pas rtog ge bas brtag mi nus pa'i phyir 'di ni thun mong ma yin pa'i don @186a * //
analyzed: rtog ge'i spyod yul ma yin pas rtog ge bas brtag mi nus pa'i phyir 'di ni thun mong ma yin pa'i don @186a * //
translated: It has the meaning of non-commonality because it is not the domain of sophistry, and cannot be analyzed by sophists.

original: to ; / chos 'di ni zhib mo mkhas pa dang mdzangs pa'i brtags pas rig par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: to ; / chos 'di ni zhib mo mkhas pa dang mdzangs pa'i brtags pas rig par bya ba yin te /
translated: This Dharma is subtle, to be known through the investigation of the wise and the sagacious.

original: rnam grangs 'di dag kyang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rnam grangs 'di dag kyang 'di lta ste /
translated: These synonyms are as follows:

original: rnam grangs bsdu ba las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam grangs bsdu ba las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood according to the Compendium of Ascertainments.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i don ni rnam pa gnyis kyis thams cad kyi thams cad du shes par rig par bya ste /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i don ni rnam pa gnyis kyis thams cad kyi thams cad du shes par rig par bya ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: The meaning that is taught by the TathƒÅgata should be understood in all cases by means of two aspects:

original: lung dang rtogs pas so //
analyzed: lung dang rtogs pas so //
translated: scripture and realization.

original: de la lung ni so so'i skye bo'i thos pa dang bsams pa dang bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab bo //
analyzed: de la lung ni so so'i skye bo'i thos pa dang bsams pa dang bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab bo //
translated: Among them, scripture is the wisdom arisen from hearing, contemplation, and meditation of ordinary beings.

original: rtogs pa ni slob pa dang mi slob pa'i shes rab ste /
analyzed: rtogs pa ni slob pa dang mi slob pa'i shes rab ste /
translated: Realization is the wisdom of learners and nonlearners.

original: de'i phyi nas thob pa 'jig rten pa'i'o //
analyzed: de'i phyi nas thob pa 'jig rten pa'i'o //
translated: The mundane is obtained after that.

original: de la gsungs pa'i don thams cad kyi thams cad du kun mi shes la nga rgyal yang nga rgyal yin par mngon par ma rtogs shing /
analyzed: de la gsungs pa'i don thams cad kyi thams cad du kun mi shes la nga rgyal yang nga rgyal yin par mngon par ma rtogs shing /
translated: Among them, one who does not understand all of the meaning that is taught in all cases and does not realize that pride is pride

original: mi spong ba ni so so'i skye bo bdag tu mi lta ba yin no //
analyzed: mi spong ba ni so so'i skye bo bdag tu mi lta ba yin no //
translated: and does not abandon it is an ordinary being who does not view the self.

original: de la thams cad kyi thams cad du don kun shes shing nga rgyal yang nga rgyal yin par mngon par rtogs la spong par ni mi byed pa ni slob pa'o //
analyzed: de la thams cad kyi thams cad du don kun shes shing nga rgyal yang nga rgyal yin par mngon par rtogs la spong par ni mi byed pa ni slob pa'o //
translated: The learner is one who understands all objects in every way, but does not abandon pride, since he realizes that pride is pride.

original: thams cad byed pa ni mi slob pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad byed pa ni mi slob pa'o //
translated: The adept is one who does everything.üîΩThe TathƒÅgata knows the conventional truth and the ultimate truth just as they are, but he does not answer questions in terms of either of them, because he sees that it is harmful to do so.

original: 'di la de bzhin gshegs pa ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa dang / don dam pa'i bden pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mkhyen mod kyi de gnyi ga'i tshul gyis lan gdab tu mi rung la gnod pa dang bcas par gzigs na lan mi 'debs shing zhal gyis mi bzhes te shi phan chad yod par 'gyur ba dang
analyzed: 'di la de bzhin gshegs pa ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa dang / don dam pa'i bden pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mkhyen mod kyi de gnyi ga'i tshul gyis lan gdab tu mi rung la gnod pa dang bcas par gzigs na lan mi 'debs shing zhal gyis mi bzhes te shi phan chad yod par 'gyur ba dang
translated: For example, he does not answer the questions, ‚ÄúDoes the world have an end?üîΩDoes it not have an end?üîΩDoes it both have and not have an end?

original: med par 'gyur ba dang / gnyi gar 'gyur ba dang / gnyi gar mi 'gyur ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: med par 'gyur ba dang / gnyi gar 'gyur ba dang / gnyi gar mi 'gyur ba lta bu'o //
translated: Does it neither have nor not have an end?üîΩDoes the TathƒÅgata exist after death?üîΩDoes he not exist after death?üîΩDoes he both exist and not exist after death?üîΩDoes he neither exist nor not exist after death?‚Äù

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa de ltar ye shes gzigs pa sngon du btang ste /
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa de ltar ye shes gzigs pa sngon du btang ste /
translated: The TathƒÅgata, having first considered the knowledge of his vision,

original: lan mi 'debs pa la mi mkhyen pa tsam du 'dzin pa gang yin pa de dag ni de'i lta ba dang ldan pa'i mi shes pa yin par mngon par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: lan mi 'debs pa la mi mkhyen pa tsam du 'dzin pa gang yin pa de dag ni de'i lta ba dang ldan pa'i mi shes pa yin par mngon par rig par bya'o //
translated: Those who do not respond to this question, or who hold that the Buddha does not know, are said to be ignorant of the Buddha‚Äôs teaching.

original: 'di gnyis ni 'du byed rnams kyi rnam par 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di gnyis ni 'du byed rnams kyi rnam par 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: These two are the transformation of the formative forces.

original: rga ba'i rnam par 'gyur ba ni ji ltar 'di na kha cig rgas par gyur te /
analyzed: rga ba'i rnam par 'gyur ba ni ji ltar 'di na kha cig rgas par gyur te /
translated: The transformation of the body is that, in this world, some people become old.

original: skyes nas lo brgya nyi shu lon pa ste de bas na lus na ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: skyes nas lo brgya nyi shu lon pa ste de bas na lus na ba zhes bya'o //
translated: They are a hundred or a hundred and twenty years old and are therefore said to be ‚Äòbodily old‚Äô.

original: sems kyi yid mi bde ba'i rnam par 'gyur ba ni gang gis sems na ba zhes bya bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: sems kyi yid mi bde ba'i rnam par 'gyur ba ni gang gis sems na ba zhes bya bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The transformation of the mind is that which is called ‚Äòmental pain‚Äô.

original: de la dang po'i rnam par 'gyur ba la ni byis pa dang mkhas pa rnams kyis dga' mgur byar med do //
analyzed: de la dang po'i rnam par 'gyur ba la ni byis pa dang mkhas pa rnams kyis dga' mgur byar med do //
translated: In the first transformation, neither the wise nor the foolish are able to do what they want.

original: gnyis pa la ni mkhas pa rnams kyi ni yod @186b la byis pa rnams kyi ni med do //
analyzed: gnyis pa la ni mkhas pa rnams kyi ni yod @186b la byis pa rnams kyi ni med do //
translated: In the second, the wise are able to do what they want, but the foolish are not.

original: de la byis pa ni lus na bar gyur na sems na bar yang nges par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la byis pa ni lus na bar gyur na sems na bar yang nges par 'gyur ro //
translated: In this regard, the foolish are certain to become mentally pained when the body is pained.

original: mkhas pa ni lus na bar gyur kyang sems na bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: mkhas pa ni lus na bar gyur kyang sems na bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: The wise person, even when the body is sick, the mind is not sick.

original: de bas na 'di ni 'dir byis pa dang mkhas pa'i khyad par yin no //
analyzed: de bas na 'di ni 'dir byis pa dang mkhas pa'i khyad par yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is the difference between the wise and the foolish in this matter.

original: legs par bzung ba'i chos zhes bya ba ni thos pa dang bsams pa'o //
analyzed: legs par bzung ba'i chos zhes bya ba ni thos pa dang bsams pa'o //
translated: The Dharma that is well taken up is what is heard and reflected upon.

original: legs par yid la byas zhes bya ba ni bsgoms pa'o //üîΩlegs par bsten zhes bya ba ni ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: legs par yid la byas zhes bya ba ni bsgoms pa'o // legs par bsten zhes bya ba ni ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: Well kept in mind is what is cultivated.üîΩWell attended to is what is attended to as it is.

original: legs par khong du chud ces bya ba ni ji snyed yod pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: legs par khong du chud ces bya ba ni ji snyed yod pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: Well penetrated is what is penetrated as much as there is.

original: nyan thos rnams ni rnam pa gnyis kyis 'di lta ste /
analyzed: nyan thos rnams ni rnam pa gnyis kyis 'di lta ste /
translated: The disciples are of two kinds:

original: nye bar len pa thams cad spong ba yongs su shes pa gsung ba'i ston pa yang dag par dris pa la len 'debs par byed de /
analyzed: nye bar len pa thams cad spong ba yongs su shes pa gsung ba'i ston pa yang dag par dris pa la len 'debs par byed de /
translated: The teacher who teaches the complete abandonment of all appropriation is one who answers questions correctly.

original: gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two?

original: gang la nye bar len pa thams cad spong ba yongs su shes pa gsung ba dang gang gi phyir ro //
analyzed: gang la nye bar len pa thams cad spong ba yongs su shes pa gsung ba dang gang gi phyir ro //
translated: The one who teaches the complete abandonment of all appropriation and the one for whom it is.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa ni 'du byed thams cad la spong ba yongs su shes pa gsung ngo //
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa ni 'du byed thams cad la spong ba yongs su shes pa gsung ngo //
translated: The Tathagata has declared that the abandonment of all formations is the full understanding of their rejection.

original: nye bar len pa ma spangs pa la nyes dmigs rnam pa gsum yang dag par gzigs la spangs pa la ni phan yon rnam pa gsum yang dag par gzigs so //
analyzed: nye bar len pa ma spangs pa la nyes dmigs rnam pa gsum yang dag par gzigs la spangs pa la ni phan yon rnam pa gsum yang dag par gzigs so //
translated: He has seen that there are three kinds of misfortune in the non-abandonment of the appropriating aggregates, and three kinds of benefit in their abandonment.

original: de la 'du byed rnams la nye bar len pa dang bcas pa la ni 'du byed rnam par 'gyur ba na mya ngan la sogs pa skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la 'du byed rnams la nye bar len pa dang bcas pa la ni 'du byed rnam par 'gyur ba na mya ngan la sogs pa skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: In the case of formations with appropriation, when the formations change, sorrow and so on arise.

original: de bas na 'di ni nyes dmigs dang pos te 'du byed thob pa rnam par 'gyur ba las gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de bas na 'di ni nyes dmigs dang pos te 'du byed thob pa rnam par 'gyur ba las gyur ba yin no //
translated: This is the first misfortune, which comes from the change of the appropriated formations.

original: gzhan yang 'du byed rnams la nye bar len pa dang bcas pa'i 'du byed rnams ma thob pa thob par bya ba'i phyir yongs su tshol ba la zhugs pa na mi dge ba rnam pa du ma mang po rnam pa sna tshogs kun du spyod de /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'du byed rnams la nye bar len pa dang bcas pa'i 'du byed rnams ma thob pa thob par bya ba'i phyir yongs su tshol ba la zhugs pa na mi dge ba rnam pa du ma mang po rnam pa sna tshogs kun du spyod de /
translated: Moreover, when one who is engaged in the pursuit of the non-acquisition of formations with appropriation in order to acquire the non-acquisition of formations, engages in many kinds of unwholesome actions.

original: des na de yongs su tshol ba de dang / mi dge ba de la brten nas sdug bsngal rnam pa bzhi la gnas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na de yongs su tshol ba de dang / mi dge ba de la brten nas sdug bsngal rnam pa bzhi la gnas par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, due to the pursuit of that and the reliance on that nonvirtue, one will abide in four types of suffering.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: What are the four?

original: mngon du byung zhing nye la rab tu nye ba dang / 'byung ba nye bar gnas par gyur pa dang / gzhan gyis gnod pa'i dbang gis byung ba dang ; bdag gis kun nas nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis byung ba ste /
analyzed: mngon du byung zhing nye la rab tu nye ba dang / 'byung ba nye bar gnas par gyur pa dang / gzhan gyis gnod pa'i dbang gis byung ba dang ; bdag gis kun nas nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis byung ba ste /

analyzed: gzhan yang phyi rol pa ni phal cher rnyed pa 'dod pa dang bkur sti 'dod pa dang / bdag bstod pa dang / gzhan smod pa'o //

original: gzhan yang phyi rol pa ni 'phags pa rnams kyi dam pa'i chos bstan pa yang dag pa'i gdams ngag bstan cing rjes su bstan pa la mi mthun par byed cing smod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang phyi rol pa ni 'phags pa rnams kyi dam pa'i chos bstan pa yang dag pa'i gdams ngag bstan cing rjes su bstan pa la mi mthun par byed cing smod par byed pa'o //
translated: Moreover, non-Buddhists are hostile to and disparage the teaching of the noble Dharma, the instruction and the teaching of the true Dharma.

analyzed: gzhan yang phyi rol pa ni dam pa'i chos ltar bcos pa smra ba po bdag nyid kyang 'dod la gzhan dag la yang ston pa'o //

original: gzhan yang 'di las phyi rol pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'am de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos kyis tshar bcad cing chos 'dul ba 'di legs par gsungs pa yin par khong du chud du zin kyang bdag nyid kyi nyes par bshad pa'i dbang du byas nas tha na
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di las phyi rol pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'am de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos kyis tshar bcad cing chos 'dul ba 'di legs par gsungs pa yin par khong du chud du zin kyang bdag nyid kyi nyes par bshad pa'i dbang du byas nas tha na
translated: Moreover, even though non-Buddhists understand that the TathƒÅgata or the TathƒÅgata‚Äôs disciples have refuted them and that this Dharma and Vinaya is well-spoken, they still,üîΩunder the influence of their own bad explanations, do not go for refuge to the Buddha, the Dharma, and the community of monks.

original: dpyad pa'i 'dab tsam gyi phyir yang sgrub par mi byed pa 'di ni byis pa'i rtags lnga pa'o //
analyzed: dpyad pa'i 'dab tsam gyi phyir yang sgrub par mi byed pa 'di ni byis pa'i rtags lnga pa'o //

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni yan lag rnam pa drug dang ldan pas smra ba'i seng ge bla na med pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni yan lag rnam pa drug dang ldan pas smra ba'i seng ge bla na med pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The TathƒÅgata is called the unexcelled lion of speakers because he has six aspects.

analyzed: drug gang zhe na / thog ma kho nar rgol ba 'ongs na ji tsam dgos par dri ba rnams kyi skabs 'byed par mdzad pa dang / rtsod par bzhed pa'i phyir rtsod pa rtsom par mdzad pa ni ma yin gyi sems can la thugs brtse ba 'ba' zhig gi phyir dang mi dga' ba rnams dga' bar bya ba dang /
translated: What are the six?üîΩFirst, when an opponent comes, he gives him an opportunity to ask questions to the extent necessary. He does not begin a debate because he wants to debate, but only out of love for sentient beings, in order to delight those who are not delighted and to increase the delight of those who are.

original: dga' ba rnams phyir zhing bskyed par bya ba'i phyir dang / de rtsod pa mdzad pa na yang dbang po rnams rab tu zhi zhing 'gyur ba med pa dang / de la bag tsha ba'i 'jigs pa bag chags kyi 'brel pa tsam yang med pa dang /

original: de la lhar bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis tshar bcad du med pa dang / des lan gyi rnam pa gcig btab pa las 'da' bar nus pa 'ga' tsam yang med de lan dang po btab ba kho nas tshar gcod par 'gyur ba dang / shin tu mkhas shing 'jigs pa med pa yang de bzhin gshegs pa dang lhan cig tu rtsod pa rtsom pa na spobs pa yang rdugs par 'gyur la bag tsha ba'i 'jigs pa yang shas cher 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: de la lhar bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis tshar bcad du med pa dang / des lan gyi rnam pa gcig btab pa las 'da' bar nus pa 'ga' tsam yang med de lan dang po btab ba kho nas tshar gcod par 'gyur ba dang / shin tu mkhas shing 'jigs pa med pa yang de bzhin gshegs pa dang lhan cig tu rtsod pa rtsom pa na spobs pa yang rdugs par 'gyur la bag tsha ba'i 'jigs pa yang shas cher 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang /

original: g-yo ba'i rtsod pa thams cad @189a * //
analyzed: g-yo ba'i rtsod pa thams cad @189a * //

analyzed: kyi sgo nas kyang g-yo bya bar mi nus pa dang / 'khor 'dus shing 'khod pa gzu bor 'dug pa thams cad kyis kyang de bzhin gshegs pa la ni rgyal bar 'gyur ba'i sems nye bar 'jog la rgol ba la ni pham par 'gyur ba'i sems nye bar 'jog pa dang /

original: smra ba ni 'di gnyis te /
analyzed: smra ba ni 'di gnyis te /

analyzed: gnyis gang zhe na /

analyzed: bdag tu smra ba dang / bdag med par smra ba'o //

original: 'du byed de dag kyang de'i bdag gis yid la de dag tu yang zhi zhing chud la khongs su gtogs te yan lag dang yan lag gi rjes su 'brang bar gyur pas na de'i phyir bdag ni gzugs la sogs pa'i 'du byed kyi bdag nyid yin no snyam
analyzed: 'du byed de dag kyang de'i bdag gis yid la de dag tu yang zhi zhing chud la khongs su gtogs te yan lag dang yan lag gi rjes su 'brang bar gyur pas na de'i phyir bdag ni gzugs la sogs pa'i 'du byed kyi bdag nyid yin no snyam
translated: And those formations are pacified, included, and contained in the self of that person, and they become the limbs and secondary limbs. Therefore, the self is the nature of the formations of form, etc.

original: mo // de zhing pa zhing la ji lta ba bzhin du 'du byed zhing dang 'dra ba de dag la brten nas zhing blas dang 'dra ba'i bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa skye bar 'gyur la /

translated: And he experiences pleasant and unpleasant fruits, which are like grass, herbs, and trees. Therefore, he is called a theorist of self.

original: bdag med par smra ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: bdag med par smra ba gang zhe na /

original: de ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa gnyis te /

analyzed: bdag tu smra ba sun 'byin pa dang bdag med par smra ba sgrub pa'o //

original: de la sun 'byin pa ni gal te bdag sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i las la rang dbang yod pa zhig yin na bdag ni rtag tu bde ba 'dod la sdug bsngal ba dang mi mthun pas de'i phyir bsod nams 'ba' zhig skye ba'i bsod nams ma yin
analyzed: de la sun 'byin pa ni gal te bdag sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i las la rang dbang yod pa zhig yin na bdag ni rtag tu bde ba 'dod la sdug bsngal ba dang mi mthun pas de'i phyir bsod nams 'ba' zhig skye ba'i bsod nams ma yin
translated: The refutation of that is as follows: If the self were independent with respect to pleasant and unpleasant actions, then since the self always desires pleasure and is averse to pain, it would be logical that only merit

original: pa ni mi skye ba'i rigs so //
analyzed: pa ni mi skye ba'i rigs so //
translated: would arise and nonmerit would not arise.

original: sdug pa nye bar gnas pa nang dang phyi rol gyi 'du byed rnam par 'gyur zhing gzhan du 'gyur ba las de'i mya ngan dang smre sngags 'don pa la sogs pa yang 'byung ba'i mi rigs te /
analyzed: sdug pa nye bar gnas pa nang dang phyi rol gyi 'du byed rnam par 'gyur zhing gzhan du 'gyur ba las de'i mya ngan dang smre sngags 'don pa la sogs pa yang 'byung ba'i mi rigs te /
translated: It would be illogical for the self to experience grief, lamentation, and so on, due to the transformation and change of internal and external formations that are pleasant when they persist.

original: bdag brtags pas ched du @189b bsgrubs pa gang yin pa des rtag tu gnas par 'gyur zhing de kho na bzhin du mi 'gyur ba'i rigs na de kho na ltar yang mi 'dug pa 'di ni sun 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: bdag brtags pas ched du @189b bsgrubs pa gang yin pa des rtag tu gnas par 'gyur zhing de kho na bzhin du mi 'gyur ba'i rigs na de kho na ltar yang mi 'dug pa 'di ni sun 'byin pa'o //
translated: It would be logical that whatever is accomplished by the self‚Äôs examination would always persist and not change at all. But that it does not remain just as it is is the refutation.

original: bsgrub pa ni gang gi phyir 'du byed rnams rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yin pas na de'i phyir bsod nams kyi rkyen rnams yod pa las bsod nams skye ba dang / de las bzlog pa las bsod nams ma yin pa skye ba yod la rkyen de las sdug pa dang /

translated: The proof is that since compounded phenomena are dependently arisen, merit arises from the conditions of merit and nonmerit arises from the opposite of that.

original: mi sdug pa'i 'bras bu 'byung ba de yang rkyen la rag las pa'i phyir mi rtag ste /
analyzed: mi sdug pa'i 'bras bu 'byung ba de yang rkyen la rag las pa'i phyir mi rtag ste /
translated: And since the result of that condition arises as either pleasant or unpleasant, it is impermanent because it depends on conditions.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu tsam du gtogs pa'i 'du byed kyi rgyun yod pa la bdag la sogs pa gdags su rung ngo //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu tsam du gtogs pa'i 'du byed kyi rgyun yod pa la bdag la sogs pa gdags su rung ngo //
translated: The continuum of compounded phenomena that is merely included in cause and effect exists, and it is suitable to impute self and so on to that.

original: don dam par ni chos thams cad bdag med pa yin te de bas na 'di ni bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: don dam par ni chos thams cad bdag med pa yin te de bas na 'di ni bsgrub pa'o //
translated: But ultimately all phenomena are selfless, and therefore this is the proof.

original: slob pa las ni rnam pa lngas mi slob pa khyad par du 'phags te mi slob pa ni shes pa bla na med pa dang ldan pa yin la slob pa'i shes pa ni bla na yod pa'o //
analyzed: slob pa las ni rnam pa lngas mi slob pa khyad par du 'phags te mi slob pa ni shes pa bla na med pa dang ldan pa yin la slob pa'i shes pa ni bla na yod pa'o //
translated: Nonlearners are superior to learners in five ways: Nonlearners possess unsurpassed knowledge, but the knowledge of learners is surpassed.

analyzed: shes pa bla na yod pa ji lta ba de bzhin du lam dang rnam par grol ba yang bla na med par rig par bya'o //

analyzed: 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi mig shin tu yongs su dag pas de bzhin gshegs pa chos kyi skur mthong la /

original: slob pas ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: slob pas ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: But those in training do not.

original: nan tan du sgrub pa shin tu yongs su rdzogs pas de bzhin gshegs pa la bsnyen bkur byed la slob pa ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: nan tan du sgrub pa shin tu yongs su rdzogs pas de bzhin gshegs pa la bsnyen bkur byed la slob pa ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: By completely perfecting the practice of devotion, one serves the TathƒÅgata. But those in training do not.

original: de bas na 'di ni rnam pa lnga pa'o //üîΩgzhi bsdu ba las 'du byed rab tu rnam par 'byed pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de bas na 'di ni rnam pa lnga pa'o // gzhi bsdu ba las 'du byed rab tu rnam par 'byed pa zhes bya ba ste /

analyzed: bsdu ba dang po rdzogs so / // / rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las gzhi bsdu ba /
translated: This concludes the chapter on the analysis of the formative forces, the first chapter in the Treatise on the Compendium of the Teachings.üîΩThe Compendium of Bases

original: bam po bdun pa /
analyzed: bam po bdun pa /
translated: The Compendium of Bases is the seventh chapter in the YogƒÅcƒÅrabh≈´mi.

original: spyi sdom ni /
analyzed: spyi sdom ni /
translated: The general summary is:

original: rnam gzhag shes pa mtshungs pa dang // 'dod chags bral ba tha ma yin //
analyzed: rnam gzhag shes pa mtshungs pa dang // 'dod chags bral ba tha ma yin //

original: sdom ni / rnam par gzhag dang rnam dbye dang // rmongs pa dang ni rmongs pa med //
analyzed: sdom ni / rnam par gzhag dang rnam dbye dang // rmongs pa dang ni rmongs pa med //

analyzed: gdams ngag dang ni rnam par grol //
translated: instruction, and liberation.

original: nyon mongs las rnams rgyas pa yin //
analyzed: nyon mongs las rnams rgyas pa yin //
translated: Afflictions and actions are extensive.

original: tshor ba ni rnam pa lngar rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: tshor ba ni rnam pa lngar rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
translated: Feeling should be understood as presented in five ways:

analyzed: rang bzhin dang / rten dang / dmigs pa dang / grogs dang / rjes su 'brang ba'o //

analyzed: mig dang / rna ba @190a * //

analyzed: dang ; sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid do //

analyzed: dmigs pa ni drug go //

analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnams so //

analyzed: rjes su 'brang ba ni de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems gang la tshor ba rnam pa gsum char dang yang mgo mnyam du skye zhing 'gag pa'i rten byed pa'i tshul gyis rjes su 'brang ba'o //

analyzed: tshor ba rnam pa lnga po rnam par gzhag pa 'di rab tu dbye ba ni rnam pa brgyad du rig par bya ste /

translated: the specific categories of the internal sense bases, the specific categories of the external sense bases, the specific categories of the six groups of consciousness, the specific categories of the six groups of contact, the specific categories of the six groups of feeling, the specific categories of the six groups of perception,

analyzed: gsum 'dus pa'i don gyis ni rnam pa gsum du dbye bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The three should be understood as the three categories based on the meaning of the coming together of the three.

original: tshor ba'i rgyu'i don gyis ni bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: tshor ba'i rgyu'i don gyis ni bzhi pa'o //

analyzed: gsum 'dus nas reg pa'i 'bras bu'i don gyis ni lnga pa'o //

analyzed: tshor ba yongs su bcad pa'i rjes la tha snyad 'dogs pa'i don gyis ni drug pa ste /

original: 'di ltar tshor ba ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba 'di lta bu zhig bdag gis nyams su myong ngo snyam du 'du shes pa dang / gzhan dag la yang rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pa lta bu'o //
