translated: Thus, feeling is the experience of pleasure and pain, the perception of ‚ÄúI am experiencing such and such a pleasure or pain,‚Äù and the designation of that to others.

original: las dang nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i don gyis ni bdun pa dang brgyad pa'i rab tu dbye bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i don gyis ni bdun pa dang brgyad pa'i rab tu dbye bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The seventh and eighth members should be understood in terms of the affliction of karma and the affliction of the afflictions.

original: tshor ba dang phrad pa dang 'bral bar bya ba'i phyir ni sems pas mngon par 'du byed do //
analyzed: tshor ba dang phrad pa dang 'bral bar bya ba'i phyir ni sems pas mngon par 'du byed do //
translated: One forms volitions through the mind in order to unite with or separate from feelings.

original: ji tsam du sems pas mngon par 'du byed pa de tsam du sred pas 'dod cing smon par byed do //
analyzed: ji tsam du sems pas mngon par 'du byed pa de tsam du sred pas 'dod cing smon par byed do //
translated: To the extent that one forms volitions, to that extent craving desires and wishes.

original: thams cad ni rnam pa gnyis te phyogs gcig gi thams cad dang thams cad kyi thams cad do //
analyzed: thams cad ni rnam pa gnyis te phyogs gcig gi thams cad dang thams cad kyi thams cad do //
translated: All is twofold: all of one part and all of all parts.

original: de la thams cad mi rtag go zhes bya ba ni phyogs gcig gi thams cad kyi dbang du byas nas brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: de la thams cad mi rtag go zhes bya ba ni phyogs gcig gi thams cad kyi dbang du byas nas brjod pa yin te /
translated: In this regard, ‚Äúall is impermanent‚Äù is stated in terms of all of one part.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: 'du byed thams cad yin gyi /
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad yin gyi /
translated: All formations are so,

original: 'dus ma byas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ni ma yin no //
translated: but not the unconditioned.

original: chos thams cad @190b bdag med pa zhes bya ba ni 'dir thams cad kyi thams cad la bya bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad @190b bdag med pa zhes bya ba ni 'dir thams cad kyi thams cad la bya bar rig par bya'o //
translated: All phenomena are without self. Here, ‚Äúall‚Äù should be understood to mean all without exception.

original: brjed ngas pa ni rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: brjed ngas pa ni rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste /
translated: Forgetfulness should be understood as threefold:

original: rang bzhin dang rgyu dang 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin dang rgyu dang 'bras bu'o //
translated: by nature, cause, and result.

original: de la rang bzhin ni da ltar byung ba'i dus na ni kun nas dkris pas brjed ngas la /
analyzed: de la rang bzhin ni da ltar byung ba'i dus na ni kun nas dkris pas brjed ngas la /
translated: Among them, forgetfulness by nature is the forgetfulness of the present moment due to the fetters,

original: tshe phyi ma la ni bag la nyal gyis brjed ngas pa'i chos can du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: tshe phyi ma la ni bag la nyal gyis brjed ngas pa'i chos can du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: and forgetfulness by latent tendency is the forgetfulness that will occur in the future.

original: de la brjed ngas pa'i rgyu ni tshor ba rnam par gzhag par rnam pa lnga la mi rtag pa la sogs par khong du ma chud pa dang / lus thams cad kyi thog ma dang / bar dang tha mar yongs su nyon mongs pa'i sgo nas skye ba dang /
analyzed: de la brjed ngas pa'i rgyu ni tshor ba rnam par gzhag par rnam pa lnga la mi rtag pa la sogs par khong du ma chud pa dang / lus thams cad kyi thog ma dang / bar dang tha mar yongs su nyon mongs pa'i sgo nas skye ba dang /
translated: Among them, the cause of forgetfulness is the failure to comprehend impermanence and so on with regard to the five aggregates that are posited as feelings, and the arising of forgetfulness through the affliction of the body at the beginning, middle, and end.

original: rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba'i chos can yin par khong du ma chud pa ste /
analyzed: rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba'i chos can yin par khong du ma chud pa ste /
translated: It is the fact that one has not understood that one is subject to aging, sickness, and death.

original: de la dang por ni skye bas yongs su nyon mongs so //
analyzed: de la dang por ni skye bas yongs su nyon mongs so //
translated: In the first place, one is afflicted by birth.

original: bar du ni na bas yongs su nyon mongs so //
analyzed: bar du ni na bas yongs su nyon mongs so //
translated: In the middle, one is afflicted by sickness.

original: tha mar ni rga ba dang / 'chi ba gnyis kyis yongs su nyon mongs so //
analyzed: tha mar ni rga ba dang / 'chi ba gnyis kyis yongs su nyon mongs so //
translated: In the end, one is afflicted by both aging and death.

original: de la brjed ngas pa'i 'bras bu ni mya ngan la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal dang / sred pa la sogs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: de la brjed ngas pa'i 'bras bu ni mya ngan la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal dang / sred pa la sogs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: The result of forgetfulness is the suffering of sorrow, etc., and the defilement of craving, etc.

original: brjed ngas pa med pa yang rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: brjed ngas pa med pa yang rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste /
translated: The absence of forgetfulness should be understood in three ways:

original: rang bzhin dang / bar du gcod pa dang / sgrib pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin dang / bar du gcod pa dang / sgrib pa'o //
translated: as a natural quality, as a counteragent to the obstacles, and as a covering.

original: de la rang bzhin ni tshor ba rnam par gzhag pa rnam pa lnga'i rang gi mtshan nyid dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid khong du chud pa ste /
analyzed: de la rang bzhin ni tshor ba rnam par gzhag pa rnam pa lnga'i rang gi mtshan nyid dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid khong du chud pa ste /
translated: The natural quality is the understanding of the individual and general characteristics of the fivefold presentation of feeling.

original: de yang nyon mongs pa spang bar bya ba dang / bden pa mngon par rtogs par bya ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang nyon mongs pa spang bar bya ba dang / bden pa mngon par rtogs par bya ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, it is for the sake of abandoning the defilements, realizing the truths, and realizing nirvana.

original: de la brjed ngas pa'i bar du gcod pa ni bdud bzhi po rnams yin te /
analyzed: de la brjed ngas pa'i bar du gcod pa ni bdud bzhi po rnams yin te /
translated: Among these, the four demons are the obstacles to non-forgetting.

original: phung po'i bdud ni thams cad du rjes su 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phung po'i bdud ni thams cad du rjes su 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The demon of the aggregates is always connected.

original: lha'i bu'i bdud ni dus dus su bar chad byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lha'i bu'i bdud ni dus dus su bar chad byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The demon of the sons of the gods is the intermittent obstacle.

original: 'chi ba dang nyon mongs pa'i bdud gnyis ni 'chi 'pho dang / skye ba las byung ba'i sdug bsngal gyi gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'chi ba dang nyon mongs pa'i bdud gnyis ni 'chi 'pho dang / skye ba las byung ba'i sdug bsngal gyi gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The two demons of death and defilements are the basis of suffering arising from death and rebirth.

original: de la brjed ngas pa'i sgrib pa ni yul lkog tu gyur pa la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa dang yul lkog tu gyur pa ma yin pa la dmigs pa'am /
analyzed: de la brjed ngas pa'i sgrib pa ni yul lkog tu gyur pa la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa dang yul lkog tu gyur pa ma yin pa la dmigs pa'am /
translated: Among these, the obscuration of non-forgetting is the defilement that takes a hidden object as its object, or the defilement that takes an unhidden object as its object, or the defilement that takes both as its object.

original: kun nas dkris pa'am /üîΩbag la nyal lo //
analyzed: kun nas dkris pa'am /üîΩbag la nyal lo //
translated: Or it is the envelopment,üîΩor the latent tendency.

original: sangs rgyas rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi nyan thos rnams ni rnam pa gsum gyis slob ma rnams la yang dag pa'i gdams ngag sbyin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi nyan thos rnams ni rnam pa gsum gyis slob ma rnams la yang dag pa'i gdams ngag sbyin par rig par bya ste /
translated: The buddhas and the disciples of the buddhas are known to give true instructions to their disciples in three ways.

original: @191a * // 'di lta ste /
analyzed: @191a * // 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: bsdu ba'i gdams ngag dang / dmigs pa la mthun mthun du 'dzud pa dang / rang gi don thob par byed pa ste /
analyzed: bsdu ba'i gdams ngag dang / dmigs pa la mthun mthun du 'dzud pa dang / rang gi don thob par byed pa ste /
translated: the instruction in the means of conversion, the instruction in the means of entering into the object, and the instruction in the means of attaining one's own goal.

original: de dag kyang cho 'phrul rnam pa gsum dang go rims bzhin du sbyar bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang cho 'phrul rnam pa gsum dang go rims bzhin du sbyar bar rig par bya'o //
translated: These should be known as corresponding to the three kinds of miracles.

original: rnam par grol ba yongs su smin par bya ba'i shes rab ni rnam pa gnyis kyis yang dag par btsal bar bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba yongs su smin par bya ba'i shes rab ni rnam pa gnyis kyis yang dag par btsal bar bya ste /
translated: The wisdom that brings about the maturation of liberation is to be sought in two ways.

original: tshul bzhin du thos ba dang bsam pa khyad par can gyi shes rab slob pa'i rnam par grol ba yongs su smin par byed pa gang yin pa dang / slob pa'i khyad par can gyi shes rab mi slob pa'i rnam par grol ba yongs su smin par byed pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: tshul bzhin du thos ba dang bsam pa khyad par can gyi shes rab slob pa'i rnam par grol ba yongs su smin par byed pa gang yin pa dang / slob pa'i khyad par can gyi shes rab mi slob pa'i rnam par grol ba yongs su smin par byed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The second is the ripening of the liberation of no more learning, which is the wisdom of special learning.

original: sems rnam par grol ba yongs su smin pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: sems rnam par grol ba yongs su smin pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The full ripening of mental liberation is twofold:

original: slob pa dang mi slob pa'o //
analyzed: slob pa dang mi slob pa'o //
translated: that of learning and that of no more learning.

original: de la slob pa ni rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la slob pa ni rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The first is the vajra-like samadhi.

original: mi slob pa ni de yan chad yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mi slob pa ni de yan chad yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The second is the state beyond that.

original: dge slong sems rnam par gral ba la zhugs pa la ni chos lnga dben pa yin te /
analyzed: dge slong sems rnam par gral ba la zhugs pa la ni chos lnga dben pa yin te /
translated: For the monk who has entered mental liberation, there are five things that are void.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: yang dag pa'i gdams ngag dang / zhi gnas kyi yan lag dang / lhag mthong gi yan lag dang / rtag tu gus par byed pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab bo //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i gdams ngag dang / zhi gnas kyi yan lag dang / lhag mthong gi yan lag dang / rtag tu gus par byed pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab bo //
translated: Right advice, the branches of serenity, the branches of insight, constant devotion, and supramundane wisdom.

original: de la yang dag pa'i gdams ngag ni yang dag pa'i mdza' bshes rnam pa gsum gyis phye ba ste /
analyzed: de la yang dag pa'i gdams ngag ni yang dag pa'i mdza' bshes rnam pa gsum gyis phye ba ste /
translated: Right advice is distinguished by three kinds of right friends.

original: ston pa dang / slob dpon nam bla ma dang 'dra ba'i tshangs ba mtshungs par spyod pa dang / khyim pa mkhas pa chos 'di pa rnams so //
analyzed: ston pa dang / slob dpon nam bla ma dang 'dra ba'i tshangs ba mtshungs par spyod pa dang / khyim pa mkhas pa chos 'di pa rnams so //
translated: They are teachers, preceptors, or spiritual benefactors who are like gurus, fellow brahmacarins, and learned householders who belong to this teaching.

original: 'di dag ni mdza' bshes rnam pa gsum po yin te /
analyzed: 'di dag ni mdza' bshes rnam pa gsum po yin te /
translated: These are the three kinds of right friends.

original: 'di rnams ni yang dag pa'i gdams ngag 'byung ba'i sgo yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams ni yang dag pa'i gdams ngag 'byung ba'i sgo yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that they are the doors to the arising of right advice.üîΩThe branches of serenity are as they occur in the Sravakabhumi:

original: de la zhi gnas kyi yan lag ni ji ltar 'di na kha cig tshul khrims dang ldan par gnas pa zhes bya ba nas rgyas par nyan thos kyi sa las 'byung ba bzhin te /
analyzed: de la zhi gnas kyi yan lag ni ji ltar 'di na kha cig tshul khrims dang ldan par gnas pa zhes bya ba nas rgyas par nyan thos kyi sa las 'byung ba bzhin te /
translated: Here someone lives with perfect morality. He sees danger in the slightest transgression and, taking it as a principle to practice, trains in the rules of training.

original: de de ltar tshul khrims dang ldan na 'gyod pa med do //
analyzed: de de ltar tshul khrims dang ldan na 'gyod pa med do //
translated: When one is endowed with morality in this way, there is no regret.

original: 'gyod pa med na mchog tu dga' ba nas rgyas par bde ba dang ldan na sems mnyam par 'jog nus so zhes bya ba'i bar du sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'gyod pa med na mchog tu dga' ba nas rgyas par bde ba dang ldan na sems mnyam par 'jog nus so zhes bya ba'i bar du sbyar ro //
translated: When there is no regret, there is supreme joy, and so on up to: when one is endowed with happiness, one is able to enter into concentration.

original: de la lhag mthong gi yan lag ni gtam rnam pa gsum ci 'dod pa thob pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: de la lhag mthong gi yan lag ni gtam rnam pa gsum ci 'dod pa thob pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: The limbs of insight are the three kinds of talk, whatever they may be, that lead to the attainment of what is desired.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: 'phags pa'i dang / yo byad bsnyungs pa'i @191b dang ; sems sgrib pa med pa la phan par 'gyur ba'i'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i dang / yo byad bsnyungs pa'i @191b dang ; sems sgrib pa med pa la phan par 'gyur ba'i'o //
translated: talk that is conducive to the attainment of the noble qualities, talk that is conducive to the attainment of fewness of wishes, and talk that is conducive to the attainment of a mind free from obstruction.

original: de la 'phags pa'i gtam gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la 'phags pa'i gtam gang zhe na /
translated: What is talk that is conducive to the attainment of the noble qualities?

original: 'phags pa rnams kyi mi slob pa'i phung po lnga las brtsams pa'i gtam yin te //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyi mi slob pa'i phung po lnga las brtsams pa'i gtam yin te //
translated: It is talk that is based on the five aggregates of the noble ones that are free from training.

original: 'phags pa rnams ni 'di ltar tshul khrims dang ldan no //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams ni 'di ltar tshul khrims dang ldan no //
translated: The noble ones are endowed with morality in this way.

original: ting nge 'dzin ni 'di lta bu'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni 'di lta bu'o //
translated: Their concentration is like this.

original: shes rab ni 'di lta bu'o //
analyzed: shes rab ni 'di lta bu'o //
translated: Their wisdom is like this.

original: rnam par grol ba ni 'di lta bu'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba ni 'di lta bu'o //
translated: Their liberation is like this.

original: rnam par grol ba'i ye shes gzigs pa dang ldan pa ni 'di lta bu'o zhes bya ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i ye shes gzigs pa dang ldan pa ni 'di lta bu'o zhes bya ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: The one who possesses the knowledge-vision of liberation is this one.

original: de la yo byad bsnyungs pa'i gtam gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la yo byad bsnyungs pa'i gtam gang zhe na /
translated: What is talk about the diminution of possessions?

original: 'phags pa'i rigs gsum las brtsams te 'dod pa nyung ba dang / chog shes pa dang / bsnyungs pa'i gtam dang ; spong ba dang bsgom pa la kun tu dga' ba las brtsams nas 'du 'dzi med pa'i gtam gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i rigs gsum las brtsams te 'dod pa nyung ba dang / chog shes pa dang / bsnyungs pa'i gtam dang ; spong ba dang bsgom pa la kun tu dga' ba las brtsams nas 'du 'dzi med pa'i gtam gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is talk about the three noble lineages, about fewness of wishes, contentment, the diminution of possessions, and about the delight in renunciation and meditation.

original: de la sems sgrib pa med pa la phan par 'gyur ba'i gtam gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la sems sgrib pa med pa la phan par 'gyur ba'i gtam gang zhe na /
translated: What is talk that is helpful for the non-obstruction of thought?

original: de ni sgo gsum du rig par bya ste nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa thams cad kyi sgrib pa med pa la phan par 'gyur ba dang / sgrib pa lnga'i sgrib pa med pa la phan par 'gyur ba dang / ma rig pa'i sgrib pa'i sgrib pa med pa la phan par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de ni sgo gsum du rig par bya ste nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa thams cad kyi sgrib pa med pa la phan par 'gyur ba dang / sgrib pa lnga'i sgrib pa med pa la phan par 'gyur ba dang / ma rig pa'i sgrib pa'i sgrib pa med pa la phan par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It should be understood as threefold: that which is helpful for the non-obstruction of all the obstructions of the defilements, that which is helpful for the non-obstruction of the five obstructions, and that which is helpful for the non-obstruction of the obstruction of ignorance.

original: de la dang po ni spong ba dang 'dod chags dang bral ba dang 'gog pa'i khams las brtsams te /
analyzed: de la dang po ni spong ba dang 'dod chags dang bral ba dang 'gog pa'i khams las brtsams te /
translated: The first is the teaching that begins with the realms of abandonment, freedom from attachment, and cessation.

original: de thob par bya ba yin par rig par bya'o ;
analyzed: de thob par bya ba yin par rig par bya'o ;
translated: It should be understood as the means of attaining them.

original: / gnyis pa ni de dag nyid la phan yon du lta ba las brtsams te /
analyzed: / gnyis pa ni de dag nyid la phan yon du lta ba las brtsams te /
translated: The second is the teaching that begins with the view of the benefits of those very realms.

original: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi sgrib pa rnams dang / sgrib pa'i gnas kyi 'du byed rnams kyi nyes dmigs kyi gtam yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi sgrib pa rnams dang / sgrib pa'i gnas kyi 'du byed rnams kyi nyes dmigs kyi gtam yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood as the teaching of the faults of the obscurations that are adverse to them and of the formative forces that are the basis of the obscurations.

original: gsum pa ni rkyen 'di pa nyid kyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang mthun pa'i gtam yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gsum pa ni rkyen 'di pa nyid kyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang mthun pa'i gtam yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: The third is the teaching that is in conformity with the dependent origination of this very condition.

original: rnam pa gsum po 'di dag kyang lhag mthong gi yan lag yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa gsum po 'di dag kyang lhag mthong gi yan lag yin no //
translated: These three aspects should be understood as the branches of profound insight.

original: de yang mdor bsdu na 'dun pa skyed par byed pa dang / yang dag pa'i tshogs la sbyor bar byed pa dang / yang dag par yid la byed pa la sbyor bar byed pa'o ;
analyzed: de yang mdor bsdu na 'dun pa skyed par byed pa dang / yang dag pa'i tshogs la sbyor bar byed pa dang / yang dag par yid la byed pa la sbyor bar byed pa'o ;
translated: In brief, they are: the generation of will, the application to the correct accumulation and the application to correct mental attention.

original: / de la 'phags pa'i ni 'dun pa skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: / de la 'phags pa'i ni 'dun pa skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: The noble ones are those who generate aspiration.

original: yo byad bsnyungs pa'i ni yang dag pa'i tshogs la sbyor bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: yo byad bsnyungs pa'i ni yang dag pa'i tshogs la sbyor bar byed pa'o //
translated: Those who are austere are those who apply themselves to the true accumulations.

original: sems sgrib pa med pa la phan par 'gyur ba'i ni yang dag par yid la byed pa la sbyor bar byed pa'o //üîΩgtam de dag la brten nas zhi gnas su @192a * //
analyzed: sems sgrib pa med pa la phan par 'gyur ba'i ni yang dag par yid la byed pa la sbyor bar byed pa'o // gtam de dag la brten nas zhi gnas su @192a * //
translated: Those who are free from obscurations of mind are those who apply themselves to correct mental activity.

original: gtogs pa'i shes rab gang yin pa de ni lhag mthong yin te /
analyzed: gtogs pa'i shes rab gang yin pa de ni lhag mthong yin te /
translated: The wisdom that is included in serenity, which is based on those topics, is insight.

original: de bas na de ni lhag mthong gi yan lag ces bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na de ni lhag mthong gi yan lag ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the branch of insight.

original: rtag tu gus par byed pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: rtag tu gus par byed pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is constant devotion?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is this:

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la sbyor ba de nyid la brtson 'grus brtsams pa ste /
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la sbyor ba de nyid la brtson 'grus brtsams pa ste /
translated: The exertion of effort in the very application of serenity and insight.

original: gnas pa'i rgyun du byed cing byang bar byed pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gnas pa'i rgyun du byed cing byang bar byed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the practice and the cultivation of the continuity of serenity.

original: brtson 'grus brtsams pa de yang rnam pa lngar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtsams pa de yang rnam pa lngar rig par bya ste /
translated: This exertion of effort should be known as fivefold:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is this:

original: go cha'i brtson 'grus dang / sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus dang / zhum pa med pa'i brtson 'grus dang / mi bskyod pa'i brtson 'grus dang ; chog mi shes pa'i brtson 'grus so //
analyzed: go cha'i brtson 'grus dang / sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus dang / zhum pa med pa'i brtson 'grus dang / mi bskyod pa'i brtson 'grus dang ; chog mi shes pa'i brtson 'grus so //
translated: and insatiable effort.

original: de thog ma kho nar ni 'dun pa drag po dang ldan te mngon par spro ba brtan por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de thog ma kho nar ni 'dun pa drag po dang ldan te mngon par spro ba brtan por 'gyur ro //
translated: First of all, one becomes endowed with intense aspiration, with firm enthusiasm.

original: de bzhin du sbyor bar yang byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyor bar yang byed do //
translated: One also applies oneself in that way.

original: chos rgya chen po rnams thob par bya ba'i phyir bdag nyid la yang khyad du mi gsod de zhum par mi 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: chos rgya chen po rnams thob par bya ba'i phyir bdag nyid la yang khyad du mi gsod de zhum par mi 'gyur ro ;

original: / grang ba la sogs pa'i gnod pa rnams kyang bzod do //
analyzed: / grang ba la sogs pa'i gnod pa rnams kyang bzod do //

original: ngan don gyis kyang chog par mi 'dzin te /
analyzed: ngan don gyis kyang chog par mi 'dzin te /
