original: gong ma bas kyang ches gong du gya nom pa 'dod pa'i tshul gyis gnas so //
analyzed: gong ma bas kyang ches gong du gya nom pa 'dod pa'i tshul gyis gnas so //
translated: One remains in a manner of seeking ever higher and more refined virtue than one has already achieved.

original: de de ltar brtson 'grus brtsams te gnas na bden pa rnams mngon par rtogs par 'gyur te ;
analyzed: de de ltar brtson 'grus brtsams te gnas na bden pa rnams mngon par rtogs par 'gyur te ;
translated: When one remains in that way, having begun effort, one realizes the truths.

original: 'phags pa'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: and he attains the noble supramundane wisdom.

original: de la brten nas bsgom pa'i lam la rgyu zhing 'gro bar gtogs pa dang gnas par gtogs pa dang / rten du gtogs pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa las sems rnam par sbyong bar byed de /
analyzed: de la brten nas bsgom pa'i lam la rgyu zhing 'gro bar gtogs pa dang gnas par gtogs pa dang / rten du gtogs pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa las sems rnam par sbyong bar byed de /
translated: In dependence on that, he purifies his mind from the afflictive obstructions and from the obstructions to the knowable, while traveling on the path of cultivation.

original: de grong ngam grong gi nye 'khor na gnas pa na bud med gzhon nu kha dog rgyas shing chags par 'gyur ba mthong na 'dod chags bsal ba'i phyir mi sdug pa yid la byed do //
analyzed: de grong ngam grong gi nye 'khor na gnas pa na bud med gzhon nu kha dog rgyas shing chags par 'gyur ba mthong na 'dod chags bsal ba'i phyir mi sdug pa yid la byed do //
translated: When he lives in a village or its environs and sees young women with beautiful complexions, he contemplates foulness in order to eliminate desire.

original: yang na gzhan dag gis gnod par byas shing dkrugs par gyur na gnod sems bsal ba'i phyir byams pa yid la byed de /
analyzed: yang na gzhan dag gis gnod par byas shing dkrugs par gyur na gnod sems bsal ba'i phyir byams pa yid la byed de /
translated: Or, if he is disturbed by others‚Äô violence, he contemplates lovingkindness in order to eliminate malice.

original: de ltar na rgyu zhing 'gro ba na nye ba'i nyon mongs pa las sems rnam par sbyong par byed do //
analyzed: de ltar na rgyu zhing 'gro ba na nye ba'i nyon mongs pa las sems rnam par sbyong par byed do //
translated: Thus, while traveling, he purifies his mind from the afflictive obstructions.

original: de dben pa na gnas pa na 'dod pa'i rtog pa la sogs pa'i rtog pa dang bral ba'i phyir dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba dran pa sgom par byed de /
analyzed: de dben pa na gnas pa na 'dod pa'i rtog pa la sogs pa'i rtog pa dang bral ba'i phyir dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba dran pa sgom par byed de /
translated: When he is in solitude, he cultivates mindfulness of inhalation and exhalation because he is free from conceptual thoughts such as desire.

original: de ltar na gnas par gtogs pa'i nye ba'i @192b nyon mongs pa las sems rnam par sbyong bar byed do //
analyzed: de ltar na gnas par gtogs pa'i nye ba'i @192b nyon mongs pa las sems rnam par sbyong bar byed do //
translated: Thus, he purifies his mind of the secondary mental afflictions that are associated with the meditative development of the immeasurables.

original: de 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab thob pa de la brten nas nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal gyi lhag ma bsal ba'i phyir 'du byed thams cad la mi rtag pa'i 'du shes sgom par byed do //
analyzed: de 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab thob pa de la brten nas nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal gyi lhag ma bsal ba'i phyir 'du byed thams cad la mi rtag pa'i 'du shes sgom par byed do //
translated: On the basis of that supramundane wisdom, he cultivates the perception of impermanence in relation to all conditioned entities in order to eliminate the remaining pride that thinks ‚ÄúI am‚Äù.

original: de ltar na skyes bu dam pa la brten pas yang dag pa'i gdams ngag sngon du btang nas 'di'i go rims kyis rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin thob pa'i phyir slob pa'i rnam par grol ba yang yongs su rdzogs par byed la /
analyzed: de ltar na skyes bu dam pa la brten pas yang dag pa'i gdams ngag sngon du btang nas 'di'i go rims kyis rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin thob pa'i phyir slob pa'i rnam par grol ba yang yongs su rdzogs par byed la /
translated: Thus, by relying on a holy person, by means of the instructions that he has received, he perfects the liberation of the adept in this order and, on the basis of the vajra-like meditative concentration, he abandons the most subtle form of the most subtle category of the most subtle of the obscurations to that which needs to be known.

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir mi slob pa'i rnam par grol ba yang yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir mi slob pa'i rnam par grol ba yang yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: He also brings to completion the unlearner's liberation, which is free from all afflictions.

original: de la rnam par grol ba gang zhe na /üîΩgtan du spong ba'i gnyen po skyes pas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs su gtogs pa'i gnas ngan len thams cad shin tu sbyangs pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de la rnam par grol ba gang zhe na / gtan du spong ba'i gnyen po skyes pas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs su gtogs pa'i gnas ngan len thams cad shin tu sbyangs pa'i phyir //
translated: What is liberation?

original: gnas yongs su gyur ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams gtan mi skye ba'i chos can du gyur pa gang yin pa de la ni rnam par grol ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gnas yongs su gyur ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams gtan mi skye ba'i chos can du gyur pa gang yin pa de la ni rnam par grol ba zhes bya'o //
translated: It is the transformation of the basis, which is the attainment of the quality of the non-arising of the afflictions due to the complete purification of all the negative tendencies that are included in the category of the afflictions, through the arising of the antidote that is the abandonment of those afflictions forever.

original: 'phags pa nyan thos ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba ni 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched 'du byed kyi lhag ma srid pa'i rtse mo bsgrubs te gnas nas de ma thag tu zag pa rnams zad pa thob par 'gyur
analyzed: 'phags pa nyan thos ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba ni 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched 'du byed kyi lhag ma srid pa'i rtse mo bsgrubs te gnas nas de ma thag tu zag pa rnams zad pa thob par 'gyur
translated: The noble disciple who is free from attachment to the sphere of nothingness establishes the summit of existence, which is the remainder of the formations that are the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception, and immediately after that attains the exhaustion of the defilements.

original: ro // lhag ma'i gnas skabs kyi tshe ni de'i zag pa rnams mthar gyis spong bar 'gyur te nam ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba ma thob kyi bar du re zhig de ma thag tu zag pa zad pa thob par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ro // lhag ma'i gnas skabs kyi tshe ni de'i zag pa rnams mthar gyis spong bar 'gyur te nam ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba ma thob kyi bar du re zhig de ma thag tu zag pa zad pa thob par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: At the time of the remaining stages, his contaminants are gradually abandoned. He does not immediately obtain the destruction of contaminants until he obtains freedom from attachment to the base of nothingness.

original: de la 'dod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ma rig pa ma gtogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams ni 'dod pa'i zag pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'dod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ma rig pa ma gtogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams ni 'dod pa'i zag pa'o //
translated: The contaminants of the desire realm are the afflictions except for ignorance associated with the desire realm.

original: sems can 'dod chags dang ma bral ba rnams dang 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams kyi gzugs dang gzugs med pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ma rig pa ma gtogs pa ni srid pa'i zag pa'o //
analyzed: sems can 'dod chags dang ma bral ba rnams dang 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams kyi gzugs dang gzugs med pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ma rig pa ma gtogs pa ni srid pa'i zag pa'o //
translated: The contaminants of existence are the afflictions except for ignorance associated with the form and formless realms of sentient beings who are not free from attachment and those who are free from attachment.

original: mu stegs can rnams ni ma gtogs te de dag ni log pa'i rtog pas rmongs par byas pa'i lta ba ngan ba rnams kyis sems zil gyis non pas lta ba de la brten nas kha cig ni 'dod pa yongs su tshol bar byed do //üîΩkha cig ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba nas 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi bar du yongs su tshol bar byed de de dag gi khams gsum gyi mi shes pa gcig tu @193a * //
analyzed: mu stegs can rnams ni ma gtogs te de dag ni log pa'i rtog pas rmongs par byas pa'i lta ba ngan ba rnams kyis sems zil gyis non pas lta ba de la brten nas kha cig ni 'dod pa yongs su tshol bar byed do // kha cig ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba nas 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi bar du yongs su tshol bar byed de de dag gi khams gsum gyi mi shes pa gcig tu @193a * //
translated: Some of them seek the pleasures of desire,üîΩand some seek freedom from the desire realm up to the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: bsdus pa ni ma rig pa'i zag pa rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bsdus pa ni ma rig pa'i zag pa rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: Their ignorance of the three realms should be known as the classification of the defilement of ignorance.

original: gzhi rnam pa dgu la kun du sbyor bas na kun du sbyor ba dgur rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gzhi rnam pa dgu la kun du sbyor bas na kun du sbyor ba dgur rig par bya ste /
translated: The nine fetters should be known as the fetters to the nine bases.

original: gzhi rnam pa dgu gang zhe na /
analyzed: gzhi rnam pa dgu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the nine bases?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: khyim pa'i phyogs la brten te chags su rung ba'i sems can dang sems can ma yin par grags pa'i yul la 'dod chags kyi kun nas dkris pa dang / phyogs de nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i sems can dang sems can ma yin par grags pa'i yul la khong khro ba'i kun nas dkris pa dang /
analyzed: khyim pa'i phyogs la brten te chags su rung ba'i sems can dang sems can ma yin par grags pa'i yul la 'dod chags kyi kun nas dkris pa dang / phyogs de nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i sems can dang sems can ma yin par grags pa'i yul la khong khro ba'i kun nas dkris pa dang /
translated: It is the fetter of desire for objects that are known as sentient beings and nonsentient beings that are suitable to be attached to in relation to the household life. It is the fetter of anger toward objects that are known as sentient beings and nonsentient beings that are not in accord with that very position.

original: sems can du grags pa la nga rgyal gyi kun nas dkris pa dang / nyes par bshad pa'i chos can rnams kyi rab tu byung ba'i phyogs la brten te /
analyzed: sems can du grags pa la nga rgyal gyi kun nas dkris pa dang / nyes par bshad pa'i chos can rnams kyi rab tu byung ba'i phyogs la brten te /
translated: It is the fetter of pride toward those who are known as sentient beings. It is the fetter of the three kinds of wrong belief in relation to the aspect of going forth of those who have been taught badly.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows.

original: dam pa'i chos ma yin pa thos pa dang / tshul bzhin ma yin pa sems pa dang / thabs kyis yongs su ma zin pa'i bsgom pa la log par mos pa rnam pa gsum gyi kun nas dkris pa dang ; legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la ma mos pa'i kun nas dkris pa dang /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos ma yin pa thos pa dang / tshul bzhin ma yin pa sems pa dang / thabs kyis yongs su ma zin pa'i bsgom pa la log par mos pa rnam pa gsum gyi kun nas dkris pa dang ; legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la ma mos pa'i kun nas dkris pa dang /
translated: It is the fetter of the three kinds of wrong belief in relation to listening to what is not the true Dharma, reflecting improperly, and meditating without being embraced by skillful means. It is the fetter of not believing in the well-spoken Dharma and Vinaya.

original: rab tu byung ba'i phyogs la brten pa'i shes pas dbul ba dang / khyim pa'i phyogs la brten pa'i longs spyod kyis dbul ba ste /
analyzed: rab tu byung ba'i phyogs la brten pa'i shes pas dbul ba dang / khyim pa'i phyogs la brten pa'i longs spyod kyis dbul ba ste /
translated: The poverty of wisdom is based on the side of going forth, and the poverty of resources is based on the side of household life.

original: gzhi dgu po 'di rnams kyi rjes su chags pa'i kun du sbyor ba la sogs pa kun du sbyor ba dgu po rnams mthun mthun du kun du sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: gzhi dgu po 'di rnams kyi rjes su chags pa'i kun du sbyor ba la sogs pa kun du sbyor ba dgu po rnams mthun mthun du kun du sbyor bar byed do //
translated: These nine fetters, such as the fetter of attachment to pleasure, are fetters in accordance with the nine bases.

original: de la phrag dog gis bsgyur te chos mthun pa rnams la chos kyi ser sna byed pa des ni phyi ma la shes pas dbul bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la phrag dog gis bsgyur te chos mthun pa rnams la chos kyi ser sna byed pa des ni phyi ma la shes pas dbul bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Among them, one who is transformed by jealousy and is stingy with the Dharma with regard to those who are similar in having the Dharma will become poor in wisdom in the next life.

original: lhag ma yang mthun mthun du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma yang mthun mthun du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The rest should be applied in accordance with the situation.

original: de la 'dod chags kyi 'ching bas bcings pas bde ba tshor bar 'gyur ba'i yul las sems lhag par btang snyoms su byed mi nus so //
analyzed: de la 'dod chags kyi 'ching bas bcings pas bde ba tshor bar 'gyur ba'i yul las sems lhag par btang snyoms su byed mi nus so //
translated: Among them, one who is bound by the fetter of attachment is unable to set the mind in equanimity with regard to objects that give rise to pleasant feelings.

original: de bzhin du zhe sdang gi 'ching bas sdug bsngal tshor bar 'gyur ba'i yul dang / gti mug gi 'ching bas sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa tshor bar 'gyur ba'i yul te /
analyzed: de bzhin du zhe sdang gi 'ching bas sdug bsngal tshor bar 'gyur ba'i yul dang / gti mug gi 'ching bas sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa tshor bar 'gyur ba'i yul te /
translated: Likewise, the object of the fetter of hatred is the object of the feeling of suffering. The object of the fetter of delusion is the object of the feeling that is neither pleasant nor unpleasant.

original: de bas na 'ching ba gsum mo //
analyzed: de bas na 'ching ba gsum mo //
translated: Therefore, there are three fetters.

original: nyon mongs pa'i phyogs su gtogs pa'i gnas ngan len gyi rten du gnas pa ni bag la nyal zhes bya ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i phyogs su gtogs pa'i gnas ngan len gyi rten du gnas pa ni bag la nyal zhes bya ste /
translated: The latent tendency is the support for the negative tendencies that belong to the class of afflictions.

original: kun nas dkris pa skye ba'i sa bon lta bu yin no //
analyzed: kun nas dkris pa skye ba'i sa bon lta bu yin no //
translated: It is like the seed of the arising of the entanglements.

original: de yang 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i phyogs su gtogs pa'i bye brag @193b dang ; 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyogs su gtogs pa'i bye brag dang gnyi ga'i phyogs su gtogs pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa bdun du rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: de yang 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i phyogs su gtogs pa'i bye brag @193b dang ; 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyogs su gtogs pa'i bye brag dang gnyi ga'i phyogs su gtogs pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa bdun du rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: Moreover, it is established as sevenfold by the specific distinctions of the class that is not free from attachment, the class that is free from attachment, and the class that is both.

original: de la 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i phyogs su gtogs pa'i bye brag gis ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang khong khro ba'i bag la nyal lo //
analyzed: de la 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i phyogs su gtogs pa'i bye brag gis ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang khong khro ba'i bag la nyal lo //
translated: The latent tendency of desire realm attachment and the latent tendency of desire realm aversion are due to the distinction of being included in the class of those not free from attachment.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyogs su gtogs pa'i bye brag gis ni srid pa'i 'dod chags kyi bag la nyal lo //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyogs su gtogs pa'i bye brag gis ni srid pa'i 'dod chags kyi bag la nyal lo //
translated: The latent tendency of attachment to existence is due to the distinction of being included in the class of those free from attachment.

original: de gnyi ga'i phyogs su gtogs pa'i bye brag gis ni nga rgyal dang ma rig pa dang / lta ba dang the tshom gyi bag la nyal te /
analyzed: de gnyi ga'i phyogs su gtogs pa'i bye brag gis ni nga rgyal dang ma rig pa dang / lta ba dang the tshom gyi bag la nyal te /
translated: The latent tendencies of pride, ignorance, view, and doubt are due to the distinction of being included in the class of both.

original: 'di rnams kyis ni nyon mongs pa thams cad bsdus so //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyis ni nyon mongs pa thams cad bsdus so //
translated: These include all afflictions.

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams ni chags pa mi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / de bzhin du zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / khro ba dang / khon du 'dzin pa ste rgyas par ni dngos po phran tshegs kyi mdo las 'byung ba bzhin te /
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams ni chags pa mi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / de bzhin du zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / khro ba dang / khon du 'dzin pa ste rgyas par ni dngos po phran tshegs kyi mdo las 'byung ba bzhin te /
translated: The branch afflictions are attachment, the root of nonvirtue, and similarly aversion, confusion, anger, and resentment. They are explained in detail in the K·π£udraka Collection.

original: de la mi dge ba thams cad kun nas slong ba ni chags pa mi dge ba'i rtsa ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la mi dge ba thams cad kun nas slong ba ni chags pa mi dge ba'i rtsa ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The root of unwholesomeness called ‚Äúattachment‚Äù is the instigator of all unwholesomeness.

original: zhe sdang dang / gti mug kyang de dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //üîΩkha'i nyes rtsom khong khro ba'i kun nas dkris pa ni khro ba'o //
analyzed: zhe sdang dang / gti mug kyang de dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o // kha'i nyes rtsom khong khro ba'i kun nas dkris pa ni khro ba'o //
translated: Hatred and delusion should be understood in the same way.üîΩAnger is the envelopment of the mind by hatred.

original: nang gi bsam pa la yod pa ni khun du 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: nang gi bsam pa la yod pa ni khun du 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Bearing a grudge is the persistence of anger in the mind.

original: sdig pa mkhyud pa ni 'chab pa'o //
analyzed: sdig pa mkhyud pa ni 'chab pa'o //
translated: Concealment is the hiding of one‚Äôs faults.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyis yongs su yi chad pa ni yongs su gdung ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyis yongs su yi chad pa ni yongs su gdung ba'o //
translated: Resentment is the mental distress caused by an affliction.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi sems kyis gzhan gyi 'byor ba la mngon par mi dga' ba ni phrag dog go //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi sems kyis gzhan gyi 'byor ba la mngon par mi dga' ba ni phrag dog go //
translated: Jealousy is the displeasure of the mind at another‚Äôs success.

original: yod byad rnams la kun du 'dzin pa ni ser sna'o //
analyzed: yod byad rnams la kun du 'dzin pa ni ser sna'o //
translated: Avarice is the grasping at goods.

original: slu ba'i bsam pas bdag nyid gzhan du sems la gzhan du ston pa ni rgyu'o //
analyzed: slu ba'i bsam pas bdag nyid gzhan du sems la gzhan du ston pa ni rgyu'o //
translated: Hypocrisy is the concealing of one‚Äôs faults by deception.

original: sems mi drang ba'i phyir mi mngon pa dang mi gsal ba dang brda phrad par mi byed pa ni g-yo'o //
analyzed: sems mi drang ba'i phyir mi mngon pa dang mi gsal ba dang brda phrad par mi byed pa ni g-yo'o //
translated: Guile is the crookedness of mind that is not straightforward, clear, or open.

original: bdag la brten nas kha na ma tho bas mi 'dzem pa ni ngo tsha mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: bdag la brten nas kha na ma tho bas mi 'dzem pa ni ngo tsha mi shes pa'o //
translated: Shamelessness is the lack of embarrassment at short comings with regard to oneself.

original: gzhan la brten nas kha na ma tho bas mi 'dzim pa ni khrel med pa'o //üîΩchung ngu bas bdag che'o snyam pa'am mtshungs pa dang mtshungs so snyam pa'i sems kyis 'gying ba ni nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: gzhan la brten nas kha na ma tho bas mi 'dzim pa ni khrel med pa'o // chung ngu bas bdag che'o snyam pa'am mtshungs pa dang mtshungs so snyam pa'i sems kyis 'gying ba ni nga rgyal lo //
translated: Lack of conscience is the lack of embarrassment at short comings with regard to others.üîΩPride is the inflation of the mind which thinks that one is superior, equal or inferior.

original: mtshungs pa bas bdag che'o snyam pa'am che ba dang mtshungs so snyam pa'i 'gying ba ni che ba'i nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: mtshungs pa bas bdag che'o snyam pa'am che ba dang mtshungs so snyam pa'i 'gying ba ni che ba'i nga rgyal lo //
translated: Pride of superiority is the inflation of the mind which thinks that one is superior to one's equals or that one is equal to one's superiors.

original: che ba bas kyang bdag ches che'o snyam pa'i 'gying ba ni nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal lo //üîΩ'du byed rnams la bdag @194a * //
analyzed: che ba bas kyang bdag ches che'o snyam pa'i 'gying ba ni nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal lo // 'du byed rnams la bdag @194a * //
translated: Pride of inferiority is the inflation of the mind which thinks that one is superior to one's superiors.üîΩPride of conceit is the inflation of the mind which thinks that one is the best in regard to certain qualities.

original: gam bdag gir yang dag par lta ba'i 'gying ba ni nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: gam bdag gir yang dag par lta ba'i 'gying ba ni nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal lo //
translated: Pride of thinking 'I am' is the inflation of the mind which thinks that the aggregates are the self or belong to the self.

original: khyad par rtogs pa ma thob par bdag gis thob bo snyam pa'i 'gying ba ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: khyad par rtogs pa ma thob par bdag gis thob bo snyam pa'i 'gying ba ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal lo //
translated: Arrogance is the inflation of the mind which thinks that one has attained special qualities which one has not attained.

original: ches khyad par du 'phags pa bas bdag cung zad tsam gyis chung ngo snyam pa'i 'gying ba ni chung ba'i nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: ches khyad par du 'phags pa bas bdag cung zad tsam gyis chung ngo snyam pa'i 'gying ba ni chung ba'i nga rgyal lo //
translated: The pride of thinking, I am a little bit inferior to those who are very superior, is the pride of the small.

original: yon tan dang ldan pa ma yin bzhin du bdag ni yon tan dang ldan pa'i snyam pa'i 'gying ba ni log pa'i nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: yon tan dang ldan pa ma yin bzhin du bdag ni yon tan dang ldan pa'i snyam pa'i 'gying ba ni log pa'i nga rgyal lo //
translated: The pride of thinking, I have good qualities, when one does not have them, is false pride.

original: 'byor ba gang yang rung ba zhig gis nyon mongs pa can gyi sems kyi dregs pa ni rgyags pa'o //
analyzed: 'byor ba gang yang rung ba zhig gis nyon mongs pa can gyi sems kyi dregs pa ni rgyags pa'o //
translated: The haughtiness of an afflicted mind due to any kind of prosperity is arrogance.

original: dge ba'i phyogs la mi rtsom pas sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las sems kun du mi srung ba ni bag med pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i phyogs la mi rtsom pas sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las sems kun du mi srung ba ni bag med pa'o //
translated: The lack of mental protection from sinful, non-virtuous dharmas due to not engaging in the virtuous side is carelessness.

original: bla ma dang yon gnas la mi 'dud pa ni khengs pa'o //
analyzed: bla ma dang yon gnas la mi 'dud pa ni khengs pa'o //
translated: The lack of bowing to gurus and those worthy of honor is haughtiness.

original: mtshon thogs pa dang / dbyug ba thogs pa dang / 'thab pa dang / mtshang 'dru ba dang / 'gyed pa dang / rtsod pa kun du slong bar byed pa'i nyon mongs pa'i kun nas dkris pa ni nyes rtsom mo //
analyzed: mtshon thogs pa dang / dbyug ba thogs pa dang / 'thab pa dang / mtshang 'dru ba dang / 'gyed pa dang / rtsod pa kun du slong bar byed pa'i nyon mongs pa'i kun nas dkris pa ni nyes rtsom mo //
translated: The affliction that instigates taking up weapons, taking up clubs, fighting, accusing, quarreling, and disputing is scheming.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi sems kyis yon tan yod par yid ches par bya ba'i phyir spyod lam bsgyur ba ni tshul 'chos pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi sems kyis yon tan yod par yid ches par bya ba'i phyir spyod lam bsgyur ba ni tshul 'chos pa'o //
translated: Hypocrisy is the alteration of one's behavior by a defiled mind in order to inspire confidence in one's good qualities.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi sems kyis bdag gi yon tan gleng ba'am brten pa'i tshul kun du spyod pas tshig gi lam 'jam po kun du spyod pa ni kha gsag go //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi sems kyis bdag gi yon tan gleng ba'am brten pa'i tshul kun du spyod pas tshig gi lam 'jam po kun du spyod pa ni kha gsag go //
translated: Sycophancy is the use of sweet words by one who, with a defiled mind, praises or flatters in order to get something from another.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi sems kyi mtshan mas 'dod pa'i bsam pa ston pa ni gzhogs slong ngo //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi sems kyi mtshan mas 'dod pa'i bsam pa ston pa ni gzhogs slong ngo //
translated: Flattery is the use of sweet words by one who, with a defiled mind, indicates his desire for something.

original: nan gyis slong ba ni thob kyis 'jal ba'o //üîΩci rnyed pa tsam gyis chog mi shes te /üîΩgzhan gyi rnyed pa bstan pas rnyed pa la lhag par slong ba ni rnyed pas rnyed par byed 'dod pa'o //üîΩyon tan la yid ches par gyur pa dang / ha cang byams ches pas bla ma rnams la zhas med pa ni ma gus pa'o //
analyzed: nan gyis slong ba ni thob kyis 'jal ba'o // ci rnyed pa tsam gyis chog mi shes te / gzhan gyi rnyed pa bstan pas rnyed pa la lhag par slong ba ni rnyed pas rnyed par byed 'dod pa'o // yon tan la yid ches par gyur pa dang / ha cang byams ches pas bla ma rnams la zhas med pa ni ma gus pa'o //
translated: Extortion is the use of force to get something.üîΩInsolence is the lack of respect for others due to excessive pride in one's own qualities.

original: tshig mi bzod pa ni bka' blo mi bde ba'o //
analyzed: tshig mi bzod pa ni bka' blo mi bde ba'o //
translated: Disrespect is the lack of reverence for superiors due to excessive attachment to one's own views or to one's own qualities.

original: gnod pa la 'dzud pa'i bshes gnyen ni sdig pa'i grogs po'o //
analyzed: gnod pa la 'dzud pa'i bshes gnyen ni sdig pa'i grogs po'o //
translated: The spiritual teacher who introduces one to harm is a sinful friend.

original: zang zing la 'chums pas mi bde ba'i yon tan ston zhing yid ches par byed par 'dod pa ni sdig pa 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: zang zing la 'chums pas mi bde ba'i yon tan ston zhing yid ches par byed par 'dod pa ni sdig pa 'dod pa'o //
translated: The desire to show the good qualities of unhappiness and to inspire confidence through greed for material things is the desire for sin.

original: che ba rnams las rnyed pa dang bkur sti chen po 'dod pa ni 'dod chen no //
analyzed: che ba rnams las rnyed pa dang bkur sti chen po 'dod pa ni 'dod chen no //
translated: The desire for great gain and honor from the great is great desire.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi sems kyis mi bde ba'i yon tan stong cing yid ches par byed 'dod pa ni 'dod pa can ni //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi sems kyis mi bde ba'i yon tan stong cing yid ches par byed 'dod pa ni 'dod pa can ni //
translated: The desire to show the good qualities of unhappiness and to inspire confidence through an afflicted mind is desire.

original: gshe ba la phyir gshe ba ni mi bzod pa'o //
analyzed: gshe ba la phyir gshe ba ni mi bzod pa'o //
translated: The desire to retaliate when scolded is impatience.

original: khro ba dang rdag @194b pa dang mtshang 'dru ba la phyir mtshang 'dru ba yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: khro ba dang rdag @194b pa dang mtshang 'dru ba la phyir mtshang 'dru ba yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The same is true of the desire to retaliate when angered, beaten, or insulted.

original: bdag gi longs spyod rnams la rjes su chags pa ni zhen pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gi longs spyod rnams la rjes su chags pa ni zhen pa'o //
translated: Attachment to one's own resources is clinging.

original: gzhan gyi longs spyod rnams la rjes su chags pa ni yongs su zhen pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi longs spyod rnams la rjes su chags pa ni yongs su zhen pa'o //
translated: Attachment to the resources of others is grasping.

original: de bzhin du bzang po rnams dang ngan pa rnams la yang mthun mthun du sbyar bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bzang po rnams dang ngan pa rnams la yang mthun mthun du sbyar bar rig par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, it should be understood that the good and the bad are to be applied in the appropriate manner.

original: yul rnams la lhag par zhen pa ni 'dod chags so //
analyzed: yul rnams la lhag par zhen pa ni 'dod chags so //
translated: Attachment is the excessive desire for objects.

original: nyes par spyod pa rnams la lhag par zhen pa ni chos ma yin pa'i 'dod chags so //
analyzed: nyes par spyod pa rnams la lhag par zhen pa ni chos ma yin pa'i 'dod chags so //
translated: Unrighteous attachment is the excessive desire for bad conduct.

original: bdag dang pha ma la sogs pa'i longs spyod dang / yang dag pa'i longs spyod dang / gzhan gyi rdzas gtams pa la kun du 'dzin pa ni mi bzad pa'i chags pa'o //
analyzed: bdag dang pha ma la sogs pa'i longs spyod dang / yang dag pa'i longs spyod dang / gzhan gyi rdzas gtams pa la kun du 'dzin pa ni mi bzad pa'i chags pa'o //
translated: Excessive attachment is the grasping of one's own enjoyments, the enjoyments of one's parents, etc., and the enjoyments of others that are entrusted to one.

original: 'du byed rnams la bdag gam bdag gir mthong na rtog pa dang lhan cig skyes pa'i lta ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'o //üîΩ'jig tshogs la lta ba la brten nas 'du byed rnams rtag par lta ba ni srid pa'i lta ba'o //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams la bdag gam bdag gir mthong na rtog pa dang lhan cig skyes pa'i lta ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'o // 'jig tshogs la lta ba la brten nas 'du byed rnams rtag par lta ba ni srid pa'i lta ba'o //
translated: The view of individuality is the view that arises together with the conception that the aggregates or the self are mine.üîΩThe view of the eternality of the world is the view that the aggregates are eternal.

original: chad par lta ba ni med par lta ba'o //
analyzed: chad par lta ba ni med par lta ba'o //
translated: The view of annihilation is the view that there is no future world.

original: sgrib pa lnga ni snga ma bzhin du 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sgrib pa lnga ni snga ma bzhin du 'di lta ste /
translated: The five hindrances are as before.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa las 'byung ba dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa las 'byung ba dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood as being like the arising of the earth from the realm of meditative concentration.

original: mi 'dod pa bzhin du dus ma yin par gnyid kyis kun nas dkris pas non pa ni snyom pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'dod pa bzhin du dus ma yin par gnyid kyis kun nas dkris pas non pa ni snyom pa'o //
translated: Laziness is the state of being overcome by the bonds of sleep at an improper time, not by one's own wish.

original: gnas ma yin pa la 'dod pa ni dga' ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gnas ma yin pa la 'dod pa ni dga' ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: Lack of enthusiasm is the desire for an improper place.

original: lus kyi gnas ngan len rags pas sems las su mi rung bar gyur nas lus brkyang bskum byed pa ni bya mangs so //
analyzed: lus kyi gnas ngan len rags pas sems las su mi rung bar gyur nas lus brkyang bskum byed pa ni bya mangs so //
translated: Torpor is the unserviceability of mind that arises from the heaviness of the body's elements, and the stretching of the limbs.

original: kha zas nyungs pa dang mangs pa mi shes pa ni zas kyi tshod mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: kha zas nyungs pa dang mangs pa mi shes pa ni zas kyi tshod mi shes pa'o //
translated: Lack of knowledge of the right amount of food is the inability to know the right amount of food to eat.

original: bya ba'i rigs pa mi byed pa dang / bya ba'i mi rigs pa byed pa la ji ltar thos pa dang bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa'i chos rnams la bag med pa sngon du btang nas mi 'jug pa ni yid la mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba'i rigs pa mi byed pa dang / bya ba'i mi rigs pa byed pa la ji ltar thos pa dang bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa'i chos rnams la bag med pa sngon du btang nas mi 'jug pa ni yid la mi byed pa'o //
translated: Lack of attention is the failure to apply oneself to what should be done and to what should not be done, preceded by heedlessness with regard to the teachings that one has heard, reflected upon, and cultivated.

original: sems dmigs pa la btags pa'i yur ba'i gnyid kyis non pa'i phyir mi rigs par 'jug pa dang / bdag nyid la khyad du gsod pa ni sems zhum pa'o //
analyzed: sems dmigs pa la btags pa'i yur ba'i gnyid kyis non pa'i phyir mi rigs par 'jug pa dang / bdag nyid la khyad du gsod pa ni sems zhum pa'o //
translated: It is a lack of respect for the rules of proper conduct and for the person who teaches the rules of proper conduct.üîΩIt is a lack of respect for the person who is a spiritual teacher, a preceptor, a master, a guru, a venerable person, or one who is older in ordination.üîΩIt is a lack of respect for the person who is a spiritual teacher, a preceptor, a master, a guru, a venerable person, or one who is older in ordination.üîΩIt is a lack of respect for the person who is a spiritual teacher, a preceptor, a master, a guru, a venerable person, or one who is older in ordination.üîΩIt is a lack of respect for the person who is a spiritual teacher, a preceptor, a master, a guru, a venerable person, or one who is older in ordination.

original: pha rol la gnod pa'i rang bzhin can ni gdug pa'o //üîΩ'phyas 'dogs pa'i rang bzhin can ni 'phya skyen pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol la gnod pa'i rang bzhin can ni gdug pa'o // 'phyas 'dogs pa'i rang bzhin can ni 'phya skyen pa'o //
translated: It is a lack of respect for the person who is a spiritual teacher, a preceptor, a master, a guru, a venerable person, or one who is older in ordination.üîΩIt is a lack of respect for the person who is a spiritual teacher, a preceptor, a master, a guru, a venerable person, or one who is older in ordination.üîΩIt is a lack of respect for the person who is a spiritual teacher, a preceptor, a master, a guru, a venerable person, or one who is older in ordination.üîΩIt is a lack of respect for the person who is a spiritual teacher, a preceptor, a master, a guru, a venerable person, or one who is older in ordination.üîΩIt is a lack of respect for the person who is a spiritual teacher, a preceptor, a master, a guru, a venerable person, or one who is older in ordination.üîΩIt is a lack of respect for the person who is a spiritual teacher, a preceptor, a master, a guru, a venerable person, or one who is older in ordination.

original: slob dpon dang / bla ma dang / yon gnas dang / chos mthun pa la ni slu ba mi drang ba'o //üîΩlus dang ngag gi las brlang la @195a * //
analyzed: slob dpon dang / bla ma dang / yon gnas dang / chos mthun pa la ni slu ba mi drang ba'o // lus dang ngag gi las brlang la @195a * //
translated: It is a lack of respect for the person who is a spiritual teacher, a preceptor, a master, a guru, a venerable person, or one who is older in ordination.

original: sems rtsub cing mi des ba ni mi mnyen pa'o //üîΩtshul khrims dang / lta ba dang / spyod pa dang / 'tsho ba mi mthun pa ni mi mthun par 'jog pa'o //üîΩchags pa'i sems kyis 'dod pa rnams la dmigs nas yid kyis rtog cing goms par byed pa dang / yang dang yang du byed pa ni 'dod pa'i rtog pa'o //
analyzed: sems rtsub cing mi des ba ni mi mnyen pa'o //üîΩtshul khrims dang / lta ba dang / spyod pa dang / 'tsho ba mi mthun pa ni mi mthun par 'jog pa'o //üîΩchags pa'i sems kyis 'dod pa rnams la dmigs nas yid kyis rtog cing goms par byed pa dang / yang dang yang du byed pa ni 'dod pa'i rtog pa'o //
translated: It is a lack of respect for the person who is a spiritual

original: gzhan gyis gnod pa byas pa'i rgyu la dmigs nas sdang ba'i sems kyis rtog cing goms par byed pa dang / yang dang yang du byed pa ni gnod sems kyi rtog pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis gnod pa byas pa'i rgyu la dmigs nas sdang ba'i sems kyis rtog cing goms par byed pa dang / yang dang yang du byed pa ni gnod sems kyi rtog pa'o //
translated: The thought of malice is the repeated reflection and cultivation of a hostile mind, focusing on the cause of harm done by another.

original: rnam par 'tshe ba'i sems kyis gzhan la gnod pa bya ba la dmigs nas yid kyis snga ma bzhin du byed pa ni rnam par 'tshe ba'i rtog pa'o //üîΩnyon mongs pa can gyi sems kyis gnyen rnams la dmigs nas yid kyis snga ma bzhin du byed pa ni gnyen la rtog pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par 'tshe ba'i sems kyis gzhan la gnod pa bya ba la dmigs nas yid kyis snga ma bzhin du byed pa ni rnam par 'tshe ba'i rtog pa'o // nyon mongs pa can gyi sems kyis gnyen rnams la dmigs nas yid kyis snga ma bzhin du byed pa ni gnyen la rtog pa'o //
translated: The thought of violence is the repeated reflection, as above, focusing on the harm to be done to another with a violent mind.üîΩThe thought of relatives is the repeated reflection, as above, focusing on relatives with an afflicted mind.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi sems kyis yul gyi mi rnams la dmigs nas snga ma bzhin du byed pa ni yul gyi mi la rtog pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi sems kyis yul gyi mi rnams la dmigs nas snga ma bzhin du byed pa ni yul gyi mi la rtog pa'o //
translated: The thought of countrymen is the repeated reflection, as above, focusing on countrymen with an afflicted mind.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi sems kyis rang gi don thob par bya ba'i phyir dus gzhan la lta ba la dmigs nas yid kyis snga ma bzhin du byed pa ni mi 'chi ba'i rtog pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi sems kyis rang gi don thob par bya ba'i phyir dus gzhan la lta ba la dmigs nas yid kyis snga ma bzhin du byed pa ni mi 'chi ba'i rtog pa'o //
translated: The thought of death is the repeated reflection, as above, focusing on the view of another time, with an afflicted mind, for the sake of attaining one's own goal.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi sems kyis bdag dang zhan rnams kyi tha ma dang rab la dmigs nas yid kyis snga ma bzhin du byed pa ni khyad du gsod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rtog pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi sems kyis bdag dang zhan rnams kyi tha ma dang rab la dmigs nas yid kyis snga ma bzhin du byed pa ni khyad du gsod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rtog pa'o //
translated: When one who is in a defiled state of mind observes the low and high status of oneself and others, and then, as before, mentally conceives of them, this is the conception associated with contempt.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi sems kyis sbyin bdag dang 'dris pa'i khyim rnams kyi 'byor pa la dmigs nas yid kyis rtog cing goms par byed pa dang / yang dang yang du byed pa de ni rigs kyi 'byor ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rtog pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi sems kyis sbyin bdag dang 'dris pa'i khyim rnams kyi 'byor pa la dmigs nas yid kyis rtog cing goms par byed pa dang / yang dang yang du byed pa de ni rigs kyi 'byor ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rtog pa'o //
translated: When one who is in a defiled state of mind observes the wealth of benefactors and friends, and then mentally conceives of it and becomes accustomed to it, and does it again and again, this is the conception associated with the wealth of one‚Äôs family.

original: mya ngan la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mya ngan la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: Sorrow, etc., should be understood as before.

original: kun du spyod pa ni kun nas dkris pa yin pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa thams cad la kun nas dkris pa yod do //
analyzed: kun du spyod pa ni kun nas dkris pa yin pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa thams cad la kun nas dkris pa yod do //
translated: Since the entanglements are the same as the envelopments, all the defilements have entanglements.

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa brgyad po rnams ni dus skabs bzhir rgyun mi 'chad par kun du spyod de /
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa brgyad po rnams ni dus skabs bzhir rgyun mi 'chad par kun du spyod de /
translated: The eight proximate defilements are always present in the four occasions.

original: de bas na de rnams nyi tshe kun nas dkris par rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de bas na de rnams nyi tshe kun nas dkris par rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Therefore, they are called ‚Äúpartial entanglements.‚Äù

original: de la lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa'i tshe ni ngo tsha mi shes pa dang khrel med pa kun du spyod pa'i sgo nas sgrib par @195b byed do //
analyzed: de la lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa'i tshe ni ngo tsha mi shes pa dang khrel med pa kun du spyod pa'i sgo nas sgrib par @195b byed do //
translated: At the time of the training in superior morality, shamelessness and absence of abashment are obscurations because they are the doors to the practice of immorality.

original: lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa'i tshe ni rmugs pa dang gnyid do //
analyzed: lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa'i tshe ni rmugs pa dang gnyid do //
translated: At the time of the training in superior mind, lethargy and sleep are obscurations.

original: lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa'i tshe chos rnams rab tu rnam par 'byed pa ni rgod pa dang 'gyod pa'o //
analyzed: lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa'i tshe chos rnams rab tu rnam par 'byed pa ni rgod pa dang 'gyod pa'o //
translated: At the time of the training in superior wisdom, discernment of dharmas and sleep are obscurations.

original: chos mthun pa pa rnams dang phan tshun chos dang zang zing la longs spyod ba'i tshe ni phrad dog dang ser sna kun du spyod pa'i sgo nas sgrib par byed do //
analyzed: chos mthun pa pa rnams dang phan tshun chos dang zang zing la longs spyod ba'i tshe ni phrad dog dang ser sna kun du spyod pa'i sgo nas sgrib par byed do //
translated: At the time of the enjoyment of the Dharma and material things with those who have similar interests, avarice and jealousy are obscurations because they are the doors to the practice of stinginess and envy.

original: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang gnod sems la sogs pa 'dod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa spyod pa'i 'dod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa chen po ma bsangs pa ni 'dod pa'i chu bo'o//
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang gnod sems la sogs pa 'dod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa spyod pa'i 'dod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa chen po ma bsangs pa ni 'dod pa'i chu bo'o//
translated: The great flood of desire is the afflictions associated with desire, such as desire and hatred, which are not eliminated by the practice of the path.

original: srid pa dang lta ba dang ma rig pa'i chu bo yang de bzhin du mthun mthun du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: srid pa dang lta ba dang ma rig pa'i chu bo yang de bzhin du mthun mthun du rig par bya'o //
translated: The floods of existence, views, and ignorance should be understood in the same way, according to their type.

original: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang ma bral ba bu stegs can ma brtags pa rnams kyi ni 'dod pa'i chu bo'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang ma bral ba bu stegs can ma brtags pa rnams kyi ni 'dod pa'i chu bo'o //
translated: The flood of desire is for those who are not free from desire and who are not discerning, i.e., those who are not practicing the path.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams kyi ni srid pa'i chu bo'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams kyi ni srid pa'i chu bo'o //
translated: The flood of existence is for those who are free from desire.üîΩThe flood of views is for those who are not discerning, i.e., not practicing the path.

original: mu stegs can rnams kyi ni phal cher chu bo gnyis su rig par bya ste /
analyzed: mu stegs can rnams kyi ni phal cher chu bo gnyis su rig par bya ste /
translated: The flood of ignorance is for those who are discerning, i.e., practicing the path.üîΩThe flood of views is for those who are not free from the view of the transitory aggregates, i.e., those who have not eliminated the view of the transitory aggregates.üîΩThe flood of ignorance is for those who are free from the view of the transitory aggregates, i.e., those who have eliminated the view of the transitory aggregates.üîΩThe flood of desire is for those who are not free from desire.üîΩThe flood of existence is for those who are free from desire.üîΩThe flood of views is for those who are not free from the view of the transitory aggregates.

original: lta ba ngan pa gang yin pa dang / lta ba ngan pa'i rgyu gang yin pa gcig tu bsdus pa'o /
analyzed: lta ba ngan pa gang yin pa dang / lta ba ngan pa'i rgyu gang yin pa gcig tu bsdus pa'o /
translated: The flood of ignorance is for those who are free from the view of the transitory aggregates.üîΩThe flood of desire is for those who are not free from the desire realm.üîΩThe flood of existence is for those who are free from the desire realm.üîΩThe flood of views is for those who are not free from the higher realms.üîΩThe flood of ignorance is for those who are free from the higher realms.

original: mtshungs par spyod pa rnams kyi lhag chad med pa'i nyon mongs pa de dag nyid la ni sbyor ba rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mtshungs par spyod pa rnams kyi lhag chad med pa'i nyon mongs pa de dag nyid la ni sbyor ba rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: The same defilements, in the absence of excess or deficiency, are called the 'preparatory efforts' of those who practice in common.

original: phyogs gnyis kyi ni nye bar len pa rnam pa bzhir rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: phyogs gnyis kyi ni nye bar len pa rnam pa bzhir rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
translated: The 'appropriations' should be understood as being of four kinds, in two parts.

original: khyim pa'i phyogs dang / 'di las phyi rol ba'i rab tu byung ba'i phyogs kyi'o //
analyzed: khyim pa'i phyogs dang / 'di las phyi rol ba'i rab tu byung ba'i phyogs kyi'o //
translated: The part of the householder and the part of the ordained who are outside this doctrine.

original: de la gang nye bar len pa dang / gang gis nye bar len pa dang / gang gi phyir nye bar len pa de dag thams cad ni nye bar len pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la gang nye bar len pa dang / gang gis nye bar len pa dang / gang gi phyir nye bar len pa de dag thams cad ni nye bar len pa zhes bya'o //
translated: In this regard, all that is appropriated, by which it is appropriated, and for whose sake it is appropriated, are all called 'appropriations'.

original: de la ci nye bar len zhe na 'dod pa rnams dang / lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs dang / bdag tu smra ba nye bar len to //
analyzed: de la ci nye bar len zhe na 'dod pa rnams dang / lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs dang / bdag tu smra ba nye bar len to //
translated: What is appropriated? The appropriation of the sense-desires, of views, of morality and vows, and of the theory of self.

original: gang gis nye bar len zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis nye bar len zhe na /
translated: By what is it appropriated?

original: 'dun pa dang 'dod chags rnam pa bzhis so //
analyzed: 'dun pa dang 'dod chags rnam pa bzhis so //
translated: By the four kinds of desire and attachment.

original: gang gi phyir nye bar len zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir nye bar len zhe na /
translated: For whose sake is it appropriated?

original: 'dod pa rnams thob par bya ba'i phyir dang longs spyod pa'i phyir ni dang po'o //üîΩrnyed pa dang bur sti'i dbang du byas nas gzhan la klan ka tshol ba'i phyir ram //
analyzed: 'dod pa rnams thob par bya ba'i phyir dang longs spyod pa'i phyir ni dang po'o // rnyed pa dang bur sti'i dbang du byas nas gzhan la klan ka tshol ba'i phyir ram //
translated: The first is for the sake of obtaining and enjoying sense objects.

original: gal 'dzin pa las thar par bya ba'i phyir ni gnyis pa'o //üîΩzhi gnas kyi yan lag la brten cing gnas nas 'jig rten gyi 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur bar bya ba @196a * //
analyzed: gal 'dzin pa las thar par bya ba'i phyir ni gnyis pa'o // zhi gnas kyi yan lag la brten cing gnas nas 'jig rten gyi 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur bar bya ba @196a * //
translated: The second is for the sake of finding fault with others, based on gain and honor, or for the sake of freeing oneself from bondage.

original: nas ; 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa'i bar gyi phyir ni gsum pa'o //
analyzed: nas ; 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa'i bar gyi phyir ni gsum pa'o //
translated: The third is for the sake of the meditative concentration of the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception, based on the limbs of serenity.

original: las byed pa dang / de'i 'bras bu la longs spyod pa'i skyes bu'am /
analyzed: las byed pa dang / de'i 'bras bu la longs spyod pa'i skyes bu'am /
translated: The fourth is for the sake of the person who performs action and experiences its result, or for the sake of the person who engages in and disengages from the world.

original: 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i skyes bur rnam par brtags pa'i rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pa'i phyir ni bdag tu smra ba nye bar len to //
analyzed: 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i skyes bur rnam par brtags pa'i rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pa'i phyir ni bdag tu smra ba nye bar len to //
translated: The theory of self is imputed in dependence on the four kinds of appropriation.

original: nye bar len pa bzhi po de dag ni phyogs gnyis kyi yin te /
analyzed: nye bar len pa bzhi po de dag ni phyogs gnyis kyi yin te /
translated: These four kinds of appropriation are of two kinds:

original: 'dod pa la longs spyod pa'i khyim pa'i phyogs dang nyes par bshad pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu byung ba'i phyogs kyi'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa la longs spyod pa'i khyim pa'i phyogs dang nyes par bshad pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu byung ba'i phyogs kyi'o //
translated: The first is the side of householders who enjoy sense objects, and the second is the side of those who go forth in the Dharma and Vinaya that is explained as faulty.

original: chos 'di pa rnams kyis ni nye bar len pa thams cad spong ba'i yongs su shes pa gsungs pa ston par khas blangs te /
analyzed: chos 'di pa rnams kyis ni nye bar len pa thams cad spong ba'i yongs su shes pa gsungs pa ston par khas blangs te /
translated: Those who are Dharma practitioners accept the teaching that declares the complete abandonment of all appropriation is complete knowledge.

original: nyon mongs pa dang bcas pas 'chi ba'i dus byed du zin kyang de dag gis nye bar len pa gang yang rnam par gzhag pa med de /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang bcas pas 'chi ba'i dus byed du zin kyang de dag gis nye bar len pa gang yang rnam par gzhag pa med de /
translated: Even if they die with afflictions, they do not posit any appropriation at all.

original: 'di ltar de dag ni 'dod pa rnams la mi lta bar rab tu byung ba la lta ba dang tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs dang / bdag tu smra ba yang khas mi len to //
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag ni 'dod pa rnams la mi lta bar rab tu byung ba la lta ba dang tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs dang / bdag tu smra ba yang khas mi len to //
translated: Because they go forth without looking at sense objects, they do not accept views, ethics and rituals, or the assertion of a self.

original: nyes par bshad pa'i chos can de dag la ni tha dad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: nyes par bshad pa'i chos can de dag la ni tha dad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: Those who have the faulty Dharma have two types of differences:

original: lta ba dang 'dod pa phan tshun mi mthun par smra ba rnams dang / 'jig rten pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams so //
analyzed: lta ba dang 'dod pa phan tshun mi mthun par smra ba rnams dang / 'jig rten pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams so //
translated: those who speak in discord about views and sense objects and mundane meditative attainments.

original: de la lta ba dang 'dod pa phan tshun mi mthun pa rnams kyi phyir ni lta ba'i nye bar len pa rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de la lta ba dang 'dod pa phan tshun mi mthun pa rnams kyi phyir ni lta ba'i nye bar len pa rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The clinging to views is established for those who have different views and opinions.

original: 'jig rten pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams kyi phyir ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs kyi nye bar len pa rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams kyi phyir ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs kyi nye bar len pa rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The clinging to morality and asceticism is established for those who are absorbed in worldly meditation.

original: phyogs de gnyi ga la brten pa rnams ni bdag tu smra ba'i khongs su gtogs pa ste de bas na phyogs de gnyi ga'i phyir ni bdag tu smra ba'i nye bar len pa rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: phyogs de gnyi ga la brten pa rnams ni bdag tu smra ba'i khongs su gtogs pa ste de bas na phyogs de gnyi ga'i phyir ni bdag tu smra ba'i nye bar len pa rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The clinging to a doctrine of self is established for those who are attached to both of these views.

original: de la lta ba drug cu rtsa gnyis ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de la lta ba drug cu rtsa gnyis ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The sixty-two kinds of views are as explained above.

original: lus kyi sdom pa dang / ngag gi sdom pa log pa'i rtog pa las byung ba'i lta bas gnod par byas pa ni tshul khrims so //
analyzed: lus kyi sdom pa dang / ngag gi sdom pa log pa'i rtog pa las byung ba'i lta bas gnod par byas pa ni tshul khrims so //
translated: Morality is the bodily and vocal restraint that is ruined by false views arising from wrong reflection.

original: de dang 'tsham pa'i rtags dang cha lugs dang zas dang skom dang spyod lam dang spyod pa dang yi dam ni brtul zhugs so //
analyzed: de dang 'tsham pa'i rtags dang cha lugs dang zas dang skom dang spyod lam dang spyod pa dang yi dam ni brtul zhugs so //
translated: Asceticism is the sign, the dress, the food and drink, the conduct, the behavior, and the vow that are appropriate to that morality.

original: bdag ni bden pa dang gnas pa'i sgo nas yod do zhes smra ba gang yin pa de ni bdag tu smra ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bdag ni bden pa dang gnas pa'i sgo nas yod do zhes smra ba gang yin pa de ni bdag tu smra ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The one who says I exist by way of truth and reality is called the one who speaks of self.

original: de la bden pa ni rdzas @196b su yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la bden pa ni rdzas @196b su yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There, truth is because of substantial existence.

original: gnas pa ni rnam par gzhag pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: gnas pa ni rnam par gzhag pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: Reality is by way of establishment.

original: de la 'dod pa'i srid pa'i rkyen gyis byung ba ni 'dod pa'i nye bar len pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'dod pa'i srid pa'i rkyen gyis byung ba ni 'dod pa'i nye bar len pa'o //
translated: There, the appropriated of desire is that which arises by way of the condition of craving for existence in the desire realm.

original: shes so bar smra ba la brten nas rnyed pa dang bkur sti la sred pa'i rkyen gyis byung ba ni lta ba'i nye bar len pa'o //
analyzed: shes so bar smra ba la brten nas rnyed pa dang bkur sti la sred pa'i rkyen gyis byung ba ni lta ba'i nye bar len pa'o //
translated: The appropriated of view is that which arises by way of the condition of craving for gain and honor based on the one who speaks of self.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa la sred pa'i rkyen gyis byung ba ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs kyi nye bar len pa'o //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa la sred pa'i rkyen gyis byung ba ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs kyi nye bar len pa'o //
translated: The appropriated of morality and ritual is that which arises by way of the condition of craving for meditative attainment.

original: yod pa dang med pa la sred pa'i rkyen gyis byung ba ni bdag tu smra ba'i nye bar len pa'o //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa la sred pa'i rkyen gyis byung ba ni bdag tu smra ba'i nye bar len pa'o //
translated: The appropriated of the one who speaks of self is that which arises by way of the condition of craving for existence and non-existence.

original: mdud pa ni bzhi ste snga ma bzhin du 'di las phyi rol pa rnams nyi tshe'i yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mdud pa ni bzhi ste snga ma bzhin du 'di las phyi rol pa rnams nyi tshe'i yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The knots are four, and should be known as limited to those outside of this, as before.

original: sgrib pa lnga ni gnas skabs lnga mi mthun pa rnams par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: sgrib pa lnga ni gnas skabs lnga mi mthun pa rnams par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
translated: The five obscurations should be understood as being established in five states that are not conducive to meditative concentration.

original: khyim na gnas pa'i yul gyis 'phrog pa'i phyir bstan pa dang / mi mthun pa'i sgo nas ni 'dod pa'i 'dun pa'o //
analyzed: khyim na gnas pa'i yul gyis 'phrog pa'i phyir bstan pa dang / mi mthun pa'i sgo nas ni 'dod pa'i 'dun pa'o //
translated: The obscuration consisting of the desire realm is not conducive to the teaching because it is carried away by the objects of the householders life.üîΩThe obscuration consisting of malice is not conducive to the teaching of the Dharma because it does not tolerate the Dharma instruction, Dharma discourse, and so on of those who are in agreement.

original: chos mthun pa pa rnams yis gleng ba dang / smra dbab pa dang / rjes su bstan pa la sogs pas 'dul ba mi bzod pas yang dag par dga' bar bya ba'i chos dang mi mthun pa'i sgo nas ni gnod sems dang // zhi gnas dang mi mthun pa'i sgo nas ni rmugs pa dang gnyid do //
analyzed: chos mthun pa pa rnams yis gleng ba dang / smra dbab pa dang / rjes su bstan pa la sogs pas 'dul ba mi bzod pas yang dag par dga' bar bya ba'i chos dang mi mthun pa'i sgo nas ni gnod sems dang // zhi gnas dang mi mthun pa'i sgo nas ni rmugs pa dang gnyid do //
translated: The obscuration consisting of lethargy and sleep is not conducive to serenity.

original: lhag mthong dang mi mthun pa'i sgo nas ni rgod pa dang 'gyod pa'o //
analyzed: lhag mthong dang mi mthun pa'i sgo nas ni rgod pa dang 'gyod pa'o //
translated: The obscuration consisting of excited speech and regret is not conducive to insight.

original: chos kyi 'phel ba'i gtam nges par byed pa dang // chos spyod pa dang / ston pa'i bstan pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa la mos pa dang mi mthun pa'i sgo nas ni the tshom gyi sgrib pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi 'phel ba'i gtam nges par byed pa dang // chos spyod pa dang / ston pa'i bstan pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa la mos pa dang mi mthun pa'i sgo nas ni the tshom gyi sgrib pa'o //
translated: The obscuration consisting of doubt is not conducive to the increase of the Dharma, to the practice of the Dharma, to the teaching of the Teacher, and to the inclination toward nirvana.

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gi kun nas dkris pa gang gis kun nas dkris pa'am bag la nyal du gyur bas rang gi don 'thob pa la sems las su mi rung zhing sems 'jom po ma yin pa de dag ni tha ba rnams so //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gi kun nas dkris pa gang gis kun nas dkris pa'am bag la nyal du gyur bas rang gi don 'thob pa la sems las su mi rung zhing sems 'jom po ma yin pa de dag ni tha ba rnams so //
translated: The roughness of the body is the unserviceability of the body, the unfitness of the body for work, due to the envelopment of desire, hatred, and ignorance.

original: yul ngan pa la 'dod chags pa ni dri ma zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yul ngan pa la 'dod chags pa ni dri ma zhes bya'o //
translated: The defilement of the object is the desire for a bad object.

original: 'khrul pa'i 'os ma yin pa'i gzhi la zhe sdang ba ni dri ma zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i 'os ma yin pa'i gzhi la zhe sdang ba ni dri ma zhes bya'o //
translated: The defilement of the basis is the hatred for a basis which is not a cause of error.

original: gsal zhing byis pa'i skye bos kyang brda phrad pa'i gzhi la gti mug pa ni dri ma zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gsal zhing byis pa'i skye bos kyang brda phrad pa'i gzhi la gti mug pa ni dri ma zhes bya'o //
translated: The defilement of the object is the delusion concerning a basis which is clear and comprehensible even to a child.üîΩThe defilement of the basis is the constant destruction by the practice of desire, hatred, and ignorance.üîΩThe defilement of the object is the constant destruction by the practice of desire, hatred, and ignorance.

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug rgyun du kun du spyod pas rtag tu 'joms pas na /üîΩrtags 'joms rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug rgyun du kun du spyod pas rtag tu 'joms pas na / rtags 'joms rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: The defilement of the basis is the constant destruction by the practice of desire, hatred, and ignorance.üîΩThe defilement of the object is the constant destruction by the practice of desire, hatred, and ignorance.üîΩThe defilement of the basis is the constant destruction by the practice of desire, hatred, and ignorance.üîΩThe defilement of the object is the constant destruction by the practice of desire, hatred, and ignorance.üîΩThe defilement of the basis is the constant destruction by the practice of desire, hatred, and ignorance.üîΩThe defilement of the object is the constant destruction by the practice of desire, hatred, and ignorance.üîΩThe defilement of the basis is the constant destruction by the practice of desire, hatred, and ignorance.üîΩThe defilement of the object is the constant destruction by the practice of desire, hatred, and ignorance.üîΩThe defilement of the basis is the constant destruction by the practice of desire, hatred, and ignorance.üîΩThe defilement of the object is the constant destruction by the practice of desire, hatred, and ignorance.üîΩThe defilement of the basis is the constant destruction by the practice of desire, hatred, and ignorance.üîΩThe defilement of the object is the constant destruction by the practice of desire, hatred, and ignorance.üîΩThe defilement of the basis is the constant destruction by the practice of desire, hatred, and ignorance.üîΩThe defilement of the object is the constant destruction by the practice of desire, hatred, and ignorance.üîΩThe defilement of the basis is the constant destruction by the practice of desire, hatred, and ignorance.

original: ngo tsho shes pa dang khrel yod pa dang bral te ngo tsha mi shes pa dang khrel med pas gcig tu nges par rgyun du 'dod @197a * //
analyzed: ngo tsho shes pa dang khrel yod pa dang bral te ngo tsha mi shes pa dang khrel med pas gcig tu nges par rgyun du 'dod @197a * //
translated: The defilement of the object is the constant destruction by the practice of desire, hatred, and ignorance.üîΩThe defilement of the basis is the constant destruction by the practice of desire, hatred, and

original: chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug rnams ma bsdams pa ni zug rngu rnams zhes bya'o //üîΩngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa 'dres te /
analyzed: chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug rnams ma bsdams pa ni zug rngu rnams zhes bya'o // ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa 'dres te /
translated: The three roots of nonvirtue, i.e., greed, hatred, and delusion, are called ‚Äúthorns‚Äù because they are not restrained.üîΩShamelessness and lack of abashment are called ‚Äúthorns‚Äù because they are not restrained.

original: rgyud kyi sgo nas ni yod la skad cig pa'i sgo nas ni med de bsam pa yod pa ni mdud par bsdus pa gang yin pa'i ngan pa'i don gyis tha chad ces bya'o //
analyzed: rgyud kyi sgo nas ni yod la skad cig pa'i sgo nas ni med de bsam pa yod pa ni mdud par bsdus pa gang yin pa'i ngan pa'i don gyis tha chad ces bya'o //
translated: They exist in the sense of a continuum, but not in the sense of a moment.

original: lus kyi las mi dge ba thams cad ni nyes par spyod pa'o /
analyzed: lus kyi las mi dge ba thams cad ni nyes par spyod pa'o /
translated: All unwholesome bodily actions are misconduct.

original: lus ji lta ba bzhin du ngag gi las dang yid kyis las kyang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: lus ji lta ba bzhin du ngag gi las dang yid kyis las kyang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: Just as with the body, so it is with speech and mind.

original: ngan 'gror 'gro ba'i las kun du spyod pa'i phyir rjes su thob par gyur cing rjes su thob par 'gyur la rjes su 'thob pas na de'i phyir nye bar spyod pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ngan 'gror 'gro ba'i las kun du spyod pa'i phyir rjes su thob par gyur cing rjes su thob par 'gyur la rjes su 'thob pas na de'i phyir nye bar spyod pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Because one engages in action that leads to bad destinies, one obtains and will obtain and does obtain them. Therefore, they are called ‚Äúmisconducts.‚Äù

original: 'dis ni las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the defilement of action.

original: snga mas ni nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa bstan to //
analyzed: snga mas ni nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa bstan to //
translated: The previous verse shows the defilement of the passions.

original: 'di gnyis ni las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam par gzhag pa smra ba ste /
analyzed: 'di gnyis ni las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam par gzhag pa smra ba ste /
translated: These two are the proponents of the afflicted classification of karma.

original: log par smra ba dang / yang dag par smra ba'o //
analyzed: log par smra ba dang / yang dag par smra ba'o //
translated: They are the proponents of false speech and true speech.

original: de la gang 'di skad du ched du bsams te las mi dge ba ci byas pa de dag thams cad ni nges par yang yin la ngan song myong bar 'gyur ba yang yin no zhes smra ba des ni mya ngan las 'da' bar bya ba'i phyir tshangs par
analyzed: de la gang 'di skad du ched du bsams te las mi dge ba ci byas pa de dag thams cad ni nges par yang yin la ngan song myong bar 'gyur ba yang yin no zhes smra ba des ni mya ngan las 'da' bar bya ba'i phyir tshangs par
translated: Among them, the one who says, ‚ÄúAll nonvirtuous actions that are intentionally committed are certain to be experienced in the lower realms‚Äù

original: spyod pa la gnas pa la skur ba btab pa yin no //
analyzed: spyod pa la gnas pa la skur ba btab pa yin no //
translated: denigrates the practice of pure conduct for the sake of attaining nirvana.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩgang gi tshe 'di nyid la yang ched du bsams te /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / gang gi tshe 'di nyid la yang ched du bsams te /
translated: Why is that?üîΩBecause even in this life, it is not easy to find such a sentient being

original: mi dge ba'i las ma byas pas de lta bu'i sems can yang rnyed par sla ba ma yin na tshe rabs gzhan dag tu lta ci mos te /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i las ma byas pas de lta bu'i sems can yang rnyed par sla ba ma yin na tshe rabs gzhan dag tu lta ci mos te /
translated: who does not commit nonvirtuous actions intentionally, let alone in other lives.

original: des na de dag ngan song du 'gro bar nges pas na su la yang thar par 'gyur ba'i skabs med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na de dag ngan song du 'gro bar nges pas na su la yang thar par 'gyur ba'i skabs med par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, since they are certain to go to the lower realms, there is no opportunity for anyone to attain liberation.

original: de bas de ni log par smra ba yin par rig par bya'o //üîΩgang 'di skad du ched du bsams te /
analyzed: de bas de ni log par smra ba yin par rig par bya'o // gang 'di skad du ched du bsams te /
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that this is a false statement.

original: mi dge ba'i las byas la gal te de ltar byas nas bsags par gyur na ni de lta na de phyi ma la mi sdug pa'i nga song myong bar nges par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i las byas la gal te de ltar byas nas bsags par gyur na ni de lta na de phyi ma la mi sdug pa'i nga song myong bar nges par 'gyur ro //
translated: Some say: If one intentionally commits nonvirtuous actions and then accumulates them, then one will definitely experience unpleasant karmic maturation in the future.

original: de lta ma bsags na ni de'i de chos yang dag par blang ba gang dang gang la brten pa bde ba'am sdug bsngal bar byas par gyur ba de'i ni de lhan cig byed par nges par 'gyur te /üîΩtshe 'di nyid la bde ba myong ba'am /
analyzed: de lta ma bsags na ni de'i de chos yang dag par blang ba gang dang gang la brten pa bde ba'am sdug bsngal bar byas par gyur ba de'i ni de lhan cig byed par nges par 'gyur te / tshe 'di nyid la bde ba myong ba'am /
translated: If one does not accumulate them, then whatever virtuous or nonvirtuous karmas one has committed will definitely be coemergent conditions for the pleasure or pain that one experiences.

original: sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ro zhes smras te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ro zhes smras te /
translated: One will experience pleasure or pain in this life.

original: de lta na ni las gang byas nas 'gyod pa med cing gnyen po ma bstan pa'i gang @197b zag de'i las de ni bsags par 'gyur ba yang yin no //
analyzed: de lta na ni las gang byas nas 'gyod pa med cing gnyen po ma bstan pa'i gang @197b zag de'i las de ni bsags par 'gyur ba yang yin no //
translated: Thus, if one commits an action and does not regret it and does not apply an antidote, then that karma is accumulated.

original: 'bri bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni tshe 'di kho na la myong bar 'gyur ba yin du zin kyang de ni ngan song myong bar 'gyur ba yang yin la tshe 'di la yang thar pa'i bar du gcod par yang byed do //
analyzed: 'bri bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni tshe 'di kho na la myong bar 'gyur ba yin du zin kyang de ni ngan song myong bar 'gyur ba yang yin la tshe 'di la yang thar pa'i bar du gcod par yang byed do //
translated: The karma that is to be experienced in this very life, even though it is to be experienced in this very life, is to be experienced in the lower realms and it also obstructs liberation in this life.

original: gzhan yang las de byas na 'gyod par yang byed la gnyen po dang yang bcas pa'i gang zag de'i las de ni bsags par yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang las de byas na 'gyod par yang byed la gnyen po dang yang bcas pa'i gang zag de'i las de ni bsags par yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, if one performs that karma and then regrets it, and if one is a person who has antidotes, then that karma is not accumulated.

original: bsags par 'gyur ba gang yin pa des ngan song myong bar 'gyur du zin kyang de ni de ni tshe 'di kho na la myong bar 'gyur la thar pa'i bar du gcod par yang mi byed do //
analyzed: bsags par 'gyur ba gang yin pa des ngan song myong bar 'gyur du zin kyang de ni de ni tshe 'di kho na la myong bar 'gyur la thar pa'i bar du gcod par yang mi byed do //
translated: The karma that is accumulated is to be experienced in the lower realms, but it is to be experienced in this very life and it does not obstruct liberation.

original: de bas na des ni tshangs par spyod pa la gnas pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la skur ba btab pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na des ni tshangs par spyod pa la gnas pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la skur ba btab pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, one does not slander pure conduct and nirvana.

original: des na 'di ni yang dag par smra ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: des na 'di ni yang dag par smra ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should know that this is a correct statement.

original: de la gnyen po rnam pa bcu med na ni las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pas kun nas nyon mongs par byed la rnam pa bcu po de dag yod na ni rnam par dag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la gnyen po rnam pa bcu med na ni las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pas kun nas nyon mongs par byed la rnam pa bcu po de dag yod na ni rnam par dag par 'gyur te /
translated: If the ten aspects of antidotes are absent, then karma is thoroughly afflicted by the afflictions. If those ten aspects are present, then karma is pure.

original: 'di lta ste /üîΩgnyen po gang gis byas ma thag tu bsags par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / gnyen po gang gis byas ma thag tu bsags par mi 'gyur te /
translated: What are the ten?üîΩThe antidote that prevents karma from being accumulated as soon as it is committed,
