original: lhag pa'i sems bsgom pa'i phyir lhag pa'i tshul khrims bsgom pa dang / lhag pa'i shes rab sgom pa'i phyir lhag pa'i sems bsgom pa dang / zag pa spang ba'i phyir lhag pa'i shes rab bsgom pa dang sems drag pos bsgom pa dang / yun ring por bsgom pa dang /
analyzed: lhag pa'i sems bsgom pa'i phyir lhag pa'i tshul khrims bsgom pa dang / lhag pa'i shes rab sgom pa'i phyir lhag pa'i sems bsgom pa dang / zag pa spang ba'i phyir lhag pa'i shes rab bsgom pa dang sems drag pos bsgom pa dang / yun ring por bsgom pa dang /
translated: The cultivation of superior morality for the sake of cultivating superior mind; the cultivation of superior mind for the sake of cultivating superior wisdom; the cultivation of superior wisdom for the sake of abandoning the asavas; cultivation with intense mind; cultivation for a long time;

original: gnyen po sgom du ma bsgom pa ste /
analyzed: gnyen po sgom du ma bsgom pa ste /
translated: and cultivation without a remedy.

original: las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po rnam pa bcu po 'di dag med na ni kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po rnam pa bcu po 'di dag med na ni kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If these ten remedies for the defilement of action are absent, there is defilement.

original: de las bzlog pa ni rnam par byang bar 'gyur bar rig par bya'o //üîΩtshe 'di nyid la lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las shin tu ma bsdams par gnas pa'i ni sngon gyi las mi dge ba byas shing bsags pa gang yin pa de phyi ma la kun nas nyon @198a * //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni rnam par byang bar 'gyur bar rig par bya'o // tshe 'di nyid la lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las shin tu ma bsdams par gnas pa'i ni sngon gyi las mi dge ba byas shing bsags pa gang yin pa de phyi ma la kun nas nyon @198a * //
translated: The opposite of this should be understood as purification.

original: mongs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mongs par 'gyur ro //
translated: In this very life, for one who lives with body, speech, and mind unrestrained, the previously committed and accumulated unwholesome actions will be defiled in the next life.

original: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las shin tu bsdams par gnas pa'i ni kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las shin tu bsdams par gnas pa'i ni kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: One who abides in the restraint of body, speech, and mind does not become afflicted.

original: tshe 'di la lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las shin tu ma bsdams par gnas pa ni ji lta bu lus la sogs pa'i las shin tu bsdams par gnas pa ni ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: tshe 'di la lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las shin tu ma bsdams par gnas pa ni ji lta bu lus la sogs pa'i las shin tu bsdams par gnas pa ni ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: What is it to abide in the restraint of body, speech, and mind? What is it to abide in the non-restraint of body, speech, and mind?

original: ji ltar 'di na kha cig lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las mi dge ba'i kun nas dkris pa'i nyes rtsom dang / de skyed par byed pa'i tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ma rig pa'i nyes rtsom ni spangs la lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las dge ba yang yang dag par blangs te gnas pa de la ni tshe 'di nyid la
analyzed: ji ltar 'di na kha cig lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las mi dge ba'i kun nas dkris pa'i nyes rtsom dang / de skyed par byed pa'i tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ma rig pa'i nyes rtsom ni spangs la lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las dge ba yang yang dag par blangs te gnas pa de la ni tshe 'di nyid la
translated: Here, one who abandons the non-virtuous karma of body, speech, and mind, the composition of the entanglements, and the composition of ignorance concomitant with improper mental attention that generates that, and who abides in the correct adoption of virtuous karma of body, speech, and mind, in this very life

original: de'i rgyus nyon mongs pa dang log pa'i 'dun pa dang / rtog pa dang yongs su tshol ba las byung ba'i sdug bsngal gyi khyad par rnams mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de'i rgyus nyon mongs pa dang log pa'i 'dun pa dang / rtog pa dang yongs su tshol ba las byung ba'i sdug bsngal gyi khyad par rnams mi 'byung ngo //
translated: Because of that, the suffering that arises from the afflictions, from wrong intentions, from thoughts, and from searching is not produced.

original: des de spangs pa yang dag par blangs pa tsam gyis chog par bzung nas tshe 'di la 'phags pa'i lam skyed par mi byed cing mya ngan las 'das pa mngon sum du mi byed do //
analyzed: des de spangs pa yang dag par blangs pa tsam gyis chog par bzung nas tshe 'di la 'phags pa'i lam skyed par mi byed cing mya ngan las 'das pa mngon sum du mi byed do //
translated: Having taken up the mere restraint of abandoning that, he does not generate the noble path in this life and does not manifest nirvana.

original: de ltar bsdams par gnas pa de ni tshe 'di la sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos mi byed cing mi sogs mod kyi 'on kyang nyon mongs pa'i bdag la nyal gyi bcings bas bcings pas na shi ba'i 'og tu yang srid par skye ba mngon par 'grub par
analyzed: de ltar bsdams par gnas pa de ni tshe 'di la sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos mi byed cing mi sogs mod kyi 'on kyang nyon mongs pa'i bdag la nyal gyi bcings bas bcings pas na shi ba'i 'og tu yang srid par skye ba mngon par 'grub par
translated: Although that one who abides restrained does not commit or accumulate sinful, nonvirtuous dharmas in this life, still, because he is bound by the bonds of the latent afflictions, after death he is reborn in existence.

original: 'gyur te / yang srid par skye ba der sngon gyi las kyi rkyen la brten nas kun nas nyon mongs pa bskyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gyur te / yang srid par skye ba der sngon gyi las kyi rkyen la brten nas kun nas nyon mongs pa bskyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: In that rebirth in existence, he produces the afflictions based on the condition of former karma.

original: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las shin tu bsdams par gnas pa'i khyad par ni 'di yin te spangs pa yang dag par blangs ba de la gnas pa de ni gsar du yang las mi byed la /
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las shin tu bsdams par gnas pa'i khyad par ni 'di yin te spangs pa yang dag par blangs ba de la gnas pa de ni gsar du yang las mi byed la /
translated: The one who abides in that restraint of abandoning does not create new karma.

original: las rnyid pa nyams su myong ste /
analyzed: las rnyid pa nyams su myong ste /
translated: He experiences the ripening of old karma.üîΩHe exhausts karma through the ripening of karma.

original: rnam par smin pa rnam par smin pa'i sgo nas zad par byed la spangs pa yang dag par blangs pa de tsam gyis kyang chog par mi 'dzin te /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa rnam par smin pa'i sgo nas zad par byed la spangs pa yang dag par blangs pa de tsam gyis kyang chog par mi 'dzin te /
translated: He does not consider that restraint of abandoning to be sufficient.

original: tshe 'di nyid la 'phags pa'i lam yang skyed cing de'i 'bras bu mya ngan las 'das pa yang mngon sum du byed do //
analyzed: tshe 'di nyid la 'phags pa'i lam yang skyed cing de'i 'bras bu mya ngan las 'das pa yang mngon sum du byed do //
translated: In this very life, he generates the noble path and actualizes its fruit, nirvana.

original: de de'i tshe ji srid du rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i lus gnas pa de srid du tshe 'di la sngon gyi las kyis 'phangs pa'i tshor ba myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de de'i tshe ji srid du rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i lus gnas pa de srid du tshe 'di la sngon gyi las kyis 'phangs pa'i tshor ba myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, for as long as his conscious body remains, he experiences the feelings projected by his previous karma in this life.

original: de'i rnam par shes pa dang bcas @198b pa'i lus de yang ji srid tshe ma zad pa de srid du gnas so //
analyzed: de'i rnam par shes pa dang bcas @198b pa'i lus de yang ji srid tshe ma zad pa de srid du gnas so //
translated: And his conscious body remains for as long as his life does not end.

original: tshe zad nas rnam par shes pas lus spangs nas de phyin chad ni srog gi dbang po rnam par smin par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: tshe zad nas rnam par shes pas lus spangs nas de phyin chad ni srog gi dbang po rnam par smin par mi 'gyur te /
translated: When life is exhausted, consciousness abandons the body, and from then on the faculty of life force does not ripen.

original: des na de'i rnam par shes pa tshor ba thams cad dang bcas par 'dir 'gags pas phyi ma la nyid mtshams sbyor bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na de'i rnam par shes pa tshor ba thams cad dang bcas par 'dir 'gags pas phyi ma la nyid mtshams sbyor bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, its consciousness, along with all feelings, ceases here, and it does not link with the next life.

original: de'i tshor ba grib ma bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i shing la brten pa de yang rnam par shes pa'i shing 'gags pas thams cad kyi thams cad du med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshor ba grib ma bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i shing la brten pa de yang rnam par shes pa'i shing 'gags pas thams cad kyi thams cad du med par 'gyur ro //
translated: That feeling, which is like a shadow, is based on the tree of consciousness. When the tree of consciousness ceases, it becomes completely nonexistent.

original: de'i tshe sngon gyi las de las de ni rgyu gnyis kyi phyi ma la kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur te ;
analyzed: de'i tshe sngon gyi las de las de ni rgyu gnyis kyi phyi ma la kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur te ;
translated: At that time, due to that karma from the past, it will not be afflicted in the next life due to two causes.

original: grogs nyon mongs pa gang gis kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba de ma lus par spangs pa'i phyir dang / gang du rnam par smin par 'gyur ba na kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: grogs nyon mongs pa gang gis kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba de ma lus par spangs pa'i phyir dang / gang du rnam par smin par 'gyur ba na kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Because it completely abandons the afflictions that would afflict it, and because it does not go to a place where it would be afflicted due to ripening.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: This is as follows.

original: 'du byed kyi rgyud de yang ma lus par 'gags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi rgyud de yang ma lus par 'gags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that causal stream of formations has completely ceased.

original: de de'i tshe sems can rnams la mdza' ba'i bsam pas kho na med pa'i sems su 'gyur te /
analyzed: de de'i tshe sems can rnams la mdza' ba'i bsam pas kho na med pa'i sems su 'gyur te /
translated: At that time, he has a mind free from enmity toward sentient beings, due to his attitude of affection.

original: de la dmigs pa'i gnod sems spangs pas gnod sems su gyur pa'i sems med do //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i gnod sems spangs pas gnod sems su gyur pa'i sems med do //
translated: He has a mind free from enmity, due to his abandonment of malice that has that as its object.

original: sdig pa'i las la nyes dmigs su lta ba'i phyir de spangs pa yang dag par blangs pas 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems su yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sdig pa'i las la nyes dmigs su lta ba'i phyir de spangs pa yang dag par blangs pas 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems su yang 'gyur ro //
translated: He has a mind free from desire, due to his abandonment of desire, due to his taking up the view of the disadvantages of evil deeds.

original: de'i gnyen po lam thob pas yang dag par sems shin tu rnam par grol bar yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i gnyen po lam thob pas yang dag par sems shin tu rnam par grol bar yang 'gyur ro //
translated: He has a mind that is completely liberated, due to his attainment of the path that is the antidote to that.

original: de ltar gyur pa des ni rtag tu gnas par bya ba drug thob pa yin te de rnams kyis ni de la shas cher gnas pa de'i spong pa de dge bar gcig tu nges pa kho nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa des ni rtag tu gnas par bya ba drug thob pa yin te de rnams kyis ni de la shas cher gnas pa de'i spong pa de dge bar gcig tu nges pa kho nar 'gyur te /
translated: One who has become like that has attained the six constant abodes. By means of those, his abandonment becomes virtuous and certain.

original: tshe 'di la sdig pa mi dge ba'i las kyi rkyen yod du zin kyang rnam par 'dre bar mi 'gyur ba 'di ni de'i sdom pa la gnas pa la snga ma las khyad par du 'phags par bya'o //
analyzed: tshe 'di la sdig pa mi dge ba'i las kyi rkyen yod du zin kyang rnam par 'dre bar mi 'gyur ba 'di ni de'i sdom pa la gnas pa la snga ma las khyad par du 'phags par bya'o //
translated: Even when there are conditions for evil, unwholesome actions in this life, they do not become mixed up. This is to be known as superior to the previous one, in terms of the observance of restraint.

original: las kyi rnam par smin pa myong bar 'dogs shing smra ba ni rnam pa lngas kun nas nyon mongs pa can yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: las kyi rnam par smin pa myong bar 'dogs shing smra ba ni rnam pa lngas kun nas nyon mongs pa can yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The imputation and expression of the experience of the ripening of karma should be known as defiled by five aspects.

original: rnam pa lngas ni kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa lngas ni kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be known as undefiled by five aspects.

original: rnam pa lnga po gang dag gis kun nas nyon mongs pa can yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa lnga po gang dag gis kun nas nyon mongs pa can yin no zhe na /
translated: By what five aspects is it defiled?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: rgyu mi mthun par 'dogs pa dang / @199a * //
analyzed: rgyu mi mthun par 'dogs pa dang / @199a * //
translated: Imputing a cause that is not concordant,

original: rgyu med par 'dogs pa dang / rgyu mi mthun pa dang rgyu med par 'dogs pa'i nyes pa rnam pa gsum gyis so //
analyzed: rgyu med par 'dogs pa dang / rgyu mi mthun pa dang rgyu med par 'dogs pa'i nyes pa rnam pa gsum gyis so //
translated: Imputing a cause that is not concordant and imputing a cause that is not concordant and a cause that is not existent, by these three faults.

original: de la rgyu mi mthun par 'dogs pa ni ji ltar 'di na kha cig 'di ltar lta zhing 'di skad du smra ste /
analyzed: de la rgyu mi mthun par 'dogs pa ni ji ltar 'di na kha cig 'di ltar lta zhing 'di skad du smra ste /
translated: Among them, imputing a cause that is not concordant is like this: For example, some here have such a view and say this:

original: skyes bu gang zag 'dis nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba ci yang rung ba de dag thams cad ni sngon byas pa'i rgyu las byung ba yin no snyam mo //
analyzed: skyes bu gang zag 'dis nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba ci yang rung ba de dag thams cad ni sngon byas pa'i rgyu las byung ba yin no snyam mo //
translated: Whatever experiences this person has are all due to causes that were previously created.

original: dbang phyug gis sprul pa'i rgyu las byung ba yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: dbang phyug gis sprul pa'i rgyu las byung ba yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The same is true of the causes that are emanated by God.

original: rgyu med rkyen med par nyams su myong ngo zhes bya ba ni rgyu med par 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu med rkyen med par nyams su myong ngo zhes bya ba ni rgyu med par 'dogs pa'o //
translated: To say that they are experienced without causes or conditions is to impute causelessness.

original: der 'dogs pa'i nyes pa rnam pa gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: der 'dogs pa'i nyes pa rnam pa gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three kinds of faults in this imputation?

original: tshe 'di la mi dge ba dang ldan pa'i tshor ba ni sngon gyi las kyi rgyu las byung na yang nyes pa yod la tshe 'di'i las kyi rgyu las byung na yang nyes pa yod de //
analyzed: tshe 'di la mi dge ba dang ldan pa'i tshor ba ni sngon gyi las kyi rgyu las byung na yang nyes pa yod la tshe 'di'i las kyi rgyu las byung na yang nyes pa yod de //
translated: If the feelings that are associated with nonvirtue in this life are due to causes in previous lives, there is a fault. If they are due to causes in this life, there is a fault.

original: gal te sngon gyi mi dge ba'i las kyi rgyu las byung ba yin na ni de lta na chos yang dag par blangs pa kha cig bde ba yin la mi dge ba yang yod na de la mi dge ba'i tshor ba gang yin pa de sngon gyi mi
analyzed: gal te sngon gyi mi dge ba'i las kyi rgyu las byung ba yin na ni de lta na chos yang dag par blangs pa kha cig bde ba yin la mi dge ba yang yod na de la mi dge ba'i tshor ba gang yin pa de sngon gyi mi
translated: If it arises from the cause of nonvirtuous karma in a previous life, then some who have taken up the Dharma would be happy and some would not be happy.

original: dge ba'i las kyi rgyu las byung bar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: dge ba'i las kyi rgyu las byung bar mi rung ngo //
translated: In that case, it would not be tenable that any feeling of unhappiness arises from the cause of nonvirtuous karma in a previous life.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sngon gyi mi dge ba'i tshe 'di la bde bar rnam par smin par mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon gyi mi dge ba'i tshe 'di la bde bar rnam par smin par mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not tenable that nonvirtuous karma in a previous life would have a pleasant karmic maturation in this life.

original: gal te tshe 'di'i mi dge ba'i las kyi rgyu las byung ba yin na ni //
analyzed: gal te tshe 'di'i mi dge ba'i las kyi rgyu las byung ba yin na ni //
translated: If it arises from the cause of nonvirtuous karma in this life,üîΩthen the assertion that the cause of all feelings is a previous life and the assertion that there is no cause would be undermined.

original: de lta na de'i rgyu mi mthun par smra ba dang / rgyu med par smra ba de dam bcas pa nyams par 'gyur te thams cad sngon byas pa'i rgyu las byung ba'o zhes rgyas par sbyar ba 'di ni nyes pa dang po'o //
analyzed: de lta na de'i rgyu mi mthun par smra ba dang / rgyu med par smra ba de dam bcas pa nyams par 'gyur te thams cad sngon byas pa'i rgyu las byung ba'o zhes rgyas par sbyar ba 'di ni nyes pa dang po'o //
translated: This is the first fault.

original: gzhan yang gal te mi dge ba yang sngon gyi mi dge ba'i las kyi rgyu las byung bar nges la /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te mi dge ba yang sngon gyi mi dge ba'i las kyi rgyu las byung bar nges la /
translated: Moreover, if nonvirtue definitely arises from the cause of previous nonvirtuous karma,

original: dge ba yang dge ba'i rgyu las byung ba yin na ni de lta na de dag gis mi dge ba'i gnyen por dge ba yang dag par brtsams pa dang ldan pa'i brtson 'grus rtsom pa gang ci yang rung ba de dag kyang don med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dge ba yang dge ba'i rgyu las byung ba yin na ni de lta na de dag gis mi dge ba'i gnyen por dge ba yang dag par brtsams pa dang ldan pa'i brtson 'grus rtsom pa gang ci yang rung ba de dag kyang don med par 'gyur te /
translated: and if virtue arises from the cause of virtue, then in that case, any effort to apply the antidote to nonvirtue, that is, to engage in virtue, would be pointless.

original: 'di ni nyes pa gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni nyes pa gnyis pa'o //
translated: This is the second fault.

original: gzhan yang skyes bu'i byed pa med pa na dge ba dang mi dge ba las brtsams te bya ba dang mi bya ba brtags pa'i yang dag pa pa ji lta ba'i shes pa yang mi dgos par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang skyes bu'i byed pa med pa na dge ba dang mi dge ba las brtsams te bya ba dang mi bya ba brtags pa'i yang dag pa pa ji lta ba'i shes pa yang mi dgos par 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, if there is no human action, then the correct knowledge of what to do and what not to do, beginning with virtue and nonvirtue, would be unnecessary.

original: shes pa'i 'og tu 'di ni yongs su spang @199b bar bya'o //
analyzed: shes pa'i 'og tu 'di ni yongs su spang @199b bar bya'o //
translated: After knowing this, one would think, ‚ÄúThis should be abandoned.

original: 'di ni nan tan du bsgrub par bya'o snyam pa de med na de yang med par 'gyur ba'i phyir yang dag pa'i shes pa yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: 'di ni nan tan du bsgrub par bya'o snyam pa de med na de yang med par 'gyur ba'i phyir yang dag pa'i shes pa yang mi rung ngo //
translated: This should be accomplished with effort.‚Äù If that does not exist, then that would not exist. Therefore, correct knowledge would be impossible.

original: shes pa dang mi ldan na ni dran pa gnas par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes pa dang mi ldan na ni dran pa gnas par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If there is no awareness, there is no stability of mindfulness.

original: dran pa gnas par ma gyur na ni ting nge 'dzin kyang med do //
analyzed: dran pa gnas par ma gyur na ni ting nge 'dzin kyang med do //
translated: If there is no stability of mindfulness, there is no concentration.

original: mnyam par ma bzhag pa rnams kyi sems ni rtog pa ngan pa dag gis mgo rmongs par byed do //
analyzed: mnyam par ma bzhag pa rnams kyi sems ni rtog pa ngan pa dag gis mgo rmongs par byed do //
translated: The minds of those who are not concentrated are confused by bad thoughts.

original: mgo rmongs pa rnams kyi dbang po rnams ni byis pa dang mtshungs par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: mgo rmongs pa rnams kyi dbang po rnams ni byis pa dang mtshungs par shes par bya'o //
translated: The faculties of those who are confused should be understood as being like those of fools.

original: byis pa dang mtshungs par gyur pa rnams kyi ni dge sbyong gi chos dang ldan pa'i dge sbyong du smra ba gang gi yin pa de yang nyams par 'gyur te /
analyzed: byis pa dang mtshungs par gyur pa rnams kyi ni dge sbyong gi chos dang ldan pa'i dge sbyong du smra ba gang gi yin pa de yang nyams par 'gyur te /
translated: Those who are like fools have lost the quality of being called ‚Äúmonks‚Äù who have the qualities of monks.

original: 'di ni nyes pa gsum pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni nyes pa gsum pa'o //
translated: This is the third fault.

original: 'di dag ni mdor bsdu na nyes pa gsum pa ste /
analyzed: 'di dag ni mdor bsdu na nyes pa gsum pa ste /
translated: These are the three faults in brief.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: da ltar byung ba'i mi dge ba'i tshor ba rgyu med pa las byung ba'i nyes pa dang / brtson 'grus la skur ba btab pa'i nyes pa dang / shes pa la skur ba btab pa'i nyes pa'o //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i mi dge ba'i tshor ba rgyu med pa las byung ba'i nyes pa dang / brtson 'grus la skur ba btab pa'i nyes pa dang / shes pa la skur ba btab pa'i nyes pa'o //
translated: The fault of the present nonvirtuous feeling arising without a cause, the fault of deprecating effort, and the fault of deprecating consciousness.

original: las kyi rnam par smin pa nyams su myong bar 'dogs pa kun nas nyon mongs pa ma yin pa rnam pa lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: las kyi rnam par smin pa nyams su myong bar 'dogs pa kun nas nyon mongs pa ma yin pa rnam pa lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five ways of designating the experience of the ripening of karma that are not afflicted?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: gang gis nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba dang / cis nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba dang / ji ltar nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba dang ; nyams su myong ba na ji ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa can du 'gyur ba dang / ji ltar rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gang gis nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba dang / cis nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba dang / ji ltar nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba dang ; nyams su myong ba na ji ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa can du 'gyur ba dang / ji ltar rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: That by which one experiences, that by means of which one experiences, the manner in which one experiences, how one becomes afflicted when experiencing, and how one becomes purified.

original: de la nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la brten nas gang zag tu 'dogs pa ni gang gis nyams su myong ba'o //
analyzed: de la nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la brten nas gang zag tu 'dogs pa ni gang gis nyams su myong ba'o //
translated: That by which one experiences is the designation of a person based on the five appropriated aggregates.

original: de yang reg pa'i skye mched drug gis nyams su myong ngo //
analyzed: de yang reg pa'i skye mched drug gis nyams su myong ngo //
translated: That by means of which one experiences is the six sense bases of contact.

original: de la ma'i lto na 'dug pa'i khu chu dang khrag gi 'byung ba chen po bzhi la brten pa dang / nying mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par shes pa las dang nyon mongs pas bsdus pa dang ma'i lto na khong stong yod pa ni bu 'chags par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de la ma'i lto na 'dug pa'i khu chu dang khrag gi 'byung ba chen po bzhi la brten pa dang / nying mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par shes pa las dang nyon mongs pas bsdus pa dang ma'i lto na khong stong yod pa ni bu 'chags par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: The four great elements of blood and semen in the mother's womb are the cause of the four great elements of the embryo.

original: de na ming dang gzugs so //üîΩde nas skye mched drug go //
analyzed: de na ming dang gzugs so // de nas skye mched drug go //
translated: The consciousness that enters the womb is the cause of name-and-form.

original: de nas rig pa'o //
analyzed: de nas rig pa'o //
translated: The six sense spheres are the cause of contact.

original: de nas tshor ba ste de ltar go rims 'di bzhin du tshor bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas tshor ba ste de ltar go rims 'di bzhin du tshor bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The cause of feeling is the contact of this life.

original: tshor ba de'i rgyu ni tshe 'di'i reg pa yang yin la sngon gyi las kyang rgyu yin no //
analyzed: tshor ba de'i rgyu ni tshe 'di'i reg pa yang yin la sngon gyi las kyang rgyu yin no //
translated: The cause of craving is the feeling of this life and also previous karma.

original: gal te dam pa'i chos ma yin pa thos pa la brten nas tshul bzhin @200a * //
analyzed: gal te dam pa'i chos ma yin pa thos pa la brten nas tshul bzhin @200a * //
translated: If, on the basis of hearing the non-Dharma, one generates a mind of doubt,

original: ma yin pa yid la byed pa'i rgyus ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor bas reg par gyur na ni de tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa sred pa'i rkyen gyis phyi ma la skye ba dang rga ba la sogs pa'i bar gyi sdug bsngalüîΩgyi khyad par rnams 'byung ste /
analyzed: ma yin pa yid la byed pa'i rgyus ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor bas reg par gyur na ni de tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa sred pa'i rkyen gyis phyi ma la skye ba dang rga ba la sogs pa'i bar gyi sdug bsngal gyi khyad par rnams 'byung ste /
translated: When one experiences feelings that arise from contact with ignorance due to the cause of inappropriate attention, then due to the condition of feeling, craving arises, and due to the condition of craving, the sufferings of future birth, aging, and so on arise.

original: de ltar ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa'i tshor ba myong ba de ni bden pa gnyis kyis kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ro //üîΩde las bzlog pa dam pa'i chos thos nas tshul bzhin yid la byed pa la brten te /
analyzed: de ltar ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa'i tshor ba myong ba de ni bden pa gnyis kyis kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ro // de las bzlog pa dam pa'i chos thos nas tshul bzhin yid la byed pa la brten te /
translated: Thus, the experience of feeling that arises from contact with ignorance is thoroughly afflicted by the two obscurations.üîΩThe opposite of that is the experience of feeling that arises from contact with proper attention, which is based on listening to the sublime teachings.

original: reg pa'i 'dus te reg pa'i tshor ba myong ba ni bden pa gnyis kyis rnam par byang bar 'gyur ro /
analyzed: reg pa'i 'dus te reg pa'i tshor ba myong ba ni bden pa gnyis kyis rnam par byang bar 'gyur ro /
translated: That is purified by the two obscurations.

original: // / rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las bzhi bsdu ba /
analyzed: // / rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las bzhi bsdu ba /
translated: The Compendium of the Four Yogas

original: bam po brgyad pa /
analyzed: bam po brgyad pa /
translated: EIGHTH CHAPTER

original: las rnam par byang ba log par 'dogs pa dang / log par sgrub pa la nyes dmigs gnyis yod par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: las rnam par byang ba log par 'dogs pa dang / log par sgrub pa la nyes dmigs gnyis yod par rig par bya ste /
translated: It should be understood that there are two disadvantages in misapprehending and misconstruing the purification of action.

original: gnyes gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyes gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: nang gi rtog pa la slu ba dang / gzhan gyis smad pa'o //
analyzed: nang gi rtog pa la slu ba dang / gzhan gyis smad pa'o //
translated: deception of one‚Äôs own mind and blame by others.

original: las rnam par byang ba log par 'dogs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: las rnam par byang ba log par 'dogs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is misapprehending the purification of action?

original: ji ltar 'di na kha cig ston pa ma yin bzhin du bdag nyid ston pa lta bur 'dzin cing 'di ltar log par 'dogs te /
analyzed: ji ltar 'di na kha cig ston pa ma yin bzhin du bdag nyid ston pa lta bur 'dzin cing 'di ltar log par 'dogs te /
translated: It is like the case of someone who, although not a teacher, holds himself out to be one and makes the following misapprehension:üîΩ‚ÄúWhatever suffering there is in this life, all of it arises from causes created in the past.‚Äù

original: tshe 'di la sdug bsngal myong ba gang ci yang rung ba de dag thams cad ni sngon gyi byas pa'i rgyu las byung ba yin no snyam nas des sngon gyi mi dge ba'i las de rnam pa gnyis kyi rgyur gyur par mthong ste /
analyzed: tshe 'di la sdug bsngal myong ba gang ci yang rung ba de dag thams cad ni sngon gyi byas pa'i rgyu las byung ba yin no snyam nas des sngon gyi mi dge ba'i las de rnam pa gnyis kyi rgyur gyur par mthong ste /
translated: He sees that past nonvirtuous action has two causes:

original: byed pa de ni sngon gyi las la goms pa las byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: byed pa de ni sngon gyi las la goms pa las byung ba'i phyir /
translated: the cause of the action is the habituation to past action;

original: tshe 'di'i mi dge ba'i las kyi rgyu dang sdug bsngal de'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: tshe 'di'i mi dge ba'i las kyi rgyu dang sdug bsngal de'i rgyu'o //
translated: the cause of the suffering is the nonvirtuous action of this life.

original: de bas na sngon gyi mi dge ba'i las de dag dang 'bras bu sdug bsngal ni dka' thub drag pos 'byang bar 'gyur la phyi ma la mi dge ba'i las rnams byed par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir //
analyzed: de bas na sngon gyi mi dge ba'i las de dag dang 'bras bu sdug bsngal ni dka' thub drag pos 'byang bar 'gyur la phyi ma la mi dge ba'i las rnams byed par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir //
translated: Therefore, those former nonvirtuous actions and their resultant suffering are purified by the austerity of the fast, and one does not commit nonvirtuous actions in the future.

original: tshe 'di la lus dang ngag gis bsdams par gnas pas de ltar phyi ma la gcig tu nges par byed pa la brtson pa rnams kyis ni mi dge bas skye bar mi 'gyur te de lta na mi dge ba'i las de zad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshe 'di la lus dang ngag gis bsdams par gnas pas de ltar phyi ma la gcig tu nges par byed pa la brtson pa rnams kyis ni mi dge bas skye bar mi 'gyur te de lta na mi dge ba'i las de zad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, those who strive to be certain in the future by observing the fast with body and speech in this life do not take rebirth through nonvirtue and in that way, their nonvirtuous karma is exhausted.

original: de zad pas sdug bsngal zad cing sdug bsngal mthar thug par 'gyur ro zhe'o //
analyzed: de zad pas sdug bsngal zad cing sdug bsngal mthar thug par 'gyur ro zhe'o //
translated: Through its exhaustion, suffering is exhausted and suffering ends.

original: log par sgrub pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: log par sgrub pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is wrong practice?

original: ji ltar 'di na kha cig bdag gi las kyi kun nas nyon mongs @200b pa yang mi shes de'i gnyen po yang mi shes pa snga ma dang phyi ma'i khyad par rtogs pa yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mi shes te de de
analyzed: ji ltar 'di na kha cig bdag gi las kyi kun nas nyon mongs @200b pa yang mi shes de'i gnyen po yang mi shes pa snga ma dang phyi ma'i khyad par rtogs pa yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mi shes te de de
translated: Here, some do not understand the affliction of their karma, do not understand its antidote, and do not understand the difference between former and later states as it truly is.

original: ltar kun du rmongs nas ston pa la gzhi med pa'i dad pa dad par bya ba'i gnas ma yin par skyes pas bstan pa la mos par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ltar kun du rmongs nas ston pa la gzhi med pa'i dad pa dad par bya ba'i gnas ma yin par skyes pas bstan pa la mos par 'gyur te /
translated: He becomes devoted to the teaching.

original: smra ba ngan pa mi rigs pa'i phyogs su song ba de la brten nas gzhan dag gis rnam par bskyod na yang som nyir bya ba'i gnas la the tshom skyed par mi byed la dri ba'i sgo nas legs par lan thebs pa dang / legs par lan mi thebs pa dang /
analyzed: smra ba ngan pa mi rigs pa'i phyogs su song ba de la brten nas gzhan dag gis rnam par bskyod na yang som nyir bya ba'i gnas la the tshom skyed par mi byed la dri ba'i sgo nas legs par lan thebs pa dang / legs par lan mi thebs pa dang /
translated: Even if others should disturb him by relying on that bad speech which has gone over to the side of what is improper, he does not generate doubt in the matter to be doubted.

original: som nyi rnam par dag par byed pa dang ; rnam par dag par mi byed pa'i sgo nas ston pa thams cad mkhyen pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa yongs su mi tshol la //
analyzed: som nyi rnam par dag par byed pa dang ; rnam par dag par mi byed pa'i sgo nas ston pa thams cad mkhyen pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa yongs su mi tshol la //
translated: He does not investigate whether the teacher is omniscient or not, by way of whether he is purified or not purified of doubt, by way of whether he answers well or does not answer well when questioned.

original: ston pa 'das nas ni gtan du som nyi'i gnas la gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ston pa 'das nas ni gtan du som nyi'i gnas la gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: After the teacher has passed away, he remains for a long time in a state of doubt.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: ston pa gson pa'i tshe ni des thams cad mkhyen pa yin nam ma yin pa nges par rtogs par 'gyur ba zhig na shi ba'i 'og tu su la drir yang med na ji ltar nges par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ston pa gson pa'i tshe ni des thams cad mkhyen pa yin nam ma yin pa nges par rtogs par 'gyur ba zhig na shi ba'i 'og tu su la drir yang med na ji ltar nges par 'gyur te /
translated: When the teacher was alive, one could have ascertained whether he was omniscient or not. But after his death, since there is no one to ask, how can one ascertain that?

original: 'di ni log par sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni log par sgrub pa'o //
translated: This is a false proof.

original: de la ci'i phyir las rnam par byang ba log par 'dogs pa shin tu mi rigs par 'gyur zhe na ;
analyzed: de la ci'i phyir las rnam par byang ba log par 'dogs pa shin tu mi rigs par 'gyur zhe na ;
translated: Why is it so unreasonable to impute purification of karma?

original: rgyu rnam pa gnyis kyis te /
analyzed: rgyu rnam pa gnyis kyis te /
translated: It is due to two reasons.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows.

original: dka' thub drag po de ni sngon byas pa'i rgyu las byung ba yin //
analyzed: dka' thub drag po de ni sngon byas pa'i rgyu las byung ba yin //
translated: That severe austerity arises from a cause that was previously created.

original: mi srid pa des sngon gyi mi dge ba'i las 'byang bar 'gyur yang mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi srid pa des sngon gyi mi dge ba'i las 'byang bar 'gyur yang mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though that impossible thing purifies previous nonvirtuous karma, it is impossible.

original: de la brtsal ba chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen pos byas pas tshor ba chung ngu dang / 'bring dang chen po skye ba'i phyir dang / brtsal ba rnam pa gsum dang bral bas brtsal ba las byung ba'i sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba rnam pa gsum mi gnas pa'i phyir sngon byas pa'i rgyu las byung bar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de la brtsal ba chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen pos byas pas tshor ba chung ngu dang / 'bring dang chen po skye ba'i phyir dang / brtsal ba rnam pa gsum dang bral bas brtsal ba las byung ba'i sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba rnam pa gsum mi gnas pa'i phyir sngon byas pa'i rgyu las byung bar mi rung ngo //
translated: Because the small, medium, and great feelings arise from the small, medium, and great efforts, and because the three kinds of feelings arising from effort do not occur when the three kinds of effort are absent.

original: dka' thub drag po de la yang sngon gyi las mi dge ba sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de bde ba myong ba bya ba de'i mthu med pas de ni nges par 'di ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dka' thub drag po de la yang sngon gyi las mi dge ba sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de bde ba myong ba bya ba de'i mthu med pas de ni nges par 'di ltar 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, in the case of severe austerities, since nonvirtuous karma that is to be experienced as suffering is not capable of being experienced as pleasure, it is certain that:

original: bdag nyid yongs su gdungs pas sngon gyi mi dge ba'i las 'byang bar mthong ste /
analyzed: bdag nyid yongs su gdungs pas sngon gyi mi dge ba'i las 'byang bar mthong ste /
translated: One sees that one‚Äôs own suffering purifies nonvirtuous karma from the past.

original: de ltar gyur na tshe 'di la brtsal ba'i sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba de sngon gyi las mi dge ba sdug bsngal myong bar @201a * //
analyzed: de ltar gyur na tshe 'di la brtsal ba'i sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba de sngon gyi las mi dge ba sdug bsngal myong bar @201a * //
translated: If that were the case, then the feeling of suffering that arises from effort in this life would purify nonvirtuous karma from the past.

original: 'gyur ba gang yin pa de'i 'bras bur gyur pa yin nam ma yin /
analyzed: 'gyur ba gang yin pa de'i 'bras bur gyur pa yin nam ma yin /
translated: Is that which changes the result of that or not?

original: gal te 'bras bur gyur pa yin na ni dka' thub kyang don med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te 'bras bur gyur pa yin na ni dka' thub kyang don med par 'gyur te /
translated: If it is the result, then austerities are pointless,

original: de'i 'bras bu myong ba kho nas zad par 'gyur la de ltar gyur na ni sngon gyi mi dge ba'i las kyi yin gyi dka' thub kyis byang bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu myong ba kho nas zad par 'gyur la de ltar gyur na ni sngon gyi mi dge ba'i las kyi yin gyi dka' thub kyis byang bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: because the result of that is exhausted by just being experienced. If that were the case, then it would be the result of previous nonvirtuous karma, but it would not be purified by austerities.

original: gang dag gi tshe 'di'i 'bras bu nyams su myong bas ni las kyi phyogs gcig de byang bar zad de /
analyzed: gang dag gi tshe 'di'i 'bras bu nyams su myong bas ni las kyi phyogs gcig de byang bar zad de /
translated: When one experiences the result in this life, one part of karma is exhausted.

original: gzhan ni lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba yin pas na /
analyzed: gzhan ni lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba yin pas na /
translated: Since another part is to be experienced in another life,

original: de'i phyir tshe phyi ma la myong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshe phyi ma la myong bar 'gyur te /
translated: it is experienced in a future life.

original: de ni 'bras bu'i sgo nas dka' thub kyis 'byang bar 'gyur du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de ni 'bras bu'i sgo nas dka' thub kyis 'byang bar 'gyur du mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore it is not tenable that it is purified by austerities through the result.

original: gal te brtsal ba'i sdug bsngal de sngon byas pa'i rgyu las byung ba ma yin na ni de lta na nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba gang ci yang rung ba de dag thams cad sngon byas pa'i rgyu las byung ba yin no zhes bya bar mi rung ngo
analyzed: gal te brtsal ba'i sdug bsngal de sngon byas pa'i rgyu las byung ba ma yin na ni de lta na nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba gang ci yang rung ba de dag thams cad sngon byas pa'i rgyu las byung ba yin no zhes bya bar mi rung ngo
translated: If the suffering of searching did not arise from a previous cause, then it would not be tenable to state, ‚ÄúWhatever is experienced arises from a previous cause.‚Äù

original: // ji ltar sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ba bde ba myong bar bsgyur du mi rung ba de bzhin du sngon gyi las dge ba bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba de yang sdug bsngal myong ba'am /üîΩde gnyi gar bsgyur du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: // ji ltar sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ba bde ba myong bar bsgyur du mi rung ba de bzhin du sngon gyi las dge ba bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba de yang sdug bsngal myong ba'am / de gnyi gar bsgyur du mi rung ngo //
translated: Just as it is not tenable to transform the experience of suffering into the experience of pleasure, in the same way it is not tenable to transform previous virtuous karma that is to be experienced as pleasure into the experience of suffering orüîΩinto the experience of both.

original: gzhan yang tshe 'di la myong bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de tshe phyi ma la myong bar bya ba dang / tshe phyi ma la myong bar 'gyur ba gang yin de mi myong bar bya ba dang / yongs su ma smin pa gang yin pa de yongs su smin par bya ba dang /
analyzed: gzhan yang tshe 'di la myong bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de tshe phyi ma la myong bar bya ba dang / tshe phyi ma la myong bar 'gyur ba gang yin de mi myong bar bya ba dang / yongs su ma smin pa gang yin pa de yongs su smin par bya ba dang /
translated: Moreover, it is not tenable to transform that which is to be experienced in this life into that which is to be experienced in the next life, or that which is to be experienced in the next life into that which is not to be experienced, or that which is not fully ripened into that which is fully ripened, or that which is fully ripened into that which is not fully ripened.

original: yongs su smin zin pa gang yin pa de dang der bsgyur du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: yongs su smin zin pa gang yin pa de dang der bsgyur du mi rung ngo //
translated: But it is not possible to transform that which is already fully ripened.

original: de la don gyi mdo ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la don gyi mdo ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is summarized as follows:

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba las thams cad ni rang bzhin nges pa dang / dus nges pa dang / rnam pa nges pa ste /
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba las thams cad ni rang bzhin nges pa dang / dus nges pa dang / rnam pa nges pa ste /
translated: All virtuous and nonvirtuous actions are determined by nature, determined by time, and determined by aspect.

original: de ji ltar nges pa de bzhin du 'bras bu yongs su 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ji ltar nges pa de bzhin du 'bras bu yongs su 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will yield results in accordance with that determination.

original: de la bdag gis brtsal ba'i sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba rnams kyis ci zhig byar yod do //
analyzed: de la bdag gis brtsal ba'i sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba rnams kyis ci zhig byar yod do //
translated: What can I do about the painful feelings that I have sought out?üîΩIf those feelings arise from the cause of past karma, then it would seem that only a portion of that karma would be exhausted.

original: gal te tshor ba de rnams sngon gyi las kyi rgyu las byung ba zhig yin na ni las kyi phyogs gcig de tsam zhig 'byang ba byed par snang bar gyur na yang de dag gi phan yon tsam du 'gyur bar zad la rang gis khas blangs pas na
analyzed: gal te tshor ba de rnams sngon gyi las kyi rgyu las byung ba zhig yin na ni las kyi phyogs gcig de tsam zhig 'byang ba byed par snang bar gyur na yang de dag gi phan yon tsam du 'gyur bar zad la rang gis khas blangs pas na
translated: But that would be a benefit that you yourself have accepted.

original: de yang phan yon tsam du yang mi 'gyur te de ltar na gtan du slu ba yin la las kyis bcings pas thar bar yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de yang phan yon tsam du yang mi 'gyur te de ltar na gtan du slu ba yin la las kyis bcings pas thar bar yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, it would not be beneficial, because it would be a permanent deception. And it would not be liberation, because one would be bound by karma.

original: rnam grangs des na 'di ni log par smra ba dang / @201b log par sgrub pa de'i nyes dmigs dang po ste /
analyzed: rnam grangs des na 'di ni log par smra ba dang / @201b log par sgrub pa de'i nyes dmigs dang po ste /
translated: For this reason, this is the first disadvantage of false speech and false practice.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: nang gi rang gi don la slu ba yin no //
analyzed: nang gi rang gi don la slu ba yin no //
translated: It is a deception regarding one‚Äôs own inner aims.

original: gzhan gyis smad pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan gyis smad pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is contempt by others?

original: de dag ni smra ba rnam pa gnyis dang / dka' thub rnam pa gsum la brten te /
analyzed: de dag ni smra ba rnam pa gnyis dang / dka' thub rnam pa gsum la brten te /
translated: They rely on two kinds of speech and three kinds of austerities.

original: skyes bu gang zag 'dis gang chung zad nyams su myong ba de dag thams cad ni sngon byas pa'i rgyu las byung ba kho na yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni ngan par smra ba gcig ste /
analyzed: skyes bu gang zag 'dis gang chung zad nyams su myong ba de dag thams cad ni sngon byas pa'i rgyu las byung ba kho na yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni ngan par smra ba gcig ste /
translated: This person claims that whatever experiences one has are only due to causes created in the past. This is one kind of bad speech,

original: rgyu mi mthun par smra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu mi mthun par smra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is a cause that is not in accord with the result.

original: gzhan dag ni 'di skad du 'di ltar de thog ma ni dbang phyug gis sprul to //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni 'di skad du 'di ltar de thog ma ni dbang phyug gis sprul to //
translated: Others say, ‚ÄúIn this way, the world was first created by ƒ™≈õvara.

original: de phyin chad ni sngon byas pa'i las kyis nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro zhes smra ba 'di ni ngan par smra ba gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: de phyin chad ni sngon byas pa'i las kyis nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro zhes smra ba 'di ni ngan par smra ba gnyis pa'o //
translated: This is the second bad doctrine.

original: dka' thub rnam pa gsum ni lus kyi sdom pa dang / ngag gi sdom pa dang / yid kyi sdom pa'o //
analyzed: dka' thub rnam pa gsum ni lus kyi sdom pa dang / ngag gi sdom pa dang / yid kyi sdom pa'o //
translated: There are three kinds of austerities: the austerity of the body, the austerity of speech, and the austerity of the mind.

original: de la lus kyi sdom pa ni lus kyis de las gzhan pa'i sems can rnams dang lhan cig tu mi 'dug ste /
analyzed: de la lus kyi sdom pa ni lus kyis de las gzhan pa'i sems can rnams dang lhan cig tu mi 'dug ste /
translated: The austerity of the body is to not associate with other sentient beings.

original: tshang tshing dang / nags tshal dang / dgon pa dang / gnas dben par gnas pas thams cad kyis mi mthong ba 'ba' zhig tu sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: tshang tshing dang / nags tshal dang / dgon pa dang / gnas dben par gnas pas thams cad kyis mi mthong ba 'ba' zhig tu sgrub pa'o //
translated: One should practice in a place that is not seen by anyone, such as a dense forest, a jungle, or a deserted place.

original: de la ngag gi sdom pa ni mi smra ba'i brtul zhugs pa yi dam du 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: de la ngag gi sdom pa ni mi smra ba'i brtul zhugs pa yi dam du 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The austerity of speech is to take a vow of silence.

original: de la yid kyi sdom pa ni brtsal ba'i tshor ba rnams yid kyis dang du mi len pa'o //
analyzed: de la yid kyi sdom pa ni brtsal ba'i tshor ba rnams yid kyis dang du mi len pa'o //
translated: The austerity of the mind is to not accept any feelings that arise.

original: de dag 'di ltar lta ba phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa 'di gnyis dang / dka' thub phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa gsum gyis sdug bsngal las yang dag par 'da' bar 'gyur ro zhes de ltar 'dod cing ston la /
analyzed: de dag 'di ltar lta ba phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa 'di gnyis dang / dka' thub phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa gsum gyis sdug bsngal las yang dag par 'da' bar 'gyur ro zhes de ltar 'dod cing ston la /
translated: They assert and teach that one can transcend suffering through these two perfect views and three perfect austerities.

original: rang yang sdug bsngal las yang dag par 'das par ma gyur pa'i phyir gzhan dag gis smad pa yin no //
analyzed: rang yang sdug bsngal las yang dag par 'das par ma gyur pa'i phyir gzhan dag gis smad pa yin no //
translated: But since they themselves have not transcended suffering, they are criticized by others.

original: gal te thams cad sngon byas pa'i rgyu las byung ba dang / dbang phyug gis sprul pa'i rgyu las byung ba dang / dka' thub rnam pa gsum ma btang ba'i rgyu las byung ba yin na ni de ltar na de dag nyid dka' thub rnam pa gsum dang bcas pas sdug bsngal nyams su myong ba na sngon gyi las gnag pa dang /
analyzed: gal te thams cad sngon byas pa'i rgyu las byung ba dang / dbang phyug gis sprul pa'i rgyu las byung ba dang / dka' thub rnam pa gsum ma btang ba'i rgyu las byung ba yin na ni de ltar na de dag nyid dka' thub rnam pa gsum dang bcas pas sdug bsngal nyams su myong ba na sngon gyi las gnag pa dang /
translated: If all this arose from the cause of previous karma, from the cause of being emanated by ƒ™≈õvara, and from the cause of not abandoning the three types of austerity, then they themselves, together with the three types of austerity, would experience suffering due to black karma,

original: dbang phyug gis kyang sdig pa can du sprul pa dang / dka' thub rnam pa gsum ma btang bdes na da ltar sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba myong bar 'gyur gor ma chag ste /üîΩnang gi rtogs pa la bslus pa de dag gi gzhan la grags @202a * //
analyzed: dbang phyug gis kyang sdig pa can du sprul pa dang / dka' thub rnam pa gsum ma btang bdes na da ltar sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba myong bar 'gyur gor ma chag ste / nang gi rtogs pa la bslus pa de dag gi gzhan la grags @202a * //
translated: And if Mahe≈õvara himself were to manifest as a sinner, and not give up the three types of austerities, he would certainly experience the feeling of suffering now.

original: shing bsngags pa tsam gyi phan yon lta bu gang yin pa de yang med de 'di ni nyes dmigs gnyis pa ste /
analyzed: shing bsngags pa tsam gyi phan yon lta bu gang yin pa de yang med de 'di ni nyes dmigs gnyis pa ste /
translated: Those who deceive themselves about their inner realization have no benefit whatsoever, such as the mere praise and acclaim of others. This is the second disadvantage.

original: yan lag 'dis kyang de dag ni smad pa'i 'os kho na yin no //
analyzed: yan lag 'dis kyang de dag ni smad pa'i 'os kho na yin no //
translated: By this part, they are only worthy of contempt.

original: de las bzlog pa las ni las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang bar smra ba yang dag par 'dogs pa dang / yang dag pa'i nan tan du sgrub pa la phan yon rnam pa gnyis yod par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa las ni las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang bar smra ba yang dag par 'dogs pa dang / yang dag pa'i nan tan du sgrub pa la phan yon rnam pa gnyis yod par rig par bya ste /
translated: The opposite of that is the two benefits of the afflictive and purifying aspects of karma: the correct designation of the teaching and the correct practice of the teaching.

original: nang gi rtogs pa la slu ba med pa dang / gzhan gyis bsngags pa'o //
analyzed: nang gi rtogs pa la slu ba med pa dang / gzhan gyis bsngags pa'o //
translated: The two benefits should be understood as the non-deception of inner realization and the praise of others.

original: las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa 'dogs shing smra ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa 'dogs shing smra ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the defilement of action?

original: las ni 'di gnyis yin te /
analyzed: las ni 'di gnyis yin te /
translated: It is the two kinds of action:

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba'o //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba'o //
translated: good and bad.

original: de las 'das pa'i dus nas bzung ste /
analyzed: de las 'das pa'i dus nas bzung ste /
translated: From the past,üîΩone experiences in this life the agreeable and disagreeable results of good and bad actions.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las byas pas tshe 'di la sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i rnam par smin pa nyams su myong ba dang / sdug pa dang mi sdug pa nyams su myong nas kyang dge ba dang mi dge ba byed de /
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las byas pas tshe 'di la sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i rnam par smin pa nyams su myong ba dang / sdug pa dang mi sdug pa nyams su myong nas kyang dge ba dang mi dge ba byed de /
translated: Having experienced the agreeable and disagreeable, one acts again in a good or bad way.

original: des na phyi ma la yang sdug pa dang mi sdug pa nyams su myong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na phyi ma la yang sdug pa dang mi sdug pa nyams su myong bar 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, in the future, one will again experience the agreeable and disagreeable.

original: de lta bu ni las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu ni las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa yin no //
translated: This is the defilement of action.

original: gsar du yang mi byed la rnying dang phrad na yang zad par byed pa dang / lhag ma yang gnyen pos spong bar byed pas rnam par byang ba ste ;
analyzed: gsar du yang mi byed la rnying dang phrad na yang zad par byed pa dang / lhag ma yang gnyen pos spong bar byed pas rnam par byang ba ste ;
translated: Purification is the opposite of that: one does not do what is bad and one does not accumulate what is good; one exhausts what has been done and one does not let the rest remain.

original: 'di ni las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba 'dogs shing smra ba bla na med pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba 'dogs shing smra ba bla na med pa'o //
translated: This is the unexcelled designation and proclamation of the afflicted and purified aspects of karma.

original: de la yang dag pa'i nan tan du sgrub pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la yang dag pa'i nan tan du sgrub pa gang zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúWhat is right practice?

original: ji ltar chos 'di pa thos pa dang ldan te las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa la yang kun nas nyon mongs pa gang yin pa dang / rnam par byang ba la yang rnam par byang ba yin par legs par yang dag par rtogs nas mi dge ba'i las ni spong la dge ba ni sgom par byed do //
analyzed: ji ltar chos 'di pa thos pa dang ldan te las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa la yang kun nas nyon mongs pa gang yin pa dang / rnam par byang ba la yang rnam par byang ba yin par legs par yang dag par rtogs nas mi dge ba'i las ni spong la dge ba ni sgom par byed do //
translated: Having heard the Dharma in this way, and having correctly understood the afflicted and purified aspects of karma, one abandons unwholesome karma and cultivates wholesome karma.

original: de thos pa dang / bsams pa las byung ba'i yid la byed pa la sbyor bar byas nas bsgoms pa las byung ba rtogs par bya'o snyam ste /
analyzed: de thos pa dang / bsams pa las byung ba'i yid la byed pa la sbyor bar byas nas bsgoms pa las byung ba rtogs par bya'o snyam ste /
translated: Having applied oneself to the mental attention that arises from hearing and reflection, one should realize that which arises from cultivation.

original: rab tu dben pa'i gnas su 'dug nas sgrib pa rnams dang / sdug bsngal gyi chos rnams las sems yongs su sbyong bar byed do //
analyzed: rab tu dben pa'i gnas su 'dug nas sgrib pa rnams dang / sdug bsngal gyi chos rnams las sems yongs su sbyong bar byed do //
translated: Having gone to a solitary place, one should purify one‚Äôs mind of the obscurations and the phenomena of suffering.

original: 'dod pa'i 'dun pa dang / gnod sems dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa spangs pa'i phyir zhi gnas kyi phyogs su gtogs @202b pa'i sems gnas pa rnam pa dgus sems lhag par btang snyoms su byed la /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dun pa dang / gnod sems dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa spangs pa'i phyir zhi gnas kyi phyogs su gtogs @202b pa'i sems gnas pa rnam pa dgus sems lhag par btang snyoms su byed la /
translated: He becomes indifferent to his mind through the nine mental abidings that are included in serenity, in order to abandon desire for sense objects, malice, drowsiness and torpor, and restlessness and worry.

original: rmugs pa dang gnyid dang the tshom spang ba'i phyir gzhi'i bye brag rnam pa drug gi lhag mthong gi tshul bzhin gyis sems mngon par 'du byed de /
analyzed: rmugs pa dang gnyid dang the tshom spang ba'i phyir gzhi'i bye brag rnam pa drug gi lhag mthong gi tshul bzhin gyis sems mngon par 'du byed de /
translated: He makes his mind fully adopt the six kinds of thorough investigation that are included in insight, in order to abandon doubt and laziness.

original: de bas na zhi gnas kyi phyogs su gtogs pa las langs ma thag pa kho nar yang dag par slob pa'i sdug bsngal ni nges par 'byang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na zhi gnas kyi phyogs su gtogs pa las langs ma thag pa kho nar yang dag par slob pa'i sdug bsngal ni nges par 'byang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, as soon as he rises from the side of serenity, he trains properly and is liberated from suffering.

original: de de ltar sgrib pa rnams las sems rnam par sbyangs nas chos gos dang / bsod snyoms dang / mal cha dang / stan longs spyad cing spyod pa las sems rnam par sbyong bar byed de /
analyzed: de de ltar sgrib pa rnams las sems rnam par sbyangs nas chos gos dang / bsod snyoms dang / mal cha dang / stan longs spyad cing spyod pa las sems rnam par sbyong bar byed de /
translated: Having thus purified his mind from the obscurations, he then purifies his mind in the enjoyment of the requisites of Dharma robes, alms, bedding and seats.

original: ji ltar bur chos gos nas mal cha dang stan gyi bar du brten pa de'i mi dge ba'i chos rnams 'phel zhing dge ba'i chos rnams 'grib par 'gyur ba de yongs su spong bar byed la 'dod na yang chos gos la sogs pa'i longs spyod ngan pas 'tsho
analyzed: ji ltar bur chos gos nas mal cha dang stan gyi bar du brten pa de'i mi dge ba'i chos rnams 'phel zhing dge ba'i chos rnams 'grib par 'gyur ba de yongs su spong bar byed la 'dod na yang chos gos la sogs pa'i longs spyod ngan pas 'tsho
translated: He completely avoids the conditions that increase nonvirtuous phenomena and decrease virtuous phenomena, from the robe up to the bed and seat.

original: zhing sdug bsngal dang du len to ;
analyzed: zhing sdug bsngal dang du len to ;
translated: He endures suffering and lives with poor resources, such as a robe, and so on, if he wishes.

original: / de'i chos gos la sogs pa longs spyod bzang ba'i gzhi dag las rgyu rnam pa gnyis kyis sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams skye bar 'gyur te /üîΩ'di lta ste /üîΩ'du shes dang rtog pa'o //
analyzed: / de'i chos gos la sogs pa longs spyod bzang ba'i gzhi dag las rgyu rnam pa gnyis kyis sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams skye bar 'gyur te / 'di lta ste / 'du shes dang rtog pa'o //
translated: Two causes generate nonvirtuous phenomena from the basis of good resources, such as a robe, and so on.

original: gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two?

original: dge ba la yang yun ring po nas ma goms pas sems las su mi rung ba dang / chos gos la sogs pa la yang 'dun pa'i 'dod chags kyis lhag par chags pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba la yang yun ring po nas ma goms pas sems las su mi rung ba dang / chos gos la sogs pa la yang 'dun pa'i 'dod chags kyis lhag par chags pa'o //
translated: They are the mind‚Äôs unserviceability due to lack of long-term familiarity with virtue and the excessive attachment to a robe, and so on, due to the craving of desire.üîΩWhat is the mind‚Äôs unserviceability?

original: gang gi tshe sems kyang las su rung bar byas la chos gos la sogs pa la yang lhag par chags pa mi rtag pa rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la yang nyes dmigs su mthong ba de'i tshe ni chos gos la sogs pa longs spyod bzang po la
analyzed: gang gi tshe sems kyang las su rung bar byas la chos gos la sogs pa la yang lhag par chags pa mi rtag pa rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la yang nyes dmigs su mthong ba de'i tshe ni chos gos la sogs pa longs spyod bzang po la
translated: When one makes the mind serviceable and one sees the faults of attachment to excellent robes and so on, and one sees that they are impermanent and dependently arisen, then one engages in excellent enjoyment of robes and so on.

original: 'jug tu zin kyang kun nas nyon mongs par yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'jug tu zin kyang kun nas nyon mongs par yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: Even though one engages in such enjoyment, one does not become afflicted.

original: de ltar na de ni bde bar yang 'gyur la kha na ma tho ba yang med pa dang / zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom pa'i stobs kyis kyang sgrib pa rnams las sems rnam par sbyangs nas so sor rtog pa'i stobs kyis kyang chos gos la sogs pa phyin ci ma log par longs spyod pas kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na de ni bde bar yang 'gyur la kha na ma tho ba yang med pa dang / zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom pa'i stobs kyis kyang sgrib pa rnams las sems rnam par sbyangs nas so sor rtog pa'i stobs kyis kyang chos gos la sogs pa phyin ci ma log par longs spyod pas kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus one is happy and free of misdeeds and by the power of cultivating serenity and insight, one purifies the mind of obscurations and by the power of discernment, one does not become afflicted by enjoying robes and so on without error.

original: de'i tshe sems rtse gcig pa tsam dang ldan mod kyi de phyi ma la yang kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba'i phyir 'dod pa'i 'dod @203a * //
analyzed: de'i tshe sems rtse gcig pa tsam dang ldan mod kyi de phyi ma la yang kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba'i phyir 'dod pa'i 'dod @203a * //
translated: At that time, although one possesses mere one pointedness of mind, it is still afflicted since it is still afflicted in the future.

original: chags kyi bag la nyal ni ma spangs so //
analyzed: chags kyi bag la nyal ni ma spangs so //
translated: At that time, he possesses only one pointedness of mind, but he has not abandoned the latent propensities of attachment to sense objects because that one pointedness of mind can be defiled in the future.

original: des de shes rab kyis rtogs nas spang ba'i phyir bas mtha'i gnas mal dag tu 'dug ste /
analyzed: des de shes rab kyis rtogs nas spang ba'i phyir bas mtha'i gnas mal dag tu 'dug ste /
translated: Having understood that through wisdom, he abandons it by living in remote wilderness regions.

original: des snga rol du ting nge 'dzin gyi tshogs shin tu yongs su dag par byas nas mthar gyis bsam gtan bzhi pa'i bar du snyoms par 'jug ste de la brten nas bden pa rnams kyang mngon par rtogs la zag pa zad pa yang 'thob cing sems kyang shinüîΩtu rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des snga rol du ting nge 'dzin gyi tshogs shin tu yongs su dag par byas nas mthar gyis bsam gtan bzhi pa'i bar du snyoms par 'jug ste de la brten nas bden pa rnams kyang mngon par rtogs la zag pa zad pa yang 'thob cing sems kyang shinüîΩtu rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Having previously purified the prerequisites for concentration, he enters meditative attainment in sequence up to the fourth absorption and, in dependence on that, realizes the four truths, obtains the elimination of contaminants and his mind is completely liberated.

original: sdug bsngal thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir zhi ba dang / phan 'dogs pa'i phyir dge ba dang / lus dang sems thams cad khyab par chub pa'i phyir rgyas pa dang / nyon mongs pa thams cad dang gtan bral ba'i phyir zag pa med pa'i tshor ba myong ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir zhi ba dang / phan 'dogs pa'i phyir dge ba dang / lus dang sems thams cad khyab par chub pa'i phyir rgyas pa dang / nyon mongs pa thams cad dang gtan bral ba'i phyir zag pa med pa'i tshor ba myong ste /
translated: He experiences the feeling of the uncontaminated, because it is free from all suffering, because it is virtuous, because it is expansive, because it pervades all bodies and minds, and because it is eternally free from all afflictions.

original: 'di ni yang dag par nan tan du sgrub pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ni yang dag par nan tan du sgrub pa zhes bya ste /
translated: This is called right practice.

original: de ltar na nang gi rtogs pa la slu ba med do //
analyzed: de ltar na nang gi rtogs pa la slu ba med do //
translated: Thus, there is no deception in the realization of the inner.

original: de las bzlog pa ni de'i gzhan gyis bsngags pa rnam pa lngar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni de'i gzhan gyis bsngags pa rnam pa lngar rig par bya'o //
translated: The opposite of this should be understood as the five kinds of praise by others.

original: de de'i tshe tshe 'di'i sgrib pa'i kun nas dkris pa'i sdug bsngal de las kyang sems shin tu rnam par grol bar 'gyur la de'i bag la nyal gyi lhag ma spangs pa dang / tshe 'di la 'phags pa'i lam 'bras bu dang bcas pa thob pa'i phyir sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha'i las kyi rnam par smin pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa las kyang rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de de'i tshe tshe 'di'i sgrib pa'i kun nas dkris pa'i sdug bsngal de las kyang sems shin tu rnam par grol bar 'gyur la de'i bag la nyal gyi lhag ma spangs pa dang / tshe 'di la 'phags pa'i lam 'bras bu dang bcas pa thob pa'i phyir sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha'i las kyi rnam par smin pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa las kyang rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, his mind is completely liberated from the suffering of the entanglements of the obscurations of this life, and the remainder of the latent afflictions are abandoned. And because he has attained the noble path and its result in this life, he is also liberated from the afflictions of the maturation of karma in the past and future.

original: gang zag ni gsum ste /
analyzed: gang zag ni gsum ste /
translated: There are three types of persons:

original: so so'i skye bo bstan pa la ma zhugs pa dang / slob pa bstan pa la zhugs pa dang / so so'i skye bo bstan pa la zhugs pa'o//
analyzed: so so'i skye bo bstan pa la ma zhugs pa dang / slob pa bstan pa la zhugs pa dang / so so'i skye bo bstan pa la zhugs pa'o//
translated: ordinary beings who have not entered the teaching, learners who have entered the teaching, and ordinary beings who have entered the teaching.

original: de la gang zag dang po ni rnam pa gsum du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la gang zag dang po ni rnam pa gsum du rig par bya'o //
translated: The first type of person should be understood in three ways.

original: gnyis pa dang gsum pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa dang gsum pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The second and third are similar to that.

original: de la rnam pa gsum po gang gis dang po shos rig par bya zhe na /
analyzed: de la rnam pa gsum po gang gis dang po shos rig par bya zhe na /
translated: By what three ways should the first be understood?

original: 'di ni gang zag kha cig 'jig rten pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba dang ldan pa yin te /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di ni gang zag kha cig 'jig rten pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba dang ldan pa yin te / 'di lta ste /
translated: Some persons possess mundane right view.

original: sbyin pa yod do zhes bya ba nas rgyas par sbyar ro //
analyzed: sbyin pa yod do zhes bya ba nas rgyas par sbyar ro //
translated: They think, ‚ÄúThere is generosity,‚Äù and so on, in detail.

original: de yang phyis dam pa'i chos ma yin pa thos pa dang / tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa la brten nas 'jig rten pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba 'gag par mngon du phyogs par 'gyur la thams cad kyi thams cad du 'gag pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang phyis dam pa'i chos ma yin pa thos pa dang / tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa la brten nas 'jig rten pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba 'gag par mngon du phyogs par 'gyur la thams cad kyi thams cad du 'gag pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Later, on the basis of hearing what is not the true Dharma and improper mental attention, their mundane right view is about to cease, but it has not completely ceased.

original: @203b 'gag pa'i rgyur ni 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @203b 'gag pa'i rgyur ni 'gyur ro //
translated: It is the cause of its cessation.

original: skur pa 'debs pa ni de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su 'gyur ba log par lta ba skye bar mngon du phyogs la da dung ni ma skyes te /
analyzed: skur pa 'debs pa ni de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su 'gyur ba log par lta ba skye bar mngon du phyogs la da dung ni ma skyes te /
translated: Denial is about to arise as the opposing factor to that right view, but it has not yet arisen.

original: skye ba'i rgyu ni yin no //
analyzed: skye ba'i rgyu ni yin no //
translated: It is the cause of its arising.

original: de yang bar mdor dam pa'i chos thos pa dang tshul bzhin yid la byed pa la brten nas log par lta bar skye bar mngon du phyogs pa de kun du spyod pa'i sgo nas spangs la yang dag pa'i lta ba ni mi skyed de snga nas ldan pa'i
analyzed: de yang bar mdor dam pa'i chos thos pa dang tshul bzhin yid la byed pa la brten nas log par lta bar skye bar mngon du phyogs pa de kun du spyod pa'i sgo nas spangs la yang dag pa'i lta ba ni mi skyed de snga nas ldan pa'i
translated: Moreover, one who is about to generate wrong view on the basis of hearing the true Dharma and proper mental attention abandons wrong view by means of practice but does not generate the correct view because he already possesses it.

original: phyir ro // gzhan yang kha cig ni yang dag pa'i lta ba dang ldan pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: phyir ro // gzhan yang kha cig ni yang dag pa'i lta ba dang ldan pa yang ma yin /
translated: Moreover, some do not possess correct view

original: log pa'i lta ba dang ldan pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: log pa'i lta ba dang ldan pa yang ma yin te /
translated: and do not possess wrong view.

original: de la chos thos pa dang tshul bzhin yid la byed pa la brten nas /
analyzed: de la chos thos pa dang tshul bzhin yid la byed pa la brten nas /
translated: On the basis of hearing the Dharma and proper mental attention,

original: 'jig rten pa yang dag pa'i lta ba skyed par byed la log par lta ba ni spong bar mi byed de snga nas de dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa yang dag pa'i lta ba skyed par byed la log par lta ba ni spong bar mi byed de snga nas de dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: they generate mundane correct view but do not abandon wrong view because they do not previously possess it.

original: gzhan yang log par lta ba dang yang ldan la tshul bzhin yid la byed pa la yang brten nas log par lta ba de yang spong la yang dag par lta ba yang skyed par byed do //
analyzed: gzhan yang log par lta ba dang yang ldan la tshul bzhin yid la byed pa la yang brten nas log par lta ba de yang spong la yang dag par lta ba yang skyed par byed do //
translated: Moreover, one who possesses wrong view and who relies on proper attention abandons that wrong view and generates correct view.

original: gang zag gnyis pa ni sangs rgyas la sogs pa la shes nas dad par gyur pa ste /üîΩdang po mngon sum du byed pa na sangs rgyas la sogs pa la de'i mi shes pa bden pa mngon par rtogs pa'i snga rol du spangs zin pas de'i tshe yang spong bar mi byed la sangs rgyas la sogs pa la dad pa dang ldan pa'i phyir rig
analyzed: gang zag gnyis pa ni sangs rgyas la sogs pa la shes nas dad par gyur pa ste / dang po mngon sum du byed pa na sangs rgyas la sogs pa la de'i mi shes pa bden pa mngon par rtogs pa'i snga rol du spangs zin pas de'i tshe yang spong bar mi byed la sangs rgyas la sogs pa la dad pa dang ldan pa'i phyir rig
translated: The second type of person is one who has faith through knowledge of the Buddha and so on.üîΩWhen he first manifests the transcendent wisdom that directly realizes the four truths, he does not abandon ignorance of the four truths because he has not previously abandoned it.

original: pa yang mngon sum du byed pa'i sgo nas skyed par byed do //üîΩslob pa'i lam kho nas ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i ma rig pa rnam pa gzhan spong bar byed la rig pa ni skyed par mi byed de /
analyzed: pa yang mngon sum du byed pa'i sgo nas skyed par byed do // slob pa'i lam kho nas ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i ma rig pa rnam pa gzhan spong bar byed la rig pa ni skyed par mi byed de /
translated: But he generates correct view through directly realizing the four truths and he generates faith in the Buddha and so on because he possesses faith in the Buddha and so forth.

original: lam gyi rang bzhin mtshungs pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: lam gyi rang bzhin mtshungs pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: The path of learning alone abandons other aspects of ignorance to be abandoned by the path of meditation and generates other aspects of correct view because the nature of the path is similar.

original: / mi slob pa'i lam mngon sum du byed pa na ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i phyir ma rig pa thams cad kyang spong la mi slob pa'i rig pa de yang skyed par byed do //
analyzed: / mi slob pa'i lam mngon sum du byed pa na ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i phyir ma rig pa thams cad kyang spong la mi slob pa'i rig pa de yang skyed par byed do //
translated: When one manifests the path of no-more-learning, one abandons all ignorance to be abandoned by the path of cultivation and one generates the knowledge of no-more-learning.

original: gang zag gsum pa ni bdag med pa dang ldan pa'i dam pa'i chos thos pa na dang po thos pa tsam gyis mos par 'gyur la snying nas 'jug pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang zag gsum pa ni bdag med pa dang ldan pa'i dam pa'i chos thos pa na dang po thos pa tsam gyis mos par 'gyur la snying nas 'jug pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The third person, when hearing the holy Dharma endowed with selflessness, first generates mere belief through mere hearing, but does not engage it from the heart.

original: de bdag med pa la mos pa'i phyir bdag tu lta ba ni spong la snying la zhugs pa ma yin pas na bdag med par lta ba ni skyed par mi byed do //
analyzed: de bdag med pa la mos pa'i phyir bdag tu lta ba ni spong la snying la zhugs pa ma yin pas na bdag med par lta ba ni skyed par mi byed do //
translated: Because of believing in selflessness, he abandons the view of self, but because he has not engaged it from the heart, he does not generate the view of selflessness.

original: gang gi tshe chos de dag ji ltar thos pa bzhin du tshul bzhin du sems pa de'i tshe ni snying nas zhugs par gyur @204a * //
analyzed: gang gi tshe chos de dag ji ltar thos pa bzhin du tshul bzhin du sems pa de'i tshe ni snying nas zhugs par gyur @204a * //
translated: When he properly reflects on those dharmas in accordance with how he has heard them, at that time he engages it from the heart.

original: pas bdag med par lta ba skyed par byed la bag la nyal gyi sgo nas ni mi spong ngo //
analyzed: pas bdag med par lta ba skyed par byed la bag la nyal gyi sgo nas ni mi spong ngo //
translated: Because of that, he generates the view of selflessness, but he does not abandon it through the door of latency.

original: des de yan chad kyi bsgom pa'i lam gyis bden pa mngon par rtogs pa'i phyir bag la nyal gyi sgo nas spong zhing zag pa med pa skyed par byed do //
analyzed: des de yan chad kyi bsgom pa'i lam gyis bden pa mngon par rtogs pa'i phyir bag la nyal gyi sgo nas spong zhing zag pa med pa skyed par byed do //
translated: The path of cultivation is the path of insight into the truths, because it is the path of insight into the truths.üîΩThe first verse of the chapter on action is:

original: sdom ni / gnyis pa lnga dang gsum pa bcu //
analyzed: sdom ni / gnyis pa lnga dang gsum pa bcu //
translated: The first two are fivefold, the third is tenfold,

original: bzhi tshan yang ni tha ma yin //
analyzed: bzhi tshan yang ni tha ma yin //
translated: the fourth is fourfold, and the fifth is twofold.

original: las ni gnyis te /
analyzed: las ni gnyis te /
translated: Action is twofold:

original: las lci ba dang yang ba'o //
analyzed: las lci ba dang yang ba'o //
translated: heavy and light.

original: gzhan yang gnyis te /
analyzed: gzhan yang gnyis te /
translated: It is also twofold:

original: bsags par 'gyur ba dang // bsags par 'gyur ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bsags par 'gyur ba dang // bsags par 'gyur ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: accumulated and unaccumulated.

original: gzhan yang gnyis te /
analyzed: gzhan yang gnyis te /

original: ched du bsams pa dang / ched du bsams pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: ched du bsams pa dang / ched du bsams pa ma yin pa'o //

original: gzhan yang gnyis te /
analyzed: gzhan yang gnyis te /

analyzed: myong bar 'gyur bar nges pa dang / myong bar 'gyur bar ma nges pa'o //
translated: certain to be experienced and uncertain to be experienced.

original: gzhan yang gnyis te /
analyzed: gzhan yang gnyis te /
translated: It is also twofold:

original: rnam par smin pa rnam par smin zin pa dang / rnam par smin pa rnam par ma smin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa rnam par smin zin pa dang / rnam par smin pa rnam par ma smin pa'o //

original: las ni gsum ste /
analyzed: las ni gsum ste /

original: gzhan yang gsum ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang gsum ste /

analyzed: tshe 'di la myong bar 'gyur ba dang / skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba dang / lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'o //

original: gzhan yang gsum ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang gsum ste /

analyzed: slob pa'i dang / mi slob pa'i dang / slob pa'i yang ma yin mi slob pa'i yang ma yin pa'i'o //

original: gzhan yang gsum ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang gsum ste /

translated: liberation of body, etc.

original: las ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: las ni bzhi ste /
