analyzed: las gnag la rnam par smin pa yang gnag pa dang / las dkar la rnam @204b par smin pa yang dkar ba dang / las dkar gnag 'dres la rnam par smin pa yang dkar gnag 'dres pa dang / las dkar ba yang ma yin gnag pa yang ma yin la rnam par smin pa yang med de las zad par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: black karma with black retribution, white karma with white retribution, mixed black and white karma with mixed retribution, and neither black nor white karma with neither black nor white retribution, which leads to the destruction of karma.

original: de la las lci ba ni rgyu rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la las lci ba ni rgyu rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste /
translated: Therein, heavy karma should be understood as threefold:

original: bsam pa dang / sbyor ba dang / zhing gi sgo nas so //
analyzed: bsam pa dang / sbyor ba dang / zhing gi sgo nas so //
translated: in terms of intention, in terms of performance, and in terms of field.

original: de la bsam pa ni kun nas dkris pa drag pos byed pa dang / chos mthun pa pa mthong na rab tu dga' ba dang de'i 'og tu yang shas cher rjes su rtog cing rjes su dpyod pa ste de lta bu ni bsam pa'i sgo nas lci ba yin no //
analyzed: de la bsam pa ni kun nas dkris pa drag pos byed pa dang / chos mthun pa pa mthong na rab tu dga' ba dang de'i 'og tu yang shas cher rjes su rtog cing rjes su dpyod pa ste de lta bu ni bsam pa'i sgo nas lci ba yin no //
translated: The intention is to commit the act with intense fetters, to be very pleased when one sees someone who agrees with one, and then to reflect and speculate about it a great deal.

original: sbyor ba'i sgo nas ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i sgo nas ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is it heavy in terms of application?

original: rgyun du yang byas la bsgrims te yun ring por 'dris par byas pa'i sgo nas bsags pa dang / gzhan dag kyang de 'ba' zhig la yang dag par 'dzud pa dang / de 'ba' zhig gi bsngags pa yang brjod pa ste de lta bu ni sbyor ba'i sgo nas lci ba yin no //
analyzed: rgyun du yang byas la bsgrims te yun ring por 'dris par byas pa'i sgo nas bsags pa dang / gzhan dag kyang de 'ba' zhig la yang dag par 'dzud pa dang / de 'ba' zhig gi bsngags pa yang brjod pa ste de lta bu ni sbyor ba'i sgo nas lci ba yin no //
translated: It is accumulated through repeated practice, through being practiced for a long time, and through being practiced with intensity. It is also heavy in terms of application when one causes others to engage in it, and when one praises it alone.

original: zhing gi sgo nas ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: zhing gi sgo nas ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is it heavy in terms of the field?

original: phan 'dogs pa dang yang dag par zhugs pa dang yang dag par nan tan du sgrub pa'i 'bras bu la gnas pa'i sems can gang yin pa de dag la legs par byas pa'am /

original: brdzun du smra bas brid pa la sogs pa 'ga' zhig byas par bsams pa las de'i 'du shes kyis gzhan la byas pa ste /üîΩde la ni bsam pa lci ba kho na yin par rig par bya'o /

translated: One should understand that the intention is heavy in the case of a lie, etc.

original: dngos po lci ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po lci ba ni ma yin no //
translated: when one has thought about it and done it with that perception, but the object is not heavy.

original: nor pa ma yin pa ni de las bzlog pa yin par rig par bya'o //üîΩde la myong @205a * //
analyzed: nor pa ma yin pa ni de las bzlog pa yin par rig par bya'o // de la myong @205a * //
translated: The opposite of that should be understood as not being a mistake.

original: bar 'gyur bar nges pa ni ched du bsams pa lci ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: bar 'gyur bar nges pa ni ched du bsams pa lci ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: That which is certain to be experienced is any weighty intentional action.

original: myong bar 'gyur bar ma nges pa ni ched du bsams pa de nyid lci ba ma yin pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: myong bar 'gyur bar ma nges pa ni ched du bsams pa de nyid lci ba ma yin pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: That which is uncertain to be experienced is any unintentional action that is weighty.

original: de la rnam par smin pa rnam par smin zin pa ni 'bras bu smin zin pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la rnam par smin pa rnam par smin zin pa ni 'bras bu smin zin pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: That which has already ripened is any action whose result has already ripened.

original: de las bzlog pa ni rnam par smin pa rnam par ma smin pa'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni rnam par smin pa rnam par ma smin pa'o //
translated: The opposite of that is that which has not yet ripened.

original: de la dgra bcom pa nyid 'thob pa'i tshe ni myong bar 'gyur bar nges pa'i las sngon byas pa rnam par smin par nye bar gnas pas bar chad byed par nus kyi rgyud dang 'brel pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de la dgra bcom pa nyid 'thob pa'i tshe ni myong bar 'gyur bar nges pa'i las sngon byas pa rnam par smin par nye bar gnas pas bar chad byed par nus kyi rgyud dang 'brel pas ni ma yin no //
translated: When one obtains the state of an arhat, karma that is certain to be experienced in a prior birth can obstruct that attainment, since its karmic maturation is near. But it cannot obstruct that attainment through its connection to the continuum.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: las des de'i gnas mi mthun pa mngon par 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: las des de'i gnas mi mthun pa mngon par 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: That karma would create an incompatible state for the arhat,

original: sgrib pa des na dgra bcom pa nyid thob par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrib pa des na dgra bcom pa nyid thob par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that obscuration prevents the attainment of arhatship.

original: gal te skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: If karma is not to be experienced after rebirth,üîΩbut is to be experienced in a third life, then it cannot obstruct the attainment of arhatship.

original: lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba zhig yin na ni dgra bcom pa nyid 'thob pa'i bar chad byed mi nus mod kyi 'on kyang de yang myong bar 'gyur ba ma yin pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba zhig yin na ni dgra bcom pa nyid 'thob pa'i bar chad byed mi nus mod kyi 'on kyang de yang myong bar 'gyur ba ma yin pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not that it is not to be experienced at all.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: nyon mongs pa'i grogs de yang yod la 'du byed de yang yod na de ltar de la myong bar 'gyur ba nges pa zhes 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i grogs de yang yod la 'du byed de yang yod na de ltar de la myong bar 'gyur ba nges pa zhes 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If there is a friend of the afflictions and there is a formation, then it is said that there is a certainty of experiencing the result.

original: dge ba'i las ni rgyu rnam pa gnyis kyis rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i las ni rgyu rnam pa gnyis kyis rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: Virtuous karma is established by two causes:

original: sdug pa'i 'bras bu yongs su 'dzin pa dang / dmigs pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa de'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: sdug pa'i 'bras bu yongs su 'dzin pa dang / dmigs pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa de'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: the possession of a pleasant result and the result of the correct understanding of the object.

original: mi dge ba yang rgyu gnyis kyis rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: mi dge ba yang rgyu gnyis kyis rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: Nonvirtuous karma is also established by two causes:

original: mi sdug pa'i 'bras bu yongs su 'dzin pa dang / log pa'i dmigs pa la mngon par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: mi sdug pa'i 'bras bu yongs su 'dzin pa dang / log pa'i dmigs pa la mngon par zhen pa'o //
translated: the possession of an unpleasant result and the adherence to a false object.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i rnam pa gnyi gar yang lung bstan du med pa la lung ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i rnam pa gnyi gar yang lung bstan du med pa la lung ma bstan pa'o //
translated: That which is neither virtuous nor nonvirtuous is indeterminate.

original: de la bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba ni bsam gtan dang po dang / gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dang ldan pa dang / 'dod pa na spyod pa'i dge ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba ni bsam gtan dang po dang / gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dang ldan pa dang / 'dod pa na spyod pa'i dge ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: Karma to be experienced as pleasure is that associated with the first, second, and third absorptions and any virtue in the desire realm.

original: sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ba ni ngan song du skye bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ba ni ngan song du skye bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: That which is to be experienced as suffering is that which will be born in the unfortunate realms.

original: dud 'gro dang yi dags su skyes pa rnams kyi bde ba myong ba sngon gyi las kyi rgyu las byung ba gang yin pa de ni bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i las las gyur par rig par bya'o //

original: / tshe 'di la myong bar 'gyur ba ni bsam pa de lta bu'am sbyor ba dang / dngos po sbyor ba de lta bu'am /
analyzed: / tshe 'di la myong bar 'gyur ba ni bsam pa de lta bu'am sbyor ba dang / dngos po sbyor ba de lta bu'am /
translated: The karma to be experienced in this life is that which is experienced in this life due to such a thought, such an application, such an application of the object,

original: lus dang ngag gi sbyor bas zhing de lta bu la byas pas tshe 'di la gang gi rnam par smin par 'gyur ba gang yin pa'o //üîΩtshe 'di la ni mi smin la skyes ma thag pa'i tshe la rnam par smin par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: lus dang ngag gi sbyor bas zhing de lta bu la byas pas tshe 'di la gang gi rnam par smin par 'gyur ba gang yin pa'o // tshe 'di la ni mi smin la skyes ma thag pa'i tshe la rnam par smin par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: or due to the application of body and speech, such as that which is done to such a field, and that which is experienced in this life.üîΩThat which is not experienced in this life but is experienced immediately upon birth is to be experienced after rebirth.

original: tshe 'di la smin pa yang ma yin skyes nas smin par 'gyur ba yang ma yin la de'i 'og tu rnam par smin pa rnam par smin par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: tshe 'di la smin pa yang ma yin skyes nas smin par 'gyur ba yang ma yin la de'i 'og tu rnam par smin pa rnam par smin par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: That which is not experienced in this life or immediately after birth, but is experienced later, is to be experienced in another life.

original: 'phags pa nyan thos dus dus su lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang lhag pa'i sems dang ldan pa'i shes rab la slob pa'i zag pa med pa dang / de'i phyi nas thob pa'i dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa gang yin pa de ni slob pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa nyan thos dus dus su lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang lhag pa'i sems dang ldan pa'i shes rab la slob pa'i zag pa med pa dang / de'i phyi nas thob pa'i dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa gang yin pa de ni slob pa'o //
translated: The training of the noble disciples in the pure morality, the pure mind, and the pure wisdom, and the contaminated virtue that is acquired subsequently to that, is the training.

original: mi slob pa'i dgra bcom pa'i rgyud la yod pa thams cad do //
analyzed: mi slob pa'i dgra bcom pa'i rgyud la yod pa thams cad do //
translated: All that exists in the stream of the perfected being who is not in training is the non-training.

original: de ma yin pa ni slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin pa'o //üîΩmthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa gang yin pa dang / des bskyed pa'i sems pa gang yin pa dang / ngan song du 'gro bar 'gyur ba'i las thams cad ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ma yin pa ni slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin pa'o // mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa gang yin pa dang / des bskyed pa'i sems pa gang yin pa dang / ngan song du 'gro bar 'gyur ba'i las thams cad ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba'o //
translated: That which is neither is neither in training nor not in training.üîΩThe action of the defilements to be abandoned by insight, the volition that they produce, and all the actions which lead to the unfortunate planes of existence, are to be abandoned by insight.

original: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa dang / des bskyed pa'i sems pa ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i las yin no //
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa dang / des bskyed pa'i sems pa ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i las yin no //
translated: The action of the defilements to be abandoned by cultivation, and the volition that they produce, are the action to be abandoned by cultivation.

original: spang bar bya ba ma yin pa ni slob pa dang mi slob pa'i 'jig rten las 'das pa gang yin pa thams cad do //
analyzed: spang bar bya ba ma yin pa ni slob pa dang mi slob pa'i 'jig rten las 'das pa gang yin pa thams cad do //
translated: The non-abandonable is all that is supramundane, whether of the learner or post-learner.

original: ched du bsams pa'i mi dge ba'i las tshe 'di nyid la byas shing bsags pa spong ba ni rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: ched du bsams pa'i mi dge ba'i las tshe 'di nyid la byas shing bsags pa spong ba ni rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste /
translated: The abandonment of the unwholesome karma that is done and accumulated through intention in this very life should be understood as threefold.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: tshe 'di la spong ba dang / skyes nas spong ba dang / lan grangs gzhan la spong ba'o //
analyzed: tshe 'di la spong ba dang / skyes nas spong ba dang / lan grangs gzhan la spong ba'o //
translated: abandonment in this life, abandonment after birth, and abandonment in another life.

original: de la tshe 'di la spong ba ni ji ltar 'di na kha cig tshe 'di la ched du bsams te las byas @206a * //
analyzed: de la tshe 'di la spong ba ni ji ltar 'di na kha cig tshe 'di la ched du bsams te las byas @206a * //
translated: Abandonment in this life is when someone here in this life does and accumulates karma through intention,

original: shing bsags nas de las phyir ldog cing des spong ba yang dag par blang ba yang byas la de 'dod chags dang ma bral ba so so'i skye bo zhig yin te /
analyzed: shing bsags nas de las phyir ldog cing des spong ba yang dag par blang ba yang byas la de 'dod chags dang ma bral ba so so'i skye bo zhig yin te /
translated: but then turns away from that, takes up the vow of abandonment, and is not free from attachment as an ordinary person.

original: de la gnas bzhin du 'chi ba'i dus byed par gyur na de skyes pa'i 'og dang / lan grangs gzhan la yang las de mi byed pa dang rnam par smin pa nyams su mi myong ba dang / tshe 'di la gcig tu nges par mi byed pa'i skal pa can ma yin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la gnas bzhin du 'chi ba'i dus byed par gyur na de skyes pa'i 'og dang / lan grangs gzhan la yang las de mi byed pa dang rnam par smin pa nyams su mi myong ba dang / tshe 'di la gcig tu nges par mi byed pa'i skal pa can ma yin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If one dies while abiding in that state, then after birth, one will not perform that action in other lives, one will not experience its karmic maturation, and one will not definitely not perform it in this life.

original: gzhan yang 'di nas so so'i skye bo 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba kha cig gis spong ba yang dag par blangs nas 'chi ba'i dus byed par gyur na de'i tshe 'di la byed kyang mi byed /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di nas so so'i skye bo 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba kha cig gis spong ba yang dag par blangs nas 'chi ba'i dus byed par gyur na de'i tshe 'di la byed kyang mi byed /
translated: Moreover, if some ordinary beings who are free from attachment to the desire realm die while taking up the vows of abandoning taking life and so on, then at that time they do not perform that action.

original: rnam par smin pa yang nyams su myong bar mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa yang nyams su myong bar mi 'gyur na /
translated: But if they do not experience its karmic maturation,üîΩhow could they see it after birth?

original: skyes nas der skyes pa'i tshe lta byed par ga la 'gyur de lta mod kyi lan grangs gzhan la las de byed pa dang / rnam par smin pa nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba las yongs su grol ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: skyes nas der skyes pa'i tshe lta byed par ga la 'gyur de lta mod kyi lan grangs gzhan la las de byed pa dang / rnam par smin pa nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba las yongs su grol ba ni ma yin no //
translated: They are not completely liberated from performing that action and experiencing its karmic maturation in other lives.

original: gzhan yang slob pa 'dod pa rnams las 'dod chags dang bral ba spong ba yang dag par blangs nas dge sbyong gi 'bras bu dang po'am gnyis pa thob pa de ni gang dag gi gnas ngan len mang ba'i lus yongs su gdung ba mang ba dor bar 'os
analyzed: gzhan yang slob pa 'dod pa rnams las 'dod chags dang bral ba spong ba yang dag par blangs nas dge sbyong gi 'bras bu dang po'am gnyis pa thob pa de ni gang dag gi gnas ngan len mang ba'i lus yongs su gdung ba mang ba dor bar 'os
translated: They are suitable to discard the body that is the basis of many unwholesome states and is subject to much torment.

original: pa smad pa 'dis sdig pa'i las byas pa de tshe 'di nyid la bde ba dang bcas pa'am /
analyzed: pa smad pa 'dis sdig pa'i las byas pa de tshe 'di nyid la bde ba dang bcas pa'am /
translated: Those who commit evil deeds with this contemptible body experience happiness or

original: sdug bsngal dang bcas par myong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang bcas par myong bar 'gyur te /
translated: suffering in this very life.

original: bdag gis de 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bdag gis de 'di lta ste /
translated: I should make it so thatüîΩit is experienced in this life, in just a moment.üîΩAfter it arises, may I not experience its karmic maturation in another life or in a future life.

original: tshe 'di la myong bar 'gyur ba'i skad cig pa tsam du gyur cig / phyis skyes pa'i 'og gam lan grangs gzhan la de'i rnam par smin pa nyams su myong bar ma gyur cig ces de ltar de spang ba'i phyir yang dag pa'i sems kyis smon nas 'di
analyzed: tshe 'di la myong bar 'gyur ba'i skad cig pa tsam du gyur cig / phyis skyes pa'i 'og gam lan grangs gzhan la de'i rnam par smin pa nyams su myong bar ma gyur cig ces de ltar de spang ba'i phyir yang dag pa'i sems kyis smon nas 'di
translated: Having made this aspiration with a correct mind in order to abandon that,

analyzed: lus dang @206b ngag dang yid kyis sdig pa'i las kun nas slong bar byed de /

original: gang la las kyi rgyu rnam pa bzhi po 'di dag gi gnyen por tshad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnam pa bzhi po bsgoms na ni tha na khye'u 'am bu mo des kyang su la yang sdig pa'i las bya bar sems pa gang yin pa de ni gnasüîΩma yin zhing skabs ma yin te /
analyzed: gang la las kyi rgyu rnam pa bzhi po 'di dag gi gnyen por tshad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnam pa bzhi po bsgoms na ni tha na khye'u 'am bu mo des kyang su la yang sdig pa'i las bya bar sems pa gang yin pa de ni gnas ma yin zhing skabs ma yin te /
translated: If anyone cultivates the four immeasurables as the antidote to these four types of karmic causes, then even if they are a boy or a girl, it is impossible and out of the question that they would think to do anything nonvirtuous to anyone.

original: de bas na de bsgom pa la brtson pa de ni mi dge ba'i las kyi rgyu yang dag par zad par bya ba la brtson pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na de bsgom pa la brtson pa de ni mi dge ba'i las kyi rgyu yang dag par zad par bya ba la brtson pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should know that those who strive to cultivate the immeasurables are striving to completely exhaust the causes of nonvirtuous karma.

original: de ltar brtson pa des ni sdig pa'i las byas shing bsags pa de rgyu gnyis kyis tshad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin bsgom pas zil gyis gnon par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar brtson pa des ni sdig pa'i las byas shing bsags pa de rgyu gnyis kyis tshad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin bsgom pas zil gyis gnon par 'gyur te /
translated: Those who strive in this way will overcome the nonvirtuous karma they have created and accumulated through two causes by cultivating the immeasurables.

original: sdig pa'i las de ni sems can tshad nges pa la gnod pa'i bsam pas kun nas bslang ba yin la /
analyzed: sdig pa'i las de ni sems can tshad nges pa la gnod pa'i bsam pas kun nas bslang ba yin la /
translated: The nonvirtuous karma is motivated by the intention to harm a definite number of sentient beings.

original: tshad med pa yongs su bsgoms pa ni sems can tshad med pa la phan pa'i bsam pa dang ldan pa dang / mi dge ba'i las kun nas slong bar byed pa'i sems de ni khams tha chad pa yin pa dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs lta bu yin la tshad med pa bsgom pa dang ldan pa'i sems ni khams bzang po pa yin pa dang /
analyzed: tshad med pa yongs su bsgoms pa ni sems can tshad med pa la phan pa'i bsam pa dang ldan pa dang / mi dge ba'i las kun nas slong bar byed pa'i sems de ni khams tha chad pa yin pa dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs lta bu yin la tshad med pa bsgom pa dang ldan pa'i sems ni khams bzang po pa yin pa dang /
translated: The mind that instigates nonvirtuous action is of a lesser realm, and the mind endowed with the cultivation of the immeasurables is of a good realm.

original: gnyen po yin no //
analyzed: gnyen po yin no //
translated: The latter is the antidote to the former.

original: las thams cad ni sems la rag las pas na sems ni gtso bo yin te /
analyzed: las thams cad ni sems la rag las pas na sems ni gtso bo yin te /
translated: Since all karma depends on the mind, the mind is primary.

original: gang gi phyir mi ni sems kyi rgyu las byung ngo zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mi ni sems kyi rgyu las byung ngo zhes 'byung ste /
translated: It is said that humans arise from the cause of mind,

original: sems la dbang lus pa dang sems la brten cing 'dug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems la dbang lus pa dang sems la brten cing 'dug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are controlled by the mind and exist in dependence on the mind.

original: de de ltar sngon gyi smon lam la brten nas tshad med pa'i sems kyi ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa ste 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bar gyur pa'i mod la phyir mi 'ong ba la yang dag par gnas par 'gyur te gal te de tsam gyis chog parüîΩbzung ste tshe 'di la gong du 'bad par mi byed na ni tshe 'di la las de byed pa'i rgyur yang mi 'gyur na skyes pa'i 'og gam lan grangs gzhan lta ci smos te /
analyzed: de de ltar sngon gyi smon lam la brten nas tshad med pa'i sems kyi ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa ste 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bar gyur pa'i mod la phyir mi 'ong ba la yang dag par gnas par 'gyur te gal te de tsam gyis chog par bzung ste tshe 'di la gong du 'bad par mi byed na ni tshe 'di la las de byed pa'i rgyur yang mi 'gyur na skyes pa'i 'og gam lan grangs gzhan lta ci smos te /
translated: The moment they become free from attachment to the desire realm, they perfectly abide as nonreturners.üîΩIf they are satisfied with that and do not strive to progress in this life, then that karma will not be the cause for their rebirth in the desire realm.

original: skyes pa'i 'og gam lan grangs gzhan la de'i rnam par smin pa nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba'i rgyur yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyes pa'i 'og gam lan grangs gzhan la de'i rnam par smin pa nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba'i rgyur yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: What need is there to mention that it will not be the cause for their experiencing the maturation of that karma in their next life or in other future lives?

original: 'di las phyi rol pa log pa'i lta bar ltung zhing lam ngan par zhugs pa rnams kyi dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las lta bas kun nas bslang zhing lta ba'i dbang gis byung ba gang yin pa de ni yon po'o //
analyzed: 'di las phyi rol pa log pa'i lta bar ltung zhing lam ngan par zhugs pa rnams kyi dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las lta bas kun nas bslang zhing lta ba'i dbang gis byung ba gang yin pa de ni yon po'o //
translated: The virtue and nonvirtue of those who are outside this Dharma, who have fallen into wrong views and who have entered bad paths, are motivated by views and arise from the power of views.

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang drag po rnams kyi des bslang ba'i las ni nyes pa'o //üîΩgti mug drag cing @207a * //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang drag po rnams kyi des bslang ba'i las ni nyes pa'o // gti mug drag cing @207a * //
translated: The action that is motivated by strong attachment and aversion is called ‚Äúbad.‚ÄùüîΩThe action that is motivated by strong delusion

original: shas cher dbang po rtul la brjed ngas shing blo zhan pa rnams kyi gti mug gis kun nas bslang ba'i las gang yin pa de ni snyigs ma'o //
analyzed: shas cher dbang po rtul la brjed ngas shing blo zhan pa rnams kyi gti mug gis kun nas bslang ba'i las gang yin pa de ni snyigs ma'o //
translated: and that is performed by those who are dull-witted, forgetful, and weak-minded is called ‚Äúdefiled.‚Äù

original: bde 'gror 'gro ba'i legs par spyod pa thams cad ni gtsang ba'o //
analyzed: bde 'gror 'gro ba'i legs par spyod pa thams cad ni gtsang ba'o //
translated: All good conduct that leads to a happy rebirth is called ‚Äúpure.‚Äù

original: mya ngan las 'das par 'gro ba'i legs par spyod pa thams cad ni thub pa'i'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das par 'gro ba'i legs par spyod pa thams cad ni thub pa'i'o //
translated: All good conduct that leads to nirvana is called ‚Äúconducive to liberation.‚Äù

original: sems can dmyal bar skye bar 'gyur ba'i gnas tha dad pa'i mi dge ba ni gnag la rnam par smin pa yang gnag pa'o //
analyzed: sems can dmyal bar skye bar 'gyur ba'i gnas tha dad pa'i mi dge ba ni gnag la rnam par smin pa yang gnag pa'o //
translated: The nonvirtue that is the cause for rebirth in the hells is called ‚Äúblack‚Äù and its karmic maturation is also called ‚Äúblack.‚Äù

original: mtho ris su skye bar 'gyur ba'i gnas tha dad pa'i dge ba ni dkar ba la rnam par smin pa yang dkar pa'o //
analyzed: mtho ris su skye bar 'gyur ba'i gnas tha dad pa'i dge ba ni dkar ba la rnam par smin pa yang dkar pa'o //
translated: The virtue that is the cause for rebirth in the higher realms is called ‚Äúwhite‚Äù and its karmic maturation is also called ‚Äúwhite.‚Äù

original: de ma yin pa'i gnas kyi ni dkar gnag 'dres pa la rnam par smin pa yang dkar gnag 'dres pa ste /
analyzed: de ma yin pa'i gnas kyi ni dkar gnag 'dres pa la rnam par smin pa yang dkar gnag 'dres pa ste /
translated: The action that is neither of these two is called ‚Äúmixed‚Äù and its karmic maturation is also called ‚Äúmixed.‚Äù

original: gnas gcig na las rnam pa gnyis ka yod pas na de'i phyir gcig tu bsdus te bstan to //
analyzed: gnas gcig na las rnam pa gnyis ka yod pas na de'i phyir gcig tu bsdus te bstan to //
translated: Since both types of action exist in one realm, they are combined and taught as one.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa zag pa med pa'i las ni gnag pa yang ma yin dkar ba yang ma yin la rnam par smin pa yang med pa'i las yin te las zad par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa zag pa med pa'i las ni gnag pa yang ma yin dkar ba yang ma yin la rnam par smin pa yang med pa'i las yin te las zad par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Supramundane, uncontaminated action is neither dark nor bright and has no karmic maturation, since it exhausts action.

original: de yang las zad pa dang zad par 'gyur ba de gnyi ga gcig tu bsdus nas las zad par 'gyur ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de yang las zad pa dang zad par 'gyur ba de gnyi ga gcig tu bsdus nas las zad par 'gyur ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Since both the exhaustion of action and the exhaustion of action are combined and taught as one, they are called the action that exhausts action.

original: phyi ma la mi skye bar bya ba dang / skyes zin pa dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi ma la mi skye bar bya ba dang / skyes zin pa dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it causes the non-arising of action in the future and the separation from action that has already arisen.

original: sdug pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu rnam par smin par 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir na de la dkar ba ma yin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sdug pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu rnam par smin par 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir na de la dkar ba ma yin zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called not bright because it does not cause the maturation of the result of action that is attractive.

original: de nyid ni de dag gi nang na gcig tu nges par dkar ba yin no //
analyzed: de nyid ni de dag gi nang na gcig tu nges par dkar ba yin no //
translated: It is the one definite bright action among those.

original: gnas tha dad pa'i mtho ris ni gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha las 'das pa 'dod pa'i khams kyi bdud kyi gnas kyi bdud kyi pho brang dang / tshangs pa'i 'jig rten yan chad 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched man chad kyi bar de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus pa la bya ste /
analyzed: gnas tha dad pa'i mtho ris ni gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha las 'das pa 'dod pa'i khams kyi bdud kyi gnas kyi bdud kyi pho brang dang / tshangs pa'i 'jig rten yan chad 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched man chad kyi bar de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus pa la bya ste /
translated: The different places of the higher realms are the abode of Mara in the desire realm, which is beyond the gods who control others' emanations, and the world of Brahma and so on up to the sphere of neither discernment nor nondiscernment.

original: mig gis gzugs gcig tu nges par sdug pa rnams mthong ba nas yid kyis chos rnams rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i bar du brjod de khyad par du 'phags pa'i bdag po'i don gyis so //
analyzed: mig gis gzugs gcig tu nges par sdug pa rnams mthong ba nas yid kyis chos rnams rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i bar du brjod de khyad par du 'phags pa'i bdag po'i don gyis so //
translated: They are called the realms of the gods because they are the special abodes of the gods.

original: yid kyi sgo nas mngon par 'grub pa ni yid las skyes pa'i don gyis so //
analyzed: yid kyi sgo nas mngon par 'grub pa ni yid las skyes pa'i don gyis so //
translated: The realm of the gods is established by the mind because it is produced by the mind.

original: sems can dmyal ba'i gnas tha dad pa ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba'i gnas tha dad pa ni bzhi ste /
translated: The different places of the hells are fourfold.

original: sems can dmyal ba chen po rnams dang / nyi tshe ba'i sems can dmyal ba rnams dang / grang ba'i sems @207b can dmyal ba rnams dang / sems can dmyal ba'i 'khor rnams so //
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba chen po rnams dang / nyi tshe ba'i sems can dmyal ba rnams dang / grang ba'i sems @207b can dmyal ba rnams dang / sems can dmyal ba'i 'khor rnams so //
translated: the great hells, the occasional hells, the cold hells, and the neighboring hells.

original: gnas der so so'i bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba kho na'i las dang / so so'i sdug bsngal myong ba kho nar 'gyur ba'i las kyi 'bras bu'i rnam par smin pa nyams su myong bar 'gyur bas na de'i phyir gnas tha dad pa zhes pa'o ;
analyzed: gnas der so so'i bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba kho na'i las dang / so so'i sdug bsngal myong ba kho nar 'gyur ba'i las kyi 'bras bu'i rnam par smin pa nyams su myong bar 'gyur bas na de'i phyir gnas tha dad pa zhes pa'o ;
translated: Since the results of karma that is experienced only as individual pleasure and that is experienced only as individual pain are experienced in those places, they are called separate places.

original: / de la bdud kyi pho brang dang / bsam gtan dang po dang / gnyis pa rnams na ni gcig tu nges par dga' ba dang bde ba nyams su myong ba yod do //
analyzed: / de la bdud kyi pho brang dang / bsam gtan dang po dang / gnyis pa rnams na ni gcig tu nges par dga' ba dang bde ba nyams su myong ba yod do //
translated: In the palace of Mara, in the first and second absorptions, there is only the experience of pleasure and joy.

original: bsam gtan gsum pa yan chad na ni gcig tu nges par bde ba dang / yid bde ba nyams su myong ba yod de /
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa yan chad na ni gcig tu nges par bde ba dang / yid bde ba nyams su myong ba yod de /
translated: In the third absorption and above, there is only the experience of pleasure and mental satisfaction.

original: de ni yid bde ba de dang 'dra ba'i las su rung zhing nyams bde ba'i sems bde ba yod kyi dga' ba ni ma yin pa dang / de dang 'dra ba'i bde ba yod kyi tshor ba'i bde ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni yid bde ba de dang 'dra ba'i las su rung zhing nyams bde ba'i sems bde ba yod kyi dga' ba ni ma yin pa dang / de dang 'dra ba'i bde ba yod kyi tshor ba'i bde ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It is physical bliss, similar to the bliss of sensation, but not the bliss of sensation.

original: reg pa'i skye mched drug gi sgo nas nyams su myong bas na reg pa'i skye mched can zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: reg pa'i skye mched drug gi sgo nas nyams su myong bas na reg pa'i skye mched can zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: It is also called the faculty of contact, because it is experienced through the six sense spheres.

original: de ni gnas tha dad pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni gnas tha dad pa yin te /
translated: It is a different stage,

original: rgyu dang 'bras bur 'brel pa'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bur 'brel pa'i tshul gyis so //
translated: because it is related as cause and effect.üîΩThe summary verse: Ignorance, knowledge, equipoise,üîΩdisturbance, the intermediate state,üîΩtraining, attachment,

original: sdom ni / mi shes shes pa mnyam par gzhag / khyad par bar du gcod pa dang // slob pa dang ni chags pa dang // bdag med pa dang lam dang rgal //
analyzed: sdom ni / mi shes shes pa mnyam par gzhag / khyad par bar du gcod pa dang // slob pa dang ni chags pa dang // bdag med pa dang lam dang rgal //
translated: selflessness, the path, and crossing over.

original: log par lta ba gang yin pa dang / bdag tu lta ba gang yin pa dang ma rig pa de nyid ni sngar bshad pa'i sems can gyi ris gsum po dag tu mi shes pa'i rtsa ba las 'byung ste /
analyzed: log par lta ba gang yin pa dang / bdag tu lta ba gang yin pa dang ma rig pa de nyid ni sngar bshad pa'i sems can gyi ris gsum po dag tu mi shes pa'i rtsa ba las 'byung ste /
translated: The ignorance that is wrong view and the ignorance that is the view of self arise from the root of unknowing in the three realms of sentient beings explained above.

original: ris thams cad du gnod pa'i rtsa ba can kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad kun nas slong ba'i chos gcig po de spangs na yang dag pa kho nar shes pa brda sprad par bya'o //
analyzed: ris thams cad du gnod pa'i rtsa ba can kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad kun nas slong ba'i chos gcig po de spangs na yang dag pa kho nar shes pa brda sprad par bya'o //
translated: When one abandons the one thing which is the root of all the misfortunes in all the realms of existence, and which is the cause of all the defilements, one should be declared to have been taught the right knowledge.

original: de la 'dir kun nas nyon mongs pa gcig ni bden pa'i dngos po la skur pa 'debs pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'dir kun nas nyon mongs pa gcig ni bden pa'i dngos po la skur pa 'debs pa'o //
translated: Here, one defilement is the denial of the reality of the truths.

original: gnyis pa ni sgro 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni sgro 'dogs pa'o //
translated: The second is the imputation of what is not real.

original: gsum pa ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi snang ba'i tshul gyis rnam par rmongs par byed pa ste /
analyzed: gsum pa ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi snang ba'i tshul gyis rnam par rmongs par byed pa ste /
translated: The third is the confusion which is the non-appearance of the right knowledge of things as they are.

original: de gnyi ga'i rgyu'o //üîΩrnam par rmongs na sgro 'dogs pa'am /
analyzed: de gnyi ga'i rgyu'o // rnam par rmongs na sgro 'dogs pa'am /
translated: This is the cause of the other two.

original: skur ba 'debs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skur ba 'debs par 'gyur ro //
translated: When there is confusion, there is imputation or denial.

original: 'di gnyis ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes pa ste /
analyzed: 'di gnyis ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes pa ste /
translated: These two are the right knowledge of things as they are.

original: tshul bzhin yid la byed pas rab tu phye ba dang / ting nge 'dzin gyis rab tu phye ba'o //
analyzed: tshul bzhin yid la byed pas rab tu phye ba dang / ting nge 'dzin gyis rab tu phye ba'o //
translated: It is distinguished by the proper mental attention and by the concentration.

original: de la thos pa dang bsams pa las byung ba'i yid la byed pa dam pa'i chos thos pa'i @208a * //
analyzed: de la thos pa dang bsams pa las byung ba'i yid la byed pa dam pa'i chos thos pa'i @208a * //
translated: The attention that arises from listening and reflection is the cause of the five feelings that arise from listening to the holy Dharma.

original: dbang las byung bas tshor ba rnam pa lnga las gnas skabs rnam par 'gyur ba las gyur pa'i nyes dmigs dang / gnas skabs rnam par 'gyur ba de tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa ni yang dag pa'i shes pa yin te /
analyzed: dbang las byung bas tshor ba rnam pa lnga las gnas skabs rnam par 'gyur ba las gyur pa'i nyes dmigs dang / gnas skabs rnam par 'gyur ba de tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa ni yang dag pa'i shes pa yin te /
translated: The correct knowledge that arises from the transformation of the state is the correct knowledge that arises from the proper attention to that transformation of the state, which is the stage of meditative concentration.

original: de la brten nas bsgom pa la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la brten nas bsgom pa la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: On the basis of that, one enters into meditation.

original: de la gnas skabs rnam par 'gyur ba las gyur pa'i nyes dmigs gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la gnas skabs rnam par 'gyur ba las gyur pa'i nyes dmigs gang zhe na /
translated: What is the disadvantage that arises from the transformation of the state?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i gnas skabs kyi mi rtag pa nyid dang / sdug bsngal ba'i gnas skabs kyi rang bzhin gyis sdug bsngal ba nyid dang / bde ba'i gnas skabs kyi rnam par 'gyur ba'i chos nyid do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i gnas skabs kyi mi rtag pa nyid dang / sdug bsngal ba'i gnas skabs kyi rang bzhin gyis sdug bsngal ba nyid dang / bde ba'i gnas skabs kyi rnam par 'gyur ba'i chos nyid do //
translated: The impermanence of the state of neither pleasure nor suffering, the suffering inherent in the state of suffering, and the impermanence inherent in the state of pleasure.

original: de la gnas skabs rnam par 'gyur ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la gnas skabs rnam par 'gyur ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the transformation of the condition?

original: bde ba'i gnas skabs las sdug bsngal ba'i gnas skabs su gzhan du 'gyur ba dang / sdug bsngal ba'i gnas skabs las kyang bde ba'i gnas skabs su 'gyur ba dang / sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i gnas skabs las gnyi ga'i gnas skabs su 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: bde ba'i gnas skabs las sdug bsngal ba'i gnas skabs su gzhan du 'gyur ba dang / sdug bsngal ba'i gnas skabs las kyang bde ba'i gnas skabs su 'gyur ba dang / sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i gnas skabs las gnyi ga'i gnas skabs su 'gyur ba dang /
translated: The condition of pleasure transforms into the condition of suffering, and the condition of suffering transforms into the condition of pleasure. The condition of neither pleasure nor suffering transforms into both conditions.

original: de bzhin du gnas skabs thams cad las gnas skabs thams cad du phan tshun 'gyur ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gnas skabs thams cad las gnas skabs thams cad du phan tshun 'gyur ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: In this way, all conditions transform into all conditions.

original: gnas skabs 'di rnams la gzhan du 'gyur bar mthong na ni mi rtag pa'i 'du shes la gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnas skabs 'di rnams la gzhan du 'gyur bar mthong na ni mi rtag pa'i 'du shes la gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: When one sees the transformation of these conditions, one abides in the perception of impermanence.

original: gzhan du 'gyur pa'i nyes dmigs mthong na ni tshor ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan du 'gyur pa'i nyes dmigs mthong na ni tshor ba'o //
translated: When one sees the disadvantage of transformation, one abides in the perception of suffering.

original: cho ga ni sdug bsngal 'di yin no snyam du rig nas sdug bsngal ba'i 'du shes la gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: cho ga ni sdug bsngal 'di yin no snyam du rig nas sdug bsngal ba'i 'du shes la gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: When one understands that the ritual is suffering, one abides in the perception of suffering.

original: de ltar 'du shes shing de ltar mthong na rnam par dag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar 'du shes shing de ltar mthong na rnam par dag par 'gyur te /
translated: If one perceives and sees in this way, one becomes purified.

original: de bas na 'di la yang dag pa'i shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'di la yang dag pa'i shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, this is called right knowledge.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa'i yang dag pa'i shes pa ni rnam pa de dag nyid kyis 'jug na /
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa'i yang dag pa'i shes pa ni rnam pa de dag nyid kyis 'jug na /
translated: If the right knowledge of meditative equipoise engages in those aspects,

original: shin tu sbyangs pas yongs su zin cing rnam par dag la skyon med par 'jug ste khyad par ni de yin no //
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pas yongs su zin cing rnam par dag la skyon med par 'jug ste khyad par ni de yin no //
translated: it engages in purification and faultlessness, being accompanied by suppleness. This is the difference.

original: de la mi rtag pa nyid ni 'dus byas thams cad spyi'i mtshan nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la mi rtag pa nyid ni 'dus byas thams cad spyi'i mtshan nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Among them, impermanence should be known as the general characteristic of all conditioned things.

original: sdug bsngal ba nyid ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos thams cad spyi'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba nyid ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos thams cad spyi'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Suffering should be known as the general characteristic of all contaminated things.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa rnam pa gnyis la brten pas @208b ni chos 'di rnams mtshan nyid kyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du snang bar 'gyur bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa rnam pa gnyis la brten pas @208b ni chos 'di rnams mtshan nyid kyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du snang bar 'gyur bar rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be known that these phenomena appear as they really are through the two kinds of right knowledge that are in accordance with reality.

original: 'di las phyi rol pa ni sems mnyam par bzhag tu zin kyang de bas chos 'di pa sems mnyam par ma bzhag pa yang shes pas khyad par du 'phags nas sems mnyam par bzhag pa lta ci smos /
analyzed: 'di las phyi rol pa ni sems mnyam par bzhag tu zin kyang de bas chos 'di pa sems mnyam par ma bzhag pa yang shes pas khyad par du 'phags nas sems mnyam par bzhag pa lta ci smos /
translated: Those outside this doctrine, even if they have settled their minds, are inferior to those within this doctrine who have not settled their minds. What need is there to mention those who have settled their minds?

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: 'di las phyi rol pa ni sems mnyam par bzhag pa yin du zin kyang de ni reg pa'i skye mched rnams kyi yongs su bsgyur ba lnga'i tshul gyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa dang yang dag pa'i sems 'dod chags dang bral ba dang
analyzed: 'di las phyi rol pa ni sems mnyam par bzhag pa yin du zin kyang de ni reg pa'i skye mched rnams kyi yongs su bsgyur ba lnga'i tshul gyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa dang yang dag pa'i sems 'dod chags dang bral ba dang
translated: Even if those outside this doctrine have settled their minds, they are not capable of knowing reality as it is through the five modes of transformation of the sense bases. They are not capable of the right mind free of attachment

original: / rnam par grol bar 'gyur ba'i skal ba can ma yin te /
analyzed: / rnam par grol bar 'gyur ba'i skal ba can ma yin te /
translated: and of liberation.

original: de bas na de ni 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa man chad las khyad par du thob tu zin kyang chos 'dul ba 'di las shin tu ring ste /
analyzed: de bas na de ni 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa man chad las khyad par du thob tu zin kyang chos 'dul ba 'di las shin tu ring ste /
translated: Therefore, even though they have attained a higher state than the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception, they are still far from this doctrine of discipline,

original: gnam dang sa bzhin no //
analyzed: gnam dang sa bzhin no //
translated: like the distance between heaven and earth.

original: brtan zhing dka' ba thams cad bzod du zin kyang yongs su nyams pa'i chos can yin pas shing bal gyi sbur ma bzhin du mi brtan pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i rgyags pa mi bzod do //üîΩchos 'di la ni mnyam par ma bzhag ste /
analyzed: brtan zhing dka' ba thams cad bzod du zin kyang yongs su nyams pa'i chos can yin pas shing bal gyi sbur ma bzhin du mi brtan pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i rgyags pa mi bzod do // chos 'di la ni mnyam par ma bzhag ste /
translated: Even if they are stable and endure all hardships, they are subject to complete degeneration, like cotton fluff, and they are not stable.

original: dad pa dang thos pa tsam gyis bdag med pa la mos par zad du zin pa de ni sems kyi ting nge 'dzin 'thob pa'i skal pa can yin la de ni reg pa'i skye mched rnams spong ba dang / yongs su shes par 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: dad pa dang thos pa tsam gyis bdag med pa la mos par zad du zin pa de ni sems kyi ting nge 'dzin 'thob pa'i skal pa can yin la de ni reg pa'i skye mched rnams spong ba dang / yongs su shes par 'gyur ba dang /
translated: They are not capable of the meditative absorption of the mind, and they are not capable of eliminating the sense bases of contact, of fully understanding them,

original: sems 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / rnam par grol bar 'gyur ba'i skal ba can yin te /
analyzed: sems 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / rnam par grol bar 'gyur ba'i skal ba can yin te /
translated: of being free from attachment to the mind, or of being completely liberated.

original: de bas na de ni yang dag pa'i mos pa tsam la gnas par zad bzhin du chos 'dul ba 'di las chung ma zos par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na de ni yang dag pa'i mos pa tsam la gnas par zad bzhin du chos 'dul ba 'di las chung ma zos par rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they are only abiding in mere correct belief, and it should be understood that they have eaten little of this Dharma and Vinaya.

original: lnga po 'di dag ni yul drug po rnams la dbang po drug po rnams zhi bar 'gyur ba'i rnam pa yin te /üîΩnyes dmigs mthong ba'i phyir shin tu dul ba dang / gtang bar bya ba ma yin pa'i yul rnams la mi gtod pa'i phyir shin tu spos pa dang / gtad par bya ba'i yul rnams sam glo bur du snang bar gyur pa rnams la dran pa shin tu gnas pa'i phyir shin tu bsrungs pa dang /
analyzed: lnga po 'di dag ni yul drug po rnams la dbang po drug po rnams zhi bar 'gyur ba'i rnam pa yin te / nyes dmigs mthong ba'i phyir shin tu dul ba dang / gtang bar bya ba ma yin pa'i yul rnams la mi gtod pa'i phyir shin tu spos pa dang / gtad par bya ba'i yul rnams sam glo bur du snang bar gyur pa rnams la dran pa shin tu gnas pa'i phyir shin tu bsrungs pa dang /
translated: These five are the aspects of the pacification of the six sense faculties with regard to the six objects.

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa'i phyir shin tu yang dag par bsdams pa dang / lam bsgom pa shin tu yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir shin tu bsgoms pa'o /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa'i phyir shin tu yang dag par bsdams pa dang / lam bsgom pa shin tu yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir shin tu bsgoms pa'o /
translated: They are very disciplined because they see the disadvantages of the objects, very controlled because they do not focus on objects that should not be focused on, very guarded because they are very mindful of objects that should be focused on or that suddenly appear, very restrained because they abandon all afflictions, and very cultivated because they completely perfect the cultivation of the path.

original: @209a * // khyad par gdags pa mkhyen pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa ni gnas gnyis su bde ba dang sdug bsngal las yang dag par 'das pa brjod par mdzad de /
analyzed: @209a * // khyad par gdags pa mkhyen pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa ni gnas gnyis su bde ba dang sdug bsngal las yang dag par 'das pa brjod par mdzad de /
translated: The TathƒÅgata, who knows the designation of distinctions, declares the transcendence of both happiness and suffering,

original: mngon par mi mkhyen pas ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon par mi mkhyen pas ma yin no //
translated: but not because he does not know them.

original: de la gang 'di snyam du dge sbyong goo ta ma ni gcig tu nges par bde ba'i 'jig rten mi shes shing ma rtogs bzhin du bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang 'dres su dogs pa dang / bde ba dang sdug bsngal 'dres pa'i 'jig rten gyi dbyi bas la yang dag par 'da' bar bya ba dang /
analyzed: de la gang 'di snyam du dge sbyong goo ta ma ni gcig tu nges par bde ba'i 'jig rten mi shes shing ma rtogs bzhin du bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang 'dres su dogs pa dang / bde ba dang sdug bsngal 'dres pa'i 'jig rten gyi dbyi bas la yang dag par 'da' bar bya ba dang /
translated: Some may think, ‚ÄúThe ascetic Gautama does not know or understand the world of definite happiness. He is afraid that happiness and suffering may be mixed, and he has transcended the world of mixed happiness and suffering.üîΩ

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal las 'da' bar bya ba'i phyir nyan thos rnams la chos ston to snyam du 'dzin to //
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal las 'da' bar bya ba'i phyir nyan thos rnams la chos ston to snyam du 'dzin to //
translated: Some think, The ascetic Gautama does not know or understand the world of definite happiness, yet he teaches the Dharma to the hearers for the sake of transcending the world of mixed happiness and suffering and for the sake of transcending happiness and suffering.

original: de'i 'du shes de ni log pa'i 'du shes dang log pa'i rtog pa dang log pa'i lta ba yin gyi de bzhin gshegs pa ni gcig tu nges par bde ba'i 'jig rten dang gcig tu nges par sdug bsngal ba dang bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba 'dres pa
analyzed: de'i 'du shes de ni log pa'i 'du shes dang log pa'i rtog pa dang log pa'i lta ba yin gyi de bzhin gshegs pa ni gcig tu nges par bde ba'i 'jig rten dang gcig tu nges par sdug bsngal ba dang bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba 'dres pa
translated: His perception is a mistaken perception, a mistaken conception, and a mistaken view. The TathƒÅgata knows the world of definite happiness, the world of definite suffering, the world of mixed happiness and suffering, and the world of mixed happiness, suffering, and neither.

original: dang / de dag gi mi rtag pa nyid kyang mkhyen /
analyzed: dang / de dag gi mi rtag pa nyid kyang mkhyen /
translated: He knows their impermanence as well.

original: des na 'jig rten thams cad las yang dag par 'da' bar bya ba'i phyir bde ba dang sdug bsngal las 'das pa brjod par mdzad do //
analyzed: des na 'jig rten thams cad las yang dag par 'da' bar bya ba'i phyir bde ba dang sdug bsngal las 'das pa brjod par mdzad do //
translated: Therefore, in order to transcend the entire world, he declares the transcendence of happiness and suffering.üîΩPleasant things should be understood as threefold:

original: yid du 'ong ba'i dngos po ni rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: yid du 'ong ba'i dngos po ni rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste /
translated: those that are sought,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: those that are enjoyed,üîΩand those that are desired.

original: btsal bar bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i 'dod pa gang yin pa'o ;
analyzed: btsal bar bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i 'dod pa gang yin pa'o ;
translated: Those that are sought are future desires.

original: / rtag par bya ba ni 'das pa'i 'dod pa spyad zin pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: / rtag par bya ba ni 'das pa'i 'dod pa spyad zin pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Those that are enjoyed are past desires that have already been experienced.üîΩThose that are desired are external objects and internal feelings that are desired.

original: lhag par chags par bya ba ni phyi rol gyi yul 'dod pa dang nang gi 'dod pa'i tshor ba 'di dus gsum du gtogs pa 'di dag ni rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste /
analyzed: lhag par chags par bya ba ni phyi rol gyi yul 'dod pa dang nang gi 'dod pa'i tshor ba 'di dus gsum du gtogs pa 'di dag ni rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste /
translated: These are to be understood as fourfold:

original: gcig ni ma 'ongs pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: gcig ni ma 'ongs pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: one is in terms of the future,

original: gcig ni 'das pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: gcig ni 'das pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: one is in terms of the past,

original: gnyis ni da ltar gyi sgo nas so //
analyzed: gnyis ni da ltar gyi sgo nas so //
translated: and two are in terms of the present.

original: rnam pa 'di rnams kyang khongs su gtogs pa ni yid du 'ong ba dang snying du sdug pa dang dga' ba'i rang bzhin dang bde ba'i rang bzhin gyi rnam pa rnams so //
analyzed: rnam pa 'di rnams kyang khongs su gtogs pa ni yid du 'ong ba dang snying du sdug pa dang dga' ba'i rang bzhin dang bde ba'i rang bzhin gyi rnam pa rnams so //
translated: These aspects are included in the aspects of being lovely, dear, delightful, and blissful.

original: de bzhin du sdug pa dang mdzes pa dang / dga' ba dang yid du 'ong ba'i rnam pa rnams kyang ci rigs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sdug pa dang mdzes pa dang / dga' ba dang yid du 'ong ba'i rnam pa rnams kyang ci rigs par rig par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, the aspects of being beautiful, good, delightful, and attractive should be understood as appropriate.

original: sa gnyis kyi ting nge 'dzin la brtson pa la ni rnam pa gnyis kyi sgo nas dus gnyis kyi ting nge 'dzin rnam pa gsum mngon par bsgrub pa la 'dod pa rnams par du gcod par byed do //
analyzed: sa gnyis kyi ting nge 'dzin la brtson pa la ni rnam pa gnyis kyi sgo nas dus gnyis kyi ting nge 'dzin rnam pa gsum mngon par bsgrub pa la 'dod pa rnams par du gcod par byed do //
translated: For one who is striving in the meditative concentration of the two stages, the desires of the two times are an obstruction to the accomplishment of the three kinds of meditative concentration by means of the two aspects.

original: bar du gcod pa de spang ba'i phyir ni gnyen po rnam pa lnga bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: bar du gcod pa de spang ba'i phyir ni gnyen po rnam pa lnga bsgom par bya'o //
translated: In order to eliminate that obstruction, one should cultivate the five kinds of antidotes.

original: de la 'das @209b pa'i 'dod pa sngon spyad zin pa gang yin pa de dag kyang dben pa na gnas pa'i rtog pa'i sgo nas sems 'phrog par byed do //
analyzed: de la 'das @209b pa'i 'dod pa sngon spyad zin pa gang yin pa de dag kyang dben pa na gnas pa'i rtog pa'i sgo nas sems 'phrog par byed do //
translated: Among them, the desires of the past are those that one has already experienced in the past. They steal away the mind through the door of reflection while one is dwelling in solitude.

original: khyim med pa'i rnyed pa dang bkur sti dang ldan pa da ltar byung ba gang yin pa rnams kyang sems 'phrog par byed do //
analyzed: khyim med pa'i rnyed pa dang bkur sti dang ldan pa da ltar byung ba gang yin pa rnams kyang sems 'phrog par byed do //
translated: The acquisition of gain and honor that is present for the one who is without a home also carries off the mind.üîΩThe acquisition of gain and honor that is future for the one who is without a home also carries off the mind.üîΩThe acquisition of gain and honor that is past for the one who is without a home also carries off the mind.üîΩThe acquisition of gain and honor that is present for the one who is without a home also carries off the mind.üîΩThe acquisition of gain and honor that is future for the one who is without a home also carries off the mind.üîΩThe acquisition of gain and honor that is past for the one who is without a home also carries off the mind.

analyzed: de la rgyu zhing 'gro ba'i rnyed pa dang bkur sti dang ldan pa rnams kyang sems 'phrog par byed de des ni gnas pa'i sems kyang g-yeng bar byed do // khyim na gnas pa'i sngon spyad zin pa rnams kyang sems 'phrog par byed do //

original: de la so so'i skye bo la yang bar du gcod par byed la /
analyzed: de la so so'i skye bo la yang bar du gcod par byed la /
translated: The acquisition of gain and honor that is past for the one who is without a home also carries off the mind.

original: slob pa la yang bar du gcod par byed pa'o //üîΩde la so so'i skye bo'i ting nge 'dzin tshad med pa bsgom pa dang ldan pa gang yin pa de la yang bar du gcod par byed do //üîΩslob pa'i ting nge 'dzin shes bya'i dngos po thams cad rtogs pas rgya che ba gang yin pa de la yang bar du gcod par byed do //
analyzed: slob pa la yang bar du gcod par byed pa'o //üîΩde la so so'i skye bo'i ting nge 'dzin tshad med pa bsgom pa dang ldan pa gang yin pa de la yang bar du gcod par byed do //üîΩslob pa'i ting nge 'dzin shes bya'i dngos po thams cad rtogs pas rgya che ba gang yin pa de la yang bar du gcod par byed do //
translated: The acquisition of gain and honor that is

original: mi slob pa'i shin tu bsgoms pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang yin pa de la yang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mi slob pa'i shin tu bsgoms pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang yin pa de la yang 'di lta ste /
translated: The concentration of a non-learner who has cultivated it is also like this.

original: skye ba la bar du gcod par byed do //
analyzed: skye ba la bar du gcod par byed do //
translated: It is an obstruction to birth.

original: ting nge 'dzin 'di dag thams cad kyang dga' ba dang ldan pa yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin 'di dag thams cad kyang dga' ba dang ldan pa yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: It should be understood that all these concentrations are accompanied by joy.

original: de la dang po ni sems can rnams la phan pa dang bde ba'i bsam pa'i sgo nas dga' ba dang ldan no //
analyzed: de la dang po ni sems can rnams la phan pa dang bde ba'i bsam pa'i sgo nas dga' ba dang ldan no //
translated: The first is accompanied by joy through the door of the intention to benefit and bring happiness to sentient beings.

original: gnyis pa ni slob pa'i rnam par grol ba'i dga' ba nyams su myong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni slob pa'i rnam par grol ba'i dga' ba nyams su myong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The second is accompanied by the joy of the liberation of a learner.

original: gsum pa ni mi slob pa'i rnam par grol ba'i dga' ba nyams su myong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsum pa ni mi slob pa'i rnam par grol ba'i dga' ba nyams su myong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The third is accompanied by the joy of the liberation of a non-learner.

analyzed: de dag kyang mig gis rnam par shes par bya ba'i gzugs la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i bye brag gis drug tu 'gyur ro //
translated: And they become six by the distinction of their objects, such as form to be cognized by the eye, and so on.
