analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de ni rnam pa thams cad dang ldan pa'i phyir yongs su rdzogs pa yang yin te /
translated: That concentration is also complete because it possesses all aspects.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi mtha' ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi mtha' ni 'di yin te /
translated: This is the limit of concentration.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: 'jig rten pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ba'am /
translated: One becomes free from worldly attachment or

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: one becomes free from transworldly attachment.

original: de las gong na rnam par dag par 'gyur ba'i ting nge 'dzin med de /
analyzed: de las gong na rnam par dag par 'gyur ba'i ting nge 'dzin med de /
translated: There is no concentration that purifies beyond that.

original: de bas na de ni rdzogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na de ni rdzogs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is perfected.üîΩOne who desires the way of virtuous endeavor quickly applies himself to the four bases of supernormal power, which are the roots of success, in order to attain the way of virtuous endeavor.üîΩHe is not concerned with his body or life.üîΩHe is always devoted to the practice of effort.

original: myur du dge sbyong gi tshul 'dod pa'i lus dang srog la mi lta ba dang / rtag tu gus par sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus brtul pa dang / 'dod pa rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid yongs su shes pas dran pa nye bar gnas pa dang /
analyzed: myur du dge sbyong gi tshul 'dod pa'i lus dang srog la mi lta ba dang / rtag tu gus par sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus brtul pa dang / 'dod pa rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid yongs su shes pas dran pa nye bar gnas pa dang /
translated: He is mindful of the knowledge of the characteristics of the sense objects.

original: nyes dmigs yongs su shes @210a * //
analyzed: nyes dmigs yongs su shes @210a * //
translated: He is not attached to the sense objects because he knows their faults.

original: pas mngon par dga' ba med pa la sogs pa nye bar gnas pa'i shes bzhin dang dran pa dang shes bzhin la brten pas bag yod pa la sbyor bar byed pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: pas mngon par dga' ba med pa la sogs pa nye bar gnas pa'i shes bzhin dang dran pa dang shes bzhin la brten pas bag yod pa la sbyor bar byed pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: He is heedful because he is established in the knowledge of the right time for acting, in mindfulness, and in the vigilance that is based on knowledge and mindfulness.

original: nyin par 'chag pa dang / 'dug pa gnyis kyis sgrib pa'i chos rnams las sems yongs su sbyong ngo zhes bya ba nas rgyas par sbyar te /
analyzed: nyin par 'chag pa dang / 'dug pa gnyis kyis sgrib pa'i chos rnams las sems yongs su sbyong ngo zhes bya ba nas rgyas par sbyar te /
translated: In the daytime, he purifies his mind of obscuring phenomena by means of both walking and sitting.

original: de ltar na brtson 'grus brtsams pa yang yin la rtogs pa la yang zhum pa med do //
analyzed: de ltar na brtson 'grus brtsams pa yang yin la rtogs pa la yang zhum pa med do //
translated: Thus, he is one who has begun striving and is not discouraged about realization.

original: sems gnas pa rnam pa dgus ni gcig tu nges par zhi gnas la brtson pa'i lus shin tu sbyangs par 'gyur la /
analyzed: sems gnas pa rnam pa dgus ni gcig tu nges par zhi gnas la brtson pa'i lus shin tu sbyangs par 'gyur la /
translated: By means of the nine mental states, he is one who is intent on serenity and has physical serenity.

original: ro myong ba med pas ni kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin no //
analyzed: ro myong ba med pas ni kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin no //
translated: By means of the absence of relishing, he is one who is not defiled.

original: rmugs pa dang gnyid kyis nye ba'i nyon mongs par ma gyur pas ni nyes rtsom med do //
analyzed: rmugs pa dang gnyid kyis nye ba'i nyon mongs par ma gyur pas ni nyes rtsom med do //
translated: By means of the absence of sluggishness and drowsiness, he is one who is not negligent.

original: gcig tu nges par dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la brten pas ni lhag mthong la brtson pa'i dran pa gnas par 'gyur la rgod pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang bral bas ni kun nas nyon mongs pa med do //
analyzed: gcig tu nges par dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la brten pas ni lhag mthong la brtson pa'i dran pa gnas par 'gyur la rgod pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang bral bas ni kun nas nyon mongs pa med do //
translated: By means of the single-pointed placement of mindfulness, he is one who is intent on insight and has a settled mindfulness. By means of the absence of the defilement of agitation, he is one who is not defiled.

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'brel par 'byung ba'i lam la zhugs pa'i sems ni mnyam par gzhag par 'gyur la /
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'brel par 'byung ba'i lam la zhugs pa'i sems ni mnyam par gzhag par 'gyur la /
translated: The mind of one who has entered the path of the union of serenity and insight becomes concentrated.

original: de gnyi ga'i cha rtse gcig pa dang ldan te /
analyzed: de gnyi ga'i cha rtse gcig pa dang ldan te /
translated: It is endowed with the one pointedness of both.

original: de'i bar du gcod pa spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i bar du gcod pa spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It abandons the obstacles to both.

original: gnyen po rnam pa lnga po 'di la brten te bar du gcod pa yang yongs su shes nas spong bar 'gyur la ting nge 'dzin rnam pa gsum dmigs pa'i gzhi drug gi bye brag can dga' ba dang ldan pa yongs su rdzogs par mngon par bsgrub par 'gyurüîΩro // de bzhin gshegs pa ni rgyu rnam pa gnyis kyis 'di nyid las dper blangs pas /
analyzed: gnyen po rnam pa lnga po 'di la brten te bar du gcod pa yang yongs su shes nas spong bar 'gyur la ting nge 'dzin rnam pa gsum dmigs pa'i gzhi drug gi bye brag can dga' ba dang ldan pa yongs su rdzogs par mngon par bsgrub par 'gyur ro // de bzhin gshegs pa ni rgyu rnam pa gnyis kyis 'di nyid las dper blangs pas /
translated: One abandons the obstacles by understanding them through these five kinds of antidotes, and one accomplishes the three kinds of concentration, which are endowed with joy and have the six bases as their objects.

original: nyan thos rnams la chos ston par mdzad de /
analyzed: nyan thos rnams la chos ston par mdzad de /
translated: The TathƒÅgata uses this very example to teach the disciples the Dharma through two causes:

original: nag po'i phyogs la ni spyon dang ldan pa dang / dkar po'i phyogs la ni yon tan dang ldan pa'i sgo nas yid ches pa bskyed pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: nag po'i phyogs la ni spyon dang ldan pa dang / dkar po'i phyogs la ni yon tan dang ldan pa'i sgo nas yid ches pa bskyed pa'i phyir ro /
translated: in order to generate confidence in the dark side through the possession of faults, and in order to generate confidence in the bright side through the possession of good qualities.

original: // / rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las gzhi bsdu ba /üîΩbam po dgu pa /
analyzed: // / rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las gzhi bsdu ba / bam po dgu pa /
translated: 1. The YogƒÅcƒÅrabh≈´mi states:

original: chos 'dul ba 'di'i gang zag ni 'di gnyis yin te /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: chos 'dul ba 'di'i gang zag ni 'di gnyis yin te / 'di lta ste /
translated: The two types of persons in this Dharma and Vinaya are:

original: sems thos pa dang / sems thob pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: sems thos pa dang / sems thob pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: those who have attained the mind and those who have not attained the mind.

original: de la sems thob pa ni gnyis te /
analyzed: de la sems thob pa ni gnyis te /
translated: Those who have attained the mind are of two types:

original: bden pa mthong ba slob pa'i sems rnam par grol bas sems thob pa gang yin pa dang / dgra bcom pa ni slob pa'i sems rnam par grol @210b bas sems thob pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: bden pa mthong ba slob pa'i sems rnam par grol bas sems thob pa gang yin pa dang / dgra bcom pa ni slob pa'i sems rnam par grol @210b bas sems thob pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: those who have attained the mind through the liberation of the learner‚Äôs mind that has seen the truths, and those who have attained the mind through the liberation of the mind of an arhat.

original: de la sems thob pa ma yin pa ni /
analyzed: de la sems thob pa ma yin pa ni /
translated: Those who have not attained the mind are:

original: bslab pa gsum la gnas pa'i las dang po pa slob pa so so'i skye bo gang yin pa ste des ni thams cad kyi thams cad du sems rnam par grol ba rnam pa gnyi gas kyang sems ma thob bo //
analyzed: bslab pa gsum la gnas pa'i las dang po pa slob pa so so'i skye bo gang yin pa ste des ni thams cad kyi thams cad du sems rnam par grol ba rnam pa gnyi gas kyang sems ma thob bo //
translated: beginners who abide in the three trainings, learners who are ordinary beings. They have not attained the mind through either of the two types of liberation of the mind.

original: so so'i skya bo'i rang bzhin de'i gong du phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa dang / lus kyi rang bzhin de'i gong du phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa shin tu don du gnyer ba ni bslab pa gsum po dag la slob pas shas cher gnas so //
analyzed: so so'i skya bo'i rang bzhin de'i gong du phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa dang / lus kyi rang bzhin de'i gong du phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa shin tu don du gnyer ba ni bslab pa gsum po dag la slob pas shas cher gnas so //
translated: The one who is intent on the nirvana with remainder of aggregates above the nature of the individual, and the one who is intent on the nirvana without remainder of aggregates above the nature of the body, dwells mostly in the training in the three trainings.

original: de la mi slob pa'i sems rnam par grol bas sems thob pa gang yin pa de ni bag med par byas na /
analyzed: de la mi slob pa'i sems rnam par grol bas sems thob pa gang yin pa de ni bag med par byas na /
translated: The one who has attained the mind of the non-learner through the liberation of mind, if he becomes heedless,

original: tshe 'di'i bde bar gnas pa las yongs su nyams par 'gyur mod kyi 'on kyang de ni tshe 'di'i bde bar gnas pa las yongs su nyams kyang rung yongs su nyams kyang rung ste /
analyzed: tshe 'di'i bde bar gnas pa las yongs su nyams par 'gyur mod kyi 'on kyang de ni tshe 'di'i bde bar gnas pa las yongs su nyams kyang rung yongs su nyams kyang rung ste /
translated: he may fall away from abiding in the happiness of this life. However, even though he may fall away from abiding in the happiness of this life,

original: rnam par grol ba de las yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba'i skal ba can ma yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba de las yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba'i skal ba can ma yin pa kho na'o //
translated: he is not one who has the fortune to fall away from that liberation.

original: bag yod par bya ba gang ci yang rung ba de dag thams cad ni rnam par grol ba de rtogs par bya ba'i phyir yin na //
analyzed: bag yod par bya ba gang ci yang rung ba de dag thams cad ni rnam par grol ba de rtogs par bya ba'i phyir yin na //
translated: Whatever is done with heedfulness is for the sake of realizing that liberation.

original: de ni des thob zin la yongs su nyams par yang mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: de ni des thob zin la yongs su nyams par yang mi 'gyur na /
translated: Since he has already attained it and will not fall away from it,

original: gang gi don du bag yod par byed de /
analyzed: gang gi don du bag yod par byed de /
translated: for whose sake should he be heedful?

original: tshe 'di la bde bar gnas par bya ba'i phyir de'i 'bad pa gang yin pa ni bzo'i las kyi gnas dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: tshe 'di la bde bar gnas par bya ba'i phyir de'i 'bad pa gang yin pa ni bzo'i las kyi gnas dang 'dra ste /
translated: Whatever effort he makes for the sake of abiding in happiness in this life is like the work of an artisan.

original: de ni bag yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni bag yod pa ma yin no //
translated: That is not heedfulness.

original: slob pa'i rnam par grol bas sems thob pa gang yin pa de yang nges par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'gro ba yin la lam bsgom pa la yang gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog ste /
analyzed: slob pa'i rnam par grol bas sems thob pa gang yin pa de yang nges par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'gro ba yin la lam bsgom pa la yang gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog ste /
translated: Whatever mind a learner obtains through liberation is certain to go to complete enlightenment, and he does not rely on another for the cultivation of the path.

original: de'i bag yod pa ni rang la dbang yod la /
analyzed: de'i bag yod pa ni rang la dbang yod la /
translated: His heedfulness is self-controlled.

original: tshe 'di la yang bag med pas gtan du slu bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshe 'di la yang bag med pas gtan du slu bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: He is not deceived by heedlessness in this life.

original: thams cad kyi thams cad du sems mthong ba gang yin pa des ni nges par rnam pa gsum gyis bag yod par bya dgos te /
analyzed: thams cad kyi thams cad du sems mthong ba gang yin pa des ni nges par rnam pa gsum gyis bag yod par bya dgos te /
translated: Whoever sees the mind in all ways must definitely be heedful in three ways:

original: dbang po yang dag par sgrub pas tshogs yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / mthun pa'i gnas mal bsten pas sems gnas pa dang / skyes bu dam pa la brten pas gzhan gyi sgra la brten nas tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'i rgyu nas sems rnam par grol ba rnam pa gnyis kyi bar gyi phyir bag yod par bya'o //üîΩbag yod par gnas @211a * //üîΩpa de la ni rgyu gnyis kyis skye mched drug 'gag par mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed pa dang / mngon pa'i nga rgyal mi byed par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: dbang po yang dag par sgrub pas tshogs yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / mthun pa'i gnas mal bsten pas sems gnas pa dang / skyes bu dam pa la brten pas gzhan gyi sgra la brten nas tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'i rgyu nas sems rnam par grol ba rnam pa gnyis kyi bar gyi phyir bag yod par bya'o // bag yod par gnas @211a * // pa de la ni rgyu gnyis kyis skye mched drug 'gag par mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed pa dang / mngon pa'i nga rgyal mi byed par rig par bya ste /
translated: in order to complete the collections by correctly accomplishing the faculties, in order to stabilize the mind by relying on a suitable place, and in order to be heedful from the cause of proper mental attention based on the words of another by relying on a holy being, up to the two kinds of mental liberation.üîΩThe one who abides heedfully should be known to have two causes for the cessation of the six sense bases:

original: ma 'gags pa bzhin du 'di lta ste /
analyzed: ma 'gags pa bzhin du 'di lta ste /
translated: one who is heedful should be known to have two causes for the cessation of the six sense bases:üîΩone who is heedful should be known to have two causes for the cessation of the six sense bases:

original: dmigs pa'i sgo nas log par brtags nas 'gog go snyam du mngon par zhen pa dang / ma thob par yang log par brtags nas 'gog go snyam du mngon par zhen te des log par brtags nas 'gag par mos mod kyi /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i sgo nas log par brtags nas 'gog go snyam du mngon par zhen pa dang / ma thob par yang log par brtags nas 'gog go snyam du mngon par zhen te des log par brtags nas 'gag par mos mod kyi /
translated: They think, I will stop it by means of an object, and they conceive of it as something to be stopped. They think, I will stop it by means of a non-object, and they conceive of it as something to be stopped.

original: 'on kyang de ni lus dang bral zhing tshe zad pa'i 'og tu skye mched drug kyang 'gog par mi 'gyur la yul gyi 'du shes dang yang bral bar mi 'gyur ro ;üîΩ/'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang de ni lus dang bral zhing tshe zad pa'i 'og tu skye mched drug kyang 'gog par mi 'gyur la yul gyi 'du shes dang yang bral bar mi 'gyur ro ; /'di lta ste /
translated: But when they separate from the body, after the exhaustion of that life, the six sense-spheres will not stop, and they will not be free from the perception of objects.

original: de'i skye mched drug 'gags pa'i gnas kyi dmigs pa dang / rtogs pa'i sgo nas log par khong du chud pa'i phyir de lta bur 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i skye mched drug 'gags pa'i gnas kyi dmigs pa dang / rtogs pa'i sgo nas log par khong du chud pa'i phyir de lta bur 'gyur te /
translated: This is because they have a false understanding of the object of their meditation, thinking, It is stopped.

original: 'di ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: 'di ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: This is the second kind of false pride.

original: de las bzlog pa na mngon pa'i nga rgyal med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa na mngon pa'i nga rgyal med par rig par bya'o //
translated: The opposite of this is the absence of false pride.

original: chos 'di pa'i chags pa rnam pa gnyis la ni nyes dmigs gnyis yod par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: chos 'di pa'i chags pa rnam pa gnyis la ni nyes dmigs gnyis yod par rig par bya ste /
translated: The two kinds of attachment to this doctrine have two kinds of danger.

original: de yang so so'i skye bo'i rkyen gnyis las byung ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / de la brten pa'i tshor ba bdag med par mi shes pa'i'o //
analyzed: de yang so so'i skye bo'i rkyen gnyis las byung ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / de la brten pa'i tshor ba bdag med par mi shes pa'i'o //
translated: The first is the consciousness that arises from the two conditions of the ordinary man, and the feeling that is based on it, which is not understood as being without self.

original: de la 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i rnyed pa dang bkur sti'i dbang gis byung ba'i las kyi rkyen can gyi tshor ba la chags pa ni chags pa dang po yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i rnyed pa dang bkur sti'i dbang gis byung ba'i las kyi rkyen can gyi tshor ba la chags pa ni chags pa dang po yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The first attachment should be understood as the attachment to feeling that arises from the power of gain and honor, which is not free from passion.

original: gnyis pa ni 'dod chags dang bral ba'i 'dod pa rnams la ma chags pa'i rkyen can gyi tshor ba la chags pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni 'dod chags dang bral ba'i 'dod pa rnams la ma chags pa'i rkyen can gyi tshor ba la chags pa'o //
translated: The second is the attachment to feeling that is not free from passion, which is not attached to the desires.

original: chags pa de'i rgyu las byung ba phyi ma la mngon par 'grub pa gang yin pa de ni phyis kyang phyi rol pa rnams kyi mdud pa rnams len par 'gyur ba dang / mdud pa de'i rgyu can gyis sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: chags pa de'i rgyu las byung ba phyi ma la mngon par 'grub pa gang yin pa de ni phyis kyang phyi rol pa rnams kyi mdud pa rnams len par 'gyur ba dang / mdud pa de'i rgyu can gyis sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yin te /
translated: The cause of that attachment is the cause of the future arising of the fetters of the outsiders, and the cause of the arising of sinful, unwholesome dharmas that have that fetter as their cause.

original: 'di ni nyes dmigs dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni nyes dmigs dang po'o //
translated: This is the first disadvantage.

original: chos 'dul ba'i 'di las nyams na phyi ma'i dbang du byas pa dang / de ltar chags pa de'i yang phyi ma las skyes ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi khyad par rnams 'byung bar 'gyur la tshe 'di la yang de'i rgyus yongs su mya ngan las 'das par mi 'gyur ba'i dbang du byas pa 'di ni nyes dmigs gnyis @211b so
analyzed: chos 'dul ba'i 'di las nyams na phyi ma'i dbang du byas pa dang / de ltar chags pa de'i yang phyi ma las skyes ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi khyad par rnams 'byung bar 'gyur la tshe 'di la yang de'i rgyus yongs su mya ngan las 'das par mi 'gyur ba'i dbang du byas pa 'di ni nyes dmigs gnyis @211b so
translated: The second disadvantage is from the point of view of the future life, and the third is from the point of view of this life, that is, that because of that cause, one will not attain nirvana.

original: ; / de las bzlog pa ni dkar po'i phyogs yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ; / de las bzlog pa ni dkar po'i phyogs yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The opposite of that is to be understood as the bright side.

original: rgyu bzhis ni chos bdag med pa mthar thug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rgyu bzhis ni chos bdag med pa mthar thug par 'gyur te /
translated: The ultimate selflessness of phenomena is due to four causes:

original: chos thams cad bdag med pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin dang rnam par shes pa'i rgyu dang rkyen dang rnam par shes pa'i grogs ma gtogs par de las gzhan dmigs pa'i phyir dang / rnam par shes pa mi rtag pa dang /
analyzed: chos thams cad bdag med pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin dang rnam par shes pa'i rgyu dang rkyen dang rnam par shes pa'i grogs ma gtogs par de las gzhan dmigs pa'i phyir dang / rnam par shes pa mi rtag pa dang /
translated: The so-called selflessness of all phenomena is due to the fact that they are not perceived apart from consciousness, the nature of consciousness, the causes and conditions of consciousness, and the companions of consciousness, and due to the fact that consciousness is impermanent,

original: de'i rgyu dang rkyen mi rtag pa dang / de'i grogs mi rtag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rgyu dang rkyen mi rtag pa dang / de'i grogs mi rtag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because its causes and conditions are impermanent and because its companions are impermanent.

original: chos 'dul ba 'di ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i chos dang / de'i 'bras bus phye ba yin no //
analyzed: chos 'dul ba 'di ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i chos dang / de'i 'bras bus phye ba yin no //
translated: This Dharma and Vinaya is distinguished by the Dharma of the eightfold noble path and its result.

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i chos de yang rnam pa lngas mchog dang kha na ma tho ba med par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i chos de yang rnam pa lngas mchog dang kha na ma tho ba med par rig par bya ste /
translated: That Dharma of the eightfold noble path should be understood as supreme and irreproachable in five ways:

original: tshe 'di la nyon mongs pa yod pa dang med pa yongs su gcod pa'i phyir tshe 'di la myong ba dang / nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'i phyir rims nad med pa dang / 'gro ba na yang bsgom pa dang / 'greng ba dang 'dug pa dang nyal ba dang /
analyzed: tshe 'di la nyon mongs pa yod pa dang med pa yongs su gcod pa'i phyir tshe 'di la myong ba dang / nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'i phyir rims nad med pa dang / 'gro ba na yang bsgom pa dang / 'greng ba dang 'dug pa dang nyal ba dang /
translated: because it eliminates the presence and absence of afflictions in this life, because it is free from afflictions, because it is cultivated while going, and because it is cultivated while standing, sitting, lying down,

original: dus thams cad du yang bsgom par bla bas na /
analyzed: dus thams cad du yang bsgom par bla bas na /
translated: and at all times.

original: de'i phyir dus nges pa med pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa thob par byed pa'i phyir 'thob par byed pa dang / 'di las phyi rol pa rnams dang thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir 'di pas mthong ba dang / gzhan gyi dad pa dang 'dod pa dang rnam pa dang yongs su rtogs pa dang nyid thor thos pa dang /üîΩlta ba dpyod pa'i bzod pa ma yin par rang gis rtogs par bya ba yin pa'i phyir so so rang rig pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir dus nges pa med pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa thob par byed pa'i phyir 'thob par byed pa dang / 'di las phyi rol pa rnams dang thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir 'di pas mthong ba dang / gzhan gyi dad pa dang 'dod pa dang rnam pa dang yongs su rtogs pa dang nyid thor thos pa dang / lta ba dpyod pa'i bzod pa ma yin par rang gis rtogs par bya ba yin pa'i phyir so so rang rig pa'o //
translated: It is the path of insight because it is the direct cause of the attainment of nirvana.üîΩIt is the path of insight because it is the direct cause of the attainment of nirvana.üîΩIt is the path of insight because it is the direct cause of the attainment of nirvana.üîΩIt is the path of insight because it is the direct cause of the attainment of nirvana.

original: lam gyi 'bras bu'i chos ni mtshan nyid rnam pa lngar rig par bya ste /üîΩ'di lta ste /

analyzed: rnam grangs bsdu ba las 'byung ba bzhin no // rgya mtsho ni 'di gnyis yin te / chu'i rgya mtsho dang 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho'o //

analyzed: de la 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho ni chu'i rgya mtsho las rnam pa gsum gyis mi mtshungs par rig par bya ste /

original: gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three?üîΩThey are:

original: rang bzhin mi mtshungs pa dang / 'bying ba mi mtshungs pa dang / rgal ba mi mtshungs pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin mi mtshungs pa dang / 'bying ba mi mtshungs pa dang / rgal ba mi mtshungs pa'o //
translated: a difference in nature, a difference in submersion, and a difference in crossing over.

original: de la rang bzhin mi mtshungs pa ni chu'i rgya mtsho ni gzugs kyi phyogs gcig gi rang bzhin du zad pa'i phyir tshad nges pa yin la /üîΩ'khor ba'i rgya mtsho ni 'du byed thams cad kyi rang bzhin yin @212a * //
analyzed: de la rang bzhin mi mtshungs pa ni chu'i rgya mtsho ni gzugs kyi phyogs gcig gi rang bzhin du zad pa'i phyir tshad nges pa yin la / 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho ni 'du byed thams cad kyi rang bzhin yin @212a * //
translated: In this regard, the difference in nature is that the ocean of water has a limited size because it is of the nature of only one element, form.

original: pa'i phyir tshad med do //üîΩde la 'bying ba mi mtshungs pa ni gang dag 'bying ba dang / gang gis 'bying ba dang / ji ltar 'bying ba ste /
analyzed: pa'i phyir tshad med do // de la 'bying ba mi mtshungs pa ni gang dag 'bying ba dang / gang gis 'bying ba dang / ji ltar 'bying ba ste /
translated: The ocean of cyclic existence is immeasurable because it is of the nature of all formations.

original: chu'i rgya mtshor ni dud 'gro'i skye gnas su skyes pa kha cig dang / mi kha cig 'bying bar zad la /
analyzed: chu'i rgya mtshor ni dud 'gro'i skye gnas su skyes pa kha cig dang / mi kha cig 'bying bar zad la /
translated: In this regard, the difference in submersion is that some beings born as animals and some humans are submerged in the ocean of water.

original: 'khor ba'i rgya mtshor ni lhar bcas pa'i 'jig rten 'bying ste /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i rgya mtshor ni lhar bcas pa'i 'jig rten 'bying ste /
translated: The entire world with its gods is submerged in the ocean of cyclic existence.

original: de dag kyang lus tsam zhig gis 'bying bar zad kyi /
analyzed: de dag kyang lus tsam zhig gis 'bying bar zad kyi /
translated: Moreover, they are submerged only by their bodies,

original: ngag gis ma yin /
analyzed: ngag gis ma yin /
translated: not by their speech,

original: yid kyis ma yin /
analyzed: yid kyis ma yin /
translated: not by their minds.

original: 'dod chags kyis ma yin /
analyzed: 'dod chags kyis ma yin /
translated: not by passion,

original: zhe sdang gis ma yin /
analyzed: zhe sdang gis ma yin /
translated: not by aversion,

original: gti mug gis ma yin skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyis ma yin no //
analyzed: gti mug gis ma yin skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyis ma yin no //
translated: not by delusion, not by the suffering of birth and so on.

original: de yang las dang nyon mongs pa dang / de'i 'bras bu brtan pa'i cha gsum du go rims bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang las dang nyon mongs pa dang / de'i 'bras bu brtan pa'i cha gsum du go rims bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, it should be understood that these three are respectively the three parts of action, affliction, and their result.

original: 'khor ba'i rgya mtshor ni lus nas skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bar rnams kyis kyang 'bying ngo //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i rgya mtshor ni lus nas skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bar rnams kyis kyang 'bying ngo //
translated: In the ocean of cyclic existence, one sinks with the body and so on up to the suffering of birth and so on.

original: de la rab tu byung ba rtog gi ba dpyod pa can rnams ni rang gis log par brtags pa'i rtog pa ngan pa rnams kyis dkrugs pas 'khor ba'i rgya mtshor 'bying ngo //
analyzed: de la rab tu byung ba rtog gi ba dpyod pa can rnams ni rang gis log par brtags pa'i rtog pa ngan pa rnams kyis dkrugs pas 'khor ba'i rgya mtshor 'bying ngo //
translated: Among them, those who have gone forth, who are speculative and analytical, sink in the ocean of cyclic existence, agitated by their own bad speculations.

original: phyi rol pa gzhan dag ni mdud pas bcings pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi rol pa gzhan dag ni mdud pas bcings pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Others, the non-Buddhists, are bound by their tenets.

original: khyim pa rnams ni rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par yang sdug bsngal rnams kyis kun nas bcom zhing nyon mongs pa rnams kyis sreg bzhin du skyo bar mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyim pa rnams ni rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par yang sdug bsngal rnams kyis kun nas bcom zhing nyon mongs pa rnams kyis sreg bzhin du skyo bar mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because householders are always and continuously overcome by suffering and burned by the afflictions, but they do not become weary.

original: de ma yin pa'i skye gnas su skyes pa rnams ni 'gro ba dang 'ong ba la las dang nyon mongs pa la brten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ma yin pa'i skye gnas su skyes pa rnams ni 'gro ba dang 'ong ba la las dang nyon mongs pa la brten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Those born in other destinies are weary because they go and come, and because they are based on karma and the afflictions.

original: chu'i rgya mtshor ni gru bub pa tsam las gyur par zad la /
analyzed: chu'i rgya mtshor ni gru bub pa tsam las gyur par zad la /
translated: In the ocean of water, there is only the danger of shipwreck.

original: dud 'gro'i skye gnas su gyur pa der skyes pa rnams kyang las dang nyon mongs pa'i phyogs gcig tsam gyis 'bying bar zad de /
analyzed: dud 'gro'i skye gnas su gyur pa der skyes pa rnams kyang las dang nyon mongs pa'i phyogs gcig tsam gyis 'bying bar zad de /
translated: Those born in the animal realm are only submerged by one part of karma and the afflictions.

original: de yang gtan du ma yin pa 'di ni 'bying ba mi mtshungs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang gtan du ma yin pa 'di ni 'bying ba mi mtshungs par rig par bya'o //
translated: And that is not permanent. This is how the inequality of submersion should be understood.

original: de la rgal ba mi mtshungs pa ni chu'i rgya mtsho la ni 'dod pa rnams las 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i so so'i skye bo rnams kyang rgal na de ma yin pa dag lta ci smos /
analyzed: de la rgal ba mi mtshungs pa ni chu'i rgya mtsho la ni 'dod pa rnams las 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i so so'i skye bo rnams kyang rgal na de ma yin pa dag lta ci smos /
translated: The objection that the analogy is not appropriate is that ordinary beings who are not free from attachment to the desire realm can cross the ocean of water, not to mention those who are free from attachment.

original: 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho ni cha gsum du 'dug ste /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho ni cha gsum du 'dug ste /
translated: The ocean of samsara is divided into three parts:

original: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i chags par 'gyur ba'i yul lnga'i bye brag dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i yid kyis shes par bya ba chags par 'gyur ba'i chos kyi bye brag dang / slob pa'i nang gi skye mched @212b drug gi bye brag go //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i chags par 'gyur ba'i yul lnga'i bye brag dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i yid kyis shes par bya ba chags par 'gyur ba'i chos kyi bye brag dang / slob pa'i nang gi skye mched @212b drug gi bye brag go //
translated: the five objects that are the basis of attachment for those who are not free from attachment to the desire realm, the particular phenomena that are the basis of attachment for the mind that is free from attachment, and the particular six internal sense bases of learners.

original: de la 'dod chags pa dang ma bral ba'i so so'i skye bo ni yul rnam pa lnga'i rgya mtsho las rgal bar mi nus so //
analyzed: de la 'dod chags pa dang ma bral ba'i so so'i skye bo ni yul rnam pa lnga'i rgya mtsho las rgal bar mi nus so //
translated: Ordinary beings who are not free from attachment cannot cross the ocean of the five types of objects.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i so so'i skye bo ni nang gi skye mched drug gi rgya mtsho las rgal mi nus te /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i so so'i skye bo ni nang gi skye mched drug gi rgya mtsho las rgal mi nus te /
translated: Ordinary beings who are free from attachment cannot cross the ocean of the six internal sense bases.

original: de las rgal mi nus pas na yul rnam pa gnyis kyis rgya mtsho las kyang ma rgal ba yin no //
analyzed: de las rgal mi nus pas na yul rnam pa gnyis kyis rgya mtsho las kyang ma rgal ba yin no //
translated: Since one is unable to cross over that, one has not crossed over the ocean of the two types of objects.

original: slob pa ni sdug bsngal gyi sgo nas skye mched drug yongs su shes nas de la dmigs pa'i lam nyid sgom par byed de /
analyzed: slob pa ni sdug bsngal gyi sgo nas skye mched drug yongs su shes nas de la dmigs pa'i lam nyid sgom par byed de /
translated: The learner, having fully understood the six sense spheres from the perspective of suffering, cultivates the path that observes that.

original: de ni gnas pa de rnams kyis gnas pas lta ba drag po dang / yang dag pa'i dran ba can gyi ni dpyod pa yid la byed pas 'dod chags dang ma bral ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sa pa'i yul rnam pa gnyis las yul de nyid la snang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ni gnas pa de rnams kyis gnas pas lta ba drag po dang / yang dag pa'i dran ba can gyi ni dpyod pa yid la byed pas 'dod chags dang ma bral ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sa pa'i yul rnam pa gnyis las yul de nyid la snang bar 'gyur te /
translated: Since he abides in those abodes, he is one who has intense view and correct mindfulness. He is not free from attachment to the two types of objects of the level of freedom from attachment.

original: des ni de myur ba myur bar shes rab kyis rtogs nas spong bar byed do //
analyzed: des ni de myur ba myur bar shes rab kyis rtogs nas spong bar byed do //
translated: He quickly realizes and abandons that through wisdom.

original: des ni skye mched drug gi rgya mtsho yang rgal te /
analyzed: des ni skye mched drug gi rgya mtsho yang rgal te /
translated: He also crosses over the ocean of the six sense spheres.üîΩSince he has crossed over that, he has crossed over the ocean of the two types of objects.

original: de las rgal bas yul rnam pa gnyis pas rgya mtsho bslab pa 'bul ba kun nas slong ba'i nyon mongs pa dang bcas /
analyzed: de las rgal bas yul rnam pa gnyis pas rgya mtsho bslab pa 'bul ba kun nas slong ba'i nyon mongs pa dang bcas /
translated: The one who has crossed over the ocean of the two types of objects is the nonlearner.

original: rtog pa dang sems kun du 'khrug pa kun nas slong ba'i nyon mongs pa dang bcas /
analyzed: rtog pa dang sems kun du 'khrug pa kun nas slong ba'i nyon mongs pa dang bcas /
translated: It is completely free from the afflictions that cause thoughts and mental functions to be disturbed.

original: rnyed pa dang bkur sti la lhag par zhen pa kun nas slong ba'i nyon mongs pa dang bcas /
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti la lhag par zhen pa kun nas slong ba'i nyon mongs pa dang bcas /
translated: It is completely free from the afflictions that cause one to be attached to gain and honor.

original: ngan par spyod pa kun nas slong ba'i nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa las gtan rgal ba yin no //
analyzed: ngan par spyod pa kun nas slong ba'i nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa las gtan rgal ba yin no //
translated: It is completely free from the afflictions that cause one to engage in evil conduct.üîΩThe summary verses:

original: sdom ni / lam la mtshungs pa med pa dang // ston pa la ni mtshungs pa med //
analyzed: sdom ni / lam la mtshungs pa med pa dang // ston pa la ni mtshungs pa med //
translated: The path is unequaled, the teacher is unequaled,üîΩThe retinue, the place, the teaching,

original: yul 'khor rgyal por bcas pa dang // 'jig rten rnam pa gnyis po dang // 'dus byas dang ni 'dus ma byas //
analyzed: yul 'khor rgyal por bcas pa dang // 'jig rten rnam pa gnyis po dang // 'dus byas dang ni 'dus ma byas //
translated: The time, the demonstration of the two kinds of miracles,

original: 'gro ba dang ni dgag pa dang // dang du len dang stong nyid gsum //
analyzed: 'gro ba dang ni dgag pa dang // dang du len dang stong nyid gsum //
translated: The demonstration of the three acceptances,

original: lam mtshungs pa med pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: lam mtshungs pa med pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The path is unequaled in two ways:

original: rang bzhin mi mtshungs pa dang / rnam pa mi mtshungs pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin mi mtshungs pa dang / rnam pa mi mtshungs pa'o //
translated: It is unequaled in its intrinsic reality and it is unequaled in its aspects.

original: de la sdug bsngal kun 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i lam gang yin pa dang / sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam gang yin pa 'di ni rang bzhin mi mtshungs pa ste /
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal kun 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i lam gang yin pa dang / sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam gang yin pa 'di ni rang bzhin mi mtshungs pa ste /
translated: The path that leads to the origination of suffering and the path that leads to the cessation of suffering are not the same in nature.

original: gcig ni kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gcig ni kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur pa'o //
translated: One leads to affliction,

original: gnyis pa ni rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: the other to purification.

original: 'di ni 'dir mi mtshungs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dir mi mtshungs pa'o //
translated: This is the difference here.

original: sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam de nyid la yang 'dus byas kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid la 'jug pa @213a * //
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam de nyid la yang 'dus byas kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid la 'jug pa @213a * //
translated: Moreover, the path that leads to the cessation of suffering is also the entryway to the general characteristics of conditioned phenomena.

original: yang yod la 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas pa'i spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi rnam par 'jug pa yang yod de /
analyzed: yang yod la 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas pa'i spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi rnam par 'jug pa yang yod de /
translated: It is also the entryway to the general characteristics of both conditioned and unconditioned phenomena.

original: 'di ni rnam pa mi mtshungs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam pa mi mtshungs pa'o //
translated: This is the difference in terms of aspects.

original: de la 'dus byas kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi rnam pa gang yin pa de ni de'i 'bras bu dang mi mtshungs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la 'dus byas kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi rnam pa gang yin pa de ni de'i 'bras bu dang mi mtshungs par rig par bya'o //
translated: The aspect that is the general characteristic of conditioned phenomena is to be understood as not the same as its result.

original: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi rnam pa gang yin pa de ni de'i 'bras bu dang mtshungs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi rnam pa gang yin pa de ni de'i 'bras bu dang mtshungs par rig par bya'o //
translated: The aspects of the general characteristics of the conditioned and the unconditioned should be understood as being similar to its effect.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: de'i 'bras bu mya ngan las 'das pa ni rtag pa dang bdag med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu mya ngan las 'das pa ni rtag pa dang bdag med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because its effect, i.e., nirvana, is permanent and selfless.

original: lnga po 'di dag ni chos 'di pa'i ston par gdags pa'i gnas yin te /
analyzed: lnga po 'di dag ni chos 'di pa'i ston par gdags pa'i gnas yin te /
translated: These five are the bases for designating the Teacher of this Dharma.

original: de dag ni 'di las phyi rol pa'i ston pa la med de /
analyzed: de dag ni 'di las phyi rol pa'i ston pa la med de /
translated: They do not exist for the teachers of other schools,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: namely:

original: nye bar len pa thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam dang / nye bar len pa thams cad zad par 'gro ba'i lam dang chos thams cad yongs su shes nas spangs pa'i phyir sdug bsngal mthar byed pa dang / tshor ba rnam par gzhag pa rnam pa lnga la rnam pa re re zhing yang 'jig tshogs la lta ba rnam pa bzhi bzhi la brten nas //
analyzed: nye bar len pa thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam dang / nye bar len pa thams cad zad par 'gro ba'i lam dang chos thams cad yongs su shes nas spangs pa'i phyir sdug bsngal mthar byed pa dang / tshor ba rnam par gzhag pa rnam pa lnga la rnam pa re re zhing yang 'jig tshogs la lta ba rnam pa bzhi bzhi la brten nas //
translated: the path that goes everywhere, i.e., to all the appropriated aggregates, the path that goes to the end of all appropriation, the end of suffering through the complete knowledge and abandonment of all phenomena, and the fivefold presentation of feeling.

original: de la brten pas rlom sems rnam pa bzhi yang dag par bcom pa dang / nga rgyal gyi rgyu las byung ba'i nyes dmigs rnam pa gsum dang / nga rgyal med pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i phan yon gsum mo //
analyzed: de la brten pas rlom sems rnam pa bzhi yang dag par bcom pa dang / nga rgyal gyi rgyu las byung ba'i nyes dmigs rnam pa gsum dang / nga rgyal med pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i phan yon gsum mo //
translated: The three benefits that arise from the cause of the absence of pride are also explained.

original: de la rlom sems su byed pas yongs su mi 'chad pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa las sems phyir ldog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la rlom sems su byed pas yongs su mi 'chad pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa las sems phyir ldog par 'gyur te /
translated: The first fault is that, because of conceit, the mind turns away from nirvana, since one does not fully understand it.

original: 'di ni nyes dmigs dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni nyes dmigs dang po'o //
translated: This is the first fault.

original: nyes par spyod pa kun du spyod pa dang / chags par 'gyur ba kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi dngos po la gzhol ba 'di ni nyes dmigs gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: nyes par spyod pa kun du spyod pa dang / chags par 'gyur ba kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi dngos po la gzhol ba 'di ni nyes dmigs gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second fault is that one engages in misconduct and is attached to defiled things.üîΩThe third fault is that, because of one‚Äôs dissatisfaction with nirvana, one becomes the cause for the arising of the disease of birth in the future and so on.

original: de'i mya ngan las 'das pa la yongs su yi 'chad pa'i phyir phyi ma la skye ba la sogs pa'i nad 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rgyur shin tu 'gyur ba dang / yongs su yi 'chad pa'i phyir ji lta ba bzhin du nyes par spyod pa dang /
analyzed: de'i mya ngan las 'das pa la yongs su yi 'chad pa'i phyir phyi ma la skye ba la sogs pa'i nad 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rgyur shin tu 'gyur ba dang / yongs su yi 'chad pa'i phyir ji lta ba bzhin du nyes par spyod pa dang /
translated: Because of dissatisfaction, one engages in misconduct and does not understand things as they are.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa can chags par 'gyur ba'i yul la yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa can chags par 'gyur ba'i yul la yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The same is true of the objects of attachment that are defiled.

original: skye ba la sogs pa'i nad ji lta ba bzhin du mig la sogs pa'i skye mched kyi 'bras bu rnams dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa'i zug rngu rnams kyang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa'i nad ji lta ba bzhin du mig la sogs pa'i skye mched kyi 'bras bu rnams dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa'i zug rngu rnams kyang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: The results of the sense-spheres of the eye, etc., are like the diseases of birth, etc., and the pains of attachment, etc., are like the wounds.

original: 'di ni nyes dmigs gsum pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni nyes dmigs gsum pa'o //
translated: This is the third disadvantage.

original: @213b de las bzlog pa ni nga rgyal med pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i phan yon yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: @213b de las bzlog pa ni nga rgyal med pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i phan yon yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The benefits of the absence of pride should be understood as the opposite of these.

original: de bzhin du rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i dbang du byas nas tshe 'di la yang srid par skye ba'i sa bon 'phel ba dang 'grib pa dang / de'i rgyus kyang phyi ma la yang srid par skye ba dang mi skye ba dang / de'i sa bon yongs su 'dzin pa'i nyon mongs pa kun 'byung ba dang nub pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i dbang du byas nas tshe 'di la yang srid par skye ba'i sa bon 'phel ba dang 'grib pa dang / de'i rgyus kyang phyi ma la yang srid par skye ba dang mi skye ba dang / de'i sa bon yongs su 'dzin pa'i nyon mongs pa kun 'byung ba dang nub pa dang /
translated: Similarly, in this life, in terms of dependent origination, the increase and decrease of the seeds of birth in existence, and by that cause, the birth and non-birth in the next life of the seeds of existence, the origination and disappearance of the afflictions that grasp those seeds, and the increase and decrease of the seeds of the afflictions, should be understood in the same way as the increase and decrease of the seeds of birth in existence.

original: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos brtan pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par gzhag pa yang de dang 'dra ste ston par gdags pa'i gnas 'di dag ni chos 'di pa'i ston pa 'ba' zhig la yod kyi /

analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i 'du byed kyi rgyu yang dag par zad pa'i phyir ni 'jig rten gyi mthar thug par 'gro ba'o //

analyzed: tshe 'di la yul thams cad la sred pa zad pas rtag par gnas pa'i phyir ni 'jig rten na sred pa las rgal ba ste /

analyzed: rnam pa 'di dag gis ni 'jig rten gyi mthar thug par rig par bya'o //
translated: By these aspects, he knows the end of the world.

original: legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu byung ba la sdig pa mi dge ba'i rtog pa gang yang rung ba ma byung ba las byung ba ni byung ba dang du len pa tsam du gcig tu nges par tshangs par spyod pa'i gcod par mi byed
analyzed: legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu byung ba la sdig pa mi dge ba'i rtog pa gang yang rung ba ma byung ba las byung ba ni byung ba dang du len pa tsam du gcig tu nges par tshangs par spyod pa'i gcod par mi byed
translated: He is one who accepts what has arisen, because he does not produce any evil unwholesome thoughts that have not already arisen, and he does not abandon any that have arisen, with regard to going forth in the well-proclaimed Dharma and Vinaya.

original: de / de la kun du mi spyod pa 'ba' zhig ni legs so //
analyzed: de / de la kun du mi spyod pa 'ba' zhig ni legs so //
translated: It is not only the non-performance of the latter that is good.

original: kun du spyod par gyur na yang dang du mi len pas rgyud de la rgyud de la gnas pa'i tshul gyis rten gyi skabs dbye bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: kun du spyod par gyur na yang dang du mi len pas rgyud de la rgyud de la gnas pa'i tshul gyis rten gyi skabs dbye bar mi bya'o //
translated: Even if one does perform it, one does not accept it, and one does not open the door to the continuum of that mental process by the method of abiding in that mental process.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: nyon mongs pa skad cig pas ni tshangs par spyod pa'i gnas las nyams par byed mi nus la rgyun gyis ni nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa skad cig pas ni tshangs par spyod pa'i gnas las nyams par byed mi nus la rgyun gyis ni nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the defilement that is momentary is not able to cause a fall from the state of pure conduct, but the continuum is able to.

original: stong pa nyid kyi gnas pa ni gnyis te /üîΩgnas brtan stong pa nyid kyis gnas pa dang / des bskyed pa'i stong pa nyid kyis gnas pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi gnas pa ni gnyis te / gnas brtan stong pa nyid kyis gnas pa dang / des bskyed pa'i stong pa nyid kyis gnas pa'o //
translated: There are two kinds of abiders in emptiness:üîΩthe elder who abides in emptiness and the one who abides in emptiness generated by that.

original: de la dgra bcom pa'i bdag med pa'i gnas pa gang yang pa de ni gnas brtan stong pa nyid kyis gnas pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de la dgra bcom pa'i bdag med pa'i gnas pa gang yang pa de ni gnas brtan stong pa nyid kyis gnas pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The elder who abides in emptiness is the arhat who abides in selflessness.

original: 'di ltar dgra bcom pa ni chos nyid kyis gnas brtan yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar dgra bcom pa ni chos nyid kyis gnas brtan yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: bdag med pa'i gnas pa yang gnas pa gzhan rnams kyi gnas brtan thu bo yin te /
analyzed: bdag med pa'i gnas pa yang gnas pa gzhan rnams kyi gnas brtan thu bo yin te /
translated: The steadfastness of selflessness is the most senior of the other steadfastnesses.

original: de bas na gnas brtan gyis gnas pa dang / gnas pa nyid gnas brtan yin pas na de'i phyir gnas brtan gyis gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na gnas brtan gyis gnas pa dang / gnas pa nyid gnas brtan yin pas na de'i phyir gnas brtan gyis gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the steadfastness of the steadfast, because the steadfast one is steadfast, and steadfastness is the steadfast one.

original: des bskyed pa'i gnas pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: des bskyed pa'i gnas pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is steadfastness generated by that?

original: ji ltar 'di na kha cig rgyu @214b zhing 'gro ba dang gnas pa la nyon mongs pa yod pa dang med pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes nas yod na ni spong ba'i phyir /

translated: Just as someone here, having understood as it truly is the presence or absence of afflictions in going, standing, and so on,

original: nan tan du sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: nan tan du sgrub par byed do //
translated: if present, strives diligently to abandon them,

original: med na ni mchog tu dga' bskyed par byed do //
analyzed: med na ni mchog tu dga' bskyed par byed do //
translated: if absent, generates supreme joy.

original: de'i mchog tu dga' ba de yang sems kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi bar du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i mchog tu dga' ba de yang sems kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi bar du 'gyur te /
translated: That supreme joy of his becomes mental concentration.

original: ting nge 'dzin de yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du bdag med pa'i chos rnams mthong ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du bdag med pa'i chos rnams mthong ste /
translated: And that concentration sees the selflessness of phenomena as it truly is.

original: nyin mtshan du rjes su slob pa 'di ni des bskyed pa'i stong pa nyid kyis gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: nyin mtshan du rjes su slob pa 'di ni des bskyed pa'i stong pa nyid kyis gnas pa yin no //
translated: This is the abiding in emptiness that is produced by that.

original: de la gang des ngag na nyon mongs pa yod na yod pa dang med na med par yan dag par ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa 'di ni 'dir stong pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de la gang des ngag na nyon mongs pa yod na yod pa dang med na med par yan dag par ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa 'di ni 'dir stong pa nyid yin no //
translated: Here, emptiness is the correct knowledge of the presence or absence of afflictions in the mind, when they are present or absent.

original: 'di la 'phags pa nyan thos lta ba phun sum tshogs pa bzhi mthong ba ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du stong pa nyid la zhugs nas 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis kyang stong pa nyid sgom par byed la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis kyang
analyzed: 'di la 'phags pa nyan thos lta ba phun sum tshogs pa bzhi mthong ba ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du stong pa nyid la zhugs nas 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis kyang stong pa nyid sgom par byed la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis kyang
translated: Here, the noble disciple who is endowed with the view, having entered into emptiness correctly as it is, cultivates emptiness through the mundane path and also through the supramundane path.

original: sgom par byed do ;
analyzed: sgom par byed do ;
translated: He cultivates it through the mundane path and also through the supramundane path.

original: / yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du stong pa nyid la zhugs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: / yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du stong pa nyid la zhugs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the correct entry into emptiness?

original: gang na gang med pa de ni des stong par yang dag par mthong ba la gang na yod pa de ni yod de 'di na yod do bar yang dag par ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te dper na sngon bu sa'i khang pa ni res 'ga'
analyzed: gang na gang med pa de ni des stong par yang dag par mthong ba la gang na yod pa de ni yod de 'di na yod do bar yang dag par ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te dper na sngon bu sa'i khang pa ni res 'ga'
translated: When one sees that whatever is absent in something, that is empty of it, one knows perfectly, just as it is, that whatever remains in it exists there.

analyzed: skye bo'i tshogs kha cig gis stong la res 'ga' ni mi stong pa dang / khang pa de nyid nas gdung rten nam // dag pa pa'am /

analyzed: sgo'am / gtan pa'am /
translated: a door,

analyzed: de bzhin du lus dang gnas ni tshor ba'i rnam pa zhes kyang bya /

translated: the ‚Äúaspect of perception,‚Äù and the ‚Äúaspect of intention.‚Äù

analyzed: lus dang gnas de yang res 'ga' tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa kha cig gis ni stong la /
translated: And sometimes that body and that place are empty of some afflictions and secondary afflictions of feeling, discernment, intention, and so on.üîΩBut sometimes they are not empty.

analyzed: kha cig gis ni mi stong ba dang / lus dang gnas de nyid nas res 'ga' mig gam /

analyzed: rna ba'am / lce'am /
translated: tongue,

analyzed: lus kyi phyogs gcig gam /

original: yid kyi phyogs gcig gam /
analyzed: yid kyi phyogs gcig gam /
translated: or mind.

analyzed: kha cig gis stong du zin kyang lus dang gnas thams cad thams cad kyis stong pa ni ma yin no //
translated: And even if some are empty, the entire body and place are not empty of everything.

original: de la don gyi mdo ni 'di yin te gal te chos @215a * //
analyzed: de la don gyi mdo ni 'di yin te gal te chos @215a * //
translated: The point of this passage is as follows.

original: rnams kyi rang bzhin rang bzhin gyis stong par mthong na ni phyin ci log gi stong pa nyid la zhugs pa yin par bstan te /
analyzed: rnams kyi rang bzhin rang bzhin gyis stong par mthong na ni phyin ci log gi stong pa nyid la zhugs pa yin par bstan te /

analyzed: chos 'dul ba 'di las 'das te thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: You will be expelled from this doctrine and discipline.

original: gal te kha cig ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyis yod par mthong la kha cig ni med par mthong ba dang / yod pa de yang med pa dang / gtan bral ba dang / yod par yang res 'ga' kha cig dang bral la res 'ga' ni kha cig dang ma bral bar mthong ba 'di ni yang dag pa ji lta ba dang /

analyzed: de la 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis bsgom pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The cultivation of emptiness by the mundane path is as follows.üîΩA noble ≈õrƒÅvaka who is abiding in solitude does not form the notion of a village or of a person.

original: 'phags pa nyan thos rab tu dben pa na gnas pas grong dang mi'i 'du shes ma byas nas de'i 'og tu dgon pa'i 'du shes yid la byed de de ni rang gi lus la dang 'di snyam du sems te 'du shes kyi rnam pa 'di ni ming dangüîΩgrong gi 'du shes kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: 'phags pa nyan thos rab tu dben pa na gnas pas grong dang mi'i 'du shes ma byas nas de'i 'og tu dgon pa'i 'du shes yid la byed de de ni rang gi lus la dang 'di snyam du sems te 'du shes kyi rnam pa 'di ni ming dang grong gi 'du shes kyis stong ngo //
translated: He thinks, ‚ÄúThis aspect of conception is empty of the notion of a village and the notion of a person.‚Äù

original: 'di la mi stong pa yang yod de 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di la mi stong pa yang yod de 'di lta ste /
translated: But it is not the case that everything is empty.

original: dgon pa'i 'du shes kyi rkyen gyis dgon pa'i 'du shes dang / mtshungs par ldan pa'i tshor ba dang sems pas mi stong ngo snyam mo //
analyzed: dgon pa'i 'du shes kyi rkyen gyis dgon pa'i 'du shes dang / mtshungs par ldan pa'i tshor ba dang sems pas mi stong ngo snyam mo //
translated: He thinks, ‚ÄúThe perception of the wilderness is not empty of the perception of the wilderness, nor of the feelings and volitions associated with it.‚Äù

original: 'du shes kyi rnam pa de nyid las kyang rags pa ma zhi bar gnas pa'i rims nad lta bu kha cig gis stong la ches cha phra bas ni mi stong par mthong ngo //üîΩdes shing dang / rtsva dang / nags tshal dang / ri dang / ri dags dang bya rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rnam pa 'dzin pa'i tshul gyis dgon pa'i 'du shes yid la ma byas nas sa'i 'du shes rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rnam pa ma yin pa yid la byed do //
analyzed: 'du shes kyi rnam pa de nyid las kyang rags pa ma zhi bar gnas pa'i rims nad lta bu kha cig gis stong la ches cha phra bas ni mi stong par mthong ngo // des shing dang / rtsva dang / nags tshal dang / ri dang / ri dags dang bya rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rnam pa 'dzin pa'i tshul gyis dgon pa'i 'du shes yid la ma byas nas sa'i 'du shes rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rnam pa ma yin pa yid la byed do //
translated: He sees that the gross aspects of that perception are empty, like a contagious disease that has not been pacified, but that the very subtle aspects are not empty.üîΩHe does not attend to the perception of the wilderness in the form of trees, grass, forests, mountains, and various kinds of animals and birds, but attends to the perception of the earth in various ways.

original: gzhan yang sa'i 'du shes mi mnyam pa dang / mthon dman can dang / tsher ma dang / gseg ma dang / gyo mo mang po 'dzin pa'i rnam pa yid la ma byas nas /
analyzed: gzhan yang sa'i 'du shes mi mnyam pa dang / mthon dman can dang / tsher ma dang / gseg ma dang / gyo mo mang po 'dzin pa'i rnam pa yid la ma byas nas /
translated: He does not attend to the perception of the earth in the form of uneven, high, and low places, or in the form of thorns, pebbles, and gravel.

original: 'jam zhing mnyam la lag mthil gyi rnam pa lta bur 'dug pa yid la byed do //
analyzed: 'jam zhing mnyam la lag mthil gyi rnam pa lta bur 'dug pa yid la byed do //
translated: He attends to the fact that it is smooth and even, like the surface of the palm of the hand.

original: de'i 'og tu gzugs kyi 'du shes spangs nas nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi 'du shes dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi 'du shes yid la byed do //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu gzugs kyi 'du shes spangs nas nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi 'du shes dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi 'du shes yid la byed do //
translated: Then, having abandoned the notion of form, he attends to the notion of the sphere of infinite space, the notion of the sphere of infinite consciousness, and the notion of the sphere of nothingness.

original: de'i 'og tu 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched mtshan ma med pa yid la byed de //üîΩthams cad du yang snga ma bzhin du stong pa nyid du 'phar zhing 'og ma la ni rags par 'du shes la gong ma la ni ches @215b zhi bar 'du shes te 'di ni 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis ci yang med pa'i skye mched bar gyi 'dod chags
analyzed: de'i 'og tu 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched mtshan ma med pa yid la byed de // thams cad du yang snga ma bzhin du stong pa nyid du 'phar zhing 'og ma la ni rags par 'du shes la gong ma la ni ches @215b zhi bar 'du shes te 'di ni 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis ci yang med pa'i skye mched bar gyi 'dod chags
translated: Then, he attends to the signless sphere of neither-perception-nor-non-perception.

original: dang bral bar gyur pa'i phyir 'phags pa nyan thos kyi stong pa nyid bsgom pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dang bral bar gyur pa'i phyir 'phags pa nyan thos kyi stong pa nyid bsgom pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Everywhere, as before, he leaps over to emptiness. He perceives the lower sphere as coarse and the higher sphere as peaceful. This is the cultivation of emptiness by the noble disciple through the mundane path, up to the sphere of nothingness, in order to become free from attachment to the sphere of infinite consciousness.

original: de'i 'og tu 'phags pa'i lam gyi rnam pa mi rtag pa'i rnam pa la sogs pa la brlan nas 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu 'phags pa'i lam gyi rnam pa mi rtag pa'i rnam pa la sogs pa la brlan nas 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur te /
translated: Then, having been moistened by the aspects of the noble path, such as impermanence, he becomes free from attachment to the base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception.

original: de ni rang gi lus la 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de ni rang gi lus la 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Then he thinks about his own body in this way:

original: 'du shes kyi rnam pa ni 'di lta ste zag pa thams cad kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: 'du shes kyi rnam pa ni 'di lta ste zag pa thams cad kyis stong ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúThe aspect of perception is empty of all defilements.

original: gcig tu nges par zhi ba'i phyir rims nad med pa'o //
analyzed: gcig tu nges par zhi ba'i phyir rims nad med pa'o //
translated: It is without disease because it is definitely one-sidedly peaceful.

original: 'di la mi stong ba yang yod de /
analyzed: 'di la mi stong ba yang yod de /
translated: There is also something that is not empty here.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is this:

original: gnas 'di nyid kyi rkyen gyis skye mched drug gcig la gcig gis mi stong ngo snyam ste /
analyzed: gnas 'di nyid kyi rkyen gyis skye mched drug gcig la gcig gis mi stong ngo snyam ste /
translated: By the condition of this very base, the six sense spheres are not empty of each other.

original: tshe'i tshad ji srid gnas pa'i bar du rkyen las byung ba dag go //
analyzed: tshe'i tshad ji srid gnas pa'i bar du rkyen las byung ba dag go //
translated: For as long as life lasts, they arise from conditions.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni byang chub sems dpar gyur pa na yang stong pa nyid la shas cher gnas pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub yang dag par bsgrubs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni byang chub sems dpar gyur pa na yang stong pa nyid la shas cher gnas pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub yang dag par bsgrubs te /
translated: The Blessed One, even when he was a bodhisattva, by abiding greatly in emptiness, accomplished unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba yid la byed pa la gnas pas ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba yid la byed pa la gnas pas ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: But this is not so for one who is intent on impermanence and suffering.

original: de ltar byang chub rnyed pa na yang gnas pa de mchog yin pa dang / sngon de la goms pa'i rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir de nyid kyis shas cher gnas par mdzad do //
analyzed: de ltar byang chub rnyed pa na yang gnas pa de mchog yin pa dang / sngon de la goms pa'i rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir de nyid kyis shas cher gnas par mdzad do //
translated: And when he has attained enlightenment, he abides in that state, for that is the best, and he follows the practice of his former devotion.

original: stong pa nyid ni gnyis te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni gnyis te /
translated: Emptiness is twofold:

original: mngon sum du bya ba'i stong pa nyid dang / bsgom pa'i stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: mngon sum du bya ba'i stong pa nyid dang / bsgom pa'i stong pa nyid do //
translated: the emptiness that is to be realized and the emptiness that is to be cultivated.

original: dge slong 'du 'dzi'i gnas pas gnas pa la ni rnam pa gnyis 'grub par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: dge slong 'du 'dzi'i gnas pas gnas pa la ni rnam pa gnyis 'grub par mi 'gyur te /

analyzed: mngon sum du bya ba'i stong pa nyid mngon sum du bya ba dang / bsgom par bya ba'i stong pa nyid bsgom pa'o // rnam pa gnyis po mi 'grub pa'i rgyus ni bde ba rnam pa bzhi las yongs su nyams par 'gyur bar rig par bya ste /
translated: he does not realize the emptiness that is to be realized, nor does he cultivate the emptiness that is to be cultivated.üîΩAnd because he does not accomplish these two, he falls away from the four kinds of happiness.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: What are the four kinds of happiness?

original: yongs su 'dzin pa thams cad las gyur ba'i rnam par chags pa'i sdug bsngal las nges par grol ba'i nges par 'byung ba'i bde ba dang / 'dod pa'i 'dun pa dang / gnod sems las rnam par grol ba'i bsam gtan dang po'i dben pa'i bde ba dang /üîΩrtag pa dang dpyod pa nye bar zhi bar byed pa'i nye bar zhi ba'i bde ba dang / rnam par grol ba rnam pa gnyis @216a * //

translated: the happiness of renunciation, which is the definite liberation from the suffering of attachment that arises from all forms of grasping; the happiness of seclusion, which is the first meditative concentration that is liberated from the desire for sense pleasures and from malice;

original: kyis bsdus pa dang / nye bar len pa med cing yongs su yi 'chad pa med pas bsdus pa'i rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bde ba'o //
analyzed: kyis bsdus pa dang / nye bar len pa med cing yongs su yi 'chad pa med pas bsdus pa'i rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bde ba'o //
translated: the happiness of tranquility, which is the pacification of discursive thought; and the happiness of perfect enlightenment, which is included in the two kinds of liberation and is not subject to grasping or to despair.

original: de la rnam par grol ba rnam pa gnyis ni dus dang sbyor ba'i sdug pa dang / bskyod du med pa'i sems rnam par grol ba'o //
analyzed: de la rnam par grol ba rnam pa gnyis ni dus dang sbyor ba'i sdug pa dang / bskyod du med pa'i sems rnam par grol ba'o //
translated: The two kinds of liberation are liberation through the application of time and liberation through the unshakable mind.

translated: Because arhats with dull intellectual faculty are subject to complete degeneration from mundane meditative attainment, they are called ‚Äúthose who attain liberation of mind through enjoyment that is timely‚Äù in order to be liberated from the obscurations of meditative attainment.

original: gal te dgra bcom pa dbang po rno ba'i phyir 'jig rten pa'i ting nge 'dzin las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ba'i chos can zhig yin na ni de'i nges pa'i don la dus kyi don zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te dgra bcom pa dbang po rno ba'i phyir 'jig rten pa'i ting nge 'dzin las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ba'i chos can zhig yin na ni de'i nges pa'i don la dus kyi don zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //

original: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //

translated: There, the absence of appropriation and the absence of despair is the non-apprehension of any form whatsoever, in which the mind of the Arhat would delight, or in which, through change and transformation, sorrow, etc. would arise.

original: de la mngon sum du bya ba'i stong pa nyid ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la mngon sum du bya ba'i stong pa nyid ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There, the emptiness of direct realization is twofold:

analyzed: phyi rol stong pa nyid dang / nang stong pa nyid do //
translated: the emptiness of external things and the emptiness of internal things.

analyzed: de la phyi rol stong pa nyid ni spyir na gzugs kyi 'du shes rnam pa lnga ste 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga dang ldan pa las 'das nas /

analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba mngon sum du bya'o //

analyzed: de la nang stong pa nyid ni nang gi 'du byed rnams la nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal spang ba mngon sum du bya ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: The emptiness of the internal is the actualization of the abandonment of the pride I am, in regard to the internal formative forces.

original: de la bsgom par bya ba'i stong pa nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la bsgom par bya ba'i stong pa nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the emptiness of the object of contemplation?üîΩ It should be known as twofold:

original: de yang rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: the contemplation of the internal and the contemplation of the external.üîΩ The contemplation of the internal is the contemplation of the internal sense-fields, and the contemplation of the external is the contemplation of the external sense-fields.

original: nang dang phyi rol gyi yul la bdag med par mthong ba dang / de nyid la mi rtag par mthong ba'o //
analyzed: nang dang phyi rol gyi yul la bdag med par mthong ba dang / de nyid la mi rtag par mthong ba'o //
translated: The contemplation of the internal and the external is the contemplation of the sense-fields of the eye, etc. to: the mind, and of form, etc. to: mental objects.

original: de la @216b stong pa nyid rnam pa bzhi po 'di dag gi rten yang rnam pa bzhi yod par rig par bya ste /

translated: The contemplation of the great is the contemplation of the four elements.üîΩ The contemplation of the far-reaching is the contemplation of the sense-fields of the eye, etc. to: the mind, and of form, etc. to: mental objects, in the past, future and present.üîΩ The contemplation of the beginningless and endless is the contemplation of the sense-fields of the eye, etc. to: the mind, and of form, etc. to: mental objects, in the past, future and present, as being without beginning and end.üîΩ The contemplation of the absence of one's own-nature is the contemplation of the sense-fields of the eye, etc. to: the mind, and of form, etc. to: mental objects, in the past, future and present, as being without own-being.üîΩ The contemplation of the absence of another's nature is the contemplation of the sense-fields of the eye, etc. to: the mind, and of form, etc. to: mental objects, in the past, future and present, as being without another's nature.üîΩ The contemplation of the absence of both one's own and another's nature is the contemplation of the sense-fields of the eye, etc. to: the mind, and of form, etc. to: mental objects, in the past, future and present, as being without both one's own and another's nature.üîΩ The contemplation of the absence of the

original: de la phyi stong pa nyid kyi rten ni nang gi sems gnas pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo nas dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde bas lus brlan pa dang nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal yongs su shes pa'o //
analyzed: de la phyi stong pa nyid kyi rten ni nang gi sems gnas pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo nas dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde bas lus brlan pa dang nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal yongs su shes pa'o //
translated: The basis of external emptiness is the thorough knowledge of the body's moisture and the pride of I, through the joy and bliss born of solitude by means of the door of samadhi, the inner mind's stability.

original: nang stong pa nyid kyi rten ni nang dang phyi rol gyi chos rnams la bdag med par mthong ba'o //
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid kyi rten ni nang dang phyi rol gyi chos rnams la bdag med par mthong ba'o //
translated: The basis of internal emptiness is the vision of the selflessness of internal and external phenomena.

original: bdag med par mthong ba'i rten ni de dag nyid la mi rtag par mthong ba'o //
analyzed: bdag med par mthong ba'i rten ni de dag nyid la mi rtag par mthong ba'o //
translated: The basis of the vision of selflessness is the vision of those very phenomena as impermanent.

original: mi rtag par mthong ba'i rten ni dam pa'i chos thos pa dang tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: mi rtag par mthong ba'i rten ni dam pa'i chos thos pa dang tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'o //
translated: The basis of the vision of impermanence is hearing the sublime teaching and proper attention.

original: de la 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bar bya ba la brtson pa'i dge slong ni dpyod pa'i yid la byed pa'i dbang du byas nas sdug pa'i mtshan ma 'dod pa dang ldan pa yid la byed de /

translated: Therein, a monk who strives to become free from attachment to the desire realm, in terms of the attention of investigation, attends to the signs of beauty associated with desire.

original: des lam dang phyi stong pa nyid mngon sum du ma byas pa dang / legs par ma bsgoms pa dang / bstan pa la gzhol ba'i phyir /
analyzed: des lam dang phyi stong pa nyid mngon sum du ma byas pa dang / legs par ma bsgoms pa dang / bstan pa la gzhol ba'i phyir /
translated: has not cultivated it well, and has not devoted himself to the teaching,

original: phyi stong pa nyid la mngon par dga' ba'i tshul gyis sems mi 'jug ste /
analyzed: phyi stong pa nyid la mngon par dga' ba'i tshul gyis sems mi 'jug ste /
