original: de nga'o snyam pa'i sgo nas der sems 'phro bar mthong nas /
analyzed: de nga'o snyam pa'i sgo nas der sems 'phro bar mthong nas /
translated: Seeing that his mind is scattered in the form of the thought ‚ÄúI am,‚Äù

original: nang stong pa nyid la zhi ba'o snyam du yid la byed do //
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid la zhi ba'o snyam du yid la byed do //
translated: he attends to internal emptiness, thinking ‚Äúthis is peaceful.‚Äù

original: des nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal yang spangs la lam yang legs par ma bsgoms pas de la yang sems mi 'jug ste /
analyzed: des nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal yang spangs la lam yang legs par ma bsgoms pas de la yang sems mi 'jug ste /
translated: Since he has abandoned the pride that thinks ‚ÄúI am‚Äù and has not cultivated the path well, his mind does not engage with that.

original: des nang dang phyi rol gyi 'du byed rnams la bdag med pa mthong ba sgom par byed de /
analyzed: des nang dang phyi rol gyi 'du byed rnams la bdag med pa mthong ba sgom par byed de /
translated: He cultivates the insight that internal and external formations are selfless.

original: des bdag med pa mthong ba legs par ma bsgoms pas de la yang sems mi 'jug go //
analyzed: des bdag med pa mthong ba legs par ma bsgoms pas de la yang sems mi 'jug go //
translated: Since he has not cultivated well the insight that they are selfless, his mind does not engage with that.

original: de nang dang phyi rol de dag nyid la mi rtag par mthong bas mi g-yo ba'i sems sgom par byed de /
analyzed: de nang dang phyi rol de dag nyid la mi rtag par mthong bas mi g-yo ba'i sems sgom par byed de /
translated: He cultivates the thought that is unshaken by seeing those internal and external phenomena as impermanent.

original: 'du byed rnams la mi rtag par mthong bas rnam pa thams cad du g-yo bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams la mi rtag par mthong bas rnam pa thams cad du g-yo bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Since one sees formations as impermanent, one does not move in any way.

original: de bas na mi rtag par mthong ba la mi g-yo ba'i khams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na mi rtag par mthong ba la mi g-yo ba'i khams zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, seeing as impermanent is called the ‚Äúimmovable element.‚ÄùüîΩWhen one does not delight in those abodes, one realizes them with right wisdom.

original: des gnas de dag la sems ma mos par yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis rtogs nas sems de mi sdug pa la dmigs pa'am /
analyzed: des gnas de dag la sems ma mos par yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis rtogs nas sems de mi sdug pa la dmigs pa'am /
translated: One focuses the mind on the repulsive,

original: byams pa la dmigs pa'am /
analyzed: byams pa la dmigs pa'am /
translated: or one focuses the mind on loving kindness,

original: dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba la dmigs pa'am /
analyzed: dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba la dmigs pa'am /
translated: or one focuses the mind on the in-and-out breath,üîΩor one focuses the mind on the impermanence of all formations.

original: 'du byed thams cad mi rtag pa la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin la lan mang du byas pa'i rgyus las su rung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad mi rtag pa la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin la lan mang du byas pa'i rgyus las su rung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Through the cause of doing this samƒÅdhi many times, one becomes serviceable.

original: de nas rim gyis thams cad la 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nas rim gyis thams cad la 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: Then, gradually, one engages in everything.

original: @217a * // de'i mngon sum du bya ba'i stong pa nyid mngon sum du bya ba yang yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: @217a * // de'i mngon sum du bya ba'i stong pa nyid mngon sum du bya ba yang yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te /
translated: The emptiness that is to be actualized is also fully actualized.

original: de yongs su rdzogs pa'i rgyus tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa dang / gong ma'i cha dang mthun pa'i kun tu sbyor ba rnams las sems rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yongs su rdzogs pa'i rgyus tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa dang / gong ma'i cha dang mthun pa'i kun tu sbyor ba rnams las sems rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By perfecting that, he becomes liberated from the fetters that are conducive to the lower realms and those that are conducive to the higher realms.

original: bsgom par bya ba'i stong pa nyid bsgom par bya ba yang yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bsgom par bya ba'i stong pa nyid bsgom par bya ba yang yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te /
translated: The cultivation of emptiness that is to be cultivated also becomes perfected.

original: de yongs su rdzogs par gyur ba'i rgyus mi slob pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba la sogs pa'i chos rnams dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yongs su rdzogs par gyur ba'i rgyus mi slob pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba la sogs pa'i chos rnams dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: By perfecting that, he becomes endowed with the dharmas of the non-learner, such as right view.

original: gang gi tshe mi 'jug pa de'i bar du ni so so'i skye bo'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: gang gi tshe mi 'jug pa de'i bar du ni so so'i skye bo'i gnas skabs so //
translated: As long as he does not enter, that is the stage of the ordinary person.

original: gang gi tshe 'jug pa de ni slob pa'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'jug pa de ni slob pa'i gnas skabs so //
translated: When he enters, that is the stage of the learner.

original: gang gi tshe sgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba de ni mi slob pa'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: gang gi tshe sgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba de ni mi slob pa'i gnas skabs so //
translated: When the cultivation becomes perfected, that is the stage of the non-learner.

original: de ni sgom pa yongs su rdzogs pa la zhugs shing sems g-yos pas dge ba'i rtog pa la rtog par byed do //
analyzed: de ni sgom pa yongs su rdzogs pa la zhugs shing sems g-yos pas dge ba'i rtog pa la rtog par byed do //
translated: Engaged in perfecting the cultivation, he contemplates virtuous thoughts with a moving mind.

original: de la yang tshod shes shing kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i gtam byed do //
analyzed: de la yang tshod shes shing kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i gtam byed do //
translated: He also knows the right amount of conversation and his conversation is never defiled.

original: yang dag pa'i 'chag sar 'chag par byed do //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i 'chag sar 'chag par byed do //
translated: He walks on a path that is suitable for walking.

original: yang dag par stan la 'dug la thams cad du 'ang tshod shes te de ltar na 'di ni 'di'i rgyu zhing 'gro ba dag pa yin no //
analyzed: yang dag par stan la 'dug la thams cad du 'ang tshod shes te de ltar na 'di ni 'di'i rgyu zhing 'gro ba dag pa yin no //
translated: He sits on a seat that is suitable for sitting. In all these cases he knows the right amount. This is the purity of his going and coming.

original: gnas pa dag pa ni snga ma yin no //
analyzed: gnas pa dag pa ni snga ma yin no //
translated: The purity of his staying is as above.

original: bar skabs dag tu yang spyod pa yid la byed pas nyon mongs pa kun du spyod pa la so sor brtag cing sems rnam par spyong ste /
analyzed: bar skabs dag tu yang spyod pa yid la byed pas nyon mongs pa kun du spyod pa la so sor brtag cing sems rnam par spyong ste /
translated: In the intervals he attends to his practice and examines his conduct with regard to the afflictions. He purifies his mind.

original: 'di dag ni gcig tu nges pa'i dkar po'i chos rnams yin te /
analyzed: 'di dag ni gcig tu nges pa'i dkar po'i chos rnams yin te /
translated: These are the pure white dharmas.

original: de dag dang ldan na bdud dang phyir rgol ba rnams kyis mi tshugs la sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnam pa bzhis mi 'phrogs te /
analyzed: de dag dang ldan na bdud dang phyir rgol ba rnams kyis mi tshugs la sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnam pa bzhis mi 'phrogs te /
translated: When he possesses them, he is not overcome by Mara or his army. He is not carried away by the four bad, unwholesome states.

original: yang srid par skye ba'i rang bzhin gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa can rnams dang / tshe 'di la lus dang sems yongs su gdung ba dang / ngan song gi rgyu'i rang bzhin dang / skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi rgyu'i rang bzhin gyis so //
analyzed: yang srid par skye ba'i rang bzhin gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa can rnams dang / tshe 'di la lus dang sems yongs su gdung ba dang / ngan song gi rgyu'i rang bzhin dang / skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi rgyu'i rang bzhin gyis so //
translated: and those that are the cause of the suffering of birth, etc.

original: gtam ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gtam ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Conversation is of two kinds:

original: sgra tsam la mos pa'i rjes su 'brang ba dang / chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos la nan tan du sgrub pa'i rjes su 'brang ba'o //
analyzed: sgra tsam la mos pa'i rjes su 'brang ba dang / chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos la nan tan du sgrub pa'i rjes su 'brang ba'o //
translated: that which is pursued by those who follow the faith through mere words, and that which is pursued by those who follow the Dharma through the practice of the Dharma.

original: de la snga ma ni tshes kyi lung nod pa dang / kha ston du byed pa dang / kun tu 'dri ba dang / yongs su 'dri ba dang / 'chang bas phye ba'o //
analyzed: de la snga ma ni tshes kyi lung nod pa dang / kha ston du byed pa dang / kun tu 'dri ba dang / yongs su 'dri ba dang / 'chang bas phye ba'o //
translated: The former is distinguished by the recitation of the Dharma, by teaching, by questioning, and by memorizing.

original: cig @217b shos ni dmigs pa'i gnas dang / sems rnam par grol ba'i man ngag gis phye ba ste /
analyzed: cig @217b shos ni dmigs pa'i gnas dang / sems rnam par grol ba'i man ngag gis phye ba ste /
translated: The latter is distinguished by the instruction in the object of meditation and in the means of liberation of thought.

original: de'i don du de bzhin gshegs pa rnams 'byung ba dang / nyan thos rnams kyang bstan pa'i rjes su 'jug cing dge ba'i chos de dag gis yang dag par sbyor bar byed do //üîΩchos 'dul ba gang la tshangs par spyod pa la gnas pa gtan med pa de la ni tshangs par spyod pa yang med de de la ni tshangs par spyad pa dang / tshangs par spyod pa yang med pa la ni phan tshun slob dpon dang /üîΩslob ma'i tshul du khas blangs pa rnams kyis log par sgrub pa gang yin pa de slob dpon la gnod pa'am /
analyzed: de'i don du de bzhin gshegs pa rnams 'byung ba dang / nyan thos rnams kyang bstan pa'i rjes su 'jug cing dge ba'i chos de dag gis yang dag par sbyor bar byed do // chos 'dul ba gang la tshangs par spyod pa la gnas pa gtan med pa de la ni tshangs par spyod pa yang med de de la ni tshangs par spyad pa dang / tshangs par spyod pa yang med pa la ni phan tshun slob dpon dang / slob ma'i tshul du khas blangs pa rnams kyis log par sgrub pa gang yin pa de slob dpon la gnod pa'am /
translated: For that purpose, the Tathagatas appear, and the Sravakas also follow the teaching and apply themselves to those virtuous qualities.üîΩIn that discipline of Dharma where the holy life is completely non-existent, there is no holy life. There, where there is no holy life, and where there is no one who lives the holy life, there is mutual harm from those who have taken up the role of teacher and student.

original: nye gnas la gnod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nye gnas la gnod par 'gyur ro //
translated: That is harm to the teacher, or harm to the student.

original: 'di la ni gnyi ga yod do //
analyzed: 'di la ni gnyi ga yod do //
translated: Here, both exist.

original: de la 'bras bu chen po dang / phan yon chen po'i stong pa nyid mngon sum du bya ba dang / bsgom pa btang ste /
analyzed: de la 'bras bu chen po dang / phan yon chen po'i stong pa nyid mngon sum du bya ba dang / bsgom pa btang ste /
translated: There, the cultivation of the emptiness of great fruit and great benefit is abandoned.

original: dma' zhing kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'i rnyed pa dang bkur sti'i ro myang bas 'phrog cing log par sgrub pa gang yin pa de ni tshangs par spyod pa'i gnod pa chen pos gnod par byas par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: dma' zhing kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'i rnyed pa dang bkur sti'i ro myang bas 'phrog cing log par sgrub pa gang yin pa de ni tshangs par spyod pa'i gnod pa chen pos gnod par byas par rig par bya ste /
translated: The one who is carried away by the taste of low, contemptible gain and honor, and who is wrongly practiced, should be known as one who is harmed by the great harm of pure conduct.

original: de ltar rnyed pa dang bkur sti la zhen pa de ni bdag nyid la yang gnod pa byed do //
analyzed: de ltar rnyed pa dang bkur sti la zhen pa de ni bdag nyid la yang gnod pa byed do //
translated: Thus, the one who is attached to gain and honor harms himself.

original: rnam par thar ba dang mthun pa'i gtam de yang nyan par mi 'dod la ston pa na yang rna blags par mi byed do //
analyzed: rnam par thar ba dang mthun pa'i gtam de yang nyan par mi 'dod la ston pa na yang rna blags par mi byed do //
translated: He does not want to hear the talk that is in accord with liberation, and when it is being taught, he does not lend an ear.

original: de nyan par byed na yang rnyed pa dang bkur sti'i ched du nyan par byed kyi shes par bya ba'i sems kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyan par byed na yang rnyed pa dang bkur sti'i ched du nyan par byed kyi shes par bya ba'i sems kyis ni ma yin no //
translated: Even if he does listen, he listens for the sake of gain and honor, not with the intention of understanding.

original: nan tan du sgrub par yang mi byed la ma dul ba'i phyir gzhan dul bar yang mi byed pa dang / mya ngan las bzla ba'i bar du yang mi byed de /
analyzed: nan tan du sgrub par yang mi byed la ma dul ba'i phyir gzhan dul bar yang mi byed pa dang / mya ngan las bzla ba'i bar du yang mi byed de /
translated: He does not practice earnestly, and because he is undisciplined, he does not discipline others, up to he does not liberate from suffering.

original: de ltar na des ni ston pa'i dgra bzhin du kun du spyod pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na des ni ston pa'i dgra bzhin du kun du spyod pa yin te /
translated: Thus, he acts like an enemy of the Teacher.

original: phan pa rgya chen pos nye bar gnas pa la lan du gnod pa byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan pa rgya chen pos nye bar gnas pa la lan du gnod pa byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he harms the Teacher in return for the great benefit he has received.

original: de la don gyi mdo ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la don gyi mdo ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this verse is summarized as follows:üîΩHaving gone forth in the well-proclaimed Dharma and Vinaya, he does not engage in the four types of practice that he should cultivate.

original: legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu byung nas nas des ci nas bdag gis nan tan du bsgrub par bya ba de lta bu la rnam pa bzhis ma zhugs pa dang / ci nas ston pa la nan tan du bsgrub par bya ba dang /
analyzed: legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu byung nas nas des ci nas bdag gis nan tan du bsgrub par bya ba de lta bu la rnam pa bzhis ma zhugs pa dang / ci nas ston pa la nan tan du bsgrub par bya ba dang /
translated: He does not engage in the practice that the Teacher should cultivate.

original: gang gis bstan pa la rab tu byung ba de lta bur ma zhugs te /
analyzed: gang gis bstan pa la rab tu byung ba de lta bur ma zhugs te /
translated: He does not engage in the practice that one who has gone forth in the teachings should cultivate.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: That is to say,

original: 'dre bar gnas pa dang / sgra tsam la mos pa'i rjes su 'brang ba'i gtam gyis @218a * //
analyzed: 'dre bar gnas pa dang / sgra tsam la mos pa'i rjes su 'brang ba'i gtam gyis @218a * //
translated: he engages in socializing and follows the talk of those who are devoted to mere sound.

original: rjes su 'brang ba dang / rnyed pa dang bkur sti la zhen pa dang / de la zhen pa'i dbang gis byung bas dam pa'i chos mnyan par byed kyi bdag la phan pa dang / gzhan la phan pa sgrub pa'i phyir ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su 'brang ba dang / rnyed pa dang bkur sti la zhen pa dang / de la zhen pa'i dbang gis byung bas dam pa'i chos mnyan par byed kyi bdag la phan pa dang / gzhan la phan pa sgrub pa'i phyir ma yin pa'o //
translated: They listen to the Dharma out of attachment to followers, gain, and fame, and because of that attachment, not in order to benefit themselves or others.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni tshogs yongs su sdud par bzhed pa'i phyir tshogs nye bar 'dzin par mi mdzad kyi sems can rnams la thugs brtse ba 'ba' zhig gi phyir te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni tshogs yongs su sdud par bzhed pa'i phyir tshogs nye bar 'dzin par mi mdzad kyi sems can rnams la thugs brtse ba 'ba' zhig gi phyir te /
translated: The Tathagata does not accept offerings in order to gather a following, but out of compassion for sentient beings.

original: gang gi phyir log par sgrub pa'i nyan thos rnams la yid bsrung ba med par ngo bzlog phod par mdzad de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir log par sgrub pa'i nyan thos rnams la yid bsrung ba med par ngo bzlog phod par mdzad de /
translated: He does not protect his mind from the wrongdoings of the disciples, but rather he is able to turn them away.

original: nyan thos rnams la ngo bzlog phod pa de dang / rtsub la phan par gsungs pa des chos 'dul ba 'di las phyir ldog par gyur du zin kyang de ni de dag la ches phan par 'gyur gyi 'di la gnas pa rnam pa log par sgrub pa ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos rnams la ngo bzlog phod pa de dang / rtsub la phan par gsungs pa des chos 'dul ba 'di las phyir ldog par gyur du zin kyang de ni de dag la ches phan par 'gyur gyi 'di la gnas pa rnam pa log par sgrub pa ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: The Buddha's words are harsh but beneficial, and even if they turn away from this Dharma and Vinaya, it would be of great benefit to them, unlike those who turn away from this Dharma and Vinaya.üîΩThe summary:

original: sdom ni / 'dod chags bral dang ma bral dang // rgyu dang rkyen dang lam dang ni //
analyzed: sdom ni / 'dod chags bral dang ma bral dang // rgyu dang rkyen dang lam dang ni //
translated: Free from desire, not free, cause, condition, path,

original: srog la yid ni mi brtan dang // kun tu chags pa'i gnas rgyas pa //üîΩdge slong ni 'dod chags dang bral ba yang rung /
analyzed: srog la yid ni mi brtan dang // kun tu chags pa'i gnas rgyas pa // dge slong ni 'dod chags dang bral ba yang rung /
translated: Life, mind, unstable, and expanding the basis of attachment.üîΩA monk, whether free from desire

original: 'dod chags dang ma bral ba yang rung ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang ma bral ba yang rung ste /
translated: or not free from desire,

original: 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga dang / yid kyis shes par bya ba'i yul mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i chos rnams la dus gsum du kun nas dkris pa rnam pa gsum dang / de'i rtsa ba bag la nyal gyis kun nas nyon mongs par gyur na tshe 'di la yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ba'i skal ba med do //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga dang / yid kyis shes par bya ba'i yul mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i chos rnams la dus gsum du kun nas dkris pa rnam pa gsum dang / de'i rtsa ba bag la nyal gyis kun nas nyon mongs par gyur na tshe 'di la yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ba'i skal ba med do //
translated: The three types of entanglements with regard to the five sense pleasures and the phenomena of the stage of meditative equipoise that are objects of mental consciousness, and the defilement by the latent afflictions that are their roots, make it impossible to attain nirvana in this life.

original: de la 'das pa'i dus kyi sgo nas ni de la rnam par shes pa brten to //
analyzed: de la 'das pa'i dus kyi sgo nas ni de la rnam par shes pa brten to //
translated: In this regard, consciousness is based on the past.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi sgo nas ni de la rag las so //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi sgo nas ni de la rag las so //
translated: It is dependent on the future.

original: da ltar gyi dus kyi sgo nas ni de la mngon par zhen to //
analyzed: da ltar gyi dus kyi sgo nas ni de la mngon par zhen to //
translated: It is attached to the present.

original: de'i rtsa ba bag la nyal de'i rgyud la yod pa dang rjes su 'brel pas ni rnam par shes pa de nye bar len par byed do //
analyzed: de'i rtsa ba bag la nyal de'i rgyud la yod pa dang rjes su 'brel pas ni rnam par shes pa de nye bar len par byed do //
translated: That consciousness is appropriated because of the presence of the latent afflictions that are its roots and because of their connection with the continuum.

original: de las bzlog pa ni kun nas nyon mongs par ma gyur na tshe 'di la yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur pa'i skal pa can yin no //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni kun nas nyon mongs par ma gyur na tshe 'di la yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur pa'i skal pa can yin no //
translated: Those who are the opposite of that, who are not defiled, are fortunate to attain complete nirvana in this life.

original: bzhi po 'di dag ni chos 'dul ba 'di la zhugs pa rnams kyis tshul bzhin du 'dri ba yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: bzhi po 'di dag ni chos 'dul ba 'di la zhugs pa rnams kyis tshul bzhin du 'dri ba yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: These four are to be known as the proper questions asked by those who have entered this discipline of the Dharma.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: khyim bdag gam /
analyzed: khyim bdag gam /
translated: a householder or

original: khyim bdag gi bu dad pa can dang / dge slong thos pas @218b byang ba dang / ston pa'i drung na 'dug cing bsnyen bkur byed pa dang / ston pa nyid de /
analyzed: khyim bdag gi bu dad pa can dang / dge slong thos pas @218b byang ba dang / ston pa'i drung na 'dug cing bsnyen bkur byed pa dang / ston pa nyid de /
translated: a householder's son who has faith, a monk who is learned, one who sits in the presence of the Teacher and serves him, and the Teacher himself.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni nyan thos zhu bar ni 'dod la bag tsha ba dang / mi shes pa'i don mngon par gzigs pa'i phyir nye bar gnas pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i nyes pa bsal ba dang / dam pa'i chos yun ring du gnas par mdzad pa'i phyir mkhyen bzhin du rgyu rnam pa gnyis kyis nyan thos la 'dri bar mdzad do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni nyan thos zhu bar ni 'dod la bag tsha ba dang / mi shes pa'i don mngon par gzigs pa'i phyir nye bar gnas pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i nyes pa bsal ba dang / dam pa'i chos yun ring du gnas par mdzad pa'i phyir mkhyen bzhin du rgyu rnam pa gnyis kyis nyan thos la 'dri bar mdzad do //
translated: The Tathagata asks the Sravakas about the six sense bases, knowing the answer, for two reasons: in order to remove the faults of the present and future that are seen in the desire to question the Sravakas, and in order to remove the faults of the present and future that are seen in the desire to question the Sravakas, and in order to make the true Dharma last a long time.

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug po rnams kyi ni rgyu rnam pa gnyis kyi skye mched drug ni rgyu yin la phyi rol gyi skye mched rnams ni rkyen zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug po rnams kyi ni rgyu rnam pa gnyis kyi skye mched drug ni rgyu yin la phyi rol gyi skye mched rnams ni rkyen zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The six sense bases are the cause of the six collections of consciousness, and the external sense bases are the conditions.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: This is how it is:

original: skye mched drug ni de dag gi sa bon gyi gnas yin pa dang / ji ltar thob pa'i skye mched gcig tu nges par rnam pa gcig tu 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye mched drug ni de dag gi sa bon gyi gnas yin pa dang / ji ltar thob pa'i skye mched gcig tu nges par rnam pa gcig tu 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The six sense bases are the abode of the seeds of those consciousnesses, and the sense bases that have been obtained are fixed as one kind, because they are of one kind.

original: yul ni gcig tu rnam pa du mar 'dug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul ni gcig tu rnam pa du mar 'dug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The object is fixed as many kinds, because it is of many kinds.

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad ni spyir na rgyu rnam pa gnyis kyis rig par bya ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad ni spyir na rgyu rnam pa gnyis kyis rig par bya ste /
translated: All the defilements should be known in general through two causes:

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa dang / de'i lam gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa dang / de'i lam gang yin pa'o //
translated: their nature and their path.

original: de la rang bzhin ni 'dun pa'i 'dod chags te kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi rtsa ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la rang bzhin ni 'dun pa'i 'dod chags te kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi rtsa ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Among them, the nature is the desire of craving, because it is the root of all the defilements.

original: de'i lam ni nang dang phyi rol gyi skye mched rnams te /
analyzed: de'i lam ni nang dang phyi rol gyi skye mched rnams te /
translated: Their path is the internal and external sense-spheres,

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i bye brag yin no //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i bye brag yin no //
translated: which are the particularities of the grasped and grasper.

original: dge slong rgyu zhing 'gro ba'am gnas pas gnas gnyis yang dag par mthong bas ni tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa la brten nas /
analyzed: dge slong rgyu zhing 'gro ba'am gnas pas gnas gnyis yang dag par mthong bas ni tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa la brten nas /
translated: A monk who sees two abodes while traveling or staying, on the basis of proper attention,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa gnyis las sems rnam par grol bar bya'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa gnyis las sems rnam par grol bar bya'o //
translated: should liberate his mind from the two kinds of defilements.

original: gnas gnyis po gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnas gnyis po gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two abodes?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: srog la yid mi rton pa dang / mi dge ba'i sems kyis shi na ngan 'gror 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: srog la yid mi rton pa dang / mi dge ba'i sems kyis shi na ngan 'gror 'gro ba'o //
translated: not relying on life and going to a bad rebirth when dying with an unwholesome mind.

original: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa ni gang la brten /
analyzed: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa ni gang la brten /
translated: What is proper mental attention?

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa gnyis po gang las ni sems rnam par grol bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa gnyis po gang las ni sems rnam par grol bar bya zhe na /
translated: From what two kinds of afflictions should the mind be liberated?

original: bdag rang gi skye mched rnams mtshon cha rnam pa sna tshogs kyis btab cing ma rung bar byas kyang sla'i /
analyzed: bdag rang gi skye mched rnams mtshon cha rnam pa sna tshogs kyis btab cing ma rung bar byas kyang sla'i /
translated: ‚ÄúIt would be better if my sense-spheres were cut and destroyed by various kinds of weapons,

original: bdag mi dge ba'i sems kyis shi nas ngan song dag tu skye bar 'gyur ba ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag mi dge ba'i sems kyis shi nas ngan song dag tu skye bar 'gyur ba ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: but not if, with an unwholesome mind, I were to die and be reborn in the lower realms.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúHow can I, endowed with happiness and mental ease,

original: ji ltar byas na bdag bde ba dang ldan pa dang / yid bde ba dang ldan pas mi dge ba kun du spyod pa'i gnyen por yang dag pa la yang dag par @219a * //
analyzed: ji ltar byas na bdag bde ba dang ldan pa dang / yid bde ba dang ldan pas mi dge ba kun du spyod pa'i gnyen por yang dag pa la yang dag par @219a * //
translated: cultivate the correct discernment of what is real as the antidote to engaging in unwholesome actions?‚Äù

original: so sor rtog par 'gyur zhig gu snyam du so sor brtags nas 'du byed rnams mi rtag pa 'ba' zhig sgom par byed de /
analyzed: so sor rtog par 'gyur zhig gu snyam du so sor brtags nas 'du byed rnams mi rtag pa 'ba' zhig sgom par byed de /
translated: Having contemplated in this way, he cultivates the meditation on the impermanence of formations alone.

original: de la rgyu zhing 'gro ba na ni yul gyi mtshan ma 'dzin pa dang / rtags 'dzin pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa las rnam par 'byed do //
analyzed: de la rgyu zhing 'gro ba na ni yul gyi mtshan ma 'dzin pa dang / rtags 'dzin pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa las rnam par 'byed do //
translated: When he is moving about, he is separated from the defilement of grasping the signs of objects and grasping the signs of characteristics.

original: yang na rab tu dben pa na gnas pa na mi dge ba'i rtog pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa las rnam par 'byed do //
analyzed: yang na rab tu dben pa na gnas pa na mi dge ba'i rtog pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa las rnam par 'byed do //
translated: Or else, when he is dwelling in solitude, he is separated from the defilement of unwholesome thoughts.

original: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa dang po ni rgyu lta bu yin la gnyis pa ni 'bras bu lta bu yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa dang po ni rgyu lta bu yin la gnyis pa ni 'bras bu lta bu yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: In this regard, the first defilement should be understood as being like a cause, and the second as being like an effect.

original: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa gnyis la gnas pa la ni gnas gnyis 'byung ba yod de /
analyzed: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa gnyis la gnas pa la ni gnas gnyis 'byung ba yod de /
translated: In this regard, one who is established in the two defilements has two abodes:

original: srog la yid mi rton pa dang / 'chi ba'i tshe kho na ni mi dge ba'i sems kyis shi na ngan 'gror 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: srog la yid mi rton pa dang / 'chi ba'i tshe kho na ni mi dge ba'i sems kyis shi na ngan 'gror 'gro ba'o //
translated: he does not rely on life, and at the time of death, if he dies with an unwholesome mind, he goes to an unhappy rebirth.

original: de bas na skad cig gcig gis kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa gnyis la yang nyes par lta ba dang / ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa drag po bskyed par bya ba na /
analyzed: de bas na skad cig gcig gis kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa gnyis la yang nyes par lta ba dang / ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa drag po bskyed par bya ba na /
translated: Therefore, in regard to the two kinds of defilement, even in a single moment, he should generate a strong sense of guilt and a strong sense of shame.

original: rgyun du 'byung ba lta ci smos /
analyzed: rgyun du 'byung ba lta ci smos /
translated: What need is there to mention their occurrence on a regular basis?üîΩThese are the many afflicted states that are the bases of attachment through which Mara gains entry.

original: 'di dag ni bdud 'jug par 'gyur ba'i kun du chags pa'i gnas kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa mang pos te de dag ni mkhas pas yongs su shes nas yongs su spang bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di dag ni bdud 'jug par 'gyur ba'i kun du chags pa'i gnas kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa mang pos te de dag ni mkhas pas yongs su shes nas yongs su spang bar bya ba yin te /
translated: The wise should fully understand them and then completely abandon them.

original: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'i so so'i skye bo'i snyoms par 'jug pa las byung ba'i bde ba la rag las pa'i skye mched kyi ro myong bar byed pa'i kun du chags pa'i gnas dang / 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la brtan pa'i tshor ba'i sgo nas mngon par dga' ba dang /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'i so so'i skye bo'i snyoms par 'jug pa las byung ba'i bde ba la rag las pa'i skye mched kyi ro myong bar byed pa'i kun du chags pa'i gnas dang / 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la brtan pa'i tshor ba'i sgo nas mngon par dga' ba dang /
translated: The bases of attachment that experience the bliss that arises from the meditative attainment of an ordinary being who is free from attachment to the desire realm, the bases of attachment that delight in the five sense objects of the desire realm through the feeling of stability when one is not free from attachment to the desire realm,

original: mngon par chags pa dang / lhag par zhen pa dang / lhag par zhen pa nas gnas pa'i kun du chags pa'i gnas dang / sems can phan 'dogs pa rnams la rjes su chags pa dang / gnod par byed pa rnams la khong khro ba'i kun du chags pa'i gnas dang /üîΩyul rags shing rgya che ba la 'phrog par byed pa'i bde ba'i gnas dang ; sdug bsngal gyi gnas dus gsum du btsal bar bya ba dang / brtag par bya ba dang / lhag par chags par bya ba'i kun du chags pa'i gnas te /üîΩde la sdug pa dang / yid dang 'thad pa dang / dga' ba dang / yid du 'ong ba rnams kyi dbye ba ni snga ma bzhin du @219b rig par bya'o //üîΩmi sdug pa ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi sgo nas mi 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par chags pa dang / lhag par zhen pa dang / lhag par zhen pa nas gnas pa'i kun du chags pa'i gnas dang / sems can phan 'dogs pa rnams la rjes su chags pa dang / gnod par byed pa rnams la khong khro ba'i kun du chags pa'i gnas dang / yul rags shing rgya che ba la 'phrog par byed pa'i bde ba'i gnas dang ; sdug bsngal gyi gnas dus gsum du btsal bar bya ba dang / brtag par bya ba dang / lhag par chags par bya ba'i kun du chags pa'i gnas te / de la sdug pa dang / yid dang 'thad pa dang / dga' ba dang / yid du 'ong ba rnams kyi dbye ba ni snga ma bzhin du @219b rig par bya'o // mi sdug pa ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi sgo nas mi 'dod pa'o //

original: mi dga' ba ni rjes su dran pa'i yul mi 'dod pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: mi dga' ba ni rjes su dran pa'i yul mi 'dod pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: Disagreeable is from the point of view of the object of recollection that is not desired.

original: yid du mi 'ong ba ni 'dod pa'i tshor ba'i sgo nas so //üîΩsdug bsngal ba yang yul mi 'dod pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: yid du mi 'ong ba ni 'dod pa'i tshor ba'i sgo nas so // sdug bsngal ba yang yul mi 'dod pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: Unpleasant is from the point of view of the feeling of desire.üîΩPainful is from the point of view of the object that is not desired.

original: gnod par byed pa yang mi 'dod pa'i tshor ba'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: gnod par byed pa yang mi 'dod pa'i tshor ba'i sgo nas so //
translated: Harmful is from the point of view of the feeling that is not desired.

original: mi mthun pa ni 'das pa'i dus kyi mi 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa ni 'das pa'i dus kyi mi 'dod pa'o //
translated: Unfavorable is from the point of view of the past that is not desired.

original: 'cher 'grib ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi mi 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: 'cher 'grib ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi mi 'dod pa'o //
translated: Fluctuating is from the point of view of the future that is not desired.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa ni gnyis te /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa ni gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of defilement:

original: phyi rol gyi yul gyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / nang gi tshor ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi yul gyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / nang gi tshor ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: defilement of external objects and defilement of internal feelings.

original: de la mig la sogs pa la brten nas gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnams la lhag par zhen pa ni yul gyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: de la mig la sogs pa la brten nas gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnams la lhag par zhen pa ni yul gyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: The defilement of objects is the attachment to objects such as form, etc., on the basis of the eye, etc.

original: reg pa la brten nas nang gi tshor ba la lhag par zhen pa ni tshor ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: reg pa la brten nas nang gi tshor ba la lhag par zhen pa ni tshor ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: The defilement of feelings is the attachment to internal feelings on the basis of contact.

original: 'gog pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa gang la gnyi ga med pa de la ni bdud dang phyir rgol ba thams cad kyi gnas med do //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa gang la gnyi ga med pa de la ni bdud dang phyir rgol ba thams cad kyi gnas med do //
translated: Where there is no nirvana of cessation, there is no place for any demon or opponent.

original: sred pa dang lta ba ni rnam pa thams cad ni rnam pa bco lngas kun nas nyon mongs pa yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: sred pa dang lta ba ni rnam pa thams cad ni rnam pa bco lngas kun nas nyon mongs pa yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: Craving and views are afflictive in fifteen ways.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:üîΩBondage to the sense-spheres through the fetters,üîΩattachment through latent tendencies,

original: kun nas dkris pa'i sgo nas skye mched rnams la kun nas sbyor ba dang / bag la nyal gyi sgo nas nye bar sbyor ba dang / bdag tu lta ba'i sgo nas lhag par sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: kun nas dkris pa'i sgo nas skye mched rnams la kun nas sbyor ba dang / bag la nyal gyi sgo nas nye bar sbyor ba dang / bdag tu lta ba'i sgo nas lhag par sbyor ba ste /
translated: and over-attachment through the view of self.

original: rnam grangs bsdu ba las rgyas par ji skad bstan pa dang 'dra'o /üîΩ// / rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las gzhi bsdu ba ;
analyzed: rnam grangs bsdu ba las rgyas par ji skad bstan pa dang 'dra'o / // / rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las gzhi bsdu ba ;
translated: This is as extensively taught in the Compendium of Enumerations.

original: bam po bcu pa /
analyzed: bam po bcu pa /
translated: In the Bodhisattva Stages, the Compendium of Bases is in the tenth chapter.

original: spyi sdom ni /
analyzed: spyi sdom ni /
translated: The general summary is:üîΩThe same cause, mere conditions,üîΩgreat desire,

original: rgyu 'dra ba dang rkyen tsam dang // 'dod chags shas ni che ba dang // gnas gcig pa ni tha ma yin //
analyzed: rgyu 'dra ba dang rkyen tsam dang // 'dod chags shas ni che ba dang // gnas gcig pa ni tha ma yin //
translated: and one place are the last.

original: sdom ni / rgyu 'dra ba dang bsam mi khyab //
analyzed: sdom ni / rgyu 'dra ba dang bsam mi khyab //
translated: The summary is: The same cause, inconceivable,

original: bcings pa dang ni grol ba dang // rtags dang rig pa kun du 'gro //üîΩmos pa dang ni sgo bsdams dang // bstan dang mngon par dga' ba yi //
analyzed: bcings pa dang ni grol ba dang // rtags dang rig pa kun du 'gro // mos pa dang ni sgo bsdams dang // bstan dang mngon par dga' ba yi //
translated: the signs and the all-pervading,

original: rtags ni tha mar brjod pa yin //
analyzed: rtags ni tha mar brjod pa yin //
translated: The signs are mentioned last.

original: 'di la 'phags pa nyan thos ni rgyu 'dra bas ram par shes pa bdag med pa la rjes su zhugs nas rnam pa gsum gyis rnam par shes pa la yang dag par lta bas gnas so //üîΩrgyu 'dra @220a * //
analyzed: 'di la 'phags pa nyan thos ni rgyu 'dra bas ram par shes pa bdag med pa la rjes su zhugs nas rnam pa gsum gyis rnam par shes pa la yang dag par lta bas gnas so // rgyu 'dra @220a * //
translated: Here, the noble disciple, having entered into the selflessness of consciousness through the similarity of cause, abides in the correct view of consciousness through three aspects.

original: bas na rnam par shes pa bdag med pa la ji ltar 'dug ce na /
analyzed: bas na rnam par shes pa bdag med pa la ji ltar 'dug ce na /
translated: How does he abide in the selflessness of consciousness through the similarity of cause?

original: skye mched gzugs can lnga po gang yin pa rnams dang / 'byung ba chen po bzhi las byung ba'i lus gang yin pa de ni 'phel ba dang / 'grib pa dang / len pa dang / 'dor ba'i mi rtag pa nyid mngon sum du gyur pas /
analyzed: skye mched gzugs can lnga po gang yin pa rnams dang / 'byung ba chen po bzhi las byung ba'i lus gang yin pa de ni 'phel ba dang / 'grib pa dang / len pa dang / 'dor ba'i mi rtag pa nyid mngon sum du gyur pas /
translated: Whatever the five physical sense bases and the body that arises from the four great elements, that is directly perceived as impermanent due to increase and decrease, taking up and laying down.

original: de'i rkyen las byung ba'i rnam par shes pa'i mi rtag pa nyid la yang rjes su 'jug go //
analyzed: de'i rkyen las byung ba'i rnam par shes pa'i mi rtag pa nyid la yang rjes su 'jug go //
translated: From that condition, he also engages in the impermanence of consciousness that arises.

original: mi rtag pa gang yin pa de ni sdug bsngal ba yin la /
analyzed: mi rtag pa gang yin pa de ni sdug bsngal ba yin la /
translated: What is impermanent is suffering.üîΩWhat is suffering is nonself.

original: sdug bsngal ba gang yin pa de ni bdag med pa yin no zhes bdag med pa la yang rjes su 'jug go //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba gang yin pa de ni bdag med pa yin no zhes bdag med pa la yang rjes su 'jug go //
translated: Thus he engages in the doctrine of nonself.

original: ji ltar bdag med pa la rjes su zhugs nas yang dag par lta bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar bdag med pa la rjes su zhugs nas yang dag par lta bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does he engage in the doctrine of nonself and then attain right view?

original: log par lta ba'i rtsa ba ni bdag tu lta ba yin te /
analyzed: log par lta ba'i rtsa ba ni bdag tu lta ba yin te /
translated: The root of wrong views is the view of self.

original: rtsa ba de snga nas yang dag par bcad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtsa ba de snga nas yang dag par bcad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he has already completely severed that root.

original: rnam par shes pa de yang rten dang dmigs pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa du mar 'jug par yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis mthong ngo //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa de yang rten dang dmigs pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa du mar 'jug par yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis mthong ngo //
translated: He sees with right wisdom that consciousness also functions in many ways, due to the differences of its supports and objects.

original: rnam par shes pa de ltar 'jug pa la des ni skad cig tsam gyi gnas skabs su yang snying po yod par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong na gtan du lta ci smos //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa de ltar 'jug pa la des ni skad cig tsam gyi gnas skabs su yang snying po yod par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong na gtan du lta ci smos //
translated: He does not see even for a moment any essence in that consciousness functioning in this way, much less for a long time.

original: skye mched drug 'gag pa zhi ba dang spros pa med pa ni spros pa dang ldan pa'i rnam pa bzhis bsam par mi bya /üîΩbrtag par mi bya /
analyzed: skye mched drug 'gag pa zhi ba dang spros pa med pa ni spros pa dang ldan pa'i rnam pa bzhis bsam par mi bya / brtag par mi bya /
translated: The pacification and non-elaboration of the cessation of the six sense-spheres should not be thought of by means of the four elaborations that are associated with conceptual proliferation.üîΩThey should not be investigated.

original: yongs su 'dri bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: yongs su 'dri bar mi bya ste /
translated: They should not be questioned.

original: gzhan dag gi blo'i khyad par yongs su brtag pa'i bsam pas bya ba tsam du zad do //
analyzed: gzhan dag gi blo'i khyad par yongs su brtag pa'i bsam pas bya ba tsam du zad do //
translated: They are merely to be done with the intention of investigating the differences in the minds of others.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: yod pa'am / med pa'am /üîΩtha dad pa'am /
analyzed: yod pa'am / med pa'am / tha dad pa'am /
translated: Existence or non-existence,

original: tha dad pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: difference or non-difference.

original: skye mched drug po gang gi skye ba yang yod la 'jig pa yang yod pa de la ni phan tshun mtshan nyid tha dad pa yang yod do //
analyzed: skye mched drug po gang gi skye ba yang yod la 'jig pa yang yod pa de la ni phan tshun mtshan nyid tha dad pa yang yod do //
translated: For those six sense-spheres that have arising and also have cessation, there is also mutual difference in their characteristics.

original: de'i skye ba dang / 'jig pa la brten nas yod pa'am med pa yang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: de'i skye ba dang / 'jig pa la brten nas yod pa'am med pa yang mi dmigs so //
translated: In dependence on their arising and cessation, existence or non-existence is not observed.

original: gang la phan tshun mtshan nyid tha dad par yod pa de la ni rigs gzhan la ltos nas tha dad pa dmigs la rang gi rigs kyi snga phyi la ltos nas tha dad pa ma yin par dmigs so //
analyzed: gang la phan tshun mtshan nyid tha dad par yod pa de la ni rigs gzhan la ltos nas tha dad pa dmigs la rang gi rigs kyi snga phyi la ltos nas tha dad pa ma yin par dmigs so //
translated: For those that have mutual difference in their characteristics, difference is observed in dependence on another type, and non-difference is observed in dependence on the prior and subsequent of their own type.

original: skye mched drug 'gag pa ni rtag pa dang zhi ba'i mtshan nyid yin te de bas na spros pa bzhi po 'di dag gis dpyad cing brtag tu mi rung ngo //
analyzed: skye mched drug 'gag pa ni rtag pa dang zhi ba'i mtshan nyid yin te de bas na spros pa bzhi po 'di dag gis dpyad cing brtag tu mi rung ngo //
translated: The cessation of the six sense-spheres has the characteristic of being permanent and peaceful. Therefore, these four elaborations are not suitable to be analyzed and investigated.

original: de la don dang ldan pa ma yin pa sems shing rtog la smra ba gang yin pa de ni spros pa zhes @220b bya'o ;
analyzed: de la don dang ldan pa ma yin pa sems shing rtog la smra ba gang yin pa de ni spros pa zhes @220b bya'o ;
translated: Thinking and speaking about what is not meaningful is called ‚Äúelaboration.‚Äù

original: / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ltar spyod pa la ni dge ba'i chos ci yang 'phel bar 'gyur ba med la mi dge ba 'grib pa yang med de /
analyzed: de ltar spyod pa la ni dge ba'i chos ci yang 'phel bar 'gyur ba med la mi dge ba 'grib pa yang med de /
translated: One who acts in that way does not increase any virtuous qualities and does not decrease non-virtuous ones.

original: de bas na spros pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na spros pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called ‚Äúelaboration.‚Äù

original: nang dang phyi rol gyi skye mched rnams la 'dun pa'i 'dod chags yod na ni yul mngon sum du gyur kyang rung lkog tu gyur kyang rung ba las dbang po lhag par btang snyoms su byed mi nus te /
analyzed: nang dang phyi rol gyi skye mched rnams la 'dun pa'i 'dod chags yod na ni yul mngon sum du gyur kyang rung lkog tu gyur kyang rung ba las dbang po lhag par btang snyoms su byed mi nus te /
translated: If there is desirous attachment to the inner and outer sense-spheres, then even if the object is directly present or hidden, one is unable to be indifferent to the sense-faculties.

original: de bas na bcings pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na bcings pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called ‚Äúbondage.‚Äù

original: 'dun pa'i 'dod chags med na ni yul la mngon sum du gyur ba las kyang dbang po lhag par btang snyoms su byed nus na lkog tu gyur ba lta la ci smos te /
analyzed: 'dun pa'i 'dod chags med na ni yul la mngon sum du gyur ba las kyang dbang po lhag par btang snyoms su byed nus na lkog tu gyur ba lta la ci smos te /
translated: If there were no desire-attachment, one would be able to remain indifferent to the object even when it is present, much more so when it is hidden.

original: de bas na grol ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na grol ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, he is called ‚Äúliberated.‚Äù

original: tshangs par sbyang nas yun ring du lon pa /
analyzed: tshangs par sbyang nas yun ring du lon pa /
translated: He who has long practiced pure conduct,üîΩwho has abandoned the grasping of the aggregates and sense bases as ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine,‚ÄùüîΩeven when afflicted by bodily pain up to the severing of his life, has no change in his body and no change in his mind.

original: phung po dang skye mched rnams la bdag tu 'dzin pa dang / bdag gir 'dzin pa spangs pa la ni lus kyi tshor ba'i sdug bsngal rnams srog 'chad par byed pa'i bar dag gis thebs su zin kyang gzugs 'gyur ba yang med la sems 'gyur ba yang med pa 'di la ni de'i dbang po shin tu bsdams pa'i rtag ragsüîΩpa yin no //
analyzed: phung po dang skye mched rnams la bdag tu 'dzin pa dang / bdag gir 'dzin pa spangs pa la ni lus kyi tshor ba'i sdug bsngal rnams srog 'chad par byed pa'i bar dag gis thebs su zin kyang gzugs 'gyur ba yang med la sems 'gyur ba yang med pa 'di la ni de'i dbang po shin tu bsdams pa'i rtag rags pa yin no //
translated: This is the sign of his well-controlled faculties.

original: de ltar dbang po shin tu bsdams pa de ni sdug bsngal rnam pa bzhi las rnam par grol ba'i phyir dga' ba rnam pa bzhi thob par 'gyur te /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: de ltar dbang po shin tu bsdams pa de ni sdug bsngal rnam pa bzhi las rnam par grol ba'i phyir dga' ba rnam pa bzhi thob par 'gyur te /üîΩ'di lta ste /
translated: Thus, he who has well-controlled faculties attains the four kinds of joy because he is liberated from the four kinds of suffering.üîΩWhat are the four kinds of suffering?

original: phyi ma la phyi rol gyi rkyen las 'byung ba dang / phyi ma la nang gi rkyen las 'byung ba dang / tshe 'di la yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i dus na phung po las gyur ba de gnyi ga dang / shi ba'i 'og tu sdug bsngal thams cad nyid mtshams sbyor ba med pas 'jig rten rtsva dang shing dang 'dra bar mthong bar gyur ba'o //
analyzed: phyi ma la phyi rol gyi rkyen las 'byung ba dang / phyi ma la nang gi rkyen las 'byung ba dang / tshe 'di la yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i dus na phung po las gyur ba de gnyi ga dang / shi ba'i 'og tu sdug bsngal thams cad nyid mtshams sbyor ba med pas 'jig rten rtsva dang shing dang 'dra bar mthong bar gyur ba'o //
translated: The latter is the arising from external conditions. The latter is the arising from internal conditions. In the present life, when one is in the state of complete nirvana, it is both of the above, arising from the aggregates. After death, it is the seeing of the world as being like grass and trees, because all suffering is not being taken up.

original: de la des ni rnam pa gnyis kyis skye mched drug gi 'jig rten rtsva dang shing dang 'dra bar mthong ste /
analyzed: de la des ni rnam pa gnyis kyis skye mched drug gi 'jig rten rtsva dang shing dang 'dra bar mthong ste /
translated: In this regard, one sees the world of the six sense-spheres as being like grass and trees in two ways.

original: rtsva dang shing dang 'dra ba'i sems can med pa'i 'du shes dang / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rtsva dang shing dang 'dra ba'i sems can med pa'i 'du shes dang / 'di lta ste /
translated: The perception that there are no sentient beings like grass and trees, and

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gtu mug gi mes bsreg par bya ba'i phyir skye mched drug po rtsva dang shing dang 'dra ba 'di nye bar len pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gtu mug gi mes bsreg par bya ba'i phyir skye mched drug po rtsva dang shing dang 'dra ba 'di nye bar len pa'o //
translated: the taking up of the six sense-spheres, which are like grass and trees, in order to burn up the fire of passion, hatred, and delusion.

original: nyan thos tshangs par spyod pa legs par spyad pa ni phyi ma la yang srid par skye ba'i sdug bsngal mi skye bar bya ba la de bzhin gshegs pa dang 'dra bar rig pa'i stobs dang ldan mod kyi tshe 'di'i rkyen las 'byung ba'i sdug @221a * //
analyzed: nyan thos tshangs par spyod pa legs par spyad pa ni phyi ma la yang srid par skye ba'i sdug bsngal mi skye bar bya ba la de bzhin gshegs pa dang 'dra bar rig pa'i stobs dang ldan mod kyi tshe 'di'i rkyen las 'byung ba'i sdug @221a * //
translated: The Shravakas who have practiced pure conduct well have the power of knowledge that is like the Tathagata in preventing the suffering of birth in future lives, but they do not have the power to prevent the suffering that arises from the conditions of this life.

original: bsngal mi skye bar bya ba dang / skyes zin pa myur ba myur bar spang ba la mi 'dra ste /
analyzed: bsngal mi skye bar bya ba dang / skyes zin pa myur ba myur bar spang ba la mi 'dra ste /
translated: The ≈õrƒÅvaka who practices pure conduct well is endowed with the power of knowledge like the TathƒÅgata to prevent the suffering of rebirth in future lives, but he is not like the TathƒÅgata in preventing the suffering that arises from conditions in this life and in quickly abandoning what has already arisen.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni rig pa'i stobs rnam pa gnyi ga dang yang ldan pas na de'i phyir rig pa mnga' ba bla na med pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni rig pa'i stobs rnam pa gnyi ga dang yang ldan pas na de'i phyir rig pa mnga' ba bla na med pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The TathƒÅgata is endowed with both aspects of the power of knowledge, therefore he should be known as the unsurpassed one who possesses knowledge.

original: dge sbyong dang bram ze kha cig tshad ma'i gtso bo mngon sum du byis pa rnams kyang rnam par rmongs par mi byed na mkhas pa rnams lta smos kyang ci dgos pa las thal te kun du rmongs pa'i gzhi dang / gnas su gyur pa'i rtog ge la brten nas sngon gyi mtha' la brtsams pa'am /
analyzed: dge sbyong dang bram ze kha cig tshad ma'i gtso bo mngon sum du byis pa rnams kyang rnam par rmongs par mi byed na mkhas pa rnams lta smos kyang ci dgos pa las thal te kun du rmongs pa'i gzhi dang / gnas su gyur pa'i rtog ge la brten nas sngon gyi mtha' la brtsams pa'am /
translated: Some ascetics and brahmins, who are not even able to confound the childish with their principal valid cognition, let alone the wise, are nevertheless based on speculation, which is the basis and the abode of confusion, and they make assertions about the past.

original: yang na tshe 'di nyid la rnam pa bzhis nan gyis mchog tu 'dzin cing mngon par zhen nas /
analyzed: yang na tshe 'di nyid la rnam pa bzhis nan gyis mchog tu 'dzin cing mngon par zhen nas /
translated: Or else, in this very life, they insistently and manifestly cling to the four kinds of perversions,

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal la log par 'dogs so //
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal la log par 'dogs so //
translated: and they falsely impute happiness and suffering.

original: de la sngon gyi mtha' las brtsams te sngon byas pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i phyir gcig tu nges par rang gis bya ba dang / dbang phyug gis sprul pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i phyir gcig tu nges par gzhan gyis byas pa dang / thog ma ni dbang phyug gis byas la phyis ni sngon byas pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i phyir rang gis kyang byas la gzhan gyis kyang byas pa dang /
analyzed: de la sngon gyi mtha' las brtsams te sngon byas pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i phyir gcig tu nges par rang gis bya ba dang / dbang phyug gis sprul pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i phyir gcig tu nges par gzhan gyis byas pa dang / thog ma ni dbang phyug gis byas la phyis ni sngon byas pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i phyir rang gis kyang byas la gzhan gyis kyang byas pa dang /
translated: In this regard, some imagine that it is definitely self-created because it arises from a cause that was previously created; some imagine that it is definitely created by another because it arises from a cause that is emanated by ƒ™≈õvara; some imagine that it is both self-created and created by another because the beginning was created by ƒ™≈õvara and later it arises from a cause that was previously created;

original: yang na rgyu med pa las byung bar rtog par byed de /
analyzed: yang na rgyu med pa las byung bar rtog par byed de /
translated: some imagine that it arises without a cause.

original: rang gis kyang ma byas gzhan gyis kyang ma byas par rgyu med par byung ba las 'dogs so //
analyzed: rang gis kyang ma byas gzhan gyis kyang ma byas par rgyu med par byung ba las 'dogs so //
translated: Some designate it as arising without a cause, not created by itself or another.

original: yang na tshe 'di nyid la rang dga' nas rang gis brtsal bas bskyed pa'i gang yin pa de ni rang gis byas pa kho nar 'dogs so //
analyzed: yang na tshe 'di nyid la rang dga' nas rang gis brtsal bas bskyed pa'i gang yin pa de ni rang gis byas pa kho nar 'dogs so //
translated: Some designate it as self-created only, generated by one‚Äôs own effort through one‚Äôs own delight in this very life.

original: mi 'dogs bzhin du ma tshor bar gzhan gyis byas pa gang yin pa de ni gzhan gyis byas pa yin no //üîΩdes kyang 'dod de tshor ba bzhin du gzhan gyis byas pa gang yin pa de ni rang gis kyang byas la /
analyzed: mi 'dogs bzhin du ma tshor bar gzhan gyis byas pa gang yin pa de ni gzhan gyis byas pa yin no // des kyang 'dod de tshor ba bzhin du gzhan gyis byas pa gang yin pa de ni rang gis kyang byas la /
translated: That which is done by another without being requested is done by another.

original: gzhan gyis kyang byas so //
analyzed: gzhan gyis kyang byas so //
translated: That which is done by another and also desired by oneself is done by oneself and another.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyis 'bad pa sngon du btang ba las byung ba ma yin par yul mngon sum du gyur ba tsam las byung ba gang yin pa de la ni de'i rgyu reg pa cha phra ba ma rtogs nas rang gis kyang ma byas gzhan gyis kyang ma
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyis 'bad pa sngon du btang ba las byung ba ma yin par yul mngon sum du gyur ba tsam las byung ba gang yin pa de la ni de'i rgyu reg pa cha phra ba ma rtogs nas rang gis kyang ma byas gzhan gyis kyang ma
translated: That which arises from the mere presence of an object, without depending on the exertion of oneself or another, is said to arise without a cause, since the subtle contact that is its cause is not realized.

original: byas par rgyu med par byung bar 'dogs pa yod do //üîΩde la dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa phrad pa tsam las bde ba dang sdug bsngal 'byung ba tsam ni yod kyi sngon gyi mtha'am /
analyzed: byas par rgyu med par byung bar 'dogs pa yod do // de la dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa phrad pa tsam las bde ba dang sdug bsngal 'byung ba tsam ni yod kyi sngon gyi mtha'am /
translated: It is said that it is not done by oneself or another.

original: tshe 'di @221b la bdag gam gzhan yod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: tshe 'di @221b la bdag gam gzhan yod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: There is pleasure and pain that arise from the mere contact of sense faculty, object, and consciousness. But there is no self or other that exists in the prior limit or in this life.

original: gsum po de nyid la bdag dang gzhan du 'dogs pa las gyur bar zad do //
analyzed: gsum po de nyid la bdag dang gzhan du 'dogs pa las gyur bar zad do //
translated: These three are the basis for the designations of self and other.

original: de bas na 'dir reg pa 'ba' zhig bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi rgyur kun du 'gro bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'dir reg pa 'ba' zhig bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi rgyur kun du 'gro bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, in this context, contact alone should be understood as the universal cause of pleasure and pain.

original: rnam pa bzhis brtson 'grus brtsam pa yang dag phar brtsams na myur ba kho nar zag pa zad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam pa bzhis brtson 'grus brtsam pa yang dag phar brtsams na myur ba kho nar zag pa zad par 'gyur te /
translated: When one has begun to practice effort in four ways, the destruction of the contaminants is quick.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: 'di lta ste /üîΩbrtson 'grus brtsams drags pa'i sgo nas /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / brtson 'grus brtsams drags pa'i sgo nas /
translated: They are as follows:üîΩOne does not allow the body to become fatigued or the mind to be injured by excessive effort.

original: ci nas de rgod bag tu gyur bas lus ngal bar 'gyur ba dang / sems snad par 'gyur ba med par snyoms par khong du chud pa dang / ha cang zhum pa'i sgo nas dus chud gzon par mi byed pa 'di ni rnam pa dang po'o //
analyzed: ci nas de rgod bag tu gyur bas lus ngal bar 'gyur ba dang / sems snad par 'gyur ba med par snyoms par khong du chud pa dang / ha cang zhum pa'i sgo nas dus chud gzon par mi byed pa 'di ni rnam pa dang po'o //
translated: One does not waste time by excessive slackness. This is the first aspect.

original: bdag ni brtson 'grus brtsams pa yin gyi gzhan gyi ni de lta ma yin no snyam du nges rlom sems su yang mi byed pa 'di ni rnam pa gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: bdag ni brtson 'grus brtsams pa yin gyi gzhan gyi ni de lta ma yin no snyam du nges rlom sems su yang mi byed pa 'di ni rnam pa gnyis pa'o //
translated: One does not become conceited, thinking, ‚ÄúI am practicing effort, but others are not like that.‚Äù This is the second aspect.

original: yang dag par brtson 'grus brtsams pa'i 'bras bu 'jig rten pa'i reg pa khyad par rtogs nas ro myang ba med pa dang ldan pa'i bag yod pa 'di ni rnam pa gsum pa'o //üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: yang dag par brtson 'grus brtsams pa'i 'bras bu 'jig rten pa'i reg pa khyad par rtogs nas ro myang ba med pa dang ldan pa'i bag yod pa 'di ni rnam pa gsum pa'o // 'di lta ste /
translated: The third is the conscientious attitude of not relishing the special worldly attainments that result from the practice of right effort.

original: phyin chad yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir brtson 'grus snyoms pa'i mtshan ma legs par bzung ba ni bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: phyin chad yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir brtson 'grus snyoms pa'i mtshan ma legs par bzung ba ni bzhi pa'o //
translated: The fourth is the conscientious attitude of taking up the signs of equanimity in effort in order to prevent future backsliding.

original: de ltar yang dag pa'i brtson 'grus brtson pa la brten nas mthar gyis dgra bcom pa zag pa zad pas ston pa'am tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa mkhas pa'i drung du bdag nyid kyis rnam par grol ba brjod par 'dod pas ni gnas drug la mos pas 'di
analyzed: de ltar yang dag pa'i brtson 'grus brtson pa la brten nas mthar gyis dgra bcom pa zag pa zad pas ston pa'am tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa mkhas pa'i drung du bdag nyid kyis rnam par grol ba brjod par 'dod pas ni gnas drug la mos pas 'di
translated: Thus, on the basis of the practice of right effort, the arhat who has destroyed the impurities, wishing to proclaim his own liberation in the presence of the Master or a wise fellow practitioner, proclaims it by means of six points.

original: lta ste / bslab pa gsum dang gang zag lnga'i sgo nas dgra bcom pa yang dag par rjod par byed do //
analyzed: lta ste / bslab pa gsum dang gang zag lnga'i sgo nas dgra bcom pa yang dag par rjod par byed do //
translated: He proclaims the state of arhatship by means of the three trainings and the five states of the person.

original: gnas drug la mos pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnas drug la mos pa gang zhe na /
translated: What are the six points?

original: nges par 'byung ba la mos pa dang / gnod pa med pa la mos pa dang / dben pa la mos pa dang / sred pa zad pa dang / nye bar len pa zad pa dang / brjed ngas pa med pa'i sems la mos pa'o //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba la mos pa dang / gnod pa med pa la mos pa dang / dben pa la mos pa dang / sred pa zad pa dang / nye bar len pa zad pa dang / brjed ngas pa med pa'i sems la mos pa'o //
translated: 1) conviction in deliverance, 2) conviction in non-violence, 3) conviction in solitude, 4) the exhaustion of craving, 5) the exhaustion of appropriation, and 6) the non-forgetfulness of the mind.

original: bslab pa gsum po rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: bslab pa gsum po rnams gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three trainings?

original: lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang / lhag pa'i sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa'o //
analyzed: lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang / lhag pa'i sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa'o //
translated: They are the training in higher morality, the training in higher mind, and the training in higher wisdom.

original: gang zag lnga po rnams gang zhe na /üîΩso so'i skye bo khyim pa dad pa tsam la brten nas nges par 'byung bar ni mos la yid yul gyis bcings pas nges par 'byung @222a * //
analyzed: gang zag lnga po rnams gang zhe na / so so'i skye bo khyim pa dad pa tsam la brten nas nges par 'byung bar ni mos la yid yul gyis bcings pas nges par 'byung @222a * //
translated: What are the five kinds of persons?

original: bar mi byed pa 'di ni gang zag dang po'o //
analyzed: bar mi byed pa 'di ni gang zag dang po'o //
translated: 1) The first kind of person is the lay person who, on the basis of mere faith, is convinced of deliverance but does not practice deliverance because his mind is bound by objects.

original: so so'i skye bo nges par byung ba'i tshul khrims tsam la rten cing lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyis sems can rnams la gnod pa mi byed par zhugs pa 'di ni gang zag gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo nges par byung ba'i tshul khrims tsam la rten cing lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyis sems can rnams la gnod pa mi byed par zhugs pa 'di ni gang zag gnyis pa'o //
translated: 2) The second kind of person is the lay person who, on the basis of mere morality, is convinced of deliverance and does not harm sentient beings by body, speech, or mind.

original: rnyed pa dang bkur sti la sred pa spangs nas tshe 'di la 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba ni gang zag gsum pa'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti la sred pa spangs nas tshe 'di la 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba ni gang zag gsum pa'o //
translated: The third person is one who, having abandoned craving for gain and honor, is free from the passion of sensual desire in this life.

original: slob pa bzhi mthong ba ni bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: slob pa bzhi mthong ba ni bzhi pa'o //
translated: The fourth is one who is a learner and has seen the truths.

original: dgra bcom pa mi slob pa ni lnga ba'o //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa mi slob pa ni lnga ba'o //
translated: The fifth is an arhat who is a non-learner.

original: de la gnas dang po dang / gnyis pa la mos pa gnyis ni bslab pa dang po la brten par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la gnas dang po dang / gnyis pa la mos pa gnyis ni bslab pa dang po la brten par rig par bya'o //
translated: Among these, the first two persons who are devoted to the first and second stages should be known as based on the first training.

original: gnas gsum pa la mos pa ni bslab pa gnyis pa la brten pa'o //
analyzed: gnas gsum pa la mos pa ni bslab pa gnyis pa la brten pa'o //
translated: The person who is devoted to the third stage is based on the second training.

original: gzhan phyi ma gnas gsum pa la mos pa rnams ni bslab pa gsum pa la brten par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan phyi ma gnas gsum pa la mos pa rnams ni bslab pa gsum pa la brten par rig par bya'o //
translated: The other three persons who are devoted to the latter three stages should be known as based on the third training.

original: de la shes pa gang gis nyon mongs pa rnams spong bar byed pa dang / nyon mongs pa spong pa gang yin pa de ni brjed ngas pa med pa'i sems so //
analyzed: de la shes pa gang gis nyon mongs pa rnams spong bar byed pa dang / nyon mongs pa spong pa gang yin pa de ni brjed ngas pa med pa'i sems so //
translated: Among these, the mind that is undistracted is the knowledge by which one abandons the defilements and the abandonment of the defilements.

original: de la yang srid par skye ba'i rgyu spangs pa'i phyir na sred pa zad pa'o //
analyzed: de la yang srid par skye ba'i rgyu spangs pa'i phyir na sred pa zad pa'o //
translated: Here, the exhaustion of craving is because the cause of rebirth in existence has been abandoned.

original: tshe 'di la yul gyi nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i phyir ni nye bar len pa zad pa'o //
analyzed: tshe 'di la yul gyi nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i phyir ni nye bar len pa zad pa'o //
translated: The exhaustion of appropriating is for the sake of abandoning the defilement of objects in this life.

original: de la gang zag dang po'i dad pa dang nges par 'byung ba la mos pa ni gcig tu nges pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la gang zag dang po'i dad pa dang nges par 'byung ba la mos pa ni gcig tu nges pa ma yin te /
translated: Among these, the first person who is devoted to faith and renunciation is not definitely fixed,

original: phyi ma la thams cad kyi thams cad du bral bar 'gyur ba dang / gzhan du 'gyur ba'i skal pa can yin no //
analyzed: phyi ma la thams cad kyi thams cad du bral bar 'gyur ba dang / gzhan du 'gyur ba'i skal pa can yin no //
translated: because in the future he will be free from all defilements and will be fortunate to become a different person.

original: gnyis pa ste gnod pa med pa la mos pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ste gnod pa med pa la mos pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The second person who is devoted to the absence of harm is also like that.

original: gsum pa ste dben pa la mos pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: gsum pa ste dben pa la mos pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The third person who is devoted to solitude is also like that.

original: slob pa'i gnas drug la mos pa ni phyi ma la 'bral bar 'gyur ba dang / gzhan du 'gyur ba'i skal pa med mod kyi 'phags pa'i gnas su skyes pa de'i ting nge 'dzin dang / dran pa dang / shes rab kyang legs par ma bsgoms shing yongs su ma smin pa dang /
analyzed: slob pa'i gnas drug la mos pa ni phyi ma la 'bral bar 'gyur ba dang / gzhan du 'gyur ba'i skal pa med mod kyi 'phags pa'i gnas su skyes pa de'i ting nge 'dzin dang / dran pa dang / shes rab kyang legs par ma bsgoms shing yongs su ma smin pa dang /
translated: The person who is devoted to the six stages of learning is not fortunate to be free from defilements in the future and to become a different person, but he is born in the stage of the noble one. His concentration, mindfulness, and wisdom are not well cultivated and are not fully matured.

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug rnams kyang ma lus par ma spangs pa'i phyir byis pa gzhon nu'i ltar stobs chung ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug rnams kyang ma lus par ma spangs pa'i phyir byis pa gzhon nu'i ltar stobs chung ba yin no //
translated: Because they have not completely abandoned desire, hatred, and ignorance, they are weak like a young child.

original: de'i shes rab stobs chung ba dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa ma spangs pa'i phyir brgya la lan 'ga' brjed ngas par gyur bar yul rags pa'i snang ba dang phrad na slob pa'i sems rnam par grol ba dang / shes rab rnam par @222b grol ba zil du brlags nas nyon mongs bskyed par byed do //
analyzed: de'i shes rab stobs chung ba dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa ma spangs pa'i phyir brgya la lan 'ga' brjed ngas par gyur bar yul rags pa'i snang ba dang phrad na slob pa'i sems rnam par grol ba dang / shes rab rnam par @222b grol ba zil du brlags nas nyon mongs bskyed par byed do //
translated: Because their wisdom is weak and they have not abandoned desire, etc., they sometimes forget, and when they encounter a gross object, they destroy the liberation of mind and liberation by wisdom of a trainee and generate the afflictions.

original: de bas na gang zag de yang bya ba dang bcas pa'i phyir yan lag des dman pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na gang zag de yang bya ba dang bcas pa'i phyir yan lag des dman pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, that person is inferior in that respect because he has something to do.

original: dgra bcom pa'i gnas drug la gnas pa gang yin pa de ni lam shin tu bsgom pa'i phyir phyi ma la gzhan du 'gyur ba'i rgyur yang mi 'gyur na 'bral bar lta ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i gnas drug la gnas pa gang yin pa de ni lam shin tu bsgom pa'i phyir phyi ma la gzhan du 'gyur ba'i rgyur yang mi 'gyur na 'bral bar lta ga la 'gyur /
translated: One who is a nonreturner who abides in the six abodes of an arhat does not even become a cause for a different state in the next life, let alone separation, because the path is well cultivated.

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug ma lus par spangs pas ni zad pa dang / mi skye ba'i ye shes thob pa'i sred pa dang / nye bar len pa zad pa la mos pa yang yongs su rdzogs la /üîΩde'i shes pa yang rtag tu gnas par bya ba drug gis yongs su zin pa'i phyir brgya la lan 'ga' yang slob pa bzhin du brjed ngas pa tsam yang med de de bas na dgra bcom pa ni gnas drug la mos pa don dam pa yongs su rdzogs
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug ma lus par spangs pas ni zad pa dang / mi skye ba'i ye shes thob pa'i sred pa dang / nye bar len pa zad pa la mos pa yang yongs su rdzogs la / de'i shes pa yang rtag tu gnas par bya ba drug gis yongs su zin pa'i phyir brgya la lan 'ga' yang slob pa bzhin du brjed ngas pa tsam yang med de de bas na dgra bcom pa ni gnas drug la mos pa don dam pa yongs su rdzogs
translated: Since he has completely abandoned desire, hatred, and ignorance, he has perfected the aspiration for the extinction of craving and the extinction of the appropriation of future rebirth, which is attained through the knowledge of extinction and the knowledge of nonarising.

original: pa shin tu rnam par dag pa dang ldan gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: pa shin tu rnam par dag pa dang ldan gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: And since his knowledge is always supported by the six factors that cause stability, he never forgets even for a moment, as if he were still in training. Therefore, the arhat has perfected the ultimate aspiration for the six matters and is endowed with complete and pure knowledge, but others are not.

original: de bas na rnam grangs des bdag la yang stod par mi byed la shes pa yang rjod par byed do //
analyzed: de bas na rnam grangs des bdag la yang stod par mi byed la shes pa yang rjod par byed do //
translated: Therefore, by this method, he does not praise himself nor does he disparage others.

original: de la ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gyi dmigs pa la mi g-yeng ba'i tshul gyis ni nang gi sems gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gyi dmigs pa la mi g-yeng ba'i tshul gyis ni nang gi sems gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Among them, the inner stability of mind is called the ‚Äúnondistraction‚Äù that is the object of concentration.

original: ting nge 'dzin shin tu yongs su grub pa'i phyir ni mi chung ba'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin shin tu yongs su grub pa'i phyir ni mi chung ba'o //
translated: It is not small because it is the basis of the perfection of concentration.

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir ni shin tu rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir ni shin tu rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: It is very pure because it is free from all the defilements.

original: shes pa yongs su byang ba'i phyir ni legs par bsgoms pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa yongs su byang ba'i phyir ni legs par bsgoms pa'o //
translated: It is well cultivated because it is the basis of the perfection of knowledge.

original: 'jig pa rjes su mthong ba'i phyir ni ro myang ba med pa ste sems de ni gcig tu nges par dge zhing kha na ma tho ba med pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jig pa rjes su mthong ba'i phyir ni ro myang ba med pa ste sems de ni gcig tu nges par dge zhing kha na ma tho ba med pa yin no //
translated: It is without relish because it sees the destruction of the defilements. This thought is absolutely good and irreproachable.

original: gang zag ni 'di gnyis yin te /
analyzed: gang zag ni 'di gnyis yin te /
translated: There are two kinds of persons:

original: dbang po'i sgo ma bsdams pa dang / sgo bsdams pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po'i sgo ma bsdams pa dang / sgo bsdams pa'o //
translated: those who do not guard the doors of the sense-faculties and those who do.

original: sgo ma bsdams pa'i gang zag gang zhe na /
analyzed: sgo ma bsdams pa'i gang zag gang zhe na /
translated: What is the person who does not guard the doors of the sense-faculties?

original: ji ltar 'di na kha cig yul la tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed cing dga' ba'i gzugs rnams la 'dod chags kyi kun nas dkris pas kyang kun nas dkris la mi dga'i ba'i gzugs rnams la gnod sems kyi kun nas dkris pas kyang kun nas dkris
analyzed: ji ltar 'di na kha cig yul la tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed cing dga' ba'i gzugs rnams la 'dod chags kyi kun nas dkris pas kyang kun nas dkris la mi dga'i ba'i gzugs rnams la gnod sems kyi kun nas dkris pas kyang kun nas dkris
translated: Here, someone, in regard to visible forms cognizable by the eye, does not avoid being intent on the greed that arises, on the anxiety that arises,

original: te / yul de'i nyes dmigs kyang mi dran la dran du zin na yang nges legs par ma bsgoms pas kun nas dkris pa des zil gyis non te /
analyzed: te / yul de'i nyes dmigs kyang mi dran la dran du zin na yang nges legs par ma bsgoms pas kun nas dkris pa des zil gyis non te /
translated: Even if they do remember them, they are overwhelmed by that fetter because they have not cultivated the definite goodness of liberation.

original: kun nas dkris pa skyes zin pa yang zil gyis mnan @223a * //
analyzed: kun nas dkris pa skyes zin pa yang zil gyis mnan @223a * //
translated: They are unable to overcome the arising of the fetters.

original: par mi nus pa dang / so so'i skye bo yang yin te /üîΩslob pa'i sems dang shes rab rnam par grol ba ma thob pa dang / des thob tu zin na yang gong du mi slob pa'i sems dang shes rab rnam par grol ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mi shes la /
analyzed: par mi nus pa dang / so so'i skye bo yang yin te / slob pa'i sems dang shes rab rnam par grol ba ma thob pa dang / des thob tu zin na yang gong du mi slob pa'i sems dang shes rab rnam par grol ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mi shes la /
translated: They are also ordinary beings.üîΩThey have not attained the learner‚Äôs mind and the liberation of wisdom.üîΩEven if they have attained that, they do not know the nonlearner‚Äôs mind and the liberation of wisdom that is in accordance with reality.

original: ma shes pas slob pa'i sems dang / shes rab rnam par grol ba yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: ma shes pas slob pa'i sems dang / shes rab rnam par grol ba yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Because they do not know that, the learner‚Äôs mind and the liberation of wisdom are not perfected.

original: de ltar de'i bsgoms pa'i stobs la ma brten pas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs kyi gnas ngan len yang dag par ma bcom pa dang / sngon so sor brtags pa'i stobs la ma brten pas dran pa dang ldan par ma byas pa'i phyir dbang po'i sgo ma bsdams par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar de'i bsgoms pa'i stobs la ma brten pas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs kyi gnas ngan len yang dag par ma bcom pa dang / sngon so sor brtags pa'i stobs la ma brten pas dran pa dang ldan par ma byas pa'i phyir dbang po'i sgo ma bsdams par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, because he does not rely on the power of cultivation, he does not completely destroy the negative reflex actions of the side of the defilements, and because he does not rely on the power of critical consideration, he does not become mindful.

original: dbang po'i sgo ma bsdams pa'i gang zag ni rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste /üîΩkun nas dkris pa dang so sor brtags pa'i stobs kyis bsdus pa'i gnyen po med pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po'i sgo ma bsdams pa'i gang zag ni rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste / kun nas dkris pa dang so sor brtags pa'i stobs kyis bsdus pa'i gnyen po med pa'o //
