translated: The person who does not guard the doors of the senses should be known as being of three types:üîΩhe who does not have the counteragent included in the power of the antidote of the coils;

original: bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis bsdus pa'i gnyen po med pa'o //
analyzed: bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis bsdus pa'i gnyen po med pa'o //
translated: he who does not have the counteragent included in the power of cultivation;

original: de las bzlog pa ni dkar po'i phyogs kyis sgo bsdams par rig par bya'o //üîΩnyan thos ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni dkar po'i phyogs kyis sgo bsdams par rig par bya'o // nyan thos ni 'di lta ste /
translated: and the opposite of these is the one who guards the doors of the senses.üîΩThe Sravaka is of two types, according to the division of the meaning:

original: don rab tu dbye ba'i sgo nas rnam pa gnyis kyis ston pas gsungs pa yang dag pa kho nar brda sprod cing ston par byed de /
analyzed: don rab tu dbye ba'i sgo nas rnam pa gnyis kyis ston pas gsungs pa yang dag pa kho nar brda sprod cing ston par byed de /
translated: the one who is taught by the Master and who is taught by another.

original: gnyis gang zhe na /üîΩgang kho na la dgongs te gsungs pa'i dgongs pa de'i thog tu phebs par brda sprod pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa ni sgo du ma dang ldan zhing rgyas pa yin na gang zag rnams kyi spongs pa yang rnam pa sna tshogs yod de /
analyzed: gnyis gang zhe na / gang kho na la dgongs te gsungs pa'i dgongs pa de'i thog tu phebs par brda sprod pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa ni sgo du ma dang ldan zhing rgyas pa yin na gang zag rnams kyi spongs pa yang rnam pa sna tshogs yod de /
translated: What are the two?üîΩThe first is the ability to explain the intended meaning of the scriptures in accordance with the intention of the one who spoke them.

original: de la brten nas chos nyid dang mi 'gal bar brda sprod pa'o //
analyzed: de la brten nas chos nyid dang mi 'gal bar brda sprod pa'o //
translated: The second is the ability to explain the Dharma without contradicting reality, since the teachings of the Tathagata are extensive and have many doors, and the dispositions of individuals are of various types.

original: dge slong gsar bu legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la shin tu mngon par dga' ba'i rtags ni gnyis yod par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: dge slong gsar bu legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la shin tu mngon par dga' ba'i rtags ni gnyis yod par rig par bya ste /
translated: The sutras state that there are two signs of a new monk who is very happy with the well-spoken Dharma and Vinaya:

original: lus 'gyur ba med pa dang / sems 'gyur ba med pa'o //
analyzed: lus 'gyur ba med pa dang / sems 'gyur ba med pa'o //
translated: his body is unmoving and his mind is unmoving.

original: de dag kha dog gsal bas bzhin gyi mdongs gsal ba dang lus brtas pas dbang po rgyas pa ni lus 'gyur ba med pa'o //
analyzed: de dag kha dog gsal bas bzhin gyi mdongs gsal ba dang lus brtas pas dbang po rgyas pa ni lus 'gyur ba med pa'o //
translated: His body is unmoving because his complexion is clear, his eyes are clear, and his faculties are full.

original: ngan don tsam gyis chog shes pa dang sogs par byed pa'i 'dod pa'i longs spyod spangs pa dang / rigs dang khyim la mi lta bas na sems 'gyur ba med pa'o //
analyzed: ngan don tsam gyis chog shes pa dang sogs par byed pa'i 'dod pa'i longs spyod spangs pa dang / rigs dang khyim la mi lta bas na sems 'gyur ba med pa'o //
translated: He is satisfied with just the bare necessities, etc. He has abandoned the enjoyments of desire that lead to attachment. He has an unperturbed mind, because he does not look to family or home.

original: gsum po 'di dag ni 'khrig pa'i 'dod chags kyi @223b gnyen po ste /
analyzed: gsum po 'di dag ni 'khrig pa'i 'dod chags kyi @223b gnyen po ste /
translated: These three are the antidotes to sexual desire.

original: 'khrig pa'i 'dod chags ma skyes pa ni skyed par mi byed pa dang / skyes zin pa ni spong bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'khrig pa'i 'dod chags ma skyes pa ni skyed par mi byed pa dang / skyes zin pa ni spong bar byed pa ste /
translated: He does not generate sexual desire that has not yet arisen, and he abandons that which has arisen.

original: 'jug par bya ba ma yin pa'i 'du shes yid la byed pa dang / mi sdug pa'i 'du shes yid la byed pa dang dbang po'i sgo bsdams pa'o //
analyzed: 'jug par bya ba ma yin pa'i 'du shes yid la byed pa dang / mi sdug pa'i 'du shes yid la byed pa dang dbang po'i sgo bsdams pa'o //
translated: He attends to the idea that it is not to be engaged in, he attends to the idea of its foulness, and he guards the sense-doors.

original: de la dbang po'i sgo bsdams pa'i mdor bsdus pa dang rgyas pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la dbang po'i sgo bsdams pa'i mdor bsdus pa dang rgyas pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The brief and extensive guarding of the sense-doors is as follows:

original: nyan thos kyis las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nyan thos kyis las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood as it is described in the Sravaka Levels.

original: dbang po'i sgo bsdams pas ni bud med la reg pa las lus legs par bsrungs pa yin no //
analyzed: dbang po'i sgo bsdams pas ni bud med la reg pa las lus legs par bsrungs pa yin no //
translated: By guarding the sense-doors, he protects his body from the touch of women.

original: bud med mi mthong ba dang mi thos pa dang mi dran pas ni dbang po rnams legs par bsdams pa yin no //
analyzed: bud med mi mthong ba dang mi thos pa dang mi dran pas ni dbang po rnams legs par bsdams pa yin no //
translated: He does not see, hear, or think about women, and so he controls his senses.

original: mthong ngam thos sam dran du zin kyang shas cher nyes dmigs su lta ba dang / yun ring por 'dris par byas pas ni dran pa legs par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: mthong ngam thos sam dran du zin kyang shas cher nyes dmigs su lta ba dang / yun ring por 'dris par byas pas ni dran pa legs par gnas pa yin no //
translated: Even if he does see, hear, or think about them, he looks at the drawbacks, and so he is well-established in mindfulness.

original: de ltar lus legs par bsrungs shing dbang po legs par bsdams la dran pa legs par gnas pa dang / 'jug par bya ba ma yin pa'i 'du shes kyang yid la byed pa de ni sems rgod bzhin du yang nyon mongs pas zil gyis mi non to //
analyzed: de ltar lus legs par bsrungs shing dbang po legs par bsdams la dran pa legs par gnas pa dang / 'jug par bya ba ma yin pa'i 'du shes kyang yid la byed pa de ni sems rgod bzhin du yang nyon mongs pas zil gyis mi non to //
translated: In this way, he protects his body, controls his senses, and is well-established in mindfulness. He does not pay attention to thoughts that are not appropriate, and so his mind is not overwhelmed by reactive emotions, even when it is excited.

original: mi sdug pa'i 'du shes kyang yid la byed pas na sems myur du 'gyur bzhin du yang nyon mongs pas zil gyis mi non to //
analyzed: mi sdug pa'i 'du shes kyang yid la byed pas na sems myur du 'gyur bzhin du yang nyon mongs pas zil gyis mi non to //
translated: He pays attention to the perception of foulness, and so his mind is not overwhelmed by reactive emotions, even when it is quickly changing.üîΩThe summary:üîΩMere conditions, imagination,

original: sdom ni / rkyen tsam dang ni rtog pa dang // smon pa dang ni rnam kun gyi //
analyzed: sdom ni / rkyen tsam dang ni rtog pa dang // smon pa dang ni rnam kun gyi //
translated: aspiration, and in every way,

original: bsdams pa dang ni ma bsdams dang // 'jug pa dang ni tshogs bsags dang // bslab pa phul dang kun du chags //
analyzed: bsdams pa dang ni ma bsdams dang // 'jug pa dang ni tshogs bsags dang // bslab pa phul dang kun du chags //
translated: The last chapter is called ‚ÄúThe Bodhisattva‚Äôs Distinctions‚Äù because it teaches the distinctions of the bodhisattvas‚Äô training in the perfections.

original: don la mi mkhas rgyun log dang // byang chub sems dpa'i khyad par dang // gdags pa yang ni tha ma yin //
analyzed: don la mi mkhas rgyun log dang // byang chub sems dpa'i khyad par dang // gdags pa yang ni tha ma yin //
translated: The last chapter is called ‚ÄúThe Bodhisattva‚Äôs Distinctions‚Äù because it teaches the distinctions of the bodhisattvas‚Äô training in the perfections.

original: reg pa'i skye mched drug po rnams ni sngon gyi las dang nyon mongs pa rnams dang rang gi sa bon gyi rgyud la 'phangs pa'i tshor ba skye ba'i rkyen tsam du 'gyur te dper na lag gis len pa ni sems kyi kun nas bslang ba'i 'bad pas 'phangs
analyzed: reg pa'i skye mched drug po rnams ni sngon gyi las dang nyon mongs pa rnams dang rang gi sa bon gyi rgyud la 'phangs pa'i tshor ba skye ba'i rkyen tsam du 'gyur te dper na lag gis len pa ni sems kyi kun nas bslang ba'i 'bad pas 'phangs
translated: The six sense bases are the mere conditions for the arising of feeling, which is projected by former karma and afflictions into the continuum of one‚Äôs own seeds. For example, the hand is the mere condition for the action of grasping, which is projected by the karma that is motivated by the mind.

original: pa'i las len pa'i rkyen tsam gyi bya ba byed pa de bzhin du 'dir yang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: pa'i las len pa'i rkyen tsam gyi bya ba byed pa de bzhin du 'dir yang rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the same is true here.

original: dge slong bas mtha'i gnas mal na 'dug cing dben pa na gnas pa la gal te yul rags shing rtog pa'i kun tu 'khrug pa'i gnas kyi snang ba yid la byed par gyur na bdud kyi phyogs dang mthun pa yin te /
analyzed: dge slong bas mtha'i gnas mal na 'dug cing dben pa na gnas pa la gal te yul rags shing rtog pa'i kun tu 'khrug pa'i gnas kyi snang ba yid la byed par gyur na bdud kyi phyogs dang mthun pa yin te /
translated: If a monk who is staying in a remote dwelling and living in solitude should attend to the appearance of a place that is rough and a locus of discursive distraction, that would be in accord with the faction of Mara.

original: de la ni dge slong gis @224a * //
analyzed: de la ni dge slong gis @224a * //
translated: In that regard, the monk

original: sems gnas pa rnam pa dgus yul thams cad dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rtog pa las sems bsdus nas gang la brten na yul de dag gis bza' bar 'gyur ba'i rtog pa gcig kyang skye ba'i skabs mi 'byed do //
analyzed: sems gnas pa rnam pa dgus yul thams cad dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rtog pa las sems bsdus nas gang la brten na yul de dag gis bza' bar 'gyur ba'i rtog pa gcig kyang skye ba'i skabs mi 'byed do //
translated: should withdraw his mind from all objects that are associated with discursive thought by means of the nine means of stilling the mind. He should not allow even a single thought to arise that would lead to his being carried away by those objects.

original: des na yul de dag gis gnas mi thod pas phyir ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na yul de dag gis gnas mi thod pas phyir ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since he does not allow those objects to prevail over him, they will be unable to carry him away.

original: de de'i tshe chags par 'gyur ba'i dngos po la 'dod pa'i rtog pas rten par mi byed la gzhan la yang gnod sems dang 'tshe ba'i rtog pas gnod par mi byed do //
analyzed: de de'i tshe chags par 'gyur ba'i dngos po la 'dod pa'i rtog pas rten par mi byed la gzhan la yang gnod sems dang 'tshe ba'i rtog pas gnod par mi byed do //
translated: At that time, he will not attend to objects that would arouse desire by means of thoughts of desire. He will not attend to objects that would arouse malice or violence by means of thoughts of malice or violence.

original: tshe 'di la yang mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshe 'di la yang mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: And in this life, he attains nirvana.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa thob nas kyang gzhan dag dang 'thabs nas rtsod cing mi 'dug ste /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa thob nas kyang gzhan dag dang 'thabs nas rtsod cing mi 'dug ste /
translated: Having attained nirvana, he does not remain in conflict and dispute with others.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: Because

original: 'thabs nas rtsod pa 'di ni 'phags pa'i chos 'dul ba la skur ba 'debs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'thabs nas rtsod pa 'di ni 'phags pa'i chos 'dul ba la skur ba 'debs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: this conflict and dispute is a slander of the noble Dharma-Vinaya.

original: de ltar na de ni 'di las phyi rol ba'i mu stegs can rnams ltar gti mug las skyes pa'i rtog pa la yang rtog par mi byed do //üîΩdge slong sngon gyi yang srid par skye bar 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal gyi rgyu'i 'bras bu tshe 'di'i reg pa'i skye mched drug la gnas pa ni yul drug gis bcom pa bzhin du gal te yang srid par skye bar bya ba kho na'i phyir smon nas tshangs par
analyzed: de ltar na de ni 'di las phyi rol ba'i mu stegs can rnams ltar gti mug las skyes pa'i rtog pa la yang rtog par mi byed do // dge slong sngon gyi yang srid par skye bar 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal gyi rgyu'i 'bras bu tshe 'di'i reg pa'i skye mched drug la gnas pa ni yul drug gis bcom pa bzhin du gal te yang srid par skye bar bya ba kho na'i phyir smon nas tshangs par
translated: Thus, he does not engage in speculation born from delusion, as do the non-Buddhist tƒ´rthikas.üîΩThe monk who is established in the six sense bases of contact in this life, which are the result of the cause of suffering that will arise in a future rebirth, if he practices pure conduct through aspiration only for the sake of being reborn in a future existence,üîΩlike one who is struck by the six objects,

original: spyod par byed na /
analyzed: spyod par byed na /
translated: then

original: de de'i tshe na phyi ma la yang srid par skye bar 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal gyi rgyu 'dun pas kyang lhag par bcom par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de de'i tshe na phyi ma la yang srid par skye bar 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal gyi rgyu 'dun pas kyang lhag par bcom par 'gyur te /
translated: At that time, he also destroys the cause of suffering that will lead to rebirth in the future.

original: tshe 'di la mya ngan las 'da' ba la bar du gcod par byed pa dang / phyi ma la yang dal ba phun sum tshogs pa 'thob pa nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshe 'di la mya ngan las 'da' ba la bar du gcod par byed pa dang / phyi ma la yang dal ba phun sum tshogs pa 'thob pa nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is an obstacle to attaining nirvana in this life and there is no certainty of attaining the perfect opportunity in the future.

original: de'i yang srid par skye bar smon pa de ni 'ching ba cha phra zhing mchog tu cha phra ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i yang srid par skye bar smon pa de ni 'ching ba cha phra zhing mchog tu cha phra ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: That aspiration for rebirth should be known as the subtle bondage and the most subtle bondage.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi lha'i pho brang na lha'am lha gang yang rung ba btson rar bcing bas bcings pa dag yod do //
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi lha'i pho brang na lha'am lha gang yang rung ba btson rar bcing bas bcings pa dag yod do //
translated: In the divine palaces of the Thirty-Three Gods, there are gods or any beings who are bound in prison.

original: de dag gi chos nyid ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de dag gi chos nyid ni 'di yin te /
translated: This is their nature:

original: bcings pa las grol nas nam 'bros pa'i bsam pa ma skyes kyi bar du ni lha'i 'dod pa'i yon tan rnams kyis rtse zhing 'dug la 'bros pa'i sems bskyed ma thag tu ni 'dod pa'i yon tan rnams las kyang nyams par 'gyur la bdag nyid kyang bcing bas
analyzed: bcings pa las grol nas nam 'bros pa'i bsam pa ma skyes kyi bar du ni lha'i 'dod pa'i yon tan rnams kyis rtse zhing 'dug la 'bros pa'i sems bskyed ma thag tu ni 'dod pa'i yon tan rnams las kyang nyams par 'gyur la bdag nyid kyang bcing bas
translated: Until the thought of fleeing arises, they remain there playing with the divine sense pleasures. But as soon as the thought of fleeing arises, they lose the divine sense pleasures and see that they are bound.

original: bcings par mthong ste /
analyzed: bcings par mthong ste /
translated: The thought of fleeing arises as soon as they see that they are bound.

original: de dag gi @224b sems bskyed ma thag tu bcings pa de ni dus cha phra ba'i sgo nas cha phra ba yin gyi rtogs par dka' ba'i cha phra ba'i sgo nas ni ma yin te gang gi phyir bcings par gyur na bdag nyid bcings par khong du chudüîΩpa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi @224b sems bskyed ma thag tu bcings pa de ni dus cha phra ba'i sgo nas cha phra ba yin gyi rtogs par dka' ba'i cha phra ba'i sgo nas ni ma yin te gang gi phyir bcings par gyur na bdag nyid bcings par khong du chud pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is subtle in terms of the time it takes to arise, but it is not subtle in terms of being difficult to realize, because when they are bound, they understand that they are bound.

original: dge slong yang srid par skye ba'i sems kyi smon par byed pa'i sems bskyed ma thag tu yang bcing bar 'gyur la bcings nas kyang bdag nyid bcings so snyam du khong du mi chud de /
analyzed: dge slong yang srid par skye ba'i sems kyi smon par byed pa'i sems bskyed ma thag tu yang bcing bar 'gyur la bcings nas kyang bdag nyid bcings so snyam du khong du mi chud de /
translated: Also, a monk who generates the thought that aspires to be reborn in cyclic existence is bound as soon as he generates that thought and, although bound, he does not understand that he is bound.

original: de bas de'i bcing ba ni dus cha phra ba'i sgo nas kyang rtogs par dka' la mchog tu cha phra ba'i sgo nas kyang mchog tu cha phra bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas de'i bcing ba ni dus cha phra ba'i sgo nas kyang rtogs par dka' la mchog tu cha phra ba'i sgo nas kyang mchog tu cha phra bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, its bondage is difficult to understand even in terms of the gross, and it should be understood as the most subtle of the subtle.

original: dge slong dbang po sdom pa la zhugs pas ni sdom pa yang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong dbang po sdom pa la zhugs pas ni sdom pa yang rig par bya'o //
translated: The monk who has undertaken the restraint should understand restraint.

original: sdom pa ma yin pa yang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sdom pa ma yin pa yang rig par bya'o //
translated: He should understand non-restraint.

original: 'jig rten pa'i sdom pa chung ba dang / 'bring dang / chen po yang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i sdom pa chung ba dang / 'bring dang / chen po yang rig par bya'o //
translated: He should understand the small, middling, and great worldly restraints.

original: slob pa dang mi slob pa'i sdom pa yang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: slob pa dang mi slob pa'i sdom pa yang rig par bya'o //
translated: He should understand the restraint of the trainee and the non-trainee.

original: de la sdom pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la sdom pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is restraint?

original: ji ltar 'di na kha cig chags par 'gyur ba'i yul rnams la sems kun nas nyon mongs pa can du gyur na dang du mi len pa dang / yang dag par nges par byed pa dang / legs par tshar gcod pa dang / skyes zin pa yang spong par byed pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar 'di na kha cig chags par 'gyur ba'i yul rnams la sems kun nas nyon mongs pa can du gyur na dang du mi len pa dang / yang dag par nges par byed pa dang / legs par tshar gcod pa dang / skyes zin pa yang spong par byed pa'o //
translated: It is the non-acceptance, the correct determination, the good suppression, and the abandonment of what has arisen, of the defiled mind with regard to the objects that cause attachment.

original: sdom pa ma yin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: sdom pa ma yin pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is non-restraint?

original: ji ltar 'di ni dge slong zhing pa lta bu kha cig gis skyes bu dam pa la brten pa dang / tshul bzhin yid la byed pa la brten nas yang dag pa'i yul gyi zhing la dmigs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i log tog kha cig skyed par 'gyur la de yang 'dod chags shas che ba'i rang bzhin can zhig yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar 'di ni dge slong zhing pa lta bu kha cig gis skyes bu dam pa la brten pa dang / tshul bzhin yid la byed pa la brten nas yang dag pa'i yul gyi zhing la dmigs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i log tog kha cig skyed par 'gyur la de yang 'dod chags shas che ba'i rang bzhin can zhig yin te /
translated: They are by nature very attached,

original: gnyen po la yang ma goms la ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa drag po yang med de /
analyzed: gnyen po la yang ma goms la ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa drag po yang med de /
translated: they are not accustomed to the antidote and they do not have strong shame and embarrassment.üîΩWhen a coarse object appears directly, they accept the arising of the fetters of attachment and do not guard the mind from the fetters of attachment.

original: yul rags pa mngon sum du snang bar gyur ne da 'dod chags drag po dang / gnyen po la ma goms pa dang / ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa chung ngu des 'dod chags kyi kun nas dkris pa skye ba dang du len cing 'dod chags kyi kun nas dkris pa las sems kun tu srung bar mi byed pas de'i tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang
analyzed: yul rags pa mngon sum du snang bar gyur ne da 'dod chags drag po dang / gnyen po la ma goms pa dang / ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa chung ngu des 'dod chags kyi kun nas dkris pa skye ba dang du len cing 'dod chags kyi kun nas dkris pa las sems kun tu srung bar mi byed pas de'i tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang
translated: Thus, they are not accustomed to proper attention and are not accustomed to the antidote.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems de lo thog la za ba'i ba lang bzhin du yul gyi zhing la zhugs nas dge ba'i rtsa ba'i @225a * //
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems de lo thog la za ba'i ba lang bzhin du yul gyi zhing la zhugs nas dge ba'i rtsa ba'i @225a * //
translated: The mind associated with it is like an ox that eats the crops, for it enters the field of objects and destroys the crop of the roots of virtue.

original: lo tog de ma rung bar byed pa ste 'di ni sdom pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: lo tog de ma rung bar byed pa ste 'di ni sdom pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: This is the absence of restraint.

original: gzhan yang 'di na kha cig myur ba kho nar yid la byas nas yul rnams gtong bar ni byed na /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di na kha cig myur ba kho nar yid la byas nas yul rnams gtong bar ni byed na /
translated: Moreover, here someone, having quickly brought to mind, gives up the objects.

original: ci nas phyin chad 'gro bar mi 'gyur ba de lta bu'i nyes dmigs kyang mthong ba 'di ni 'jig rten gyi sdom pa chung ngu yin no //
analyzed: ci nas phyin chad 'gro bar mi 'gyur ba de lta bu'i nyes dmigs kyang mthong ba 'di ni 'jig rten gyi sdom pa chung ngu yin no //
translated: But he sees the disadvantage in them in such a way that he does not go to them again. This is the lesser worldly restraint.

original: gzhan yang 'di na kha cig myur ba kho nar yang yid la byas nas yul rnams gtong bar byed la /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di na kha cig myur ba kho nar yang yid la byas nas yul rnams gtong bar byed la /
translated: Moreover, here someone, having quickly brought to mind, gives up the objects.

original: ci nas phyin chad 'gro bar mi 'gyur ba'i nyes dmigs kyang mthong ba 'di ni 'jig rten pa'i sdom pa 'bring zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ci nas phyin chad 'gro bar mi 'gyur ba'i nyes dmigs kyang mthong ba 'di ni 'jig rten pa'i sdom pa 'bring zhes bya'o //
translated: But he sees the disadvantage in them in such a way that he does not go to them again. This is called the middling worldly restraint.

original: de la brten na sems gnas pa rnam pa dgu po yid la byed pa rnam pa bzhis bsdus pa rnams thob par 'gyur te /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la brten na sems gnas pa rnam pa dgu po yid la byed pa rnam pa bzhis bsdus pa rnams thob par 'gyur te / 'di lta ste /
translated: The nine mental placements are attained by means of four attentions.

original: nyan thos kyis las 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: nyan thos kyis las 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: They are like the mental placements of the sravakas.

original: de thob na so so'i skye bo 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de thob na so so'i skye bo 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When they are attained, one becomes a layperson free from attachment to the desire realm.

original: sdom pa la zhugs pa'i rnal 'byor ba sngar ni zhing pa lta bur gyur la da ni bdag par gyur bas rgyal po lta bu yin no //
analyzed: sdom pa la zhugs pa'i rnal 'byor ba sngar ni zhing pa lta bur gyur la da ni bdag par gyur bas rgyal po lta bu yin no //
translated: The yogi who has taken vows was previously like a farmer, but now, being a master, he is like a king.

original: des snyoms par 'jug pa las byung tshor ba rags pa dang po thob pa de bag med pa'i gzhi dang / gnas su gyur ba chen po yid par rig nas dam pa'i chos thos pa'i dbang las byung ba zhi gnas kyi sbubs su chud pa'i lhag mthong blon po lta bur 'dug pas tshor ba de yang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yin pa dang rten cing 'brel bar
analyzed: des snyoms par 'jug pa las byung tshor ba rags pa dang po thob pa de bag med pa'i gzhi dang / gnas su gyur ba chen po yid par rig nas dam pa'i chos thos pa'i dbang las byung ba zhi gnas kyi sbubs su chud pa'i lhag mthong blon po lta bur 'dug pas tshor ba de yang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yin pa dang rten cing 'brel bar
translated: Having understood that the attainment of the first coarse feeling that arises from meditative equipoise is a basis for heedlessness and a great source of distraction, the feeling is destroyed by the minister-like vipashyana that is contained within the egg of shamatha, which arises from the power of hearing the excellent teachings.üîΩThe yogi understands that feeling arises in dependence on conditions and that it is impermanent, suffering, and empty.

original: 'byung ba yin na mi rtag pa nyid yin par khong du chud de /
analyzed: 'byung ba yin na mi rtag pa nyid yin par khong du chud de /
translated: If it is an element, it is impermanent.

original: de de las nyes dmigs kyi mtshan ma dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pas yid 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: de de las nyes dmigs kyi mtshan ma dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pas yid 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ro ;
translated: Thus, by the attention that possesses the sign of the disadvantage of that, the mind becomes free from attachment.

original: /'dod chags dang bral nas snyoms par 'jug pa la brten pa'i bye brag gis ni tha dad pa rnam pa bcur mthong la /
analyzed: /'dod chags dang bral nas snyoms par 'jug pa la brten pa'i bye brag gis ni tha dad pa rnam pa bcur mthong la /
translated: Having become free from attachment, it is seen to be of ten types, due to the specific distinctions of meditative attainment.

original: dus kyi bye brag gis ni rnam pa brgyad mthong ngo //
analyzed: dus kyi bye brag gis ni rnam pa brgyad mthong ngo //
translated: It is seen to be of eight types, due to the specific distinctions of time.

original: de la snyoms par 'jug pa la brten pa'i bye brag ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la snyoms par 'jug pa la brten pa'i bye brag ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The specific distinctions of meditative attainment are as follows:

original: rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa dang / rtog pa med la dpyod pa tsam dang / rtog pa yang med dpyod pa yang med pa dang / dga' ba dang ldan pa dang / bde ba dang ldan pa dang / btang snyoms dang ldan pa dang /
analyzed: rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa dang / rtog pa med la dpyod pa tsam dang / rtog pa yang med dpyod pa yang med pa dang / dga' ba dang ldan pa dang / bde ba dang ldan pa dang / btang snyoms dang ldan pa dang /
translated: that which possesses investigation and analysis, that which possesses no investigation but only analysis, that which possesses neither investigation nor analysis, that which possesses joy, that which possesses pleasure, that which possesses equanimity,

original: nyams par 'gyur ba dang / gnas pa dang / khyad par du 'gro ba dang / nges @225b par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa ste /
analyzed: nyams par 'gyur ba dang / gnas pa dang / khyad par du 'gro ba dang / nges @225b par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa ste /
translated: 1. the stage of decline, 2. the stage of stability, 3. the stage of distinction, and 4. the stage of the factors conducive to penetration.

original: rnam pa 'di dag gis tshor ba skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'gag pa'i tshul gyis dus las gyur ba'i bye brag rnam pa brgya phrag du ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: rnam pa 'di dag gis tshor ba skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'gag pa'i tshul gyis dus las gyur ba'i bye brag rnam pa brgya phrag du ma mthong ngo //
translated: In these four ways, he sees the various kinds of time in the arising, stability, and cessation of feelings, in hundreds of different ways.

original: des tshor ba de dag gi mi rtag pa nyid dang 'jug pa'i bye brag sna tshogs rtogs nas mdor bsdu na mi rtag pa nyid rnam pa gsum du yongs su gcod par byed de /
analyzed: des tshor ba de dag gi mi rtag pa nyid dang 'jug pa'i bye brag sna tshogs rtogs nas mdor bsdu na mi rtag pa nyid rnam pa gsum du yongs su gcod par byed de /
translated: Having understood the impermanence and the various kinds of activity of those feelings, he determines them in brief as being of three kinds of impermanence.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: What are the three?

original: rten dang / kun tu spyod pa dang / rgyu'o //
analyzed: rten dang / kun tu spyod pa dang / rgyu'o //
translated: 1. the basis, 2. the activity, and 3. the cause.

original: de la bsam gtan bzhi ba man chad kyi gzugs kyi lus gang yin pa de ni tshor ba'i rten to //
analyzed: de la bsam gtan bzhi ba man chad kyi gzugs kyi lus gang yin pa de ni tshor ba'i rten to //
translated: The form body from the fourth meditation down is the basis of feeling.

original: 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa'i bar gang yin pa de ni 'du shes dang tshor ba rnams kyi kun du spyod pa'o //
analyzed: 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa'i bar gang yin pa de ni 'du shes dang tshor ba rnams kyi kun du spyod pa'o //
translated: The cessation of discrimination and feeling is the activity of discrimination and feeling.

original: srid pa'i rtse mo man chad kyi sems pa dang / 'dod pa dang / smon pa gang yin pa de ni phyi ma la tshor ba'i rgyur gyur ba yin te chos 'di dag thams cad ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i phyir mi rtag pa yin te /
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo man chad kyi sems pa dang / 'dod pa dang / smon pa gang yin pa de ni phyi ma la tshor ba'i rgyur gyur ba yin te chos 'di dag thams cad ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i phyir mi rtag pa yin te /
translated: All these things are impermanent because they are dependently arisen.

original: de ltar na des tshul bzhin du 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sa thams cad nye bar brtags pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na des tshul bzhin du 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sa thams cad nye bar brtags pa yin te /
translated: Thus, he properly examines all the stages of freedom from attachment.

original: 'di ni 'jig rten pa'i sdom pa chen po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'jig rten pa'i sdom pa chen po'o //
translated: This is the great mundane restraint.

original: de la dang po gnyis ni so sor brtags pa'i stobs kyis bsdus pa'i sdom pa yin no //
analyzed: de la dang po gnyis ni so sor brtags pa'i stobs kyis bsdus pa'i sdom pa yin no //
translated: Among them, the first two are included in the restraint that is gathered by the power of investigation.

original: phyi ma de ni bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis bsdus so //
analyzed: phyi ma de ni bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis bsdus so //
translated: The latter is included in the restraint that is gathered by the power of meditation.

original: de de ltar bag yod pa dang shes pa'i stobs dang ldan te /
analyzed: de de ltar bag yod pa dang shes pa'i stobs dang ldan te /
translated: He is thus endowed with the power of heedfulness and knowledge.

original: bden pa rtogs pas bdag tu 'dzin pa dang / bdag gir 'dzin pa mngon du 'gro ba mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs nas slob pa'i sdom pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bden pa rtogs pas bdag tu 'dzin pa dang / bdag gir 'dzin pa mngon du 'gro ba mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs nas slob pa'i sdom pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having realized the truth, he abandons all the defilements to be abandoned by seeing, which are the notional attachment to ‚ÄòI‚Äô and ‚Äòmine‚Äô that are active in the present moment. He then attains the vow of training.

original: des slob pa'i sdom pa de nyid bsgoms pas nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal sngon du 'gro ba'i bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams spangs nas mi slob pa'i sdom pa thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: des slob pa'i sdom pa de nyid bsgoms pas nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal sngon du 'gro ba'i bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams spangs nas mi slob pa'i sdom pa thob par 'gyur te /
translated: Having cultivated that very vow of training, he abandons the defilements to be abandoned by cultivation, which are preceded by the pride of thinking ‚ÄòI am‚Äô. He then attains the vow of no-more-training.

original: de'i gong na khyad par du 'phags pa'i sdom pa ches lhag par dang ches bzang ba gzhan med do //
analyzed: de'i gong na khyad par du 'phags pa'i sdom pa ches lhag par dang ches bzang ba gzhan med do //
translated: There is no other vow that is superior to this, that is more excellent or better.

original: bstan pa 'di la zhugs pa'i dge slong dbang po ma bsdams pa gang yin pa de ni 'di lta ste /üîΩtshe phyi ma'am /
analyzed: bstan pa 'di la zhugs pa'i dge slong dbang po ma bsdams pa gang yin pa de ni 'di lta ste / tshe phyi ma'am /
translated: Any monk who has entered this teaching but who has not restrained his faculties is like a poisonous snake.üîΩHe will be miserable in the next life,

original: de 'di'i sdug bsngal gyi sgo nas gcig tu nges par sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de 'di'i sdug bsngal gyi sgo nas gcig tu nges par sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and in this life he will be miserable because of his suffering.
